In my view this is the equivalent of a 3 star hotel in the UK (not 5 star) as positioned. Having waited over 2 hours to be shown to our rooms we opted not to stay. 1. Old food was left outside rooms. 2. the main pool in all the photos is public ( paying a lot of money for this) 3. it would appear that an entire wing of the hotel is being held up by scaffolding 4. our rooms smelt of drains. 5. they got the lunch order wrong!

After a week of touring around Sri Lanka for the first part of our honeymoon we were looking forward to spending a week by the sea in a 5 star resort. Unfotunately we were very disappointed with this hotel. The good points about the hotel are the large swimming pools and the view of the sea from most parts of the hotel. The bad points are numerous: -During our stay the weather was very windy and it rained heavily. The hotel is not designed to cope heavy rainfall as it is designed in a very modern, open minimalist way. All the corridors, a bar and the cafe are completely open to the elements. This meant that rain was constantly pouring in and the floors were several centimetres deep in some places. This made the floors very slippy and we found we were unable to get around the hotel much and it made sitting in the front bar and cafe impossible as the bar does not have any front covers to keep the rain out. The staff are constantly sweeping the water away and moving furniture around out of the rain which was very irritating. The overall cleanliness of the hotel is not that great either and the hotel is starting to look rundown. The bathroom in our room had lots of mould in the shower(picture attached), and there was no bath option, you have to pay for a premium top floor room to get a bath! Having stayed in many 5 star and 4 star hotels all over Europe and Asia, I would say this is a 3 star at best, the other 3 star hotels we stayed in during our holiday were in fact much better. -The food is boring and pricey by Sri Lankan standards although you would expect that in a 5 star hotel. We went to the fine dining restaurant one night which was pretty good, although very run-of-the-mill options such as steak and mash. The desserts were interesting but after waiting over half an hour, when they arrived they were poorly executed and my dessert was not even what I ordered. Being the only other couple in the restaurant this was certainly not what we expected. The breakfast is also disappointing, the only positive being the traditional Sri Lankan curries offered. The omelette queue was impressive every morning and that only left under-cooked waffles, anaemic chicken sausages and fatty bacon cooked to order. The rest of the buffet was luke-warm at best. The fresh fruit offered however was fesh and ripe and there was lots of choice. -The beach is not for swimming or being on for any length of time. There are local people constantly waiting on the edge of the hotel and the beach trying to sell you things aggressively and stray dogs wandering about do not make you feel safe. The security guards do nothing about the sellers and leave them to shout at you whilst you are lying on sunbeds within the hotel grounds. -Another point to make is that there is nothing to do in the local area- we went to the 'turtle hatchery' before going to the hotel and it took us 10min to look at the 2 ponds in which 2 poor adult turtles are kept, and a small area of sand where the eggs are buried before they hatch. We ended up leaving early as we were fed up with the food, not being able to go on to the beach and the inefficient staff. Wish we had gone to the Maldives!

The location is good right on the beach but that's about it. The sprawling property has no charm, no grace, it's actually disgraceful. The service is pathetic. There is only one elevator servicing each wing and reaching your room is nothing short of a long uninteresting walk. The lobby lights are off at night and we literally had to walk in the torch light of the mobile phone when we had to leave at dawn for the whale watching tour. The spa treatments are an eye wash. The food is so lousy there is no sense of any combinations also the main course is served in a bright white light area if chef fin dishes that are broken and it feels like eating at a very low budget wedding or a college canteen. The last night was my husband's birthday and I had even offered to pay for a good cake, but my agent assured that it had been arranged free. It was one of the worst cakes that looked like it had been bought from the cheapest bakery in town. The common area toilets were so filthy I dreaded going there more than once. The key card that was issued to me was in someone else's name. Just about everything was bad about this property. I wonder how they have procured a licence to operate as a 5 Star. I do not recommend it to anybody at all! When the staff came to know that we were upset, they wouldn't leave us alone at breakfast and created an unnatural fuss. I found that extremely unprofessional. One of the staff members asked me what the problem was and after I shared all the grievances with her at the end of the conversation she actually said "wish you a good stay Ms. Natu " what should I call that? Deliberate or really dumb? If they don't get their act together soon, I guarantee that they will have to close down in the next couple of years!

Pros- Relaxed beach location with spacious rooms. Good choice of bars and restaurants. Excellent breakfast buffet. Friendly staff, especially in the restaurants and around the pool. Very nice, big pools. Lots of interesting wildlife. Laundry service was excellent and good value. Cons- There were some hawkers on the property around the pool area selling sarongs and tours. An annoyance when trying to relax. The air con in our room was not very effective. By contrast it was excellent in our kids room. There was black mold in the shower. When it rains, the communal corridors are prone to flooding. The room attendants are very pushy about tips. Our attendant Ranil visited our room a day before we left to tell us he wouldn‚Äôt be there the following day. We tipped him well, but the next day, the day of our checkout, a new room attendant who we didn‚Äôt know came into the room twice on the pretext of checking the minibar and hung around clearly also expecting to be tipped. We are always happy to tip for service, but this pushy experience made us quite uncomfortable and left a bad final impression of our stay. The day before leaving we asked for a late checkout on one of our two rooms and were told that would be possible for an extra $50 US. We happily agreed to this, but the following morning we were told neither room was available. This seems unlikely as the hotel was not at all busy (it was five days after the terrorist attacks). So we had a few hours hanging around the hot hotel common areas before our airport pickup. Not the best way to end what was otherwise a very enjoyable and relaxed stay.
Very Good

I mean its amazing to stay there in Heritance Ahungalla Staff is very friendly Food is sooooo yummmmm I been to many different holidays resorts But never seen like here twice a day room cleaning Sea view from the room is so beautiful I mean ten out of ten going for this hotel When you be there you also enjoy it Like we enjoyed there
great view .. but not so great service

We are very impressed with the way that Chamuditha on position Supervisor treated us and have care of us , durning our holiday he just made our stay in Heritance the dream holiday big thanks to him and to hotel Heritance, for sure we will visit Sri Lanka again next season ‚ù§Ô∏è

I came here for celebrate my wife's birthday . Had memorable experience here . Place was nice. Room is very clean and present . And have nice view of indian ocean . Food was delicious .staff was very friendly .definitely next time i will come here.......
Enjoyable but hotel requires updating
Over loaded with people and not enough resources

We were a family of ten having booked five rooms in Heritance Ahungalla and were really looking forward to our stay after a long drive of Six hours from Nuwara Eliya. But right from check in it was a big disappointment, as check in itself took more than one hour. The rooms were not as expected of this property, the key didn‚Äôt work for one room, lights didn‚Äôt work in another room, the wash rooms were ancient looking with flush making scary sound in another room. The pass word for wife was outdated and had to be changed. The duty manager was not apologetic but showing his helplessness , arrogant and argumentative.The rooms were of different sizes and badly done up, never expected from Heritage Ahungalla.Instead of king size beds we were given single beds joined . It was a terrible experience stay and the worst of our trip of seven days in Sri Lanka. We will never recommend this hotel to any one. J P Alex and family.

The hospitality starts from the 1st step into the hotel; warm welcome with traditional variety of fresh juices. Front desk was very helpful and friendly. Once they saw the kids, they were informing the parents about the events organized for the kids on that day. They had magic show and chef programs for kids during our stay. The room was clean. Food was amazing at the restaurant and all staff were very helpful. In the night, they had local live music. This hotel has 2 pools; The green pool with Jacuzzi and trees around is my choice and it is the best. They also have plenty of indoor and outdoor sports.

We stayed one night in February 2022 at Heritance Ahungalla. The room was very spacious and clean. We requested a quiet room and the hotel gave us a room which is far from the central pool area, facing the second pool. It was indeed very quiet. The welcome fruit was nice touch. The staff there are very nice and you can ask all kinds of questions. Buffet for dinner and breakfast had both good selection. You can taste authentic Sri Lankan food there although there are many western dishes. We sat in the garden at the dinner as it was quieter. The beach is wonderful and great place to watch sunset. The pool in the center was bit clouded but the second pool was not soo bad. If you want to experience Bawa hotel, this is another wonderful resort.
Fantastic place to holiday
Beautiful beach, hotel could use some refreshing to actually be considered a five star
Imogen P-T
Almost all the rooms have a sea view, although some are side view. Probably get one anyway if you don't pay, although you may be unlucky.
Holiday with friends

We hosted an International Conference on Assisted Reproductive Technologies for a group of 90 doctors from around the world. We have been hosting such meetings annually in destinations like Nepal, Goa, Khajuraho, Seychelles, Singapore & more. This was one of our best experiences with a Hotel that taught us what Sri Lankan hospitality is all about. The front office staff, the back-end staff, the F & B staff and the event management team were all excellent and helpful and set new bench-marks fro us for future meetings. The property is visually stunning and the open lobby takes your breath away with the majestic ocean view on entering the Hotel. Attention to small details like the design of the trolley that brings welcome drinks to a guest checking in and the smiling faces of the front desk staff go a long way in first impressions. Although the property is 35 years old, it is very well maintained with huge trees planted in the stair-wells. The architecture and design and the room interiors all blend for an exotic asian experience. The meals are wonderful, the four bars in the hotel are superlative and the three swimming pools take your breath away. The conference was running two halls simultaneously and the meeting went off without a glitch. Three nights we had music concerts in the main hall and cocktails being served. This was a global gathering and the unanimous opinion was "this was one of the best experiences we have had!" Since I was the President of the meeting, I did not have time to relax and want to go back for a short break only to take in the same sights and smells again. This was like Heaven.
Average stay
Excellent experience!!!!

Heritance Ahungalla: Heritance Ahungalla is an Ideal place to enjoy with your family. Appreciate their friendly services. International foods as well as Authentic Sri Lankan Cuisine. Thank u Heritance Ahungalla
Try another hotel

Old style and average service

this is the 3rd time I have been to Ahungalla, sorry to say I found it pretty ordinary, definitely not 5-star anymore. Good: Friendly staff. Bad: Terrible buffet and food offering, pretty ordinary food repeated again and again. Not worth it. Though it is costly, hard even to believe aitkense runs this place. Cleanliness in toilets and bathrooms is not up to the standard. Pretty an ordinary set-up, not the hotel it used to be.
One of the best hotels with authentic Sri Lankan hospitality

Came here for a couple of nights on our family trip to Sri Lanka. Rooms were clean and comfortable and service was overall very good. The main breakfast / dinner restaurant was always smoky (from preparing food) and it seemed there was no air con or exhaust fan to remove the smoke. Selection of food at the buffet was good. Cocktails were poorly made and extremely strong! Pool was not as clean as expected and it didn't seem that it was cleaned everyday. Jacuzzi was full of sand. The shower glass in our bathroom had soap scum which looked like it hadn't been cleaned for a month. Security around the perimeter of the hotel especially on the beach side needs to be beefed up. There were a few people around the beach who were hassling the patrons. The positives were that there was a live band at the bar every night and amazing views of the beach from the rooms. Overall, average especially for a resort that is meant to be 5 star.
Do not select a room facing other room balconies, It is bit irritating. try to get a room facing the sea :-)

I planned a day out two weeks ago and requested details from the Hotel. I got the confirmation on 10 Feb with the reservation number. Representative from the hotel called me and confirmed my booking also. When We went to the hotel, the front office said they could not give us a room since hotel is fully occupied and they give the rooms for the day use on availability basis(not informed at the time of booking). However, they agreed to give us a changing room (B Grade room as per the front office) on FOC basis and we said ok since we traveled 2 hours from Colombo to Ahungalla. However, we didn't get the changing room also which was agreed to give within 10 minutes. We were there for about 1 hour and we cancelled our day out and came back to Colombo. At that time the front office staff asked the confirmation number and he said the booking was in the system. :( I don't about the process of Heritance Ahungalla, but this was my experience with this Hotel.

It's not like it used to be when they used to call it Triton, The staff at some points are friendly, the food was not up to standard compared to what we use to have, you could have counted the number of dishes on the buffet and it was 70% Sri Lankan, we requested for a set of pillows at around 10.30 p.m which we did not receive when we called the phone was diverted to someone who abruptly told us that the hotel is closed after 10.30 so the housekeeping is not available and therefore they cannot do anything, once asked who is speaking did he say he is the security, and hung up abruptly, we called again and then the reception adhered to our request.
Unhappy experience. Boring food, unprofessional front office staff. Spa was awesome

Make sure to book on a day that isn't Saturday/Sunday. It tends to get crowded

I had read so many great reviews about this hotel and was really looking forward to staying here, and I somehow feel like I have stayed on another planet compared to the other people who reviewed here. I will comment that the Chef Sarun was fantastic and made the best meal we had in Sri Lanka, the gentleman who was serving us was very good. Now, the hotel is getting very tired and could use a renovation, I was first taken to a room with 2 single beds, being a couple this wasn't good enough, but also laying on the bed it was comfy, the second room had a double bed but was uncomfortable, so we left it to the young man who took us to the room to try and sort out something else - either putting blankets under or a pillow top, anything, we gave them 2hrs and nothing happened. I went to reception, spoke with the executive gentleman, who apologized and said we could look at other rooms, apparently they only have 1 type of mattress which I don't believe. In the meantime I had ordered food from the restaurant and was told it would still be another 15mins away, we proceeded to the next room, same, next room same, so I said I would settle just for the twin singles as we were only staying one night. He then said he would get a new room sorted out and have our luggage moved. When I got back, my food was waiting and it was cold, less than 15mins. I advised the waiter and he said thanks- what for ????? We waited 1hr for no key, went to reception and collected our new room key. Went to the room, located at the end of the hotel, and our luggage was not there yet. Next thing I'm looking at the table and there is ANTS EVERYWHERE, now I'm talking about 1000+ all having a little party on the ground and under the table, walking down the walls etc. I have plenty of photos which I will put up when I have better Internet at home. I rang front desk and we got moved again 2 doors down, we went for a swim for 1hr again, come back and there was more ANTS in the room. We didn't get offered another room, but got dinner which is the only reason this gets a 2 star and not 1. We didn't sleep very well and the band / music was playing very loud well into the night. We had to check out at 7am, I had ordered a breakfast, but when I went to check out, I was hauled to the cashier office, and they kept me there for 10mins arguing about the meal from the afternoon which was cold and I was told would be taken off the room, and, they also tried to charge me for a phone call from my room, which was the executive ringing the manager about the ANTS. The lady who apparently was guest relations needs to be sacked, the cashier needs to be sacked for trying to rip me off. This left the worst taste in my opinion of Sri Lanka and I cannot believe this hotels staff would act like this to customers. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone, hopefully management looks at this and takes action.

We booked our holiday in aid of 2 special events, our wedding anniversary and our friends wanted to renew their vows celebrating 25 years of marriage. In the run up to the holiday we contacted their Guest Relations Executive a Shanika Jayasekara who really was fantastic. Shanika went above and beyond to make sure both events were very special, we had room upgrades and these were right by the green pool which was our preferred room location, our rooms were made available for an early check in and this was quick and hassle free with a welcoming drink and cold face towels. On the day of our anniversary we were made to feel very special and given a cake in the evening and our table was decorated beautifully with flowers. As a surprise for our friends renewing their vows we had arranged for their grown up children to fly out for the ceremony and to join us for the rest of the holiday, Shanika was able to allocate them a room next to ours and help hide them until the ceremony. The vow renewal was a very special event indeed with drummers, dancers and an elephant, the way the hotel and especially Shanika organise these events is perfect, they really do think of everything which means we were able to just sit back and enjoy every minute of their special day. The package price was very reasonable and included a 5 course meal on the beach in the evening, with a cake. The hotel itself has the friendliest staff who really want to ensure you have a fantastic time, we are still here at the moment but felt we had to write a review sooner rather than later to let everyone know what a fantastic hotel this is. The food is very good and always something to choose to meet our tastes and if not the chef will happily cook something especially for you, we chose to eat outside in the garden area which was quieter than the main restaurant and lit beautifully with lanterns. The pool attendants made sure we had 7 sunbeds in the gardens right between our rooms and the green pool which was beautifully quiet with rarely more than 5 people in it at any one time. The beach sellers are not pushy if you are firm with them, we were able to relax on the beach without much disturbance. There are other members of staff who deserve mentioning but unfortunately while writing this I do not have their names at hand, however I will endeavour to write an addition review to this at the end of the holiday when I have their names and can give a final update.
Would love to go back!
Sch√∂nes Hotel, aber...

Unless your dream holiday is to sit by a pool all day with staff continually at beck and call this isn't for you. There is very little to do around the hotel unless you have a car or a driver. we found ourselves getting rather bored of it, quite quickly. The hotel is on a stunning sandy beach but you cannot swim in the sea, and the areas round the two pools are full of Russians with money to burn. I don't like customers being rude to staff but saw plenty of this. However staff accepted it due to massive tips and pretty much ignored everyone else. Food in the hotel was good and rooms were clean but wouldn't go back. The whole hotel was pretty impersonal with massive long white corridors which reminded me of Victorian hospitals. This hotel was the final one on our trip so we only stayed two nights, which for us was one night too many. As I said in my intro the hotel was perfect if you want to spend all day on a sun lounger but it didn't suit us.
Good but losing a bit of magic

His is hotel is very big and beautiful the pool is very great and the beach is very beautiful.... love the rooms andbthe facilities it has also rhe food here is very tasty ...excellent job by the kitchen..... also the staff and the service here is superb definitly will visit this hotel again
Winter Break January 2017
The pool is less than one meter deep. A small portion is 2.67 meter
Excellent Experience and Beautiful place
Comfortable, but a little "tired".

Arrived at the Heritance Ahungalla at 2.00am in the morning after a 10.5 hour flight from Gatwick and a 2 hour coach transfer from airport. Absolutely tired out. We had booked 2 double rooms and 2 single rooms through Thomson's I had had problems regarding the wrong names in the wrong rooms and couldn't get it sorted through their call centre. When we went to check in they had only three rooms with a little bit of stern talk they sorted it. I believe the problem lies with Thomson's Their airport Rep was with us but did absolutely nothing to help. After that the Holiday was superb. The Hotel has the most friendly of staff Especially Himasha. The Buffet food is excellent with a vast variety of cuisines from English through Italian to Chinese and Asian. One tip! every one advises not to swim in the sea. as there are strong under currents safe enough to paddle but even then you can feel the under current drawing you out. However the 2 Hotel pools are beautiful and so swimming is no problem. I should give this hotel a rating of 5 but the problem at check in forces me to drop a star sorry.

Heritance Ahungalla is a hotel i have wanted to visit since i was teenager. I had great memories of cozy bedrooms and an array of foods. Unfortunately, I went on holiday to this hotel recently and i was greatly disappointed. The suites are ridiculous and needs refurbishing, the bathrooms in the suites are laughable. The food was the only thing that lived a little bit up to expectation.
High floor rooms give you a better view.
Ask for a refurbished room

Very good hotel it has good food and it is clean .the stuff make their best to serve the guests as best as they can .the Spa in it is good You can take a nice relax in its huge gardens .the location of the hotel is good. In general it is a very good choice we have made
Honeymoon

I must say that the staff is very lovely specially Anushka & Dayal and the pool staff.. The rooms is lovely and we are staying in the cliff Richards suite... And the housekeeping is very good always decorates our room.. .. The food is excellent...

Every year when we're visiting Sri Lanka, Heritance Ahungalla is a must. With all the newer hotels around, Heritance has proved to be a very solid hotel and has never disappointed us. Accommodations, pools, and food is great and the service of the staff is exemplary. They are very attentive, helpful and never without a smile. With two young children, our family always has an awesome time there and will keep visiting. Thank you.
Graduation in Sri Lanka

A luxurious hotel on the shore of the Indian ocean. Imho, the contingent here is not very pleasant, someone turns on his music on the speaker while you listen to live music, someone tik-toki watching at full volume, and the staff does not care. Also, guides or some other people are constantly pestering on the beach and offering their overpriced services. You are just perceived as a money bag here.
Pleasant stay
Best hotel we stayed at in SL

See comments below. Rooms - very poor, given cost Food- depends when you eat, the later the worse. Beach location excellent Gardens excellent. Staff good Definitely wouldn't go again or recommend. Yet the outdoor areas were lovely

Definitely not a 5 starts hotel

The hotel is located near the beach and location is good. But the hospitality is not so good. Room is also not up to the mark as the sliding door of the bathroom was jammed and room was not cleaned before handing to us. The food was ok ok but catering staff was courteous. Try for Taj Bentota instead.
Over priced and ripped off !!!

We have spent 2 weeks in Heritance Ahungalla which is really a great place with a beautuful architecture. Rooms are spacious and always clean. There are two big pools, one is a bit quiter and secluded for more a relaxing atmospshere if requiredThe restaurant offers delicious food of all kind, a lot of local dishes and a great choice of deserts. Besides the facilities, what makes the hotel really special are very kind people, always offering a great service and meet every whish you might have. All staff was really great with no exception, special thanks to restaurant manager Duminda and team, our main waiter Jacob, pastry chef Kavinda and team, executive chef Nalinda and team, chef Rahul for a great authentic cooking experiance, pool supervisor Chatu and Rebecca and Maduranga from the pool bar.
Avoid like the plague
The Most Amazing Staff
Perfect beach holiday resort
Awesome trip to relax and feel the sun and the ocean at its best! Special thanks to Manoi for perfect room cleaning!
Some staff were more attentive to some guests and not others - probably knew they were going to get a huge tip!!! Reception staff not as good as the other staff.
Food menu
Choose upper floors for a view

Okay it's one of the best hotel is Sri Lanka, it has won the award of best leisure hotel by the minister of tourism. Sure, the two pools are outstanding, the rooms are nice, the area is quiet and the beach is nice but... staying there we kept asking ourselves: is it how one should experience Sri Lanka beaches? Just before we stayed at Mirissa, a lovely beach with a lot of atmosphere, a couple small hotels and guest houses, a few waterfront bars and a great laid back atmosphere. The Heritance is the opposite. Big resort where you pay over-priced drink and food served by stylish staff. The hotel probably owns the beach, because there is nothing else around. Would advice to go there if you don't mind missing the charm of more "informal places". Compare to other places, we found the contact with the locals to be biased. It's either hotel staff or very insisting beach sellers. The later can be quite annoying especially when the seat in group of 8-10 just in front of your chair and stay all day long. The food was not exceptional, certainly not in line with the price they ask for it (in Sri Lankan terms of course!).

My friend and I stayed at this hotel for the last 4 days of our sri lankan tour. We stopped off at the turtle sanctuary beforehand which was very cute (15 mins ish from hotel) we had a lovely greeting at the hotel- staff very pleasant. Our room was sweet, we got a complimentary upgrade. Spacious room, lovely sea view. Room a little old, could do with a bit of a spruce up. Poolside and beach were very quiet, got a sun bed every day. The "beach boys" were quite annoying and pushy but on the last day we bought something from the ladies and gave them some of our stuff, they are poor so appreciated it. Weather in late April Was ok, very very very hot, slightly cloudy, a little rain. Beach was beautiful but didn't venture into the rough sea. Stayed on the hotel complex as it's a little out. Food was ok, nothing special but staff really helpful. 4 days was perfect wouldn't do anymore. All in all a lovely stay just could do with an update.

Approach to hotel uninviting, but then through the gates a lovely setting and warm welcome, but irritation factor from incessant beach vendors and loud guests and even the street dogs make it into the hotel too because of its open design. Felt sorry for the staff dealing with inconsiderate drunks day and night. The service was hit and miss, food varied and well presented, but not the best I had in Sri Lanka, though signature spiced ice cream was wonderful. Some very nice staff, but suspect some unsavoury ones in league with beach vendors and tuk tuk drivers. Beach immediately in front of hotel fine, but elsewhere litter and no peace if walking cos of beach boys. Found lack of chains and double locks on room doors unnerving. Pillows gave best night's sleep in SL. Spa has a great range of treatments and lovely staff and one of the nicest I have ever been to and worth every penny. Would not choose to return here unfortunately. Prefer Heritance Kandalama.

Overall we were disappointed with this hotel compared to others we stayed in during our trip to Sri Lanka. The room was tired and badly needing updated, things like seeing the same room service plates still outside the same room door hours later was unhygienic and attracted bugs. The food, we were half board so ate at the buffet breakfast and dinner. I really struggled as at dinner there was only a variety of curries available and being pregnant and adverse to certain smells I couldn‚Äôt even go up to see what was available. However the staff were fantastic at dealing with this for me and I honestly couldn‚Äôt have been in better hands. I really did appreciate their efforts in ensuring I ate a proper meal once they realised I was struggling. The pools were easily the best pools we had access to during our trip, we spent a lot more time using these facilities than we did anywhere else. One of the things I disliked was being shouted at from behind the chain link fence to come and see what the locals were selling but they‚Äôre not on hotel property so I understand there isn‚Äôt anything staff can do about them. We were on our honeymoon and our tour operator had told us in our itinerary to bring our marriage certificate in order to receive honeymoon benefits. However when we checked in staff said it wasn‚Äôt needed and didn‚Äôt acknowledge it was our honeymoon at all.

We just stayed one day full board basis and it was really worth the drive and the money we spent. Booked the hotel with an offer but the comforts and facilities were just the same like before. Staff was extra ordinary going out of the way to help us. Really enjoyed. Food was delicious.

Having stayed at this hotel around 8 or 9 times over the last 20 years, we returned with high expectations. I am pleased to be able to say that the actual experience exceeded our expectations. We were given a large room on the top floor, well away from the restaurants and other potential sources of noise. The room was furnished beautifully and the bed was very comfortable. Everything was squeaky-clean and kept that way by our room boy, who also replenished our fruit bowl regularly. The hotel has a superb location at the end of a long beach and we were pleased to find that you can still stroll along its full extent without meeting more than a handful of people. There are two pools and plenty of sunbeds in the extensive garden area, where you can watch the many birds and chipmunks as well as the occasional monitor lizard passing through. We enjoyed the food, particularly the excellent dinner arranged for us by the head chef. The weather during our stay was pretty mixed, but we managed a few dinners at the seafood station by the side of the pool. I would recommend both the food and the relaxed atmosphere there.There is also a small covered 'open-air' restaurant area, where we had some good curries. Breakfast is a sumptuous affair with a wide range of choices, including hoppers and curries as well as the more traditional European-style offerings. There is also a splendid selection of fruit and juices. Whilst the hotel and its facilities are very good indeed, it was the friendliness and efficiency of the staff which really made our stay memorable. We were constantly surprised by the way in which people anticipated our wishes/preferences and provided what we were looking for - and much more - without ever having to ask for it. Truly exceptional service and hospitality! There were many familiar faces amongst the staff and we were also pleased to find that Eranda, our favourite tuk-tuk driver, was still offering his services by the gate. We have used him on many occasions and have found him very accommodating and utterly reliable. Resort areas such as Bentota and Hikkaduwa are within easy reach by tuk-tuk. We even went as far as Unawatuna this time - and enjoyed a 'roti lunch' with Eranda in Galle on the way. (Without him we would have struggled to order anything.) As the title above suggests, we have no complaints whatsoever. We only regretted not being able to stay longer. However, we will certainly try to come back.
Friendly Staff with aweome treatment
Holiday with the fam

In this hotel as you entered you feel very relaxed.... most of all it is very eye appealing.... and the staff is very helpful and explainsbthe hotel very clearly and provides all tge information... and when we went fir lunch the food was delicious and the. Service is. Excellent...... lovely hotel overall and must to visit place....
Heritance Ahungalla stay for 2 nights and three days
Never take the rooms on the ground floor unless they open direct to the pool.
Mediocre Stay

Property: Whole Hotel is situated in a calm and quiet property... Though secluded from the city of colombo... you can manage to get all necessities if you travel in very short distance... Service: Service within hotel is not good... They need to stick to basics... * There was lint on the bed sheets from the cushions and the comforter... * There was no shampoo in the bath, on asking i was informed shampoo and bath gel is one and the same... When asked whether the person claiming so was sure about it... he returned with shampoo... * You are given seat in restaurant however you are not served water until you ask for it... You have to remind the attendants to refill water more than once... * Language is a problem, however all the people try their best to communicate... Thumbs Up: GEMS and Jewel Shop is pretty good...

Plus: Rooms: nicely maintained, well serviced. Animation team: friendly and engaging Restaurant: staff are friendly and food is good and varied Beach and swing pool: attractive, but also some minuses. Minus: Price of drinks (e.g. wine, cappuccino, cocktails) too expensive compared with similar category hotels in Sri Lanka Cleanliness of premises: with a little more effort would this place be cleaner and thus more attractive. Windy weather conditions are not an excuse to leave things on the ground. Hotels in Sri Lanka clearly do an effort to group Chinese visitors together in the restaurant. This is not just a detail as the habits of these people was often experienced as plain impolite: noisy, jumping to front of queue ....
Honeymoon üçØ‚ù§Ô∏è

We stayed at this hotel for a week at the end of a touring holiday in Sri Lanka. It is claimed to be the only five-star hotel on this coast, which is not entirely accurate. In some aspects the hotel is very good - the two huge swimming pools, large public areas, well spread-out accommodation & nicely-appointed rooms - and deserves its five stars. However, there are some aspects which are not five-star and were a source of irritation during our stay. For example, on the whole, the food was very good but tended to be served not very hot, and is rather expensive for what it is. We tried the buffet, which is OK, but very expensive. We had several meals in the Coffee Shop, which is more reasonable in price but, despite being a la carte, we twice had to send food back because it was virtually cold. Getting things like that fixed, which would happen promptly in a real 5-star hotel, seemed to take an age. Service is helpful & charming, but inept and inefficient at times. There often seems to be no-one on duty with sufficient authority to make a decision about things. Complaints are handled by constantly referring them to some-one else, who often is not in a position to actually do anything, other than telling someone else. The staff are not very quick to clear up after the rain sweeps into the public areas (which are tiled) leaving very slippery surfaces around for too long. Overall we enjoyed our stay at the hotel, but I think they could try harder to merit their 5-star tag.
Excellent , superb service and superb hospitality!- Jerome
Didnt enjoy the food

We are really happy to see one of the greatest product of bawa in Sri Lanka. Room is excellent and spacious. Staff us very friendly and helpful...... My kids enjoy two swimming pools......beach is nice and clean......food is tasty.......we will be back.

I booked three rooms at half-board and came with my wife, 20 month old daughter and wife's relatives for two nights in September 2013. I was keen to experience a Geoffrey Bawa architected hotel and was impressed by the thoughtfulness of his design. The hotel aims to merge with nature, and allow for breezes to flow throughout the compound, providing a natural cooling. There were two pools, which we well maintained and a great place to lounge through during the day. I was very keen to experience the food at the hotel - as I had heard that it was rated as one of the best dining resorts in Sri Lanka and I was not disappointed. I was struck by the thoughtfulness of the dishes in the Jute restaurant - and also couldn't recall any dish tasting bad. All the food was balanced and tasty. Even the Sri Lankan food was unbelievably good. The staff were helpful and always with a smile. Also enjoyed the gym, badmington court and table tennis facility in the venue. The only negative for me was the reasonable isolation of the resort. As I tend to always like to explore the surroundings, I was a bit disappointed when leaving the resort by the lack of facilities around walking distance of the hotel. Again that was my preference, but if you wish to travel and only stay in a resort to rest and relax it is a great place.
"Rooms in the 3rd floor north side"
All rooms are sea facing and have 3 floors, higher floor gives you a better view.

mixed feeling about this hotel. the hotel grounds are beautiful, the pools and the beach are great but the building itself and the rooms are kind of old. the staff are helpful and it had a good breakfast spread. the main issue was the toilet as there was a weird mold or sewer smell
Little snippet of heaveb

This hotel was very nice and pleasant. The beach was remarkable and the food was very good. I will definitely come again! If there is a place that you want to have that is very peaceful where the staff treat you with respect and humility than this is it.
Our first Sri Lanka Trip... and not the last !!!
Away from the reception area and bar area.

Food is awesome, fresh and great selection for every palette. Quick work out at the fully equipped gym and a long dip in one of the two big pools is a great way of relaxing. The rooms are big and well equipped with good view of the pool. Friendly and attentive staff.

Visited Heritance Ahungalla with my family...there's service was superb...specially in the Restaurant. Girls are who working in the restaurant and the pool bar very kindness and always helpful. I would like to mention some names...LASITHA,MADU,ANUSHKA,LAKSHIKA AND MADUBASHINI.. Good variety foods in the buffet and some authentic foods as well. They have marvellous beach location and two large pools..one of the famous Architecture called Geoffrey bawa done a unbelievable structure.

The staff are so polite and helpful, including the restaurant manager, the lifeguard and the reception staff. The room Was clean and comfortable with a lovely beach view. The food was very good, the staff couldnt be more helpful offering to make you anything that was not available already. The chefs were really polite and friendly. The pool was lovely in particular the second pool. We watched a lovely wedding on the beach. We only stayed 4 days but were really sad to leave.

Heritance is nice hottel in this area.i think most important think is there have nice beach in front of the hotel.and staff is very friendly......and very kindly.im so happy in this two days........ ............. ..........--ü§óü§ó.i have free time we are come back.

Having spent many holidays along the beautiful west coast of Sri Lanka, trying out the various hotels over the years, I can honestly say that Heritance Ahungalla is my favourite. Convenient to get to from Colombo on the new Expressway, it is situated about 90 kilometers from Colombo. From the moment I drive up to the entrance with the fantastic view right up to the sea, I feel at home. There is such a feeling of peace and serenity with the warm yet gentle welcome from the staff. I have requested sea view rooms and have never been disappointed. Room 305 is my favourite. If you like tasty food and lots of it, Heritance Ahungalla is the place to be. I think their chefs are about the best in Sri Lanka. The buffet has a huge selection of dishes to please the western and local palate. The salads varied and desserts yummy. Heritance has two attractive large swimming pools, and also a very attractive beach. The seas around Sri Lanka can be dangerous around monsoon time, but if you love messing around in the shallow water, going for long walks or just sun bathing it is wonderful. I strongly recommend Heritance Ahungalla, if you want a relaxing holiday. I always come away feeling rested and energized wishing I could stay longer! Elizabeth Gunewardene

Comparing this hotel to other Heritance properties it falls well below. The facilities are good and the hotel is ok. In every area of the hotel, staff seemed a little directionless. When we arrived the checkin process was disorganised. Everyone was quite pleasant but just not efficient. At the pool bar we had 3 waiters just walk straight past us. The person who seemed to be the head waiter was standing there checking his mobile phone. Eventually we had to ask to be served. On the pool deck no one was offering service. We had to go hunt it down. Some people were staying here on an "all inclusive" package which may explain the poor service. The buffet was "unloved". I'd often open a closh to find it empty underneath - eg no sausages or bacon at 8.30am during breakfast. The staff at this hotel had poor English skills and it was often difficult to be understood. I appreciate that English is a second language but it's essential in a five star hotel. This hotel needs a sharp eyed management team to set high standards and coach staff effectively. On a positive note - Heritance Hotels have the best toilet paper of any hotel group in the world!!
Very old hotel. It requires deep renovation. Maximum 3 stars.
See review above and be sure to ask for a King size bed upon booking if you'd actually like to share a double bed.
Ask for the rooms around the private pool if you like easy access to them. Room 130 - 134

I stay here 14 days the restaurant food was good but pastry Chef very bad attitude he not respect the customer (guest) not only me so many people told me he not good in this hotel and Service department very excellent service Thank you

The experience at Heritance Ahungalla was simply amazing. The highlight of it all was the welcome experience The reception staff was absolutely brilliant they paved the way for us to have a fabulous stay in this resort. Not to mention the food was out of this world. We will definitely return. As the hospitality and the warm smiles are contagious.
Simply Brilliant - Again!

The rooms were very clean. The pool of the hotel was huge and was maintained very well. However, when we checked in, the staff took ages to give us a room because it was not ready at that time. Even they took another half hour to bring out luggage into the room. We came to the hotel at about 7pm, and their normal check in time is 2pm, so they had ample time to prepare the room for us. We wanted an extra bed and so told the reception at the time of check in, but they brought the extra bed at around 10 in the night. At lunch on the second day, their was a live insect in the passion fruit dessert and when we told the staff they just took it away and didn't bother to apologize. Then at check out, they manipulated us to give 5 stars and write a good review on trip advisor. No wonder it has a rating of 4.5 on trip advisor. Overall the service was poor and not to our satisfaction.
Teimuraz

We have just returned from a most wonderful stay at this hotel, and can recommend it in every way. The situation, right on a beautiful beach, and the architecture blends perfectly in to the environment and makes the most of the cooling breezes. It is conveniently placed for visits to near by Galle, and we especially enjoyed cycling through the lanes of local villages. What makes this hotel stand out, though , is the staff. Although we only stayed for a week, they made us feel like members of the family, and we were totally at home there. Every member of staff went out of their way to anticipate and meet our needs, and it is almost impossible to single out particular individuals who made our stay so special. KK, the restaurant manager and his assistant Anushka, ensured we had all we needed for every meal, and even arranged a delicious picnic for us to enjoy on our trip home. The food was absolutely delicious, catering for every taste, and Praveen Fernando found us a shady table outside for breakfast every morning. Mr de Silva, the general manager, was always on hand, and we felt cosseted and cherished throughout our stay. The swimming pools are amazing, and the shady garden a delight to relax in. The rooms are comfortable and spotless , again, with wonderful service. The local people of Sri Lanka , offering such warm and genuine a hospitality, are what makes a visit to this country so very special, this can be experienced in full at the Heritance Hotel. We had the most wonderful holiday , and will be recommending it to family and friends. We can't wait to return. Many thanks to all the members of staff who contributed to our delightful stay.
could have been better
I had room with balcony on 3rd floor facing ocean

We stayed 5 nights as an add-on to our two week island tour when the hotel was busy mainly with German, Russian and Ukrainian guests many of who were in large groups and are on all inclusive packages. Its is a quiet location on a beautiful beach with no other hotels nearby. Whilst we were there the sea was quite rough with a strong undercurrent. There is a well designed and maintained infinity pool, just off the lobby, that blends in with the sea giving the impression that you are actually in the sea. There is also another large pool elsewhere in the grounds. We were disappointed with the deluxe room that we were offered and so paid considerably more (although discounted) for a luxury suite upgrade which was very nice though was somewhat more than we needed though nothing else appeared to be available. The main restaurant (Jute) serves an excellent buffet as it offers a large choice of good quality international food though with probably less Asian dishes than we had at other hotels elsewhere. The groups sit at large tables in middle of this restaurant and can be quite noisy at dinner times. Our room hotel guide stated that attire for dinner was ‚Äòsmart casual‚Äô though this was largely ignored by many guests and especially by some men who wore jeans, shorts, T shirts and football shirts. Beach fine dining was excellent with a good choice of dishes from an a la carte menu including some wonderful seafood. Attentive and friendly service made this a truly memorable occasion. There was a lack of sun beds and umbrellas around the pools and grounds. Also, the sun beds and towels were old and many of the beds were broken or had wheels missing so there was the daily early morning rush to get towels on good beds with umbrellas. The hotel needs to invest money in buying new furniture and towels to ensure there are enough for all guests. Lunchtime food at the pool bar was limited to burgers, sandwiches and half a dozen other snacks which really should be supplemented by some salads and some more Asian snacks. Service in the grounds Service away from the two pools was infrequent and we usually had to walk to the bar to buy drinks. We have discussed our views with a representative of the hotels management (Dinusha Kularatne) who says he will be writing a report detailing our comments. It's a good hotel but it didn't live up to our expectations of the luxury hotel we wanted at the end of our holiday.

We went here purely for relaxation The hotel is a dream, the staff is friendly and the food was fantastic. Plenty of live food counters in the buffet they were entertained our special request on food . We were able to see the kitchen & we had nice cooking class with chefs. Rooms were good and has a great antique out fit. Two pools were great option for us. We loved the place and we had a great experience for the spent and waiting to go back to the heritance ahungalla soon.

Stayed for 9 nights in January (wish it had been more). This is not a Caribbean 5* resort so don't compare as such. It is half the price and in a way better, in that it has a rustic charm and a really chilled out atmosphere. It is more than ok and we thought the food, location and the people were brilliant. The two pools are lovely the beach beautiful and the Spa excellent. Yes some of the complex could do with an upgrade but that is just being picky. Thank you to all who made our holiday special we would have no second thoughts about returning. A special mention to the chefs who gave us a tour of the kitchen and offered to cook me (as part of my all inclusive) a special dish and cooked me the best curry I have ever eaten in my life. That's how personal this place is.
Nothing
Wishing we could have stayed longer

This hotel was the first destination of our honeymoon. The cool and calm environment that one encounters as you drive through the gates up to the reception is certainly inviting and to say that reflects the hotel's outlook would be an understatement. The check in was breezy with a warm welcoming service by the front office staff - now that's what I call hospitality. Although the room we got was located in the far corner, the room condition and facilities were simply breathtaking. The snacks provided were somewhat overwhelming but they tasted so well, that one would be stupid to resist. The Jacuzzi was a mind-blowing experience. As for the hotel service, I simply don't know how they do it, but they will be there at your doorstep literally seconds after you keep the phone. The restaurant and its management have won many accolades which they proudly display at the entrance. It was not before long that we realised why they receive them. The food is simply amazing with an endless spread. To walk around and have a look alone can fill you up. The flavours blend so well and they know how to exert the correct balance of tastes especially in local cuisines. The action stations were constantly full of action with a variety from prawns, sausages, bacon and waffles steaming continuously. Despite serious time restrictions and a house full of guests, the staff will go the extra mile just to see that smile on your face. The weekend extravaganza is something that one should not miss. On Fridays and Saturdays, the hotel features a cultural extravaganza with traditional and contemporary performances including the occasional fire limbo. Simply worth the time. The locality of the area features picteresque river boat rides to which the hotel also has some arrangements at additional cost. We could not make this journey, but previous experiences suggest that this cannot fail. The only option for improvement that I could think for the hotel is that it shows no signage for anyone plying from the South towards it. Whilst motorists from Colombo along the Galle Road (A2) would not miss the hotel sign, we travelled along the expressway (E1) to come up from south. Nearly missed the turn but managed not to overshoot it too much thanks to some roadside assistance. All in all, this was the first destination upon entering matrimony, and the warm service and comfortable outing at Heritance Ahungalla will be etched in our memories forever. A surefire revisiting option for us.

Reception staff were quite rude and took 2 hours to check us in. We were part of a large party and bookings were made some 6 months in advance of our arrival. One family of 4 were made wait in reception for over 3 hours before their room was available. Having said that the service staff, room attendants, waiters and bar staff were extremely accommodating and nothing was too much trouble. Rooms were not up to 5 star cleanliness and linen was worse than 1 star standard. Mini Bar was only refilled on request. The only thing 5 star about the hotel is the price and possibly the location, but be prepared to be pestered by hawkers as soon as you set foot on the beach.
Ask newly refurbish upstairs rooms
Absolutely breathtaking

The hotel is a dream, the staff are lovely and the food is fantastic. Don't pay the travel agent or hotel prices for trips, tours and transport you can get them outside the gate at a fraction of the price. We found a couple of lovely guys called Nimal Tours (Nimal and Wimal) who took us all over the place. They were reliable friendly and fun to be with. They live just across the way from the hotel in Station Road Ahungalla, everyone in the town knows them so they are easy to track down. We loved the place and can't wait to go back.

So much to say. The rooms were great, try for 3rd floor oceanview. The service was excellent. So many people to thank for our stay Klarathna, thushara, nerosh, varuna.. too many. Most particularly the front desk staff.. we toured sri lanka from Columbo to kandy to Penwalla to Nuwary Eliya to the hikkaduwa/batouna/Galle area. We had reservations with airbnb, and several hotels. When we arrived at the coast area we found none of the houses or hotels were anything like the websites depicted. All were filthy and trash strewn and very small. We came upon Heritance and were stunned . The hotel grounds are lush and clean, the pools were immaculate and the beach was clean large and perfect! There were multiple restaurants and bars on the grounds. There was entertainment . We stayed 4 days three nights and did not regret it. It should be said unless you a very comfortable with local foods and living conditions, this is the only hotel resort that offered a respite from the congestion and sanitary problems you may not be accustomed to. The hotel is also ideally centered between Columbo and Galle . We looked at almost every resort from Botouna to Galle, physically , while scrambling to find a place after being disgusted by our original "resort" this is far and away the best, by leaps and bounds . It is a five start resort at economy prices. ( we booked online in the lobby for a significantly reduced rate ) We also did half board which gave us breakfast and dinner. (We found this to be essential and we'll worth the little extra it cost) You will find the food choices were great and varied and the staff would accommodate any and all special requests. I wanted chicken noodle soup one night as opposed to the two choices and they made me a batch

all though the hotel and people were very good we found that being only bed and breakfast we liked to go out to different restaurants in the evening which was a 20 minute ride away as there was not really anything closer.We felt that on the beach you were never left alone and if you went out of the complex you ran the gauntlet of the locals
Ask for a new premium room which is slightly more expensive.
Poor Service, Terrible Toilet Conditions... etc (list goes on)

Nice hotel but let down by a couple of things. Some of the staff are lovely but.... My daughter's favourite Jack Wills t-shirt went missing - one she wore to sleep in, so she never took it out of the room. The hotel staff are very hungry for tips (one waiter told me within a minute of meeting that he was the sole breadwinner for his family and he only earned 4,000 rupees a month). It gets oppressive. The cleaners come into your room (both sets, am and pm) and tell you they are the only person responsible for cleaning your room (and can I have a tip please! ). We were given only one mug, and there were a lot of mosquitos in the room. The toiletries are in refillable china containers and its impossible to get anything out of them. Food is very good but lunches and drinks very expensive. Gave us a lovely christmas eve meal and went to great efforts (ice sculptures and father christmas arriving in a boat.) Waited for ever for coffee in the morning. Not much to do when it rains and the water was too rough to go in the sea, plus you get hassled and followed on the beach. Could be so much better.
Ask for a sea view - and double, not twin!
Corner rooms are roomier.
Fantastic Stay!

The food is delicious and the staff is very helpful. The surroundings are beautiful. The rooms are very clean and are cleaned well. The holiday was simply wonderful all around and we didn't miss anything.
Don‚Äôt go full board!
Very bad experience in Heritance

Why bed only? The buffet is over priced, ala carte much better although the selection isn't wide it was sufficient for us. Breakfast buffet was better if I hadn't booked with the breakfast addon (why did I do that??) I would have done ala carte again.
The ocean is pretty rough. Red flags were out all 3 days.

Manicured area, wide sandy beach. Very comfortable rooms, large comfortable beds, bathrobes, slippers - everything, great food, wonderful service - the staff is very attentive! Nice bar and cocktails. In the evenings the hotel is not boring)
Excellent service and big friendly smiles from all the staff.

Amazing 2 nights spent at Heritance Ahungalla during our trip around Sri Lanka. The pool was amazing, rooms well appointed and comfortable, great selection of food in the restaurant, and situated on one of the most beautiful beaches in Sri Lanka. Above all the professionalism and friendliness of the staff was second to none. Will certainly stay here on my next visit to Sri Lanka and would have no hesitation in recommending this hotel.
Beautiful beach front hotel and highly recommend Heritance Ahungalla
Good location but downsides

Great hotel. Service is high. The staff is friendly. You are greeted with sweets and freshly squeezed juices upon arrival. Clean rooms, clean grounds, clean beach. The food is delicious and varied. Warm ocean. There are monkeys running on the property.

1st floor - garden view and vicinity to the pool, 2nd floor - probably ocean view, 3rd floor - great ocean view. It's quieter around the green pool but rather far from the restaurant and the reception so not for poor walkers.
Do not trust Heritance nor Agoda
A bit of roof maintenance and construction on site but that didn't affect any party of the trip except for certain facilities like the library to be temporarily out of commission.

Service really good not a single issue about the service BUT The rooms - we booked 2 deluxe rooms one triple and double, as per my knowledge deluxe rooms should have a king sized bed not twin beds, im quite sure we were given superior rooms not deluxe and the third persons bed was a folding bed, which made our stay really uncomfortable, could not sleep all night. The funniest part...the shower cubicle was not enough for even one person. .. Very old and unsatisfying. .. Never going to any of the Aitken spence hotels ever... Must add...head office reservation lady was very un polite. ..don't remember her name. .. Overall - BIG NO NO NO
2 pools both very quite

We spent a week at Heritance between 28.12.2017 and 4.01.2018. Everything was perfect. We lived at the highest floor (room no.301) with fantastic seaview. Room was clean, spacious and well equipped. Hotel area very well maintained and not crowded (no problems with sunbeds and quiet places to relax). Choice and quality of food was amazing. The New Year's party was organized perfectly. (our best New Year's party ever). Long and clean beach excellent for walks (no problems with "beachboys"). But the best thing at Ahungalla is staff. Always polite and helpful. Special thanks for Mr. Praveen Fernando (food & beverage executive), Chef D.J Manjula and Mr. Nuwan Sasanka. Thank you very much for everything and see you in December 2018.
Sadly, a disappointment

Though it's described as a five-star resort, my parents and I were sorely disappointed by this hotel and will not be returning. The cons: 1. The receptionist offered us the opportunity to upgrade to full-board or half-board at a discount (USD30 instead of USD25 per meal). When we asked which restaurants this was applicable for, they said that it was only for the main restaurant, but failed to mention that it was ONLY valid for the buffet. If we had known, we wouldn't have signed up for two days of buffet-only meals. We found out because the waiter told us we couldn't have ala carte, and all of this happened after we'd paid for half-board for two days. In addition to not being told exactly what we were paying for, we discovered that the buffer cost LKR3,700 (USD24.2). So you're telling me that I didn't receive a discount--I'm actually paying the full cost of the buffet AND I'm locked in for a two-day commitment. This was dishonest on the hotel's part, and according to our travel agent, they shouldn't be directly giving us discounts--they're supposed to go through the agent. All in all, very poor form on the hotel's part. 2. On the morning of our check-out date, my bathroom didn't have water. I couldn't use the sink, I couldn't shower; it's a good thing I didn't have to flush anything. I checked my dad's room next door - also no water. It took two calls for housekeeping for the water to come back. How is this acceptable? 3. Our room had an odd smell that came from the bathroom drain. When we told the GRO, she said housekeeping would be around shortly to attend to it. They arrived 18 hours later. 4. When we first arrived, there was no porter to be found and we waited a solid few minutes before the receptionist noticed that we wanted to check in with our bags. He then rushed out and seemed very frazzled. Out of the 7 hotels we stayed in Sri Lanka, this was by far the poorest reception we'd received. The pros: 1. The restaurant staff were lovely, warm and attentive. My mum had a broken arm on this trip and the chef himself came out and helped her take food for the buffet and then walked her to her table. 2. They provide comfortable flip flops for guests to use on the beach and around the property. 3. The food was delicious. Every dish we had was delicious--both Sri Lankan and international fare.
Disappointing
Long hallways mean rooms closer to front desk are desirable
Ahungalla
I'd still go back - but will hopefully see some much needed improvements.

Our worst stay in the honey moon while others Mt. Lavinia Hotel, Serene Pavilions and Heritance Kandalama being really great. Got a great beach and couple of good large pools. Service is average. Rooms are old and not impressive. Some switches are broken. Air condition control really sucks, bathroom door can not be close properly. Management should consider doing some major renovations.
one to avoid
Dissapointing & Very Poor Service

I spent the Christmas weekend at the hotel. An absolutely beautiful property with a beautiful clean stretch of beach and the most mesmerizing sunsets! The major failure was the room. It was quite small and old and definitely wasn't maintained properly. Cleanliness of the room was not up to par for the price I paid especially during the peak holiday season. From table tops to curtains to the wash room, here was dust all over as if it was not cleaned in months. I had to clean the blow dryer with a wet tissue to get the dirt out before using it! There was also a very old TV in the room. Food was okay, not great but the staff was very friendly and very helpful. It makes your stay a worthy one against all odds. There are two great pools and a garden with a lot of trees. Well maintained and the pool staff was very friendly and helpful. I would definitely like to go back if the room quality and standards improves in the future.
Heritance

It was a very pleasant stay with heritance ahungalle. Rooms were very clean, comfortable, and facilities available were exceptional. However, dinner was below my expectation, as although the spread was extensive, nothing was tasty, as those lacked the flavour. Also, the table arrangement was a chaos, since the restaurant staff gave priority for group travellers, with no concern at all for small families.
Rooms towards the North are closer to the Resident Guests Pool
Another visit to a favourite Resort

4 of us stayed here from the 7th to the 18th of January. We had originally booked the Turyya Hotel , also 5 STAR , but had a call from our tour operator MERCURY to see if we wanted to change to the Heritance because the Turyya had been downgraded to a 4 Star Hotel due to a lot of complaints. We were happy to book into the Heritance . But did not have the good experience that we had expected. Our rooms were quite dirty . So much so that my daughter cleaned her room with a packet of Babywipes. My Husband did some cleaning with a towel . I refused to do so . I do not think that this should be part of my Holiday. Then we checked our pillows and duvet and had a big shock. We took our bedding to the lobby and were quickly ushered in to a back room . After complaining we were offered an , as the Manager called it , an upgraded room. We were taken to have a look at the room and were happy to move in to it . It was actually exactly the same room as the dirty one but newly decorated with a new shower etc. Before we moved in to the new room the manager asked would it be Ok if he would go and check the bedding . Of course we agreed . At around 11 o'clock I heard loud voices from my daughters room . I went to see what was going on and again the bedding was dirty . Duvet cover had a big brown stain on it and one of the pillows had mould all over it. The manager told us " that is why we put 2 pillow cases on it " OH DEAR !!!!!! But after that , I must praise the boys who cleaned our room , everything was spotless. The next day at mealtimes we were surprised that the restaurant staff seemed to be totally confused . It was a bit like FAULY TOWERS . There were other issues but it would take to long to mention them all . Would we come back to this Hotel . absolutely not , never ever .
Family Friendly beach property

First advice is please don't go to this hotel. Except the location there is nothing. They are unable to serve proper veg food. Rooms have no proper facilities in washroom. Used bed sheets with blood stains are provided. Electric switches are broken. Telephones not working in some rooms. Seepage on walls. Dampness. Washrooms has no exhaust and smell like hell.
