The sea is quit rough at Ahungalla in August and swimming is unfortunately not possible which shall be considered travelling off season.

When we entered the room, we complained about the smell of mould - the hotel did nothing. We had paid for this hotel nine months previously and we were now trapped. At dinner that night - we were asked how our soup was - and we honestly advised there was too much salt (another freshly made batch was produced). Twenty-four hours later, I was screaming at a lady from Guest Relations, the Food and Beverage Manager and the Housekeeping Manager, all standing in our room, (yes at this stage they were willing to change rooms - why I cried, you did nothing 24 hrs ago when I complained.) So they said we were being upgraded to Fine Dining - oh really, we had already paid for an evening meal, So we went for a snack, then slept. (The night before there had been a graduation - that's where the blood came from - and our future leaders had a wonderful noisy night). Upon checkout I was asked if I would like to complete a feedback form - oh dear, you really want me to write about our experience and state that we had to pay for our food. To her credit, she ran and my husband was given back the money he had just paid - and I received two bottles of water. The photos speak for themselves. Five star accommodation - I don't think so.

Working in the Hotel Industry myself, this is an experience I havent made before. I contacted the Hotel over 2 months ago, asking for an offer for a Family of 4 and myself for 4 days, Half Board. - used the Website mail: no answer - used the contact form: no answer - sent a mail to the Reservation department: no answer - Called the Hotel: was given another mail address: no answer - called again, persisted on the Reservation department directly: Reservation Agent (Trevin von Gunster) confirmed that he saw my mails from 10 days before, but was ¬¥¬¥too busy¬¥¬¥ to answer. - received an offer for 3 people, not 5, as requested - asked for a Change, over a week: no answer - called again: same person, apologies again, promised a new offer - receive a new confirmation, again for 3 adults, Kids missing - asked for a Change: since the 29th of November: no answer. I am trying since roughly 6 weeks to make a 2.500 Dollar booking, have spend hours and significant amounts on phone calls to Sri Lanka, have been kicked out of line repeatedly by the reception, have sent dozens of mails by now, and the result is: Zero. Absolutely astonishing.
Good but ...

Driven by excellent previous experiences we had at Heritance Kandalama, we booked a 3 nights‚Äô half-board stay at Ahungalla with similar expectations: that we will receive a service in accordance to a 5 stars hotel, customer oriented and with attention to detail. But unfortunately this was not the case. With the exception of the reception staff who was very friendly and efficient, the rest was below the average, especially at the main restaurant. On more than one occasion had to make exaggerated gestures to catch the waiters‚Äô attention and had to repeat our order of water and or coffee during breakfast and dinner. The used plates were often not removed, so we either had to again make exaggerated gestures to get the assistance of a waiter or make room ourselves. On top of that, getting the food from the buffet was quite a stressful experience by having to dodge tables, chairs and people (it was way too crowded!). Likewise, we faced a similar situation at the infinity pool bar. Given that the waiter was taking too long to come ‚Äìwe opted for standing up and going to the bar too make our order. Then we had to do a similar thing to get the bill as well. It was also quite unfortunate that the bar from the guests‚Äô pool was not operative and no equipment was provided to get a better use of the lovely beach (lounge chairs and sunshades). A real pity, we expected much more from what it used to be such an iconic hotel.

I have been to Heritance Ahungalla many many times. It is a second home to my family and my first choice for a family holiday, for an office trip or for a corporate training event. The difference at Heritance Ahungalla is the consistency in service and the courtesy and assistance extended by all, from the GM to a steward or housekeeping staff. Very innovative in everything they do, excellent rooms and delightful cuisine. I will never forget the 'ice-cream sandwich' served after an outdoor training session I had Heritance. The welcome and the departure is equally warm, which is not common - Gihan Talgodapitiya
rooms on the bottom floor are a good deal but not the ones on the furthest from the reception. It's creepy walking all the way at night :-(

We stayed here for 2 weeks at the end of March and first week of April. Mostly, I would agree the previous writer's review. If you wish to really see Sri Lanka then I would suggest that you stay here at the end of your holiday as it is quite far south and means that travel to places such as Kandy are extremely long and tiresome and the driving is something else to be seen, I would describe it as a 'white knuckle ride'!. The hotel is well designed but I would struggle to place it in the 4-5* bracket (try out hotels in Malaysia and you will really see the difference). There is a so called shop in the hotel which really does not sell any essentials such as shampoo so make sure you take your own hair products. Also, we bought factor 40 sun tan cream which did not work and we were severely burned (another couple had the same experience) so again, make sure you take your own sun tan creams and after sun with you. Regarding the beach terrorists, they do hassle you. We were followed for an hour on the beach by 5 of them who just would not give up, no matter how politely you said you weren't interested. They called and shouted to you if you were sunbathing near the beach and the only thing to do was to completely ignore them. One day we went outside the hotel to go the the pharmacy to buy some after sun lotion (due to the rubbish cream the shop had sold) and found exactly the same hassle, we lasted about 20 minutes before going back to the hotel. Our room smelled damp when we initially entered and the air con never seemed cool, the staff knocked on the door daily, sometimes 4-5 times to check the room was ok. However, I think this had more to do with wanting a tip. One time they completely ignored the 'do not disturb sign' and still persisted. The restaurant did offer a very good selection (buffet style) and quality of food, the only thing that let it down was the length of time it took you to get a drink when requested, especially as the ratio of staff to customers was overwhelming at times. If you don't like being hassled then maybe this isn't the place for you. In terms of the staff, all were very friendly and polite apart from one or two who seemed to have tipping on their agenda as a priority more than genuine customer service. All in all, a good quality hotel but if they really wish to put themselves in the 4-5* bracket, they are missing a lot of extras which you would normally expect.

Fantastic beach but they do not allow sun loungers and shades on the sand. I have been told the hotel does not encourage you to use the beach in case locals come along trying to sell items. This to date is our only complaint.

Wonderful hotel: proximity to the ocean, caring staff, delicious and varied food, availability of a gym. In terms of service, I am most grateful to Rukmal for the cleanliness of the room and wonderful surprises in the form of fresh flowers, cute notes and gorgeous animals made from towels.
Mixed Bag
JUST WOW

Room was excellent and very comfortable .The property is located right in front of the beach and has a very nice breeze. The staff is very friendly and helpful. I would like to mention a special thanks to Sanduni who was at the front desk.Food was good.
Rooms facing the pool and sea
Avurudu holidays
Lovely hotel and friendly staff

We booked a hotel. We walked in to our home.. It was not service, it was pampering , where we were looked after like being at home. What ever food we thought of was there and was given a right royal treatment by a professional set of Hoteliers. .. Continue the good work...
Awesome location
Rooms i the new wing overlooking the GREEN POOL is much better.

We ended our tour around Sri Lanka with a couple of nights at the Heritance Ahungalla. The hotel is well situated by the beach and we enjoyed walking along the shore watching the ocean roll in. We arrived with high expectations given all the five star reviews, but our experience did not live up to this. The bathroom in our room was disappointing for a 5 star hotel - small, bare plaster (not sure whether the room was being redecorated or this was the intended 'vibe') and the door wedged on the floor every time you tried to open it. The handle came off a drawer in the bedroom as the staff showed us the room when we checked in. On a positive note, breakfasts were buffet style with a very wide selection. Rather than accept the 'special offer' to upgrade to half board on arrival, we ate a la carte for dinners which meant we could choose what we wanted and this turned out to be much more cost effective than the half board offer/buffet. When we ate at the Mustard the place was very quiet, but we were rushed by the waiting staff - main courses arriving when we were half through our starters and left on the table, and dessert offered and our plates whipped away as we enjoyed the last mouthful of main course. Why the experience had to be rushed when the place was far from busy I don't know, perhaps the service could be most generously described as 'over eager'. This is a good hotel in a nice location. Staff were friendly. Just a few things which meant that our experience was not 5 star.

We were staying there at the New Year 2012/2013. In real, we didnt choose this hotel, it had choosen us)) of the mistake in booking of our touroperator. Some persons of staff were very polient and helpful. Breakfast could be more various and tasteful, I think. Prices for dinners were too high and we didnt take it. Nice beach, but there are a lot of local people, who always wanted you to buy something. Somebody of them could be really crazy, so please, dont walking alone by yourself at the beach. Rooms are nice, but it needed renovation in parts. There are not directly view at the ocean, but in the garden there are a lot of funny animals. Probably for somebody it is nice place, but I am nor sure that we would like to return there again.
There is a public jacuzzi facility here but it can only be used by staying guests
Not great

Heritance took us by suprise in the first look with a no frill lobby were one could see the pool and the view of the beach as you get off the car before the reception!!!!!!!! advice get as many books as you can for this holiday great place for readers as there is not to be done in the area so preferred to stay in the hotel with the two pools, great food, great hospitality. other than that Bentota/ Ahungalla doesnt have much to offer.
The staff is helpful and friendly.
I don't advise anyone to visit.
I wouldn't recommend booking this hotel. It is aimed at locals more and is a bit tired. Old bedroom furniture, old towels by the poolside.
Correct mais les prestations du personnel ne sont pas au niveau de l'hotel
Ground floor rooms have an easier access to all the amenities, but there are some upper floor rooms tat have a better view of the sea.
A ocea view room would be the best as ours was located on the side of the hotel we didn't really have much of a view.
Go outside the hotel and get a tuktuk to the bazaar - cheap exotic fruits.

We came to this hotel for a couple of days of rest and sun at the end of a two week tour of Sri Lanka. I have to admit it was my least favourite hotel. Yes there was lots of opportunity for sunbathing around the pool. The men were very attentive with keeping the grounds immaculate and bringing mattresses and towels. Also the bars were located around the grounds so drink was easy to obtain. But despite this being a hotel designed to blend with nature, I found the stark long corridors austere and unfriendly, and very noisy. In fact they echoed any noise particularly in the early mornings. In the restaurant there were far fewer waiters than previously and those that were in attendance were much less attentive. And the entertainment was a mixed bag. We saw a delightful cultural show followed by a very amateurish fire show. Positives? Lovely large rooms. The quietest air con ever. Great range of food. Lovely location on a pristine beach.

We stayed at this hotel for twelve days and expected more from a hotel with a deluxe reputation. The greatest asset this hotel has are its staff. They were simply excellent, so very friendly, exceptionally eager to please and polite and courteous at all times. You would find it difficult to find a better hotel staff anywhere. The food in the buffet restaurant was of a high standard and a perfect mix of Sri Lankan and International dishes. The food in the fine dining restaurant was even better and probably better than manyy top restaurants in London. The hotel is located right on the beach andmost of the rooms have a great sea view. There are many beach venders, but we did not find this too much a problem as they quickly learnt not to bother you once you made it clear you were not interested. Yes, there are many positives to this hotel, but unfortunately it does not deserve a deluxe rating. First impression are so important and this hotel is let down by being in need of care and attention. For example the furnishings in the public areas were stained and needed replacing and much of the woodwork needed attention. The tablecloths in the dining room were frequently filthy (unacceptable and easily rectified) and all the linen needed to be renewed. Many of the sunbeds were broken and needed replacing and wer covered with dirty matresses. However, the pool attendents were excellent and helped to make up for these problems. Our overall impression of this hotel was that it required significant investment to bring it up to an acceptable standard for a deluxe hotel. The hotel is saved by its excellent staff and fabulous food; two of the most impotant factors for a successful hotel. Would we return, possibly, but only if standards were improved. There are many boutique hotels opening in Sri Lanka and the Heritance needs to be able to match the very high standard that these hotels set.

One of four Heritance hotels we stayed in during a ten day tour. Large and has good architecture and enviable position on the beach this Hotel does lack the attention to detail that others had. No welcome drinks or towels which though not a deal breaker was noticeable because when we mentioned it the promised drinks later did not appear. The dining room was large but you were left to find out for yourself that half the breakfast buffet was in the quieter other room. Beach beds were placed by someone who seemed to feel the tired faded towels were far too precious to distribute. We had a good time but did not feel the staff overall were well motivated.We would return again to any of the others ie Kandalama, Earls Regency, and theTea Factory but would probably give this one a miss next time. Amazingly the A la Carte restaurant was not able to secure many or any takers on Valentines evening. We never felt the hotel was geared up to making guests feel special.The rooms were fine but some public areas do need a makeover. If you have a Mirror Lounge its probably a good idea to replace the rusting mirrored ceiling which detracts from the ambience.
the hotel is beautiful with great view from the lobby. the sandy beach is quiet.

I have just returned form 10 days at the Heritance with my girlfriend and can honestly say there wasnt any aspect fo the hotel that was disappointing. I work for a top tour operator in england and have travelled around the world staying at many top hotels. The service at the Heritance matched, if not exceeded many of these. The pools were fantastic...clean, great suze and we had one of the two at leat to ourselves on many occasions..it was great!! Below are some further comments: Room - was brilliant. It was a great size, really nicely furnished, clean with a great bathroom. Great views to pool and ocean. Cleaned daily. Food - amazing! we were on ahalf board basis and te food was superb. Great choice, different them every day, fresh, beautiful curries! Service - amazing. The staff were so attentive it was incredible. They were polite and friendly all the time. They alwas say hello and and make a real rapport with you throughout the time we were there. Beach - lovely but you do get hounded a bit by the touts when you walk on it. Just ignore them if you want them to leave you alone. Theyre firendly though. The sea is a bit rough so you cant really swim in it. Touts - if you want to get a taxi just ask one of the touts for a tuk tuk Its so much cheaper than the hotel taxis. We had the same driver for the whole 10 days and he was great. He took us to lots of places cheaply and was a safe driver. Dont be scared to use one..youll probably be a bit nervous the first time you get in one but then you can get their number and as soon as you want to go somewheer give them a call and theyll come and pick you up. Overall..couldnt fault our time at the heritance in any way. Ive read some of the negative reviews on this site and cant really understand what theyre on about. One said this hotel was dated which is complete rubbish! Feel free to email me if you have any questinos or want to know more. Nick
Ask for the sea view rooms!!!!!!!!!!
We prefer to come during weekdays and avoiding holidays which will be busier times. Around 2 hrs from Colombo via the highway.

Geoffery Bawa's infinity pool was amazingly beautiful. we stayed there for two days in May 2015. A perfect location for a quiet holiday. Only pity part was dinner. Main restaurant offers only buffet which was not so attractive. Room service was much better but limited selection.

Checked into the hotel on the Christmas Day. The hotel has a very nice feel but just don't carried away with the ambience. Our first couple of in room dining orders were very disappointing. The food was served cold ( real effort would have gone into that given the tropical climate) it had no local flavor, I mean the chili chicken was sweet. Anyways I have another couple of days to go hopefully will get some good food close by. I am not trying the hotel kitchen again.

I stayed here for 5 days.. The hotel is excellent and the staff is brilliant and friendly. The two pool was the highlight for me. I wish I could stay longer but have to go back :( .. I'm already planning to return soon!!
Hello . The hotel left a mixed impression, we stayed here from 02/03/24 to 02/12/24
Staying and meeting friends

The hotel looks stunning offers great views.We had booked the premium rooms sea facing. We found the service lacking in all aspects.From the rooms check in to the restaurant service. We were quite displeased with the hotel. I had planned a surprise for my husband and had requested the hotel for a cake and for the room to be decorated and offered to pay extra for the same. I had called and re-confirmed this more than three times. I had called in even three hours before check-in to ensure this is done. I was assured it would be done before we arrived. We came to the hotel and the front desk staff intimated that they never received any such request. Since it was a surprise it turned out to be quite a spoiler. Though the room was nice. We were given one with twin mattresses. We had to repeatedly request for a change in room with at least a queen mattress.(So much for an anniversary). We were told the hotel was running full.So we would be given a room change the next day.It never happened.Quite disappointing. Even the service in the restaurant was appalling none of the waiters bother to even keep the cutlery on the table after we have taken out plates or serve us even drinking water we had to repeatedly request for it.Being a 5-star hotel we were surprised at the dismal service. I might not consider the property again solely for the lack of service. Also the restaurants lack a choice of vegetarian food. especially the fine dinning restaurants does not serve any vegetarian food. even on request.We we forced to use the buffet every time.Which also has limited options.Disappointed again. We would not recommend this to others.
Coffee Shop
Service unparalleled

Stayed in Feb 2017 for 2 weeks, had a great time and it's worth a 10/10 for the beach,pool,rooms,food and staff Got on very well with all the pool boys and bar staff,if your thinking of traveling to Sri Lanka then I'd recommend this great hotel for couples and families Sea was very warm and welcoming,you can walk for miles along the soft sandy beach Had a brilliant holiday here
Absolutely heavenly
Great beach but.....
Awosome place 99% perfect 1% not for not giving me sweet hoppers lol..

April 2015 i was staying at Hotel Heritance Ahungalla, Good location, beautiful beach property...food was ok, Room service was bad.the TV was not working,flush was not working.The hotel had 2 swimming pools both beach facing.
NOT 5 STAR

This is my 2nd time at the hotel. We were allocated a spacious room. The hotel was at full capacity. The F& B managers were very good and helpful. The rooms were clean but I felt the housekeeping service lacked quite a bit. There was a cultural show and many kids activities. On the downside I was a little annoyed when the hotel had left a letter under my door reminding me about our check out for the next day. I had paid in full for both days and I feel such a reminder was not required. A family friendly hotel overall.

The hotel is generally good, with good food and is in a great location/setting. The pools were well maintained and weren't over crowded, and are safe for younger children. The architecture of the hotel is still impressive.

This hotel is very beautiful mainly because of its architecture and how beautifully the building blends with the nature ... The rooms and food are also of excellent quality ... Most of all the service they provide and the beautiful kind staff specially Dilashani and Kashalya ... Very beautiful hotel will visit again very soon...
Nothing to add

We booked for 2 nights unexpectedly as the election curfew messed with our original plans. The resort was mostly empty. It's not a full all-inclusive, meaning some guests pay a la carte. For the all-inclusive, the selection is OK - local spirits and a short list of cocktails. Wine is only served in the restaurant at lunch and dinner, which is weird. Food was good, but couldn't help the feeling that because it was not fully occupied the choice wasn't all there. The pool is nice, the beach is nearby (but not really a great beach, some serious surf). Rooms were OK, very clean, wifi was fast and the overall experience positive. Staff were extremely friendly and welcoming, which helped a lot. The gym was also a welcome addition - nothing big or fancy but there to be used, which is always a nice touch.

Great staff and service! Loved the beach and hotel ambiance! They throw an excellent breakfast buffet with heavenly pan cakes, waffles, omelets and so much more! Sri lankan dishes int he lunch buffet are to die for. Overall its a perfect vacation :)
Beautiful hotel, Excellent food
Prakash P

Your hotel hospitability is very nice the environment is very lucrative and gorgeous the food presentation and quality is very good... The childrens day programme was very nice and encourages for the kids and as parents i appreciate it ... Thankyou

The hotel is huge, rooms are big and there are never queues. Pools are good and the pool boys also nice. The housekeeping staff, especially Rukmal is amazing. Downside; The hotel has terrible price policy. You need to pay for everything + 18% and extra service charge. The prices are huge and complexity unfair. This is the reason why I will not return here.
You should ask for the rooms at a higher level as the view of the sea is good.
delicious food, bali-like rooms

Amazing place near the beach.Unfortunately our time was limited to be on the beach or the pool. Got to enjoy the Breathtaking views and the settings. Staff was extremely friendly with a smile and the helping hand. Food was delicious and couldn't ask for a better day out. Thanks!)

We were at heritance ahugalla for Two days on the 21st and 22nd of June 2014. While the other aspects of our stay was satisfatory the food was HORRIBLE and maybe even nearing on Atrocious!! In all meals the food was actually flavor less... the worst part is that most of us had to suffer from food poisoning and purging the same day! I will definitely never visit this hotel again and will definitely advise all of my friends and family to never go there even if it was the last place on earth!! solely because there was something that was seriously wrong with the food in that hotel So please if anyone of you are thinking of going there... Think again

First the good bits: pool and beach here are gorgeous. Staff are all excellent and try very hard. That's it for the good bits This hotel is on desperate need of an upgrade to claim its 5 star rating. 5 star this is not. Tired rooms, leaking shower, bath that did not drain , mouldy screens etc. Lobby bathrooms - 2 out if 3 cubicles no lighting, doors did not lick and paint chipping off the doors. The food here is ok. If you are looking for a good 3.5 star hotel then this is fine but we have stayed in many other so called luxury hotels on this trip and they were all way above this hotel in terms of fit out and upkeep . They do many things really well here but 5 star lodgings it is not.

Heritance Ahungalla would be a great location for a couples retreat, provided they make a few improvements. The hotel is situated in a slightly secluded area (15-20 minutes away from Galle city), is a heart-warming relic of colonial era architecture, and has a marvelous private beach and other relevant amenities. However, it can become even better if the service quality is improved. I had a bitter experience checking in as I waited for almost half an hour before anyone attended me, and even then it took the staff forever to complete the formalities. One would generally expect the staff of a 5-star hotel to be more competent and efficient. Moreover, the staff seemed confused when I asked them for advice on travelling around Galle. I stayed in a twin sharing room (I was there on a conference). While the room was nice, the bathroom seemed a little worn down and I felt needed to be revamped.
Package holiday camp overrun with Russians
get sea view
May get a ancient room if you have done the reservation is under a promotion/offer
Auto-glorified Hotel

My husband and I are seasoned travellers to Sri Lanka and the Indian sub-continent. We are just finishing a 4 week trip to probably one of the best hotels on the Island if you are looking for a beach holiday. Without exception all the staff are absolutely wonderful - if only we could 'bottle' their smile before returning to the UK? The management readily admit that they need to update the bedrooms and public areas of the hotel but this in no way detracts from the amazing stay you will have from the minute you arrive until the very last minute before you leave. All staff are worthy of mention but as we do not have room to name them all, 3 in particular will ensure your stay remains not just an experience but a long lasting memory (KK Restaurant Manager; Nihal Restaurant Supervisor and Saman (our houseboy for Room 102). The lifeguards at the poolside also deserve a mention; not all guests are easy to deal with but they remain polite and cheerful whatever the guest request! The hotel, originally designed by Geoffrey Bauer has pride of place on a wide, long stretch of sandy and 'sun bed free' beach. Part of me doesn't want to write this review and to share my holiday with you - the only reason being we don't want lots of people to spoil it!! So enjoy - you will not be disappointed and if you are wondering if we will return - of course!
try to get room on 2nd floor or above
Try and get a room down towards the tennis courts as that is further away from the bar area and any noise in the evenings.
Honeymoon Spl

The hotel looked amazing when we arrived and we were upgraded to a fantastic suite which we were very happy with. The beach was long and wide however the sea is rough so don't expect to do too much swimming in there. Having stayed in a few other Heritance hotels during our visit to Sri Lanka we were pretty expectant when it came to the food at Heritance Ahungalla if nothing else, but we were let down here. There was not enough to choose from which was our main issue. Another bug bear was how the hotel allowed women in niqabs to swim in the hotel pools, not the type designed to be worn for swimming which of course I have no issue with. Despite these relatively small complaints we had a very relaxing stay and would recommend the hotel.

Am avut upgrade de camera gratuit, obtinut prin booking, insa pentru ei asta insemna sa ne dea aceeai camera, doar ca la un etaj superior. Dupa ce am stat 3 ore in receptie am reusit sa obtinem camera conform rezervarii, insa nu are legatura cu pozele. Mucegai in camera. Pretul de 250 de dolari pe noapte este exagerat pentru o camera cu tavanul plin de mucegai. Mancarea nu este chiar buna. Peste pretul din meniu se va adauga: 10% servicii, 3% alte taxe si peste toate astea (pretul de baza + 10% + 3%) se adauga tva de 18% la toata suma. Hotelul este plin de rusi, ceea ce nu este placut pentru noi cei din lumea civilizata. Se trezesc de dimineata, isi pun prosoapele pe sezlong pentru a le rezerva si se duc inapoi la somn. Apar abia pe la 12, timp in care tu nu gasesti sezlong liber.

This is meant to be a 5 star hotel, but is lacking in so many areas. The positives first. The restaurant staff and room cleaning staff were excellent. The rooms are very nice, spacious and beds are extremely comfortable. Unfortunately the reception staff and management were extremely unhelpful and didn‚Äôt address issues when highlighted. We visited during Sri Lankan new year and we knew shops and restaurants would be closed, we asked the reception staff and were advised Fri and sat (which is what we expected) I also asked if they knew if restaurants in Galle would be open on the Sunday and was advised they would all be closed as still new year so better to stay at the hotel. This was incorrect as a discovered through a Facebook forum and visited Galle on the Sunday were all restaurants were open. This felt like an attempt to keep you in the hotel spending money. The prices at the hotel were also questionable. The hotel we stayed in the week before had clear pricing on there menu eg Nani goreng 1800 Sri Lankan rupees. The heritance menu do 10% state service charge to be added, but also to be added is 18% vat meaning the prices stated which were already at least 20% higher than the previous 5star rated hotel we had stayed in were much more costly than other similarly rated hotels and more concerningly this isn‚Äôt clear. The pools open at 8am which is fine as they need to clean them, but the bed cover and towels aren‚Äôt available until 8am and as I am an early riser and like to get up and spend some time in the sun before breakfast and the sun gets too hot this was disappointing. Also out of the 5 nights we stayed here I had to trek around the resort on 3 separate days to find a pool attendant as you can‚Äôt get the mattress and towels yourself, having gone to reception on 2 occasions it took until 9 am on 2 of the days to get the towels and mattresses, and all the manager Clive could do was apologise, which given it happened again the following morning was very poor. The issue clearly hadn‚Äôt been addressed. Also around the pool, wasn‚Äôt cleaned with cigarette ends (dissapointing that‚Äôs scruffy guests leave this is the first place) plastic bottles and beer caps left on the grass for the last 4 days we were there. I would not recommend this hotel to stay at and instead would highly recommend the 5 star Taj Bentota which is only 20 minutes away and is excellent with much more around the hotel as well which if you want to explore is great.
New Year's Eve

It was a last minute deal I got for an offer from HSBC Credit Card and i decided to stay at the Heritance Ahungalla, It was a wonderful experience. 2 Large Swimming pools which can accommodate many. The Sand on the Beach is so soft and golden. Very nice to walk on the beach. The Staff are very courteous and Friendly. Nice food spread. if you are traveling with kids, There is a kids club with very professional animators to look after the kids. They do face paintings, teach kids to draw and many more.
Upstairs rooms are quieter and have a better view of the ocean. But also ask for rooms away from the restaurant and main pool area. If you can afford a suite, go for it!

Heritance Ahungalla is always our first choice when I and my partner visit Sri Lanka. I have stayed in this hotel more than 20 times over the last few years and, there is nothing else in Sri Lanka to beat its architectural beauty, tranquility, beautiful sandy beaches, friendly staff and their hospitality, and great food choices. All our work stresses and worries just disappear into the thin air as soon as we walk into the lobby of the hotel for the first time. Friendly welcome from the staff and the glance of the hotel environment with the infinity pool and the sound of the sea waves set the tone for the rest of our holiday. We love to come to Herritance to celebrate Christmas and the New Year since they organise a fabulous dinner with amazing food buffet with ice sculptures and food decorations which is out of this world, dance shows, fireworks and music by a great band. This experience is heavenly under the stars with the sound of the sea. What is unbeatable in this hotel, compared to other hotels in Sri Lanka, is the friendliness and the quality of the staff who works their. This goes from the General Manager to all the managers, to the waiters who serve at the restaurant, to the cleaning staff, and to the pool staff. They are always their to do their best to make our stay a memorable experience. I would like to give a special mention to Duminda and Waruna at the restaurant who always made sure we have an amazing dinning experience. Rukmal, the towel artist, make fabulous animal figures with towels and surprise us every morning as we come back to our room after breakfast. Pool attendants are always there to prepare our sun-beds every morning. We love walking along the sandy beach in front of the hotel in the morning and also in the evening and enjoy the evening sunset and then dive into the pool for a final swim before getting ready for the dinner. One day we wanted to organise a special dinner on the beach for a friend and his family to celebrate his retirement. The staff went out of their way to organise this dinner with fabulous food and assigned dedicated staff to serve the food. It was an unforgettable experience. I recommend this for couples if you are interested in organising a romantic dinner or for any special events to mark the occasion. I hope to be back again in the summer to re-live this beautiful experience.
Unforgettable experience
The best holiday is always at Heritance Ahungalla
superb beach, excellent food, very nice hotel/pool but rooms a bit shabby
Honeymoon adventure
Upon checking in, power for the room went off. Phone in the hotel room was also faulty. Cleanliness of the bathroom was not up to standard. Dinner buffet was limited in variety and lacking in taste.
If you don't like the room call the manager not the clerks, Managers thinks from the customers point of views and give you the best
It was good but its an very old hotel. Also there were disturbance at the beach area from local sellers. Was felt unsafe and uncomfortable. it seems Hotel is not able to contorl them.
We asked for an ocean view room but not really necessary as all rooms faced either the sea or pool and had lovely aspect.
Sri, August 2023

The hotel is too large and it is a 40 year old So it is kind of an old hotel The room service is late We checked in and the shampoo and body gel bottles were empty Regardless of all this they have a nice looking beach The lobby is wide and open to the ocean and unfortunately it is as hot as the ocean and the outside street I dont know it is a good hotel if they did renew it

We only stayed here for one night - it was a beautiful hotel - our room was lovely and great bathroom. The hotel is very open and spacious - we did have a long walk to our room, however we did not mind - we saw monkeys in the trees as we walked to the main hotel area. We had the buffet dinner which was very good - breakfast was the usual Si Lankan fare

Two nights at Heritance was definitely not enough. great food comfortable accommodation and just great location. The hotel was full due the been so close to christmas. Staff were busy however treated us all like we were the only customers. Great turn around from the previous time we visited when the hotel was called triton.
Construction=some new parts and some dilapidated parts

Room was average considering we had told them it was our honeymoon. Food was not up to par when comparing with other hotels in Sri Lanka until we spoke to one of the chefs who made us a traditional Sri Lankan curry and brought it to our table. Think they try to cater for far too many people instead of sticking to traditional dishes. We were told that it would be good for snorkelling but the sea is too rough all year round. Better snorkelling a few miles down the coast. Staff were useless at bringing drinks. Could take an awful long time waiting. We got bored with the bar and mundane entertainment and walked along the beach to a ramshackle hut called The Sunset Bar where we were given a warm welcome by the locals who run this place. Ending up dancing on the sand. Soooooooooooooooo much better than listening to polite, elevator music back at the hotel!! Wouldn't recommend this hotel to anyone and wouldn't go back. There are much better hotels around.

One of the best hotels in sri lanka.we got a very nice room.two swimming pools are clean and beautiful.staff is very friendly and helpful.the food is really good. good value for money.we would love to come back. Its so beautiful during rainy season in sri lanka,highly recommend.

Good place to stay if you are after peaceful solicidity

Our room at the hotel was very impressive but sadly quite noisy. You could hear everything from the corridors and in the room above. The hotel itself was a bit tired. The green swimming pool was amazing and usually quite quiet but the main pool was very busy all the time and with lots of children playing games so it was not very peaceful. The setting is lovely and the beach is really very beautiful, we enjoyed spending time on it. The staff were well meaning and friendly however we did have a few issues. I think perhaps not all of what we said/asked was understood but instead of asking to clarify they said yes and just said of course, no problem. This meant that we had a couple of situations which left us with problems. We booked a PCR test and expressly asked if the cost could be charged to our room. We were told that this was fine and no problem, then when we came to do the test we were told we needed to pay in cash which we did not have. The hotel did. It do anything to help and we found ourselves roaming the streets in the midday heat desperately trying to find a cash machine and very stressed. We also arranged a late check out which we had to pay for. We agreed this and then confirmed it the next day. Despite this on the day of check out we got a call saying we needed to vacate the room. We queried this and confirmed what we had arranged previously and were told they didn‚Äôt have anything on their system and we would need to clear our room straight away but they could put us in another room. We were not packed or prepared for this and the whole thing turned out last day into a really stressful and ruined day.

Same as kandalama heritance also have poor hospitality. They don't care about customers. They act like we came to stay and eat there for free. üòÇ. After having bad experience in kandalama the I went heritance ahungalla. No difference. So after the bad experience from both heritance hotel I stopped choosing heritance hotel.

The Heritance Ahungalla Hotel is a great and tidy place. The hotel staff cares about the high quality of service, starts from room service across the restaurant food. Especially room service (the guy named Rukmal) was taking care of tidy in our room every day, and provided us comfort all the time. Place with direct access to the beach, the ocean is rights next to the hotel. Fantastic, colonial style hotel. I give high marks to this place. Sincerely recommend!
The dining room was a bit crowded because it was the weekend rush and it's the only thing I can think of to say I didn't like
Rooms 350 onwards have a stunning view of Pool as well as Sea
Very disappointed with room

Well, if you like a large noisy hotel with shabby rooms and indifferent food, then this is the place for you. On the plus side the beach is pristine, and the inexperienced staff try their best. BUT it is a very large hotel which opens its doors to day trippers at the weekend, so the pool is full of screaming children. In the morning you cannot sit by the main pool because of the noise from speakers accompanying aerobics - ugh. The rooms are decorated in the bare plaster look which does not stand up to wear and tear. The food is average if you like buffets at specific times. A la carte is mainly burger and chips with variations. The prices for food are higher than the Hilton in Colombo, and what really annoyed me the most was that the hotel write up proports to show this as a 5* establishment, with prices to match when in fact I have stayed in many rest houses with better facilities.

We checked into the hotel the day before a public holiday. Following day while chatting to a waiter he said there is going to be a huge crowd for lunch hence come by 12:30. Apparently they were going to have about 350 day visitors when the restaurant can accommodate only 175. We had breakfast around 9:00, and no way we could eat again at 12:30. We had no choice but to cut short the holiday and go home. How can a hotel treat its in house guests like this? Instead they should have arranged lunch for day visitors in a separate hall. Everything else was ok.
Perfect food

Arrived after an amazing tour to be greeted with a poor reception by hotel staff.Not shown to the room ,two green pools full of algae unable to see bottom of pool.room was sufficient but superficially cleaned, no welcome fruit staff rude , lazy as this is an all inclusive for other countries paying guests are ignored but they stillcharge service charge. Lack of sunbeds but pool staff reserve for tipping guests. Children allowed to run wild everywhere even in the restaurants. Covid restrictions dismal and guests not challenged despite Sri Lanka still insisting on mask wearing. Only one bar open despite advertising all facilities available‚Ä¶. Avoid this hotel as a well travelled guest this deserves at best a 3 star rating.
The dinner options were almost the same as the lunch options. This might be due to the fact that it was Sunday and there were only few guests

Our problem started upon our arrival when we were told that we had been upgraded to a luxury room, but it turned out to be an isolated one (at the very end of the hotel) with a view on tennis courts. In addition, the room contained only 2 beds (One queen-sized and another ‚ÄúExtra‚Äù bed). As we had explicitly requested (and confirmed twice with our travel agent) a room with 3 beds and a sea view, we made this clear to the staff member who showed us the room. After she spent some time on the phone, she referred us to the manager on duty( Srinath A ). This manager was beyond rude and impatient, immediately telling us that there were no other rooms available for us to change, because apparently we had checked in late (6 pm). Brushing aside this unprofessionalism, we peacefully requested a refund, in order to be available to switch hotels and find what we are looking for elsewhere. At this point, the manager refused and defiantly told us: ‚ÄúWe don‚Äôt have money at the hotel. Talk to your travel agent to get money, and go''. After spending 3 hours in the lobby and threatening to escalate if we were not refunded our money right away, suddenly and magically, a suite became available for us to move into, which uncovered the lies that were being told before about the hotel being fully-booked. Such dishonesty and disrespect is not worthy of a 5-star hotel.

Have just returned from 2 weeks at the Heritance and overall it was a disappointing experience, primarily because the service was so mixed, ranging from good, to indifferent, to frankly poor. My wife and I travelled with our 13 year old son, and we stayed in 2 adjacent luxury rooms, which were slightly tired, but extremely spacious, and thoroughly cleaned every day. A word of warning to anyone travelling with younger children, we had made 3 advance requests via our Tour Operator "Kuoni", for inter connecting rooms. We received no reply, and were only advised on arrival that the hotel has no interconnecting rooms. The 2 hotel pools are large and well maintained, one offering some limited organised activities and the other residents' pool offering a quieter option. The hotel and grounds are spacious, and even though the hotel was fully occupied for part of our stay, it never felt over crowded. We had opted for bed and breakfast, so didn't experience the buffet, all inclusive option. However a few of our fellow guests did and commented that the food was good quality, but repetitive if staying for 2 weeks. We mainly ate in the Coffee Shop restaurant where the food was good, and given a supposed 5 star hotel, we thought the prices were reasonable. Dining out options in the village of Ahungalla are non existent. If you walk out of the hotel complex, you are quickly surrounded by several locals, offering TukTuk rides, boat safaris, and numerous trips. They are persistent but never threatening, and several firm " no thank you" will usually see them retreat. The village does have a pharmacy and a bank. If you are cashing travellers cheques, it is worth the 5 minute stroll to the bank as it offers a significantly better exchange rate than the hotel. For dining out you need to get a taxi or a TukTuk to Bentota or else to HIkkaduwa. Bentota has several hotels and is 20 minutes in a taxi or about 25/30 minutes in a TukTuk. The drivers will wait for you and negotiate a return trip price. A hotel taxi was about ¬£20 for a return trip, with the tuktuks costing about half of that. The best restaurant we found was the Golden Grill, good for curries and seafood. Dinner for 3 people with beer and soft drinks was typically ¬£30 to ¬£40 in total. Main frustration came with the inconsistent service in the hotel. At breakfast, there was a great range of food, and all well presented, and plenty of staff on hand. Unfortunately it wasn't unusual for 3 different waiters to approach you to ask whether we wanted tea or coffee, but then none of them would get round to serving it. The pool attendants are helpful but want tipping continually and the room cleaners changed several times and all made subtle overtures for tips. Reception staff were always smiling, but poorly trained and inefficient with simple requests having to be made several times before anything got done. After the first week we found a great guy working reception and just made sure we dealt with him. Some lovely staff serving drinks around the pool, always friendly and helpful. Wandering onto the beach is spoilt because the locals will lie in wait and then follow you round trying to sell you gouges or trips. They will ask your name and if you give it, they will stand at the edge of the hotel property calling to you while you try and relax on your sun bed. Again they aren't threatening in any way, just persistent and something of a pain. Just keep saying "no thank you" and they will eventually give up ! Overall, the Heritance is nice but dated hotel, but represents pretty reasonable value for what it is. The location is isolated but the grounds and pools are good, and the rooms are fine. It has the potential to offer a relaxed, get away from it all style resort, IF the management could get their act together and get the service to a consistently efficient level.
Don't be fooled by the photos, it's a disappointment!

During school holidays Heritance Ahungalla is a place where I visit for relaxation. Service what we received from the time we step in and until we leave is excellent. I look forward every year to visit this hotel again and again. Never get board or tired, when we are in this hotel.

We are two couples that have a lot of experience traveling together and visiting many cities around the globe. This hotel is known as luxury hotel,but is not!!! You can not have a relaxed dinner because it's SO noisy , it was a kind of a violent experience. The room is nice but far from being clean. Don't try!
Air condition wasn't working in one room

It was a family trip with my husband and my 16-month-old son. The room was very good. We booked a Premium King with Sea View, but we got a pool-view room. However, the view was not bad but wished they gave us what we booked. The food was not as I expected at all. I stayed at this hotel a few years ago and the food was amazing then but this time the food was very average. I got a rotten taste in one of the meat items. The jacuzzis in the pool area were not working also. Overall it was a bad experience because we had high expectations compared to the last stay. Nevertheless, we liked the rooms very much. It was very clean.
Take your chances.

We stayed here for 4 nights following a tour of the national parks of Sri Lanka. The hotel was of a good standard and the food in the restaurants was excellent. The pool was good and the welcome from the staff was great. The only negative point is that the beach attached to the hotel is public and as such has a lot of hawkers on it who will not leave you alone although this is the same on a lot of Sri Lanka's beeches. Even in the monsoon season when we went (could not swim in sea due to its roughness) it was a good break after a tour and i would recommend it to anyone for a short break. Any longer than 5 days however may get boring as there is nothing in the local village.
The property was not exactly like in those photos. Need to be renovating and little bit of attention, it‚Äôs looking old and tired .

For the sixth time we returned to this hotel. Everytime we go to Sri Lanka we must stop here to check if the familiar, friendly atmosphere and the good food still are there. And it is, always. The Geoffrey Bawa building is in need of renovation but they are planning for that next year, good. They have alredy started with a few room but more to come. The crew take very well care of the guests and you fell comfortable all the time. Special thanks to Thushara and Gamini for spoiling us, chef Manjula for very nice food.

Our room number was 354, which is literally at the end of the world!_x000D_ You had to walk for 10 minutes to reach the reception. Look for rooms closer to reception and pool area, so that you don't feel like an outcast.

I visited this property for a destination family wedding and while the rooms, all beach facing and the property was great with the really nice swimming pools, the service levels expected for this category of hotel was severely lacking. We were 3 of us staying in a suite and we were categorically declined to be given another cinamon gel soap (they only give one for your entire stay) and we had to fight for extra drinking water, considering there was an extra person in the room. We had a housekeeping guy who was downright rude and hellbent on proving us wrong. Apart from this even refusal for giving us food from the buffet since we were late or allowing us to sit in the restaurant and eat. The point is that the staff blindly followed rules and did not care about customer service at all. Not once have they gone out of their way to help us feel comfortable.
Hotel in need of renovation which is currently being undertaken. Staff in the restaurant were not attentive enough in my opinion. One evening we had to ask for drinks 3 times.

Came in here over the weekend, drove from Colombo and got in late but the reception was ready for us and got us checked in real quick. They had a spacious room for three but they missed the basics like refilling the amenities like toothbrushes etc. and had to be ordered. And the shower gel, conditioner and Shampoo had no labels so we had trial and test to see what was what. So frustrating!! Nevertheless they made up with the amazing location absolutely amazing service and great spread for both breakfast and lunch as that's what we had. Ordered room service for dinner which was apt but they overkilled on the French fries!! I'd recommend you guys to go for the ambiance and location and hopefully if they correct these small issues you have a killer deal!! Cheers!

Excellent & a very pleasant stay. Very cozy rooms. Room service is also good. Beach excess is convenient. Food is good but need some improvement. Ambiance is excellent. Very positive and advice you to stay in this property.

More recently, we had a rest with a group of friends at the Heritance Ahungalla hotel on the island of Sri Lanka. The impressions were the most pleasant. The hotel is very comfortable, clean, tidy and beautiful. The window offers a stunning view of the ocean, there are many vegetation and animals around. In the morning you wake up to a variety of singing amazing, exotic birds. And when you leave your room for breakfast, you can see a family of monkeys, which is located on the branches of the nearest trees. A very funny sight. There were no problems with food, as there are dishes of both local and more familiar cuisine for us. Another pleasant feature of the hotel is that the beach is located some 100 meters from the hotel. Since during our trip there was quarantine in the country, nevertheless, we did not feel any inconvenience, because the ocean was within walking distance. I would also like to mention the staff of the pool bar and in particular Mr. Darshana. Very nice person, brilliant employee and very friendly guy. Always ready to serve and help. In general, I liked the rest very much. I hope I will come here at least one more time.

Pros: Very nice seaside resort hotel. Clean comfortable rooms with excellent service by staff. Cons: Overpriced for the total experience. Buffet lacks variety of foods. Rough seas most of the times hence unable to go in.

we were booked here for 6 nights after our round-the-island tour. This hotel was selected as it was the one being pushed by the major tour operator (to whom we have sent a full and damning report) and, at the time of booking the reports on this site were good, although these have now changed. To be fair, we WERE tired after travelling all day. Reception seemed ok until you raised your eyes sea-ward and saw the lager-swilling, chain-smoking and tattooed "guests" and the dirty looking swimming pool with broken sunbeds (covered with filthy mattresses) Need I go on? We checked out to the Taj Exotica which for a few pounds more per night was first class I should say that Heritance is about 20 minutes south of Bentota, so not exactly close to anything to allow you to escape

From the moment you arrive till the time you leave this fabulous hotel with its attentive, friendly and engaging staff never fails to impress. Our large airy room overlooked the main pool and beach and when not walking the golden sands or wallowing in the pool or relaxing in the shade of the trees around the second pool there was nothing better than sitting on the balcony enjoying a drink and listening to the nightly music from below. The breakfast buffet was huge. Well laid out and fresh daily. The food in the restaurants was well presented and tasty. My favorite, the Mexican with Sri Lankan influence menu. Ate there twice, different courses both times, everyone of them delicious. Would I return. In a heartbeat.
Request a quiet room if that is what you wish.

the whole family enjoyed the two week stay we had at this lovely hotel. staff were great nothing was too much trouble for them and they wanted to please. will return...thank you to all and the management

We have just returned from a three week stay at the Heritance Hotel. Hotel was basically good, everything worked, including the staff who, if anything, could be overly attentive. Rooms were stylish, had plenty of storage space and were serviced twice daily. Balconies had views across the beach to the setting sun. Some guests complained of minor faults, e.g. our fridge broke down but was repaired the same morning. Food was a good as could be expected with Buffet Service and we were never bored, although the dining room could be noisy. The hotel is proud of its swimming pools and rightly so. Attentive pool boys and life guards ensure there is not the usual scramble for beds and towels. We actually preferred the second (residents) pool to that shown in all the literature. The beach was regularly cleaned and patrolled. Constant slight surf, no problems for even moderate swimmers but small children should be supervised. The hotel‚Äôs main drawback is its isolation. Locally, there is simply nowhere to go and little to do. Ahungalla village consists of some 70 yards of dilapidated shacks selling local produce and a few basics at blatantly ‚Äôtourist‚Äô and local prices. There is also a passable bakery, a pharmacy, a bank with no ATM and a railway station at which few trains actually stop. There are two bus services and two qualities of bus i.e. Air Conditioned and Local. It is difficult to ascertain what is a public bus, as opposed to touring or private hire and even more difficult to have them stop. Heritance guests are not expected to want to walk anywhere, let alone get on a bus. The weather was good. It rained frequently but usually in late evening and accompanied by spectacular lightning. Mosquitoes are in evidence and, despite a wall plug device and sprays we were both bitten frequently. Guests attempting to leave the hotel by the main entrance have to run the gauntlet of a persistent group of motorised tricycle (Tuk Tuk) taxi drivers who will resort to any device to have you hire them. In addition, the driver will insist on waiting for you and interfere with your activities. Their constant attentions became oppressive, more so than had we stayed in Bentota or Hikkaduwa where there are more hotels, more activities, thereby more tourists to go around. Beach vendors were a nuisance but were not permitted onto hotel premises. A fellow female guests was accosted on the beach some 200yds from the hotel and robbed of her hat and wrap. This was however an isolated incident and we found the local people welcoming and keen to promote their countries new found stability. Expeditions were possible, 400 yards North along the beach to a fish restaurant shack is worthwhile. I ordered Lobster and drank a local beer whist two young men went out with snorkels and a net to retrieve one. 800yds south along the Galle road, on the left, is the Lucky Lanka Spice Garden and Ayurvidic Centre run by a charming young man. Full body massage for ¬£10 and a large selection of herbal potions to buy at ‚Äòlocal‚Äô prices. Other worthwhile excursions are a tour of lagoon at Balapitaya (or Bentota) with a visit to one island to see cinnamon being hand rolled by a wonderful old man and his elfin grand daughter. A morning‚Äôs snorkelling by Some at International Dive Centre, located at Coral Sands Hotel in Hikkaduwa is good value where there is an excellent parade of fish, including Octopus. The coral was badly damaged in the Tsunami but hopefully showing signs of a return. If Temples and/or elephants are your thing, then there are further trips afield, e.g Kandy, Yala National Park and Burwela Bird Sanctuary. However, from Ahungalla, both entail an expenditure of over ¬£110 pp, an overnight stay and between 5-7 hours in a minivan, each way. In summary; great hotel but we chose the wrong location for the type of holiday we enjoy. To get the best from Sri Lanka we would recommend dividing time between the Highlands, forests, wildlife parks and beaches. If however, you want a hotel based beach stay for a few days, you would be pushed to find better. Sri Lanka has great potential, stunning scenery, culture, a vibrant history and the most glorious beaches I have seen.

We stayed for two weeks at the end of September after the hotel was highly recommended to us by a friend. From the moment we arrived we were treated to a true five star experience. Our room was a deluxe room overlooking the Green Pool with a view of the sea and we couldn't have asked for better. The bathroom had double sinks and the bed was better than our one at home. The buffet food was always fresh and inspiring and the chefs would always cook some plain chicken for my fussy 6 year old daughter. The restaurant staff, even when really busy, were always smiling and attentive. We were especially impressed by KK (Kumara) who went out of his way to make our family holiday incredible. He is a credit to the hotel as well as his colleague Thusara, who also looked after us. The bar staff were great, as were the canap√©s served with our delicious arrack. The pools were lovely to swim in, especially the Green Pool. We would thoroughly recommend this hotel, even though it's large it has the personal feel of a smaller hotel. It's also worth mentioning that we booked the hotel with Imthiyaz at Sun City Travels in Colombo and he got us a very good rate for our stay. We would like to thank all the staff for their fantastic efforts in making our holiday so amazing. My daughter says she would give the hotel 10 stars if she was allowed. We look forward to returning in 2014. Hector, Maria and Kandy Baker.

We booked a double room and from the time of our arrival it felt like we were in a quarantine facility. For a beach hotel that should exude a relaxed vibe, the entire entry was roped off!! We were taken over by a hostess from the time of arrival and directed like school children - "stay here, do that, etc". Walked through an xray scanner which is quite okay but which was the only entry. Ordered to sit down, ordered to wear masks etc. It is a really open space and we are all triple vaccinated. The elevators were not working. The room was good but was definitely overrun with moisture issues. "Double" meant two single beds pushed together!! Tried to order a cocktail in the bar but was told that because of "supply issues" only Arrack cocktails were available. Had dinner in the coffee shop and were served french fries cooked in rancid Coconut Oil!! When asked why, was told "supply issues". I was offered a replacement but wondered how was I going to receive a replacement if there was indeed a supply issue?? Was a victim of overt racism at breakfast. As a Sri Lankan, I was singled out and ordered to wear a mask!! At a buffet!! All the other non Sri Lankan guests were exempted including my partner. I did complain to the restaurant manager who was very receptive and apologetic. Tried walking on the beach - impossible. All the vendors and touts just follow you around and obviously there is no control from the hotel. Overall a disappointing experience

we chose this hotel for 5 days rest on our arrival in Sri Lanka. Whilst the hotel itself is lovely and our room was fantastic - clean, large, great balcony, lovely big clean bathroom - we were disappointed by the aggressive sales tactics of the staff every time we were in the main hotel area. We found the hotel bar and restaurant to be very over priced as well. This is definitely more of a family hotel so those without children may consider other options. There is a limited amount to do outside the hotel so may be better for people on an all inclusive or at least half board package. We did appreciate the hotel's facilities - two lovely clean pools, tennis courts, table tennis all available but the beach isn't really very usable due to the number of salesmen on it (not the hote's fault).

The Triton has been renovated and relaunched at the Heritance Ahungalla (May 2006). Under the management of Aitken Spence, a major Sri Lanken hotel group, they have attempted to move away from their previous 'all inclusive' package approach to become 'Sri Lanka's first 6 star hotel'. To be honest, they have a long way to go to achieve this level. We visited in June, very shortly after they reopened. In fact, building work wasn't completed and the new Spa will not be on line for 6 months or more. It is a bit hard to know how to be fair to this hotel. They've done a great job renovating the public areas of the hotel. Although only one bar & the coffee shop were open when we were there they were very attractive, with attentive service and good (but not outstanding) food. There was also a small libary, well stocked with books for beach reading. However the biggest drawback is the size of the bedrooms. In comparison to other Sri Lankan top end hotels - such as the Galle Lighthouse Hotel or Dambulla Kandalama - the rooms and bathrooms (no bath provided) are very small. Although nicely decorated they lack a feeling of space and light. Plus the layout of the hotel means that many rooms look (indirectly) into other rooms. Staff vary from excellent (thoughtful and friendly) to down right annoying in their continual expectation of tips. The better staff including the restaurant staff were good, but lifeguards and one room boy were very pushy. Plus the internet access is ridiculously expensive ($US15 hour - over 4 times higher than anywhere else we stayed). The beach is long and undeveloped. The two pools are spacious, with plenty of deckchairs (however there were only 15 - 30 people there at the time). All in all a reasonalbly good hotel, but they have some way to go to meet the standards they have set for themselves. I was a bit disappointed and would, if I had my time again, had chosen to stay in longer Galle in preference to moving along the coast.
Ask for an Ocean Front Room

We stayed one night (full board) in a Premium room. The entrance to the hotel was impressive. We were very satisfied with the detailed security check that was done on arrival considering the prevailing situation in the country. The welcome was warm and friendly. Our room was comfortable. The restaurant was ok and food was good. The restaurant manager was very friendly. The hotel has two pools, thus making the pools less crowded at a given time, despite the number of guests. The beach was spectacular! It was a gloomy evening and we walked about 10 minutes to the North (as recommended by hotel staff) and came upon some cliffs that gave the most spectacular views of the ocean! Since we checked in on a week day, we were able to relax and spend a peaceful day. I heard it gets busier during weekends.

This is the best hotel I've been to in Srilanka, I love the atmosphere and the view. The service is great and the people that work here are lovely. Was working in Sri Lanka and had the weekend to myself and managed to get a very good rate last minute for a very reasonable price (same as a HIE in uk) however full rate I think would be maybe not so worth it. Please note when I arrived they were doing quite a bit of rennovations (though this was being done discreetly and quietly to minimise effect to guests). However hotel was probably at least 50% empty. Hotel is a Geofrey Bawa Hotel (famous architect) and you can see his style throughout the hotel. Its not the usually glassy inpersonal type hotel that you can sometimes stay in - this hotel does have character for a large hotel. Though I think the hotel could do more to enhance this. Its quite a Large hotel with reasonable facilities. I went for a wander when I first arrived and everytime I turned a corner I seemed to find something new whether it was table tennis, to the table courts to a bars that are nicely spread out. Hotel itself is in lovely bay with some wonderful views. Overall I think it was a lovely stay however not quite as special as I thought it would be from hotel website. LOCATION Its roughtly 1.5 hours drive from Colombo, and probably a good 3 hours drive from airport. If you are suffering after a travelling you maybe want to do a stop over in Negombo near airport or Colombo city. Its slightly away from many of the overcrowded toursit areas like Bentota and this can have good and bad points. ARRIVAL When you arrive at the hotel - you are ushered to sit down and they bring over some refreshments whilst you sign in. It was nicely done - though I think if busy this may take some time, this si kind of usual for Sri lanka so be prepared for this and I take the time to wander a little or orders ome drinks. ROOM Room was well furnished and decorated - I had view of the back Pool and beach. Full AC and Fan. Please note room leads to an open plan corridor (very Geffrey Bawa - but this does mean at night you may get a few mosi's in your room when you open door or use the balacony so get them to spray your room before you go to bed and use the fan(mosi cant land on you if you have fan on) - I carry a can of baygon which you can buy in local shops to kill any mosi that may be hiding at night. Toilet was nicely done - though please note - no bath - which if you have children you may want to check on which rooms have baths. The toiletries were fine - but nothing to write home about - personally I prefer my own. Hairdryer in bathroom was good enough for ladies use. All seemed very clean and nice Wardrobe and draws, and space above draws doubles as suitcase stand. Beds were very comfortable, and sheets and towels all seemed fine and I had no complaints compared to other reviewers. Room had safe in wardrobe which seemed usual good hotel quality. There was a console desk for laptop and stuff. Kettle coffee/tea facilities. There was a very small mini frdge but it had no icebox which is a shame. Also please note alcohol apart from local beer is expensive - I would purchase what you need at duty free. Also in room large media cabinet - I am hoping they will look into flatscreens tv soon! Usual Sri Lankan Satellite available. I would have liked a DVD player. Also is small sofa and coffee table. Room had good lighting and I loved instaed of heavy curtains. they have light muslin nets curtain and then huge sliding panels which makes the room very dark and peaceful. The windows seemed to insulate reasonable well against outside although to be fair it was very quiet in any case. The balcony was usual standard - 2 seats and table. They gave free wifi FACILITIES Not bad for Sri Lankan hotel, but not quite up to a top western hotel. 2 very lovely pools, one with jacuzzi. tennis court (not sure whether in good state), table tennis, fitness room (nobody uses), pool/snooker tables (you pay for this about $1.5) 3 restaurants and quite a few bars, there is a games room and library however I never bothered to check this out. However no shops (its shutdown) jsut a jewerally shop. To get to anywhere you need to take a short drive. There is very lovely Spa with Indonesian ladies brought in specially - my advice - check this out - its lovely! FOOD I never bothered with restaurants - prefering to get room service. My first order a salad was so dissappointing - I had 1 lettuce leaf - I kid you not. However I peservered and everything else that came was lovely, and they even brought me cocktails and extra's to the room. However for half board price its probably better value to just eat the buffet on offer. I did do breakfast and was a good Sri Lankan buffet with plenty of variety from European, German, English, French to Sri Lankan curries. BEACH Beach is lovely - pretty clean when I went and is a very long bay. No packs of dogs and all very pretty. However annoying youths spoiled my walk by myself but the other locals when they heard were so horrified by rude behavious and apologised - which was very sweet. they even offered to accompany me at a distance so I could enjoy my walk without being bothered. SPA Well worth a visit on 1st day to help you get into holiday spirit of relaxation. Not Sri Lankan cheap but reasonable price by western prices. SERVICE It was quiet, however I thought service was very good. nicely balanced although I can see how some reviewers may get annoyed with the overfriendliness of some staff. Bless them they are on the whole very eager to make sure you enjoy yourself and you stay is good. I would rather have this than the rude obnoxious service you can get in the UK. Other points - Ground floor rooms - balcony is open to the grounds. Its perfectly safe - but with very young children this may be either a blessing or an issue. Also the ground floor rooms near the back swimming pool - may get noisy. If this is an issue I would mention it when you book or email hotel before your arrival. BOOKING OUT The bane of all Sri Lankan Hotels and this one is no exception - allow 20 mins at least to book out if its not busy and a lot longer if it is busy. I would suggest get them to organise bill whilst you finish packing up or having breakfast. OVERALL A really lovely hotel but perhaps not quite up to the image suggested on the glossy website (but maybe after rennovations??). However I actually preferred this to the Lighthouse near galle (another Geofrey Bawa hotel) due to service and has a certain something to it. Location is lovely and tranquil when I visited. Would I go back - most definately however 3-4 days would be my limit. Just not enough there yet.
A wonderful & memorable stay at Heritance Ahungalla

Just came back from two weeks in HA. This is a lovely hotel and we cannot add too much to the previous positive reviews but just would like to share some of the points that we think worth to be mentioned. Location. This is the most important thing that needs to be considered if you plan to choose this hotel. The thing is that it is unexpectedly isolated. Most of the beach side hotels in Sri Lanka (especially such big as HA) have a developed touristic infrastructure just outside their entrance doors - shops, travel agencies, restaurants, etc. HA is not the case. Here you can find only two restaurants on the beach and ‚Ä¶ that‚Äôs all. Needless to say that the prices for everything (from taxi to excursions) are the same or just a bit less than in the hotel. Just as an example we found out that ordering a room service dinner is cheaper than going to the restaurants. So, be prepared. At the same time the good point is that the Beach is just perfect. Because the hotel is so isolated the whole huge shore line is used only by the guests. This is the advantage that cannot be underestimated. Rooms Rooms are Ok. Not bad but nothing special. We were staying in the luxury room on the second floor. All floors have all types of rooms, but the third floor is considered ‚Äòspecial‚Äô and costs some extra money. We asked for relocation to the third floor but were explained that we needed to pay a difference. As it was written in the other reviews only the third floor had a full sea view. The second and first have it only partial. This does not mean that the view is bad ‚Äì no, you‚Äôll be overlooking the big (really big) and nice (really nice) pool or picturesque garden with monkeys and varans . Position HA stands rather far away from the main touristic attractions of the central and southern Sri Lanka. If you want to see something you should expect to get up at 5 or 3 a.m. to spend a whole day in the car. The trip from the airport takes around 2.5-4 hours. When you negotiate with taxi it is advisable to make it clear from the very beginning that the price include highway fee. If you do not choose highway be ready to spend 4 hours in the permanent traffic jam on the local road. Conclusion Would I recommend this hotel? Yes, why not. It is well maintained, stylish and relaxing. If you like the beach relaxation, travel with a kid or just want to have a break after exploring the island HA might be a good option. Would I come back? No, next time we‚Äôd rather choose some of the hotels on the south closer to Galle.

We spent three days at this beautiful hotel which is situated on a sandy quiet beach. The pool, the food and the general cleaniliness of the hotel cannot be faulted. The staff were exceptional. They couldnt do enough for the guests. We had a wonderful restful holiday. Perhaps the two areas that could be improved are - a) the evening entertainment needs to be improved especially as there is nothing available outside the hotel. Something as simple as having a cinema room would help b) the wifi is very unrealiable, which can be frustrating. Overall, very happy with our time at the hotel. M.J

Serving beverages with cracked cups/glasses which also have dead insects gluing to them. The food is not well prepared neither fresh, including the seafood!
