Lovely hotel with friendly and attentive staff, epitomising Sri Lankan warmth and hospitality. Beautiful beach and poolside setting, which was perfect for kids. The food was amazing with a huge selection of food, including the Sri Lankan style ‚Äúyaara tea‚Äù! Highly recommended and we‚Äôll be coming back for more.

We stayed in this hotel as the relax part of our trip to Sri Lanka. We can said that the others heritance hotels we been were better. Because you are in a village, we probably will have all your meals at the hotel, we were disappointed about the quality and the variation of the food during dinner. The hotel is very large and they have to swimming pool areas, the northern one has less people.

We have been traveling around south India and Sri Lanka for almost 1 month. This hotel is not the worst of the lot, but it missed only by one place. In general it looks an feels very tired and you don't have to look very hard to find the dirt, grime, dust, and sand, and that was just in our room and bathroom. The same goes for many other public areas. With the exception of a few staff members we got the same impression. Tired of dealing with tourists... The food was only OK compared to everywhere else we stayed. It's a beautiful location, but unfortunately a disappointing experience compared to almost every other resort or hotel we have stayed at on this trip. Can't reccomend.
Ask for newly refurbished rooms
Good not Great!

I am writing this over a cup of coffee from the hotel. I have visited this hotel from the days it was triton and this officially concludes my 8th visit to this place (yes thats right !) And i am not joking ! Why so many times well two things always bring us back , one is the food and next is the service and fllexibilty. So this makes it my first visit for this year and believe or not i m due there in september as well. Over the years this hotel was able keep up as one of the trendiest in the vicinity however now it seems to lack behind. The food was once heavenly but now let me simply say " not as heavenly" . We were always amazed by the weekend dinner barbecue but this time it was highly dissapointimg and disorganised. We always loved the jumbo prawns and lobster (cray fish) that they always did have . but this time the stock seemed old and frozen . Worst of all the buffet spread never seemed to be re filled . Todays breakfast , i had to tell more than 3 jr chefs to re fill the bacon and it took them 20 mins. So yeah alot of negatives seemed to be observed by our group of friends who have just like me been patriots of this establishement. Rooms seemed to have changed very little. Some rooms seemed to be well stock with all the essentials some rooms seemed to lack a few things e.g bottle openers tea /cofee refills and glasses . However for a person visiting for the first time this perception can definitely differ . This was written with a lot of dissapointment and heart break hope the management will be able to revive this place before it becomes uncontrollable ( not that it is bad ) . Ps one thing that has never ever changed is the friendly staff so kudos for that. Love how pleasant everybody is ! C u soon as always :)

After a long and sick drive of about 9 hrs at a stretch right frm the Heritance Tea Factory Nuwaraeliya...totally devastated with the fluctuations in the temperatures ...n in the most crankiest of states i checked in at around 8 pm with my husband and my 9 yr old child..assumin its gonna be sad..but to our surprise we were welcomed by the stafff with that everlasting smile..not to forget the very patent quality on every face of the stafff...must thank the management for training them well..smart guys....followed with a young charming stafff leadin us to the main lobbyy..who offered us the welcom drinks..which she very meticulously carried each time ina lovely wooden old age herited trolly and offerd it to the guests with great pleasure..hope it was real...but if nt very well mastered.. And than followed the smooth checkins... we wwer led to our rooms....well to be honest..the roomsdi d have a perfect combination of asthetics but the only regret...no perfection in the fittings n finish of thewashrooms...although when demanded to the staff, was told it is one of the most expensive finishes they have used....very diplomatic...also the monotonous use of the tiger print cushions all around the room and the lobby appeared very loud..could have used more soothing colours as it hindered with the lovely asthetics....of the property...full marks for the external beautification...especially the greens created on the first floor..... excellent spread of food in jute...although no good ventilation...could use better exhaust systems s could be suffocsting for kids n for vegetarians..piping hot services in the coffee shop....which could be customised....a boon for veggies as have a seperate vegetarian menu...a special thanks to who so ever who included it...a lovely infinity poooll..which is the most significant n distinguishing portion..of the property....the blues ready to give the most perfect relaxation to ones eyes...n followed wwith the serene beach...where one can enjoy the sun settin down and watch how it adorns the sea n blazes it in shades of yellow,pink,and sometimes orange...a perfect romantic moment for a couple who has taken its first baby steps ina relation....cest voyage de noces....or honeymoon......and but ofcourse how can i forget the most over whelming experience..special private cocktails along the beach side for a few hand picked guests...and we were one of them it was aprivilege..the bartender showing all his skills..juggling away..well we were served cocktails to our hearts content...along with a perfect interaction with the guest relation guys....who made us feel extremly comfortable....n not to forget also apologised if anything was not done rightly throughout the stay...very convincing way..good training ..i had a stay for just three nights but i regret for havin done a late checkin at 8 i lost on a half day..... wish i could have stayed for the new years and hadent gonee to colombo...and wasted my stay at Taj samudra..one of the most horrible way to begin ones new year...a special thanks to ll the wonderful and ever helping and smiling staff..from ahungalla..YOU GUYS ROCK BUDDIES...THANKS for making my stay the most beautiful in srilanka....must say....c"'etait une experience inoubliable....et sans aucune doute selon moi c""est le meillieur property a srilanka entierment...bonne chance mes amis...je vais vous voir si j""aurai la chance...merci a tous..aurevoir...

It's what you don't see in the glossy photos and marketing blurb, but step one metre outside the hotel grounds (front/roadside or back/beachside) and you'll immediately be surrounded by local touts, who draw you into conversation with general chit-chat (Where are you from? How long are you staying?) before swiftly moving on to the HARD SELL (for tours, tuktuks, souvenirs, restaurants, etc), or muscling in on trying to carry your shopping and gathering around when you get your change in the hope of receiving some cash. In short, it doesn't make you feel like a human being; more like a walking Rupee or Dollar bill waiting to get rinsed. I am expecting the mandatory response from the hotel manager (does he really write these Trip Advisor responses?!), saying the hotel is working with the touts to improve the experience for guests... if this is true (and it seems to have been ongoing for some time), it simply is not working. A cynic would suggest the touts benefit the hotel in scaring guests into only using the hotel's services. We did this initially - a 9km taxi trip was a set hotel price of $27 return, compared to ¬£2.50 single in a tuktuk. And the hotel taxi driver was hell-bent on taking us to a turtle hatchery, temple, Ayurveda centre, tea shop, etc. instead of where we had actually asked to go, which was exasperating. As for the hotel itself, one you get beyond the wow factor of the pools, the hotel rooms are comfortable and functional, serviced by attentive housekeeping staff. The buffet restaurant is acceptable as a day-to-day dining option and the communal areas are decently maintained. But will we be recommending the hotel or visiting it again? Sadly, the persistent pestering and hassle we encountered from the locals means the response is a resounding 'NO'.
choose a different hotel or a villa nearby - avoid this resort

As you enter, the view of the beautiful pool .... merging into a pristine beach ... merging into the sea sweeps you away. Unfortunately you don't get swept off your feet at this property. Since we didn't get a booking at the VIVANTA by Taj in Bentota we thought we'd try the Heritance. The property is run down and seems to have seen better days. A renovation should be on the cards sooner than later. We were upgraded to a suite named after the legendary Sachin Tendulkar but unfortunately the exhilaration of of the room or the hotel in no way matched the Little Master's batting. The room was ill-planned. No light switches and plug points in the right places, basins in which you couldn't splash your face, a Mini Bar fridge with a broken shelf, and never replenished, pathetic mal-functioning wifi...... and one could go on and on.... Minor glitches but collectively a huge nuisance for the price we paid. The biggest problem was the air-conditioning, never below 24 degrees Celsius. This in a hot and humid Bentota was a big problem. Two large swimming pools. Wow !! one for playing and kids and one for peaceful and serious swimmers like me. A Great idea! However the pleasure was short lived when we entered the pool. The water was cloudy and had particles flowing in it. Temperature was like soup. The Gym was exceedingly ill-equipped for the number of rooms. Only two treadmills, one of which was closed non-functional for the duration of my stay. One large dining area for buffets. One fine-dining restaurant but we never saw a living sole there in the 4 nights we spent. The food at the buffets were exceptional, but in case you're a vegetarian please be very careful. Options are very limited. Since large groups were coming in the buffet tables had huge queues. I for one am fond of nibbling tit bits going often to the table. But that was a Big no-no. Dealing with the lower staff is impossible. Not only is their a pathetic standard of English, many of them pretend to understand and say yes but things are not done. However I'd be failing in my duty if I didn't mention here, that the senior staff ably led by GM Mr Upul Peiris and the F&B Manager Gamini, were extremely courteous and helpful. Highly responsive. Problems brought to their notice were promptly attended to. I believe Mr Peiris has been here only for a few months. Seeing his leadership abilities and genuine concern for the customer I'm very sure these glitches should be a thing of the past very soon. The management needs to move from Responsiveness to Pro-activeness. My recommendation is to go here at a quiet time and not during peak season.

The hotel environment is very nice. Our room is very big & has direct access to the pools & the ocean. Food is ok. Yet, very disappointed that the bedsheet & pillow case are dirty .... and somewhat disgusting.

A Geoffrey Bawa hotel on the coast of Sri Lanka. There are some real highlights: smooth, cool design, excellent swimming pool, fantastic location next to the beach. And some lows: the horrible smoke-filled restaurant (we had to ask for Sri Lankan dishes: they aren't always offered), irritating piped music, dodgy evening karaoke-style entertainer (though, to be fair, some guests seemed to enjoy it), and inadequate wi-fi. I would liked to have given this hotel 3.5 stars, since it is better than "average", but that doesn't seem to be available.
Beautiful beach view

Heritance Ahungalla is a decent hotel with excellent staff. Stayed three nights with family and friends and the staff were always obliging and eager to please. They also work hard. The hotel was busy and it covers a big area and the staff were as busy as bees. But always good to the guests. Where I mark the hotel down is: a) The hotel is dated and looking very tired. I think one wing looked recently renovated, but the wing we stayed in, although clean, looked too tired. It badly needs an upgrade. A '5 star' should not be allowed to deteriorate to this extent before renovation b) It's a large hotel but surprisingly low on activities. As a result there is no 'wow' factor to justify the expensive rates. The beach is nice and it's a long stretch but the hotel is strangely lifeless and boring. As it is I would say this is a '4 star'. We had a nice time but there are so many options in Sri Lanka now and there isn't a good enough reason to return to this hotel.
An overall review
A relaxing fortnight in a lovely setting

I stayed at heritance ahungalla for 1 night during last week end. Simply this is the best hotel that I have ever stayed. Upon check in their. garlon was exceptional and ccheck in was smooth. Within 5 minutes i got the room. Speccially front office Execcutive Mr Chaturanga helped a lot and his service was fantastic. Food is perfect and the rooms are having a panoramic view of Indian Ocean. Finally Heritance Ahungalla is great
If it wouldnt be so sad, it would make me laugh...

Arrived late following delayed flight and driver getting lost so we weren't in the best of moods. Felt we could have been offered some food instead of relying on the mini bar but I suppose we could have asked for it. Shown to a room which had a view of a tree right outside so changed that to a much better one overlooking the pool with a sea view. Much better but why are the bathrooms left with bare plaster? Don't get that one. The good times then began because Heritance is a wonderful hotel with excellent staff in a glorious position on a beautiful beach. Felt like Robinson Crusoe whenever I walked on it with waving palms behind me and my feet in the warm Indian Ocean. Only problem are the beach kawkers who don't take no for an answer and pester you to death. The big pool is awesome and the pool attendants outstanding at providing towels and mattresses very quickly. Food is a bit hit and miss. Breakfast is really good if you go in early; not so good if you go in late and food has not been re- refreshed. The evening buffet was exceptional on barbecue night but a little bland on other nights although there was always something to attract you. Desserts are very good as are the soups. Tried the a la carte restaurant once and the lobster was really good but took an eternity to come -odd with only two of us in there but great value for money. The hotel is made for relaxing and the staff go out of their way to help guests to enjoy their stay. We only had four days and we were really sorry to leave. When the sun is out and you're on your sunbed by the pool overlooking the beach, it just doesn't get any better! Will come again for a longer stay.

Enjoyed a lot.This hotel is a very relaxing hotel The food is great and great service.The restaurant and bar magager Mr Thushara is very friendly.the rooms are very clean and great view.staff is very friendly.the enviroment and the surrounding is also very beautiful.
Don't stay here

Excellent Hotel, good food, friendly staff, beautiful clean rooms I spent 2 Nights in this wonderful Hotel and didn't want to leave Me and my friend were so saddened while leaving this magnificent Hotel It's the place to be :)

Again im with family heritance to refresh past memories here .the hospitality is superb as same as previous. My friend Manoshi ,Supuni (Tha GRE) Lakshi (@ reservation) treated us well.hope come back again as soon as

We had a pleasant stay at the hotel. The staff were helpful at the checkin. We informed them we were vegetarian and they told us they would inform the cook to have some veg menu. But when we went for dinner we were informed that there is nothing vegetarian and it was Barbeque night. We were asked to go to the coffee shop, over there we were told they would prepare something veg and would take 45 minutes. But what we were served was inedible even our dog back home wouldn't eat it. Over all the hotel was great but we had a bad time with food. The breakfast was good. But rest of the time we had to go to taj Bentota for food. Wouldn't recommend the hotel to vegetarians
Ahun....I mean aha ...I will return to infinity.

Traveled with family on May 2017, well it was the rainy season, so not much luck enjoying the outdoors. Hotel was ok. the property is huge, well managed. Staff is friendly and attentive. Food was ok. Selections on the buffet was fine.The main restaurant seems a bit cramped up for room. breakfast options were a bit limited though.all in all a good experience.

Beautiful hotel and wonderful ambience. The view is breathtaking and the architecture of Geoffrey Bawa is stunning as always. But the stand out feature was the great staff and service. Special mention must go to Ranisha who was so friendly and helpful. Thumbs up!
Not a 5 star in any category

So disappointed with our return visit to this hotel. 5 star this is not,! Food was disappointing and variety poor. Stale bread rolls at lunch/dinner which were obviously left over from breakfast. We weren't told that alternative food was available & only found this out on the day we left !!!! The rooms were obviously designed by a man as they were not women friendly. Main lights in the bedroom were 3 downlights, really how are we supposed to do hair & make up??? Sink in the bathroom was too high we are not all tall. Plain glass in the bathroom with blinds that were obviously an after thought. We will not be returning a 3rd time. Al so no evening entertainment that we know of

We've just returned from our honeymoon - a week in the Maldives(paradise) followed by a week in Sri Lanka staying in the Heritance Ahungalla. The hotel is beautiful just like any hotel in a major city let it be London, Dublin or New York so if its traditional Sri Lankan style your looking for than its not for you. Our room was looking out onto the ocean however the water was unfortunately too rough for swimming. There wasn't a soul on the beach for the entire duration of our trip apart from the usual hawkers who camp out on the beach for the day in the hope of selling the odd sarong or two. The food was nice but became extremely repetitive when your there for 6 days, bearing in mind there's nothing outside the hotel so no chance of eating anywhere else. If you like a drink and a bit of a buzz at nite then this is also not the hotel for you, the bars have no atmosphere.Your not encouraged to go out of the hotel however saying that there's nothing to go out for in the line of entertainment, shopping or eating just a little shop across the road which sells water and snacks which may come in handy as hotels prices are the same if not even more expenive than home. Once you walk out of the hotel you'll be surrounded by hawkers trying to sell you tours which can be annoying as they're fairly persistent. We went on a local tour by tuk tuk with Raji who camps out outside the hotel or beach, his English is perfect which helps. This was quite enjoyable apart from being brought to two different shops trying to get us to buy stuff, this is standard procedure if u take a tuk tuk anyway. We did the nearby river safari which we booked through our travel rep. This would be very managable and much cheaper to do by travelling by tuk tuk and hopping on a boat when you get there, just a few mins down the road. We also went to a national park spotting elephants, about 9 hrs in a car but enjoyable all the same.All of the staff in the hotel were outstanding very friendly and pleasant. Sri Lanka is really just a country for touring around, the ideal would be 4 or 5 days seeing the sights staying in a different hotel ever nite. As part of a tour I would defintely recommend a nite or two in this hotel but def no longer.
Book this hotel if you need to crash not to enjoy Bawa's building to the sound of the sea.

the perfect getaway, all the heritance hotels in srilanka are just over the top. wonderful rooms and helpful staff and beautiful locations. we went there for three days and it was amazing. just be careful of anyone trying to sell you anything on the beach or telling you to go with them, DON'T! its a scam. all in all a 10/10 and the food was so delicious too

What a lovely day out at the Bachuus bar I first of all love this hotel because of the architecture... One of the well known Sri Lankan architects Geoffrey bawa is the one who built this magnificent hotel. I love the staff here they are so friendly and the service is so excellent and the food here is so delicious. I will definitely visit this hotel again

Ok so after arriving from a long 11/12 Hour flight from UK the 3 hour transfer to the hotel was not an experience I was looking forward to the traffic was very bad and seemed to take a life time. We had our own private car transfer and I would advise anyone staying to do the same to make the journey more bareable. Upon arrival it was evident the journey had been well worth it the architecture and landscape is truely breath taking. We recieved a warm friendly welcome and was wisked off to the bar for a welcome drink while our luggage was taken to our room. We were shown to our room and the staff member talked us through how to use the air con and the facilities available. As soon as the staff member left my partner and I burst out laughing as we couldn't believe how lucky we were. The room was amazing with stunning Ocean views and the main infinity pool from our balcony. The room is finished to a very high standard, immaculatley clean. Well stocked mini bar (not complimentary), fridge, air con and cieling fan, safe, plenty of storage for clothes, TV, Phone, complimentary water (replenished daily) and a welcome cake. The bathroom had ample towels which were changed twice daily (bare this in mind if you like us to have a nap in the early eve before dinner to put you do not disturb sign on the door so they dont disturb you while your sleeping) complimentary toiletries -shampoo, shower gel and body lotion. Our room had a huge rain shower (room for 2 or even 3 people hehe) I noted there was also a hair dryer but can't say either of us used it. Food-Breakfast was the biggest breakfast buffet I have ever seen it was nice to be able to to sample a Sri Lankan breakfast but no fear if thats not your thing there is much more a wide range of breads, cakes and pasteries, cold meats, cheese, salad, everything for a cooked English breakfast and chefs cooking omelettes, waffles, pancakes and fresh fruit/juice theatre style. (we never felt the need to eat lunch after that lot) We ate dinner in the Mustard Coffee shop on the first night the Lobster was very nice! We had dinner in the main Jute retaurant restaurant for the rest of our stay which was a set menu most evenings about 7 courses, canape, 3 starters usually small bite size of each (served at same time) 2 soups (small cups served at same time) a sorbet then you had a choice of mains which was usually a meat dish a fish/seafood dish and vegetarian option you then had a choice of desserts followed by fresh Ceylon tea or coffee they also had 2 BBQ themed evenings during our stay spoilt for choice for meats and fresh seafoods salads and desserts other hot non BBQ dishes were also available on the buffet such as currys and pasta dishes the cost was 2500 rupees (per person for both the set dinner and BBQ roughly ¬£13) which we thought was really good value. The food was always excecuted and presented extremley well although maybe one or two too many components on a plate at the same time (but this is probably my chefy foodie head on) each component tasted great and thats what matters. Drinks- we stuck to drinking the local 'lion' beer for most of our trip (served with a glass that had been stored in the freezer to ensure its stayes nice and cold which was a nice touch) which was 320 rupees (¬£1.70 a pint size bottle) we was shown an extensive wine list that had lots of famliar names I think the cheapest started around ¬£12. We drunk our way through the cocktail menu on the last night all very nice particularly their own Heritance cocktail (cant remember exact name i had hade a few by then) made with the local Arak and all the classics are also available all 800 rupees (roughly ¬£4.50) we was treated to complimentary canapes and homemade crisps as we enjoyed our drinks service at the bar and restaurant was always great. Facilities - 2 Huge Infinity pools we was lucky the hotel was not busy the only people in them most days the pool attendents were very friendly and sufficent, i noted a tennis court, volly ball net, snooker room, games room although didn't use them so not sure if they have the equipment or you need to bring your own? There internet access in the Library on the second floor it was just over ¬£1 for an hour you have to get a card from the reception. Theres a night club on site we popped in briefly but as the hotel was quiet we was the only people in there and wasn't quite the same raving on ya own haha. Music from the club was well contained so not fear of being woken up by music in your room. There is a Spa but was a bit to pricey for us. There is a well equiped gym that is free to guests. We took a tuk tuk (300 rupees roughly ¬£1.60 return) down the road to the turtle hatchery 1000 rupees PP entrance donation (¬£5.50) we went around 3pm we was advised the best time to go is around 5/6pm you might then be able to takes some turtles back to the sea (we didnt want wait around that long) still an enjoyable experience either way. The weather was perfect (June 4th-12th 2009) cloudy most days but hot (hot enough to get a tan or burnt in my case) with a nice sea breeze the odd down pour usually in the afternoon but it stops and dry out again real quick didnt bother us at all the sea unfortunately was to rough for a propper swim but was ok for a paddle my partner also go a mild sting from a jelly fish so that put us off going in again. As other people have said in their reviews hawkers (lookie lookie men/woman) are a real hassel on the beach and surrounding area we walked to the local shop to try and buy Cigarettes (you cant bring any in duty free without paying goverment tax) and we were swamped with people trying to talk to us takes us places make us go to shops following us it was a bit overwhelming and i didn't feel particularly safe having so many people around me we didnt leave the hotel on foot again after that. Also many a quiet morning walk on the beach would be spoilt I saw one couple get surrounded by 8 people this is something the resort have no control other however they do have security guards on the beach preventing them entering so no hassel in the resort complex. So an amazing stay! Definatley want to go back.

Just come back from 10 nights here, all very good,clean very friendly staff that for a change are not expecting a tip for every thing they do for you !!! Hubby quite a fussy eater but even he managed to find food .. never tried the tomato curry did the cucumber and pineapple curry very nice ,laughed a a chef one night and said hubby wanted beef casserole lo and behold next time we had it especially cooked for just us lovely. Thank you so much ..
I specifically asked for 3rd floor room and it turned out to be ok.

Just got back from the Heritance and had a marvellous time there.It is beautifully designed,with two infinity pools leading your eye out to the sea.Our room had a great sea view and was very well furnished.Beds were comfy and the bathroom was great-I want a wet room like theirs!!!Premiership matches on the box and two english speaking movie channels. The food was very good and i found myself eating curry three times a day!!i also brought a hopper pan back with me to have egg-hoppers for beakfast.However we were a little disappointed with the fine dining restaurant.The prices are the same as back home, and they had very pretty food on the plate, but it needs Gordon Ramsey to go in and make it less fussy and more tasty.With such good seafood(the tuna is the best!) i would have liked to have seen a japanese restaurant or something similar.The 'mustard' coffe shop was more to our liking-less pretentious and good food,and of course you can always find something nice in the buffet restaurant. Service is very good,if a little too much! Sri Lanka is a paradise for wildlife and the hotel has in it's grounds; egrets,bee-eaters,squirrels,a small monitor lizard,gecko's and on an evening a large bat which we named 'Nora' (Batty!) which swooped around the pool bar while we were sipping pre dinner Martini's! We went on a river cruise through the mangroves which was excellent and a trip to Sinharaja Rainforest ,which is a must for bird watchers.Our driver Erish was the best.He took us around the village he grew up in and to meet some of his family,and releasing baby turtles into the sea at Kosgoda was very satisfying. Don't let tales of war in the north put you off going,you are not affected in the least.Soldiers with guns are at a lot of check points near Colombo,but there are thousands of Tamils and Sinhalese living in perfect harmony,it is lot more safe than Northern Ireland ever was.Just keep away from the north and north east to be on the safe side. They have recovered physically very well from the Tsunami,but anyone you talk to has lost loved ones(60,000 people)There won't be another one for hundreds of years,so don't let that put you off either! The Hotel is excellent and Sri Lanka is a lush,wildlife filled paradise,with sun and picture postcard beaches.It reminded me of a cross between Thailand(with Buddhist temples all over) and the nicer parts of south goa,give it a try.We'll definitely go back.

What lovely people the Sri Lankan people are. And the stuff here were continually ensuring that we enjoyed our stay. knowing that i was ill before arriving they continually made certain i was getting better. I would particularly like to thank Duminda from the restaurant. every time we saw Duminda he would smile and ask how we were and what we had done that day or what we were doing for the day. Nothing was ever a problem and every request was met with a smile. Duminda is certainly an asset to Heritance Ahungalla. we will certainly be returning Thank you Duminda. Thank you Heritance Ahungalla
Stay out of busy life
Poor Food
Before booking, ask whether beach-obscuring marquee will be up

We stayed at this hotel 2 nights, had breakfast there and it was ok. We are at sunshine restaurant just along the beach for lunch and dinner. Hotel was nice, room was big.. but the decor etc would of put as a 3 star. Staff were friendly, especially the security guards making sure we felt safe.
spent a day - the pool view is to die for
FRIENDLY STAFF

Was at the Heritance Ahungalla for the weekend and had an awesome time. Courteous staff, great food and superb service. Lives upto the standard of being one of Sri Lanka's best hotels. Have been here many times but every time I leave thinking about the next time that I would be here. It is highly recommended and I'm sure anyone who comes here would enjoy it.
The Best of 'Down South'

I visited Heritance Ahungalla first time 16 years ago and again 15 years ago (when it was still operated under the name Triton), so I was very excited to go back to the hotel to see if it still carried that adventurous atmosphere that it did 16 years ago. I was also vevry excited to see how they had renovated the hotel after the horrible tsunami that destroyed much of the hotel about 10 years ago. I remembered the hotel as a luxurious hotel with a very high standard both in the restaurant and in the small bars around the area where you could buy from a large snack menu. Many of these places were closed now to my disappointment. The hotel of course more or less looked the same and the beautiful architecture of Geoffrey Bawa - Sri Lankas world renowned architect - was of course still stunning. I should say that my previous visits was during the peak season in february where the weather on that part of the island is fantastic. This time I visited in october and we experienced several hours of heavy rain on several of the days we stayed there, and of course that adds to the experience and the atmosphere as they had to keep huge plastic curtains down at all times to keep the water from running into the reception area and the bar area. The hallways was flooded due to the heavy rain and the open design of the hotel so they had to keep staff constantly mopping up water and that was of course no fault of theirs. That's just how it is during this season. But something seemed changed. The hotel seemed to have lost that exclusivity that set it apart from other hotels in Ahugalla/Bentota region.15 years ago there were a wonderful atmosphere in the evenings with jazz band and dancing in the lounge next to the reception and pool area. This time around that was gone - much to our dismay. We also remembered that every afternoon there was a very nice complimentary afternoon tea with buttercake and scones that you could enjoy just next to the large pool but when we asked if they still had it noone even seemed to remember that they had it 15 years ago. We stayed in one of the huge suites with several rooms a seperate living room two bathrooms, a huge balcony overloooking the residents pool with a view of the ocean behind the row of palm trees along the coast line. I don't know if some of the changes to the design and decor was due to the tsunami 10 years ago (after I visited the last time), but I remembered the beautiful residents pool (the other pool that are closed to anyone but guests in the suites and rooms in the fine wing with ocean view, and it was originally made with the most beautiful dark blue tiles that made it one of the most beautiful pools I had ever seen. This time the tiles have been removed and the pool was just an ordinary pool with a normal lightblue surface on the sides and bottom and not made from tiles anymore, just like so many ordinary pools you see all over Sri Lanka. That was sad - I thought. I may have needed refurbishment or renovation but they should have stayed true to the original design with the beautiful dark blue tiles when repairing the pool instead of the cheaper solution, as this did something to make the place stand out in a way that it now doesn't anymore. They also had a wonderful original boat like the ones used by the original population in Sri Lanka that was a trademark of Triton (as it was once called) but they had done little to keep it maintained, so it had obviously deteriorated over the last decade so they hadn't saved it (unless of course it was taken by the tsunami ten years ago). To me it was just a little sad to se that on the patio where it was once standing proud in the middle of the large pool was now just an empty plate with nothing to decorate the otherwise elegant pool area around the public pool and bar area. Another thing that added to the impression they had lowered the standard since we last visited 15 years ago was the many families with screaming children running around the pool. 15 years ago there was a much more tranquil and serene atmosphere with adult guiests with a certain sense of etiquette, which includes preventing your children from running around the other quests at the pool and adressing strangers asking all sorts of questions instead of staying near their parents as they are supposed to when using the residents pool. What had since we last visited become a sad but necessary precaution was a several meters high fence between the hotel grounds and the beach where only a small opening heavily guarded by two guards at all times (day and night) was the only passage to the beach. In the old days one could just stroll down through the line of shady palm trees and reach the beach from anywhere along the hotel grounds. But it was obviously a necessary precaution as we could see that many more touts and beggars and people selling all sorts of ridiculous junk and overpriced sarons, were all over the beach. It even seemed to us as if some of these local hustlers had some corrupt arrangement with some of the guards as they sometimes happened to be inside the fence (which means they have passed the guards unattended), and even when guards saw them on hotel grounds contacting the guests, they did absolutely nothing or very little to stop them from intimidating the guests and/or even excort them from the grounds, which would of course be their duty. One of the nights I stood in the dark on my balcony outside our suite and I noticed a visibly drunk guard who could hardly wallk in a straight line talking a little with himself while he suddenly stopped near the tennis court and fumbled with his trouser until he mannaged to unzip his pants in the middle of the lawn and urinate. That latter I could even live with - I'm no prude - had he just walked behind a tree and taken care of business, but I didn't find the fact that he was visibly drunk very reassuring. The folloing nights I stayed for an hour on my balcony to see if the guard from the night before would return, would return, but much to my surprise I saw something very strange occur. One of the guards (not the same as the drunk guard from yesterday) suddenly turned on his torch and he waved it up and down and from side to sight while pointing it in the direction towards the edge of the hotel grounds. Shortly thereafter I saw two locals walking past the tennis courts and sitting just below my balcony between the building/wing and the tennis court. They couldn't see me as I kept the balcony lights off as well as the lights in the livingroom so I was hidden in the dark. I looked in astonishment as these very suspicious looking local people arrived and they opened small packages and presented them on the top of low walll surrounding the terrace belonging to the suite just below ours and the guards looked at the "goods" in the beam of their flashlight at what looked like small packages of either pot or very small portions of khat to me (I've only seen khat but nevver tried it so it could be something else, but I know that khat is very poular if you have a job where it's hard to stay awake and it's popular amongst lorry drivers etc. so I could imagine that a boring night shift would also tempt someone to use khat to keep from falling asleep as it is a mild energy booster that make that kan keep you awake and alert) and khat is actually not amongst forbidden substances in all countries (at least not in Europe), so the use of khat may even be legal in Sri Lanka, that I don't know. Well, that aside, the guards clearly counted and exchanged money for these "goods" in the dim light from their torch. Suddenly one of the guards heard me making a noise as I was taking a step back and he pointed the torch directly at my face and for a short while I was blinded, and they saw me on the balcony, so he turned off the torch and they exchanged a few hasty words with the locals who then wrapped up the rest of their goods and ran away along the tennis court and disappeared in the dark. This was in no way frightening or intimidating, but it just seemed like something that wouldn't have happened at the classy and stylish Triton of the old days, and it only contributed to the vague feeling that the standard of the hotel was not quite the same as it was 15 years ago. From the experiences above one would have thought that it was a horrible experience, so why do I give it four stars after all? Because they still provide many of the things they provided in the old days. We always live in large suites when we travel, so I have a large backlog of experiences to use as comparison, and I must say that the suite was wonderful. It was clean and beautifully furnished and the large balcony streched all the way around the suite and had access doors from all rooms in the suite. I will also like to give the place the benefit of the doubt, because many things were closed - and that might be because it is the low season in october, so my final judgment should not be made until I've tried the place again in the high season between medio january until medio march where the weather in the southwest part of the coast line of Sri Lanka has the most beautiful weather. We also dined at the a la carte restaurant (not the large dining hall, but Restaurant Mustard at the terrace on the left side of the reception area just after the reception desk around the corner). The food was delicious, the service was perfect, and the setting was cozy with a dimly lit area and a very romantic atmosphere. So taht was truly perfect. The in-room dining (room service) was also very good and arrived quickly. The breakfast was wonderful and came on time every morning exactly at the time we've put on the breakfast list to hang on the door before going to sleep. The staff couldn't do a better job. They were quick, courteous, smiling, polite and they didn't hover at any time or made certain trick to earn extra tips (such as coming two persons to a one man job, or staying in the room and keep asking if everything is to our satisfaction, etc. - you know the drill). But none from the staff we met did that at any time. Of course my wife and I both agree on giving a generous tip at no less than 20% of the bill every time something is served, so we allso made it easy for the staff not to hover, and that should perhaps be taken into consideration, but we also find that people in Sri Lanka live on extremely low wages, and compared to the prices in Denmark where we live, even an additional 20% still makes for a very cheap price for people living in Europe, Australia and North America, so i cost us so little but means so much to them, so there is no need to be a miserly cheapskate. If you can afford an expensive plane ticket and to stay in a somewhat pricey hotel like this you probably can also survive giving 500-1000 Rps ($3-$6 USD) more when tipping the waiter, room boy, luggage carriers, drivers, etc. It takes so little and being generous when tipping often comes back a thousand fold throughout your stay when you are being served by the grateful, hard working, staff at the hotel, trying to accomodate even your most extravagant wishes and habits.(That's just my personal opinion on this subject, and each to their own, of course). I believe all rooms are non-smoking but most rooms are with a balcony (or a terrace if at ground level) so this is a comfortable hotel for smokers.

The hotel lobby sets the scene for the hotel itself ‚Äì a lobby spreading out into the infinity pool, that leads into the beach and sea. The staff provide a humbling and warm welcome, showcasing their hospitable nature from the moment you step inside. The pool is idyllic and the food showcases the talents of the award-winning kitchen. We were lucky to meet Celebrity Chef and 15 time Gold Olympic Medallist Dimuthu Kumarasinghe, and all I can say is that I am surprised he has not appeared on all our TV screens! A true culinary talent, and the most humble person, he has led an equally talent set of kitchen employees to create some truly wonderful culinary experiences. Thank you to Heshan and Kevin for giving us the best kitchen tour and pastry session, and Dinushan for providing a stellar hotel tour! All in all, this hotel is a must if you are visiting Ahungalla.
Mixed Views

We stayed at this hotel for just one night on B&B basis. The room had a private balcony overlooking the pool and the sea. We ordered room service for both lunch and dinner. The food was good, delivery was quick and service was friendly and efficient. The breakfast buffet had a good spread with both international and Sri Lankan cuisine. The only complaint we had was that the A/C vent in the room was old and/or faulty as it made a rattling noise throughout the entire stay. We called maintenance and they came to take a look at it, but it couldn‚Äôt be rectified allegedly the hotel was full, so we didn‚Äôt have the option of moving to another room. Because of this, we didn‚Äôt sleep very well and our short stay was not as relaxing as we hoped.
Good place to stay when in Sri Lanka but ...

thiz hotel was very very superb ...food z very very nice...we reached today evening to our brand.neq.jeritance.ahungalle.hotell...iys.in.south.coast.in.sri.lanka...we.r.warmlu.wellcome.to.thiz hotel at evening we gave a wery declious welcome.drink.nu staff and welcome.by.managera as well...lobby.was.so.nice..bar.was.superb.view..we.ate some.sancks.at poolbar...it was nice.and.deliciois...we went.to restaurent.as.well.and.the.staff atrestaurent treated us.nicly..there was a.guy with.spectacles..he was very much friendly with.me...he z very friendly..and kind to me...i will tell the NAME IF THIS HOTRL TO OUR PEOPLE.ON.COUNTRY

It's clean and staff is good. For the food, it's same as all hotels..not that sooooo good...but not that bad even.....if you want to have bacon for the breakfast, you will get only 2pcs for a person..üòïüòïüòï. They make hoppers, rotty, and some few items on the spot. So that's good. Tastes wise you can be some happy..don't keep any high expectations. Hotel rooms are clean..and pools ( there are 2 pools, one pool is given for foreigners for there relaxation) clean..there are no any bad things to say about this one. stayed 2 nights and i wish we stayed more!!
Just a pit stop for lunch.
All rooms face the sea (and the pool). A lift is available in case you get an upstair room
The icing on the cake . . .

we had a nice week in this spacious hotel overlooking a lovely beach but unfortunately not suitable for swimming because of strong current and waves The hotel has no good concierge service which was a bit frustrating. The taxi service of the hotel is excellent with fixed price so no haggling The restaurant can be a bit busy and the tea service was not optimal however this was sorted out with good initiative by the excellent waiter Nilka. The pool bar was god and the waiters were very helpful. God swimming pool but can get noisy with many children

Please do not expect to swim in the sea- we were told from April to September the currents are so strong the sea is closed to swimming.
A bit disapponting considering it was voted the Best Resort 5 Star Resort in Sri Lanka

A la carte restaurant could be improved. Head of reception was a bit rude and not so welcoming as we have booked throught booking. Breakfast price on the check in document was 10$/pp and she tried to charge 18$ per person.

Is this a 5 star hotel?? The hotel is not well maintained. Staff are not professional. Service not up to standard. Waited for 20 mins to get towels and sun bed at the pool area, yet nobody came. Had to go to front desk to ask if anyone working around the pool. Staff standing around in groups, not interested in attending to guests.
Step outside of the room and there is the lovely swimming pool!
first impression so poor we left after 15 minutes
sea view rooms
Great Customer Service by DILSHA
Private Beach, Sea facing pool and well maintained rooms

A short midweek trip with family and friends. Check in took a tad longer than expected. Booked a suit which was located centrally close to both pools and had a large sitting room separate from the bed room. it was excellent as we could have a get together with friends whilst the kids slept in. The spacious balcony opened out to a view of the hotel pools n garden, the golden sands and the westward sea. As it was a midweek day with less crowd, was not expecting much of a spread at the buffet, How wrong I was! It was less than on a weekend but still could hold its own with any hotel's weekend spread. Any foreign guest gets introduced to a good selection of Sri Lankan specialities, Italian pasta station to Indian Doses to Mongolian mixed rice action stations were all busily catering to individual requirements. The fruit selection at breakfast was amazing. The staff are friendly and helpful. Rooms were spotlessly clean. Pradeep the manager at the dinning hall was super! He was checking up on almost all the tables, assisting where ever needed. one of the lil kids at our table had a special request which was taken care of in a matter of minutes much to the amazement of our group. Had such a good time will be returning for sure!

I went to this hotel after 15 years. It was our Annual Company Staff trip. Rooms were ample and well kept. Very comfortable bed and suiting lightings. Food was to be amazed not so good. Everything was lacking something and not the best food ever surprisingly. Service wasn't up to the standard. I had to wait more than ten minutes after requesting cutlery for dinner. And requesting hot water took more than ever. At breakfast I had to eat without a serviette because Steward never showed up. Sometimes I had to yell at them in order to get water. This type of service is never expected from a five star rated hotel. The night club was so much fun. The other terrible fact about the hotel was they switch off the lights in the corridors and we had to assist ourselves with a torch in order to find the room. Some of my friends had mistakenly tapped the wrong room. I mean this is a hotel which operates 24/7 and why do they wanna switch off the lights? Anyway I'm very disappointed with the service and food. I hope this will no longer continue. The best thing was the soothing beach view which was so relaxing. The two pools were breathtaking too.

We stayed only one night in the hotel which was fully booked this day. The only option was to confirm a suite room. Price was ok since I am a resident and the room spacious and clean. The bath hub is a catastrophe since you cannot enter. The rain shower also should be repaired.... The highlight was the food. Huge selection of local and international food in good quality. I asked for the chef to thank him. His name was Lakmal.
Home Away from Home
Bentota in general has a lot of sea food so if you are a vegetarian, make up your mind while travelling
Pls consider adding a few extra railings and low steps for seniors
Very disappointing

I stayed here only one night with my family. Nice hotel for a beach holiday and unfortunately we were there during the monsoon period. Our room was 158 and it is a huge room in the corner , room was very clean , food was average. They have super friendly staff. Normaly they organize fire show in Saturday night and I enjoyed it a lot.

This hotel, fronting the beach on a large plot of land, is popular judging from the number of guests when I was there. Some guests had been there more than 20 times over the years. However, I was rather disappointed to see that the hotel is rather run down, unclean from the dust on the floor, some walls looked as if unpainted, the toiletries in the bath-room were just shampoo, bath gel and body lotion topped up in small ceramic bottles which I dislike as they don‚Äôt appear to me to be hygienic. Further more, there were in-room slipper and thus makes walking in the room on unpleasant when wet after a shower. I said earlier, this is not a resort. Apart from the pool and restaurant, there were no other fun activities within the hotel for guests. But despite all these, I rather enjoyed the relaxed atmosphere surrounding the place and the friendly services of all staff. Our 3 nights stay there was thus an enjoyable one. As for location, there is no decent shopping nearby.
A perfect choice for groups and families seeking a lengthy and memorable stay.

Outstanding hotel with great customer service and with an awesome view as you enter the hotel... excellent hotel with clean rooms and we always, at all times have had great customer service from Dinusha Kularathne and our newly met friend Ranisha...excellent food with authentic taste. we have been coming here for the past 4 years and the service has been consistent at all times. we have built up a great relationship and we have made a priority to visit this hotel once a year. Great destination for your holiday and a must to come.

A huge average tourist hotel. I would not call this place luxurious. Not sure if there are alternatives. If you can, skip this place. The beaches are not nice. Everything outside the hotel is depressing. They've had many years to fix, so there is no excuse for things looking so devastated and filthy after the Tsunami. Sorry, it's a real shame. The entire coast south and west looks terribly sad. I cannot in good conscience tell any of my friends to go there. There are so many poor people. Please give them employment and pay them to clean up the ENTIRE coast!

Pros: 1. Nice staff, ready to help in all matters (if you give them a tip, and they expect it). 2. Beautiful area with many animals (monkeys, palm squirrels, monkeys) 3. Nice pools Minuses: 1. All rooms located around the lobby are forced to listen to VERY loud music until 11-12 pm (our beds literally almost vibrated). We had to move further away because it was impossible to rest. 2. The choice of food only seems large, the spiciness is not indicated anywhere, so you had to take it at random. There is nothing at all for children. If you have stomach problems, you will have nothing to choose from. In fact, the only fruits were papaya, pineapple and unleavened watermelons. Sometimes I have bananas for breakfast. 3. The staff in the dining room is very slow - drinks were sometimes brought by the end of the meal 4. You should not take excursions from the guys on the beach - they will charge you twice as much and will try to take you to every place where they have a kickback. It's better to leave the hotel and negotiate with the tuk-tukers there. 5. To get to the ocean you need to break through a crowd of very intrusive locals who are trying to push everything on you - by the end of your vacation it‚Äôs already starting to irritate you. Not a minus of the hotel itself, but you won‚Äôt be able to swim in the ocean - the waves are quite shallow. No one has change, so count on it and change it for small money right away, otherwise you will also overpay.
Try to get a room on third floor, if you prefer silence and privacy
Avoid festivals and weekends
Fantastic hotel, wonderful staff and amazing range of food, local and international
Feb-24

The room overlooked the sea, and was comfortable The amenities were good -as expected from the Heritance group. The food and beverages department went out of their way to make vegetarian food for us. I would like to thank Shyamalee, Gamini and chef Chaminda for all the tasty meals we had. The beach is not a private one: so a place should be earmaked for keeping footwear. My new pair of slippers (fortunately not very costly ) was stolen.

Cosmetic repair is required for all facilities. A lot of flies in a room and in a restaurant. Not sure about the quality of alcohol (local). The only working bar (before the pandemic there were 3 bars). Not enough sun loungers.
Too much building work going around where I was staying noisy everything was average
I‚Äôll think about it
Beach view
I believe upper floor rooms you can view the sea

The Heritance Ahungalla is NOT a five or a four star. Was traveling with my older parents and children. The AC and lights in my parents room was not working, it took 3 hours, 3 phone calls and a conversion with a guy at the reception for someone to come and fix this. 2 strange men in the room fixing the AC and lights for 45 minutes. Moerover, the staff by the poolside is terribly slow. Hotel common areas are dirty. Saw used diapers and used band aids by the pool! Took them forever to ask for food and drinks. They did not even have mint to make certain cocktails! Ran out apparently. I would rate this as a 3 star, and nothing more. Will not return. Diasppointed. Waste of money.

Beautifull hotel, clean rooms and terretory, friendly people. Great beach view. All rooms with a sea side. Tasty food (we took only breakfasts). Near the hotel you may find fish resturant with great dishes. Unfortunatly ocean isn't for swiminning near the ocean, because of dangerous ocean (big waves and underwater swirls).

Totally disappointed with this hotel. The entrance foyer was cold and clinical which was about the standard for the whole hotel. There was no entertainment until we complained and then there was some water aerobics and that was about it. There was a games room that was filthy and had about 2 board games in it, the snooker table you had to pay for, the pool table you had to pay for. There were 3 restaurants but you only really had a choice of 2 as the Upper Dining Room was ridiculously expensive, we did not actually see anyone eat there in our 2 week stayy! There was a cafe with a very limited menu or the main restaurant that was a buffet. The food in these 2 restaurants was okay but the service was terrible. Breakfast was served in the buffet restaurant and the tables were always mucky, you had to constantly ask for tea or coffee and sometimes wait for up to 20 minutes for it to arrive. On a Saturday the hotel opens the main infinity pool area up to local customers, this meant that we had to use the other pool which upset the children. The main pool was rammed with people playing games and being extremely loud making it much to dangerous for children to swim and also a very uncomfortable environment. Whilst at the other pool we ordered lunch and were told we would have a long wait as they were so busy as it was a Saturday!! Whilst we were at the hotel the Sri Lankan and Indian national crickets teams were there, the hotels focus was totally on them and important members of staff were moved to run the catering at the matches - this was very much noticed by guests at the hotel as the service in the restaurants became ridiculously slow and many mistakes were made. The people of Sri Lanka our lovely and very kind and helpful and we felt totally safe when we wandered along the beach way from the hotel. We met a fantastic driver who was wonderful in showing us around and really looked after our children, he is a recommended driver at the hotel and his name is Erish. We had some absolutely wonderful experiences when he took us out as he really worked to make sure we saw everything and enjoyed ourselves, he is also a good driver and very safe which is quite a rarity in Sri Lanka!!!

We were really looking forward to a relaxing stay here after a busy touring holiday but feel disappointed. When we arrived there was a beach disco party starting and the noise was deafening. This was followed by an aquerorobic session played at full volume, we have not stayed at such a noisy place ever! Tonight is Russian Xmas and we have two lots of noise, from the disco and the lounge bar! My advice? Bring ear plugs! Our room is fantastic and of you were staying with a large group or family and friends it would be great, but I don't think we will be back
Awesome Stay, Can't Complain Much....
HNB Outing. ..
Joyful Holiday break to Ahungalla

Everything Was Good The people at the hotel were also were very helpful and it was value for money. Will be visiting soon again. A must stay place in Sri Lanka The food was excellent. & pool was very clean

We are in this hotel end of last december 2015. This hotel has aged quite a lot, even including the rooms. In our washroom water was not draining properly. Complained but nothing happened. Food was very mediocre...mostly Sri Lankan cuisine. Hotel check out was quite haphazard...You need to get into a room to checkout but not at the reception, looks like government organization. Staircase is not kids friendly. There were no safety railing in the staircase; kids can fall through the staircase. Requested the manager to give a feedback, but he was unavailable and he send the housekeeping manager (even though I explicitly requested the manager). They say resort is due for renovation, mid 2016. Well if it is due for renovation why charge premium rate...hmm not value for money.
Going back this November

The hotel is huge but there are some problem in management. I didn't set Morning call but my phone ring at 6am. Then at 8am, the cleaning team knock my door ask what time I plan to check out. It's really disturb my rest. They can ask when we check in or ring us the previous night! There should be a better way to deal with instead of annoy customer. _x000D_ Besides, I found stains on the cups and linen. They should check it more thoroughly as their room is expensive.
good service
A tad more touristy than 15 years ago - but still a friendly service and nice atmosphere

We were loking forward to staying at this hotel on the coast as we were not travelling to the Maldives. However we were dissapointed with the service and food during our stay. The only savibg grace was being upgraded and the room we got was fantastic. The hotel is set in a great location but if you do not like being hasseled on the so called private beach then this hotel is not for you. There were many locals on the beach trying to sell guests goods in full view of the scurity guards. However the security guards did not stop this from happening and we will not be returning to this hotel.
Buildings could use a major refurbishment
Birthday treat
Perfect place to spend holiday

Had a problem similar to the one we had at the other Heritance property at Kandalama, Check-in took 45 minutes as they could not find the reservation inspite of providing the voucher. Heritance needs to get their act together on this issue

We had a super holiday at Heritance Ahungalla. They have two huge beautiful pools. The beach is just 100 yards away. The buffet is an endless variety of food and desserts. Very friendly and attentive staff. Kids had a great time too.

My Mum and I stayed in a sea view twin room with balcony. Lovely sized room with wonderful views, as anticipated. The hotel was at full capacity but you would never had known. Beautiful gardens and grounds were well cared for and spacious offering opportunity to relax in one of two pool areas without a busy atmosphere. Staff couldn't do enough for you and the food and services were great. Only downside that I could say was that the cocktail menu for all inclusive was not very extensive and mini bar in room was an additional cost, even tough we only had soft drinks. This was a little unexpected.

I have being to many hotels in Sri Lanka, by far this is the best hotel i can recommend. Food is great and staff is friendly. Pool area & beach is great. From arrival to checkout the experience was great.

Nice hotel. Very calm and quite place. Hospitality is very good. Can enjoy alot. Rooms are very comfortable. Will hope to come again.. ...the pools are very big and clean.... the staff is very friendly ....Thank you....
Beautiful hotel with lovely service
i think all the rooms here are quite so i cannot really comment on it .
Top floors at the front have best sunset views.

Our room cleaning service managed by Rukmal was very well done. He made sure every wish was fulfilled. The Hotel itself was unfortunately average, rather a 3 star hotel for european standards. Generally not the cleanest, but okay. Gym was small, old fitness machines (but okay too). The staff was extremely polite and friendly, sometimes they haven‚Äòt been that service oriented as one would wish in terms of: you go to the reception for a certain matter and you have to Come Back again and again instead of them taking a note and reach out to the guest instead. This way the guest has to do the work and not the Hotel. It should be the other way round ( but we‚Äòve noticed that in other sri lankan hotels). They‚Äòre trying, but Just have other Standards. Nice Beach and Pools, a Bit crowded Some days. Food ist average to Good.
ok but needs some tlc to justify the price

Heritance Ahungalle Hotel is a great retreat in Sri Lanka, but you must adjust your expectations before moving in. We had booked a de-lux room with balcony overlooking the beach and ocean - romantic, eh?Unfortunately, the hotel and consequently the room was very 'tired' and had seen better days. The hotel even suffered poorly maintained sidewalks, tennis courts, beach loungers, etc. Most was simply under maintained. Our balcony was adjacent to the rooms on either side, separated only by planters, and the view of beach and ocean obscured by a large (but beautiful) tree. It may not have been a problem anyway, as on the second day of our stay, the hotel maintenance people set up a huge beach-obscuring marquee (JAG_68056) for another wedding. They have about 20 weddings per year, so we learned. Perhaps that wasn't so bad either, but the band wars (wedding band, bar music, and local flute player) that ensued developed an impossible cacophony of loud music which made it impossible to sleep. Our 'package' was directly booked through Heritance's agent: bed and breakfast. We soon discovered there were many alternate 'packages' which ranged from full board to 'good deals' offering better accommodation for less than we paid. Check it out before 'checking in'. The food was good, especially the buffet (good value and variety) ... but the beach-hawkers were definitely a deterrent from enjoying the beach. The hotel should definitely do something about them! They were ever-present from sun up to sun down. The redeeming feature of the hotel was the always friendly and hospitable staff ... always willing to serve and support. The Guest Relations team did their very best. One last word of advice would be to insist that any Ahungalla-related transportation from Colombo Airport to the hotel take the new highway ... it seems that the drivers attempt to circumvent the highway-toll gates by taking secondary roads which are long, uncomfortable, dangerous, and nauseating. Happy travels!
Ask for a sea view room.
Suits have more space and privacy
Not 5 star

We were at Heritance Ahungalla last weekend and were treated like VIP"S ! Special mention is made about - the staff - extremely courteous and friendly, without exception ie from reception to the restaurant. Special mention is made of Gamini Wijetunge, Head of F & B and his Assistant, Thushara, who went the extra mile to make our short stay memorable.l The food was superb - the buffet was fantastic, be it breakfast , Lunch or Dinner... - what a spread !! - Also the rooms are well designed, ( plenty of power outlets to charge phones, IPads and laptops) comfy beds, clean linen and towels,and of course, we were pampered with a fruit basket in our room !. The bathroom was large, with a rain shower and a bathtub, specially the Luxury Room we were in. This review is not complete without a special mention about the infinity pool . Lovely view of the Ocean,,and although the pool is massive , you can wade in - safe for kids - with a specially demarcated deep end area and the the hotel looks like a fairyland in the night from the pool side... Thank you all, for the wonderful stay. We will come back ! Ranjit and Kuveni Wijeratne
Relaxing and wonderful Staff
The rooms overlooking the residents pool tend to be for westerners

Have just returned from a two week trip to Sri Lanka (Nov04) where we based ourselves at the Triton Hotel, Ahungalla. I must say although the hotel needs a overhaul ( due to be completed from May05toNov05) we had a wonderfull stay there. The food was excellant at all times. The initial room was also lovely but upon discovery of a small leak we were instantly upgraded to a suite with no questions asked by the hotel. What seemed to set the hotel apart was simply its level of service. All employees from maintenance to guest relations were excellent and couldnt do enough to help. Weddings were also a source of pleasure as the hotel puts a real show on with the dancers, elephant and evening fireworks. The only downside was the beach sellers who are quite persistent and initially put you off visiting the beach. However after a few days they recognise and it becomes far less a hassle. Altogether a lovely hotel experience for the price.

experienced relaxing weekend with friendly staff and tasty foods at heritance ahungalla ...Scenic beauty of the sea & the cleaned wide beach nowhere else in the south West coast. ,lovely lobby design and ambiance express the uniqueness of the Heritance where inheritance blended with heritage blessings. Special thank to zashin,indika at the pool bar and the R/boy for the special arrangements done to surprise my GF Thankz GG
If you can, try and get a sea view to top off the experience.
Should be renewed

Every so often even the mighty falter. What matters is recovery. After an impressive check-in, things went south at dinner. Inattentive service, cold food and total apathy left me wondering if this was the wrong place to spend three nights. I usually provide feedback at the end of my stay, but this bothered me enough that I penned an email to the corporate office that very evening. I did not expect a quick response. The next morning, with a fair amount of trepidation, I went for breakfast and was pleasantly surprised when a staff member approached me and apologized for the unpleasant experience the evening before. Before long another two managers stopped by to offer their apology. The balance of my stay was perfect. This property is beautiful. I was fortunate enough to get a room with an incredible view. The accommodations were comfortable and technologically up to date. The pool is huge and strategically located within 10 meters of the beach. I was on a half board plan and had the breakfast and dinner buffets during my stay. Good selection as well as taste. One of the days I ate lunch in one of the restaurants that offers a la carte service. I asked the chef to prepare lobster Sri Lankan style and it was absolutely delightful. All in all an excellent place for holiday in the Galle district.
Heritance Ahungalla, Shi Lanka

We stayed here in January / February 2023. The hotel its self is a beautiful building and was immaculately clean and well maintained. as far as I could tell all the rooms faced the beach with either a balcony or terrace. Our room 219 was clean and well equipped with everything you would expect from a hotel of this standard. There are two pools one is a quiet pool where ball games etc are not allowed the other is for fun and games, the pool attendants are friendly and and attentive. There is also a reasonably well equipped gym and a spa which is really well priced. We found the staff to be so friendly and nothing was too much trouble every request was met with a smile and service was efficient and prompt. The food was very good although if I had one suggestion it would be to remember that not everyone likes spice in their food, my wife is one who does not and on occasions found her choices very limited, but then there was always cake!! To conclude I cannot recommend this hotel highly enough and should we decide to return to Sri Lanka (and I hope we do) we would certainly go back to Heritance.
Pret calitate pret nejustificat.

Location perfect. hotel is run down - needs TLC. Service is great at all times but prices at main buffet are ridiculous. WiFi is stable and reliable everywhere. Beach is awesome and pool area is great. Bar restaurant is good. Entertainment in the evening is 3rd. Rate and needs to be upgraded. Hotel was great in it‚Äôs heigh day but needs major updates to make it current. Staff try‚Äôs to cope with issues at all times.
Rather than asking for a balcony, we asked for a ground floor room which opened out directly onto the residents only 'Green Pool.'
A matter of expectations ...
Mini break

We stayed at the Heritance Kandalama and were expecting the same high standard we had there. Unfortuantely we were very dissapointed by the Ahungalla. How this hotel managed to win an award I will never know! The hotel is dirty and tired and the service at breakfast is worth a special mention for all the wrong reasons. Dirty tables left uncleared for hours, the most disgusting tea and coffee I have ever tasted in my entire life and service without a smile. The only thing positive I have to say about the hotel is its location and the morning walk you can take along the stretch of beach on your door step. However, a word of warning, there are beach sellers who try to befriend (hassle) you about every 20 mins so go for your walk early before they get up!! All I can say is thank goodness we didnt spend our entire stay here!
quieter floors with tidy rooms

Had a good time with my friends.Great food, good service and friendly staff. Enjoyed a lot.... i came with my friends to celebrate the end of a bachelor life of one friend. They prepared a really delicious cake. We were able to have such a good time !!

We (6 of us) chose Heritance Ahungala for our day out. It was a great experience for us, the hospitality provided to us by Ms. Raneesha was fantastic . She was very kind and Very helpful. As for the food we think it can do better and the varieties was poor and refilling of the buffet items was slaw.
Choose one facing the see

The spacious lobby faces the sea, and beyond the blue swimming pool, you can see the turbulent sea. The beach is long and beautiful, but not suitable for swimming. The rooms are spacious and elegantly decorated, the quality of tap water is poor, but bottled water is provided.
The food was not very good.

**Google Review for Heritance Ahungalla** Heritance Ahungalla is a stunning resort with a private beach and well-maintained pools. The rooms are neat, and the overall environment is clean and family-friendly. It‚Äôs a great place for a vacation with kids. However, the service leaves much to be desired. At check-in, the front desk staff greet you warmly and create an impression of excellent service, but the actual intention to help seems to be lacking. We traveled as two families and requested rooms close to each other. The staff promised to accommodate us the next day, but despite multiple follow-ups, no one informed us why it wasn‚Äôt arranged. Additionally, there were several service lapses: - When we reported non-functional TV services, no one responded. - An emergency housekeeping request was ignored until we followed up repeatedly every 30 minutes. - A simple request for bananas for a child after the paid breakfast buffet had closed was also ignored, with staff disappearing without fulfilling the request. While the staff are polite and pleasant in interactions, their inability to provide timely and reliable service is disappointing for a five-star resort. Compared to the service at The Kingsbury Colombo, Heritance Ahungalla falls significantly short. Overall, a beautiful property with potential, but the service experience needs serious improvement to match its five-star rating.

Hotel itself was very nice but our room smelled of mould at times. Also the service staff when they knew we were in our room had a habit of knocking on the door so many times it became obvious that in fact all they were after was a tip. I appreciate there is poverty in the country but this was the on thing which spoiled our stay. The meals in the restaurant were excellent each time. I would highly recommend staying here if you do not mind being 'tapped' for tips.

Heritance Ahungalla was a mixed bag for me, despite the grand entrance, the hotel looked slightly dilapidated and we were disappointed to see that the boat in the swimming pool was absent. Given the age of the hotel, I expected the service to be more refined, and, except for an exceptional experience with a man called rukmal who was exceedingly hospitable, the staff seemed worn out and thus slightly disgruntled. In the buffet I had to ask the staff 3 times to obtain a cup of coffee. I got the impression that the staff were overworked, but wanted to help.The buffet was delicious though small( the dishes though were of a very high quality). The rooms were lovely, however, the triple room we booked was just a double room with an small, and uncomfortable foldable bed added on. As I came primarily for the wonderful location, and food, I was not particularly disappointed.

Our check-in experience was smooth and quick. The room we stayed in was clean and spacious, which we appreciated. However, the biggest issue was that the AC in our room didn‚Äôt work properly, and we had to endure an uncomfortable, hot night. Although the maintenance team tried their best to resolve the issue, they were unsuccessful, and we received no apology or acknowledgment from the hotel management. On top of that, we were contacted about our check-out time, which added to the frustration. The food was tasty, but the buffet selection was quite average

We had an amazing time at this hotel, during which we held a wedding ceremony and party with our friends and family. The hotel has 2 big pools and is directly on the beach. The staff were amazing in helping us arrange the wedding and catering to the needs of the party, in total there was 31 in the group. All the staff were amazing but in particular Shanika & Paveen created an event to remember and took away any stress we may have had in organizing everything. We had a ceremony on the beach followed by a BBQ, and the use of the on site nightclub. Everyone had a great day. All the party commented on how good the food was, we even had vegans and vegetarians who were happy with the food on offer. We will definitely be coming back to this hotel, as we have created many special memories here. We can highly recommend anyone coming to stay as you'll have an amazing time.
