We booked this hotel for the second part of our holiday by the coast. We were swayed to book this hotel due to the raging reviews on Trip Advisor. Unfortunately it didn‚Äôt quite live up to our expectations, especially after leaving the Cinnamon Lodge in Habarana which was advertised to be a lower rating hotel. Our opinions do differ from those on here. The hotel is well known for the architect and so we expected something quite special, as it was also a ‚Äò5‚Äô star resort. On arrival the Loby is attractive as you can see through to a lush swimming pool right onto the sea. The swimming pools were the best bit of this hotel. They are lovely. However, we did find the hotel lacked character and that holiday feel. The architecture was a bit cold and bleak, very concrete, modern and minimalist. Somewhat like a business Hilton hotel which is just not we want on a holiday. The plants around the hotel seemed tired and a bit dead, just outside our room we overlooked a moulding wall where there used to be vegetation climbing up it. The hotel was all very open which was good for a natural breeze, but as soon as the monsoons came this caused a death trap of slippery hallways bars, seat cushions etc. The hotel rooms were nice, again modern but of good quality. The whole place lacked good lighting though. There was also the natural bare plastered look in the hotel bathrooms etc. Not our taste but might appeal to some. I personally like a bright lick of paint or something it bit more luxurious. The hotel did have good facilities if you wanted tennis, ping pong, badminton, spa‚Äôs etc. However going onto the beach was slightly annoying due to the persistent locals selling on the beach who would sit on the beach facing the hotel shouting at you to come and look as they will ‚Äúgive you good price‚Äù. This is a little off putting but I understand it‚Äôs just the way there. We never managed to go onto the beach without having to say no thanks to several different people. The restaurants and entertainment were the biggest disappointment. The food was always nice (wine expensive) but the restaurants lacked atmosphere. The main restaurant had set menus for most of our stay and these were quite pricey. The buffets in that restaurant were a bit better as at least you got more choice. But the restaurant is dark and dreary. No ambience. The a la carte ‚ÄúCafe‚Äù? did have nice food but a bit limited on choice. You also don‚Äôt expect to have your a la carte meal in a cafe which lacked again any sort of luxury and really had the ambience slightly above that of a McDonalds. (I am being slightly harsh). The entertainment at the hotel was pretty poor. Sometimes there was a band singing the same songs every night. A cocktail promotion (doesn‚Äôt mean it‚Äôs a price promotion) with live demonstration. Or simply someone plays an instrument. It was very quiet during our stay so maybe they do more in the main season. We actually spent many of our nights at the Taj hotel in Bentota after this was recommended to us by fellow guests in the same boat as us. I suggest you go there just to get a comparison of what a 5 star hotel should really be like. We had a Chinese in the restaurant there and it was lovely. There buffet meals also had a great deal more ambience. Just grab a tuk tuk to get there. The Refresh restaurant 20 mins away in Hikkaduwa was also lovely. I recommend you stay in Bentota though if you want choice and to be able to walk out the hotel to more restuarants. There is nothing near the Heritance. Having said all that, if you want a quiet, clean relaxing hotel to just unwind sit by the pool and have early nights then it‚Äôs a great option. If you are lucky you will see some black monkeys around the hotel. We did get this hotel at a good price so we can‚Äôt complain I just believe the ratings on here are misleading. This is not to discredit the staff at the Heritance who were mostly all very helpful and nice people.

Was here on a two night trip with the rest of my colleagues from office. Really not much to write home about. It didn't stand up to my expectations of a five star hotel. The staff was very courteous and helpful. There is no argument about that but the hotel infrastructure wasn't exactly that great. The car parks are somewhere way away that you have to rely on valet parking. This means you have to pick up every single thing you need from the vehicle before you check-in. The dining halls are pretty dark and gloomy, mostly I believe due to the dark colouring of the ceiling which is decorated with batik. The buffet area was really odd, it was almost like walking in to someone's kitchen to get the food served, the dining hall and the buffet area have very different vibes. The pool is good and well maintained and they do have some activity rooms where you could play 8-ball or carrom or chess. But the overall set up just put me off. Will not be returning here.
the beach view and the suites are large

The hotel was great, nice beach and good stay. Rooms r big n comfortable, lil bit expensive compare to prices in srilanka! Nice view but keep the window closed, I had 2 cockroach in my room! Week ends n holidays too many local w kids come to the pool, if u don't like kids AVOID it

This is our first visit to this beautiful hotel..everything is perfect ..staff is very friendly and helpful.food is excellent..we will come back again..Thank you for the wonderful service you provided..

as a returning guest i was impressed by the improvements at heritance , the refurbished rooms with the washrooms are much brighter also the food was much better this year, maybe the competition next door has helped in this, but the biggest star of the heritance is its staff Thushara, dinesh at the pool nimasha,chamichand thanks for the flowers each day Sodad , to name but a few but everyone made our stay very welcoming , great location on the beach ,good food , comfortable rooms, room 246 . 23/11 - 3/12

This hotel has wonderful staff. Always smiling, welcoming and warm towards their guests. They go the extra mile as shown by the towel at that greeted us in the afternoon. A great way to relax and unwind aftera busy trip around the island.

The hotel facing beach view is very nice but the room we had was in corner on 2nd floor. When we checked in evening we dint notice the water purification unit next to the building which made load noise all the though night. Not that great customer service. We tried to speak to front desk manager, tried serval times and have our call back Number but dint receive any call back.

The atmosphere is more than brilliant and it has a very warm welcoming feeling and the staff are very helpful the food is excellent but could do more of authentic Sri Lankan food and has a variety of food... The rooms are spacious comfortable good... We will definitely visit this beautiful hotel again
heritance Ahungalla

Having returned on 11th June after 12 nights at this hotel on vacation with my wife, I feel the need to express my gratitude for such an amazing holiday. My wife and I were married in Sri Lanka last year and we fell in love with Sri Lanka - we felt compelled to return to celebrate our 1st anniversary (but this time at a different hotel). As soon as we arrived - the first impressions were..........wow. The brochures do not do this stunning hotel justice. Having had a long tiring journey, we were given a very warm welcome. We stayed in a Suite which was superb in every way. The rooms are serviced daily by friendly housekeeping staff to a very very high standard. I am a Executive Chef who is in charge of a group of Companies providing Fine Dining Catering with bespoke menu's to wealthy clientele, so I was intrigued to find out whether this 5* hotel would impress. I need not have questioned this thought. After talking to The Food and Beverage Manager, I was invited to look around the kitchens and meet their brigade. The kitchens were immaculate, staff spotless, motivated and relaxed in their work - delivering the most delicious fine dining experience. With Sri Lanka's top medal winning Chef at the helm this comes as no surprise. If it is fantastic food and excellent service you require, then look no further. We will definitely return.
Why relax @ Heritance Ahungalla?
Wonderful stay!

Me and my family stayed on FB basis for one day at heritance, ahungalle in october. the best thing was the food there. However, except for the welcoming staff at entrances staff was un or minimally attentive most of the time, of course they attend to us if we go and poke them repeatedly. we have booked a triple room and checked in around 4pm but there were twin beds in the room and after repeatedly reminding them they finally added an extra foldable bed. the person who brought the bed looked like a senior for that area, when we complained he just muttered something like 'twin bed room is the only room type available at heritance when you book a triple room and we always add an extra bed , only difference is you will get meals for 3 people' and walked away rapidly, on us... there were no room amenities in the room- no iron or ironing board, no water for three people, no slippers ,toothbrushes, cups etc at all. when we needed something we had to call and wait and call again . ultimately one person appeared with a trolley and instead of replacing missing items asked us to take whatever missing in the room. and the dark color pillow covers were so dirty we just kept them away. no one has bothered to change them for ages . safe was not functioning and when we typed numbers it missed some and got locked,then the person who attended late to fix it couldnt identify that its battery was low. finally it was fixed and by about 8.30 we managed to go for dinner. it may be due to overcrowded hotel but they already had 2 hours extra to check the room beforehand since we were late for check in. meals were good, staff was also more attentive. no one offered a baby high seater for our 3 year old and we had to go after them at all the 3 meals for a chair... restaurant is overcrowded and no one is there to offer water or clean tableware. they are only interested in taking plates away, at least that's a good thing. chefs and the restaurant manager were very supportive and offered some food for our baby , they were kind enough to deliver the dishes to our room as well. There is no sea view from the room and there was some construction work going on right next to our room which we didnt mind much.. next morning we asked them to take the plates away but no one showed up. by 1pm we were ready to check out and until that time no cleaning was done and room smelled of stale food. overall we didnt mind it as it was a one night thing ,tolerable on a full stomach and surely this place happens to be a typical siri lankan hotel, no matter how many stars they got,..

Its was an amazing place .... all the staff are simling,welcoming u,amazing . We will do it anthor time and encourge everyone to go there . We love heartance.......thank you alot..mwaaah Dani and taleen Jordan 19.5.2015

We stayed at heritance ahungalle for a few days on our visit to Sri Lanka The staff were extremely helpful in particular Duminda the restaurant Manager, Rukmal from house keeping and restaurant staff Varuna, Nelka and jananjaya. We were impressed with Duminda. He is very knowledge and made our stay very enjoyable. Rukmal has a special talent of creating animal motives out of towels. We felt very special. The staff are a credit to your organisation We will visit again Kumar and Elsie. Sydney Australia Clara Thattil Colombo Sri Lanka
Good for family and Honeymoon couples.

I chose Heritance because my family was holidaying there. The best part of the experience was the comfortable deluxe room with the best mattress I've ever slept on and a balcony overlooking the pool. I felt very relaxed and the staff was friendly and courteous. What disappointed me was the breakfast and dinner buffets(I stayed three nights) There was nothing special about the menu and my palate was bored. Everything tasted the same. To me the meals ordered via the in-room dining service tasted slightly better. Overall, it was a comfortable stay. It's a nice hotel if you want to relax, swim and enjoy the beach
amazing hotel. highly recommend. food/ service / location / pool / architecture.
Excellent hotel!

We went with friends and one of our friends lost their foot ware , ten feet from the pool and they were few hawkers selling few things and the securities of the hotel are very careless . They also had some maintance work going on . Over all an ok place . The chef took special care

It's such a pleasure to go around this beautifully laid-out hotel and encounter their ever-smiling and helpful staff. Special mention of Rukmal, the talented gentleman who always cleaned up my room and left beautiful towel art creations on my bed. Today he put 2 of my hairclips on the dog he made and it made me smile when I entered my room and I haven't stopped smiling yet (just like Rukmal) :-) Lovely location, great attitude of staff, comfortable room, good food... my first solo vacation is perfect.
Worth going out of your way to stay there
Fabulous hotel and staff
You could ask the staff to help you with the kind of room you have in mind, for eg. with a view of the green pool, which floor, view of the ocean etc.

This is a nice hotel. We generally enjoyed our stay, but qualified by the comment below. Special commendation for the hotel's service staff who were very helpful and pleasant. The qualification: The hotel website features photos of lovely views of the ocean from the hotel's main dining areas and pool. Moreover, we booked a "premium" room to enjoy the view of the beach and the ocean that comes with these rooms. A guest of the hotel should have a reasonable expectation that was is displayed on the website regarding visual amenity is what they will get if they book. However, for much of our stay, the hotel's beach-side amenity was marred by the construction and deconstruction (over four days) of a large marquee running the entire length of the hotel's main access way to the beach. This marquee does not appear in any photo on the hotel's website. Its presence, in my view, thus represents a breach, however minor, of the contract between hotel and guest. Because full-fee-paying hotel guests were not put first in this regard, it is unlikely that we will return to this hotel.

We visited Heritence Ahungalle for 2 nights in mid-April 2009. This was our second trip to the property having visited 5 years ago on our last trip to SL. Booked directly through the hotel website after comparing other similar properties such as Taj Exotica Bentota, The Fortress, Galle Fort Hotel and Eden Resort. Chose the Heritence given we had a wonderful stay 5 years ago. I wrote to the hotel inquiring about rates and was promised a free upgrade to a luxury room given that I was a returning guest. The hotel also stated that the property has been completely refurbished hence the drastic increase in price. When I got to the Heritence, I was told I would be given a deluxe room (the most basic room). I advised that I was promised a free upgrade to which I was told that they cannot honour this promise. They then advised that I could have an upgrade to a luxury room for an additional cost of Rs. 10,000 (US$86) per night. Given the higher cost I declined the upgrade and was quite disappointed. I had also requested a cot for my infant son when the booking was made. When I got to the hotel I was told that all the cots were in use. I complained to the General Manager who promised to look into it and get back to me, which he never did. We could not notice the refurbishments made to the property. The room we had looked very similar to the room we had five years ago as did the common areas. The property itself is beautifully maintained and is set on a stunning section of beach in SL. The main infinity pool and lobby area are very beautiful. The food is exceptional with a wide variety of choice all of which are of a very high level of quality. We visited this hotel during the Sri Lankan New Year and the hotel was full of local guests. We were blown away by the property and service on our last visit and were disappointed in the level of service during this trip (the GM has changed once during the past 5 years). I would say that we did have a good time and enjoyed the pool but would not likely return on our next trip to SL given they did not follow through on their promises.
Reasonable hotel
Great Time
Amazing hotel !!!
Take tours whilst you are in Sri Lanka and see what this beautiful country has to offer!

Lift is broken. Only 1 lift for the whole hotel. Elderly cannot climb the stairs. Booked 3 people room for 3 of us., but in there only 2 cups available. Hair dryer not working. No milk( even small complimentary 1) in the fridge. When I call the reception, they said they will fill the bar with some charges. Normally some milk is there in the fridge in the other hotels as complimentary,even a small pack.
Great Hotel..

Must try Chef Manjula's seafood platter and executive Pravin's hospitality ,kindness and efficiency.. Srilanka hospitality at its best!!!!!! Two beautiful swimming pools one feels like it's an extension of the sea. The architecture is Jeffrey Bawa's and it's sprawling without giving a concrete look. nature had been unhindered.

we stayed 5 nights up to the 22nd sep in a luxury rated room which I upgraded to for ¬£50 per night extra from a deluxe room they wanted ¬£61 but a deal was done ,the room was fine good size .ac did not regulate cold or cold. in general hotel is very tired and needs a refurb,looking shabby the public areas in particular,chairs and tables in bars and restaurants are sticky thru not being cleaned properly. only really one main bar area next to main pool and reception this is completetely devoid of ambience and comforts hardly a good advert for checking in guests who are brought here. the a la carte restaurant next to the main dining room while serving reasonable food is dirty with table runners stained and dirty when restaurant manager challenged about theis he quickly had it changed the same night our food came out cold ,not good for curries!the meal was remade but it was too late the damage done,they tried to make amends with a free dessert please too little too late. the main dining room is where we took breakfast and on one occasion a buffet dinner,the tables and chairs again dirty also the table runner.food wise the breakfast is good also the dinner buffet with plenty of choices available. we tried the fine dining restaurant one night and it was very good my wife taking the new zealang beef and me the 2 fish curry price wise of course dearer than the other two dining rooms but light years superior which you would expect if you pay more but not expensive to European prices. a bone of contention ,if you have a wine list then maybe the odd bottle is out of stock,but it got to the point all that was left was the expensive wines costing ¬£25 plus for what we get at home for ¬£6 now I know all about mark ups but rip off! the daytime was spent by the resident only pool as this was the quietist and the pool attendant was very good at arranging our beds and towels on the same vain all the staff were very good one or two thrown in at the deep end I suspect with a poor lack of English in the restaurants. avoid the weekends as it fills up with locals on a freebie with their company and they are noisy and usually drunk playing drums at all hours. now while you are relaxing on your sun lounger near a pool you will be beckoned over to the hawkers trying to sell sarongs tee shirts or days out in a taxi,now they are not supposed to step over a line in the sand enforced by security guards but all day long they are shouting to you waving the sarongs etc,they stand on the boundary of the hotel and the beach which means the beach is a no go zone unless you don't mind saying no thank you many many times over. don't know what can be done they need to make a living you are trying to have a peaceful holiday. so to sum up after touring around sri lanka for a week we intended to chill out for 5 days didn't feel we achieved it so we do not recommend this overated hotel more 3 star.
Service excellence but need to focus on the basics

A very warm, welcoming, beautiful resort. Our family spent 6 nights at the Heritance and will more than likely book again for the location and price. We booked online for a suite at a really good rate. As there was no way to book a luxury suite, we were hoping to be upgraded at checkin. As we are a large family, the benefit of the luxury suites 2 bathrooms would have been great. Unfortunately there were no luxury suites available when we arrived. Our room was clean and comfortable. We did notice the shower/bath combo would not drain properly and also collected a lot of water on the tubs edges which would spill onto the floor. We made do with towels placed in strategic locations. The food was very good and we absolutely loved the huge swimming pool. We even swam during a thunder shower. The location served as a great base to see all of the other sites Sri Lanka had to offer. Every staff member from the waiters, to the lifeguards, to the lovely gift shop employee was fantastic. Our kids were treated to a magic show, played pool and foosball, and loved the way our towels were folded into different animals upon arriving back to our room each night. Great stay!
Really trying hard to give you a good experience

There were lots of dogs around that followed you to your room - I am afraid of dogs so it made me very nervous when I was walking around on my own. They could have some simple gates at the entrance to the stairs and this would stop the dogs getting to corridors with rooms. Booking.com advertised a few restaurants but only one restaurant and one pool bar were available to us. All inclusive guests were invited to a second restaurant but we were not allowed. Booking.com advertised shows and animators but there were none.

We had a very relaxing time with my family. We enjoy our stat a lot. Food and service is great. The two pools near by beach are amazing in this beautiful place. We will come back soon and thanks for the great hospitality.
better to asked upper flooor

This place stinks of quality: the walk to our room was sophisticated with open squares full of tropical trees and a very classy colour scheme throughout. Service was extremely attentive, and the food was impressive. The pool by our room was beautiful. The hotel itself is quite old, with some fittings showing their age, but everything worked and now's not the time to be spending huge amounts on renervations so no criticism there! Excellent overall.
Beautiful location, fine architecture but not 5* luxury
Good - But not what we expected

This is absolutely not a 5 star resort - not by international or Sri Lankan standards. Everything from the small room to the aged gym and very basic amenities was a disappointment. The food is admittedly excellent but the restaurant staff have absolutely no sense of how to host more than 100 people. On the whole, the staff are friendly but typically clueless. Basic hotel processes such as charging drinks to a room or booking a spa appointment have proved very trying. Their cashier desk is simply a joke - patrons have to go to a little room in the back of reception to make small payments, as if they are in some bizarre 1950s public administration building. The overall impression is in fact an insult to guests who are paying a significant premium for their stay.
Amazingly FILTHY
Asanka Ranasinghe

Exceptionally beautiful hotel design and location and Everything was good..great selection of food in the restaurant.Room service was much better but limited selection....Geoffery Bawa's infinity pool was amazingly beautiful..........
Beautiful hotel, but poor buffet

We stayed at this hotel for four days and it was the worst hotel experience ever. A COMPLETE WASTE OF MONEY AND A VERY EXPENSIVE DISASTER! I recommend reading the lowest reviews for this hotel before you book; there is a real discrepancy between the nightmare reviews and those that are praising this hotel. Make sure you understand what is the worst that could happen to you also if you choose to stay here, because the worst scenario did happen to us. We did not read what the low ratings on Tripadvisor said about the Heritance Ahungalla. We wished we did because so many of these complaints reflect our experience. My friend and I are both seasoned travelers, and have stayed in both five star accommodation and budget ones, all over the world. Given the cost of staying at this hotel, we were both incredibly disappointed and also traumatised during their stay. We felt so uncomfortable and threatened during our stay that we locked ourselves in our hotel room. We have lodged a formal complaint to the travel agency about our stay at the Heritance Ahungalla. Our main complaints are as follows: - Worst service: for the entire duration of the trip, the staff was incredibly rude. There was no ‚Äòhospitality‚Äô. The staff pestered us repeatedly for tips, from the receptionist to cleaning staff to waiters. When we made all the complaints listed below to the staff, we were completely ignored and were shouted at. No attempts were made to apologise or to resolve the problems. We were incredibly frustrated by this, and were very close to tears. - Terribly unhygienic: stained bedsheets, dust and mould. Restaurant tableware and cutlery was not cleaned properly and had stains. - Pests: cockroaches, flies and mosquitoes in the bedroom and the bathroom. - Touts: The hotel was full of touts, from the pool to the beach, also pestering us and other guests to buy their goods. At one point, one of the touts even made a completely disgusting sexual advance on my friend! The hotel made no effort to safeguard the safety and/or privacy of their guests. - Food: the food was always lukewarm at best, and/or cold. Food would take at least 45 minutes to arrive. We ended up eating only burgers and fries for the four days that we were there, as it was the only food we felt was safe. For a holiday experience, this was disappointing. It would have been better to have just eaten McDonald‚Äôs. - Bad facility condition: The hotel is quite old, and many parts require fixing. A number of sunbeds were broken and completely unusable. We will never stay there again and are warning everyone who visits Sri Lanka to avoid this place. If you plan on staying there, at least read both the good and bad reviews to decide for yourself. There is a higher risk staying at this hotel, because of its location. It is incredibly far away from Colombo and any other properties, so if you arrive here and the hotel is a complete disappointment, there is no other property that you can escape to. BEWARE!

This hotel is very beautiful, pleasant crew, food is very delicate, servis is good. We are very satisfied. Rooms are clean and nice, cleans 2x daily. Beaches are beautiful,arenaceous. Disadvantage is there are a big waves, but it is ok. In the hotel are 2 big swimming pool.
Great Atmosphere
Avoid rainy season, especially Southwest monsoon season, because outdoor activity will be limited, including pool access.
EXTREMELY DISAPPOINTING IN HOSPITALITY
Very Pleasant Staff
Truly a 5 Star Hotel

I think sri lanka is a wunderful country and this is a very nice hotel. The stuff is very very friendly! Thank you! The pool and the view on the beach is amazing. Also the rooms are quite pretty. But i felt really stressed as soon as i went near to the beach. You couldnt enjoy for some minutes, there were always some people who tried to sell you some stuff. That wasnt okay and the hotel shouldnt accept that.

Planned to trip to Srilanka for my wedding anniversary with my entire family. After landing at the airport and a pleasant drive to ahungalla we reached this magnificent property that sprawls out from the entrance and the fabulous use of water spaces. The property with its alluring pool, fabulous beach and amazing large rooms is magical. With excellent food, great all day activities, 2 superb pools, a stunning beach front and pleasing service this is one stay that will linger in memory for a long time.
Nothing. It was really good

We read all of the guide books and surfed the net before plumping for this hotel having spent the first night at the tired and desperately in need of a refurb Bentota beach resort , great pool sweaty sheets.... only 45 minutes from Galle, which is only worth a day trip any way if you ask me.... If you are looking for a beach side paradise with a modern room with quiet aircon and sliding doors onto a pool that is pure bliss for midnight swims then this cant be faulted. Food is great, plenty of options and places to eat, your room, the terrace, cafe or fine dining. Tennis, Snooker and yoga, not in that order.... We stayed in 5 hotels from Kandy, Nuwara, Dambulla and here. this was the best value and the most excellent. service was fab. Although all heritance hotels are good the one at Dambulla is triple the price for example; for food and beverages. Stay at the earls regeency or mahawali reach in kandy> tea plantation or St andrews in Nuwara Elya and the kandalama in Dambulla, expensive but a truely natural experience, like having a safari in your room! monkeys on the balcony, bats in the corridors and an infinty pool overlooking the wilderness. Snakes and lizards every where, in a nice way! oh and if you want golf the only place to play is the sublime course near Kandy at victoria. a real gem. Enjoy
Best hotel...
Ordinary...
When we told them in advance that it was our wedding anniversary trip, they upgraded our room at no extra charge.

This hotel's location is absolutely beautiful but the hotel rooms and after hours in -room dining are a real disappointment and are definitely not 5star worthy! However, the staff in the bar/ restaurant area are extremely helpful. I would definitely recommend to take their Romantic Dinner Set up on the beach which is extremely unique and a great menu. The peak of the hotel is the main swimming pool as it really is the focal point of the hotel. The pit of our stay is that we were not informed about anything during check in such as useful information like: you have the choice of enjoying your breakfast in your hotel room or the buffet concept restaurant & coffee and tea are complimentary during your stay (including in room dining orders!!!). All these points are great highlights which were not informed to us and we only found out by asking proactively asking questions or having the lovely surprise of not being charge for breakfast by in room dining. We really want to thank Front Desk Assistant Manager, Kansu (I think that's his name!) who looked after us during our stay and even surprised us by placing a happy anniversary cake in our suite. Overall, our stay was lovely but I feel that the hotel would benefit from a refurbishment as some areas of the hotel are a bit outdated or need a good clean up.

The worst hotel I've ever seen. Traveled a lot. I don‚Äôt know where the positive reviews came from here, but it‚Äôs terrible. Dirty, the hotel is under construction (dirty construction workers eat with you at the next table, the dishes are dirty, the service is disgusting. During your vacation you listen not to the ocean, but to the sound of a jackhammer. The all-inclusive system is zero, you won‚Äôt wait for your cocktail (small choice). Bar from in the seventies. We got poisoned there (in response to our complaint, they said it was an allergy to curry), then other guys in this hotel got poisoned. The food was not tasty, the choice was small. After what I saw on the 4th day of our stay, I already had a showdown with the agent. , who sent us there with a tour operator and reached Colombo and Moscow, we were moved to another hotel in Rio (located nearby, the Heaven and Earth hotel is barely worthy of 2-3 stars, no more, very old with lazy staff,). the general lack of modern life, animation, etc. There are not enough sun loungers for everyone, there are 4 sun umbrellas for the entire hotel.

We had a lovely time during our stay ‚ù§. I have been to this hotel many times before and am always amazed with the hospitality I receive üôå Great staff and management team who try and accommodate every request you make üòÄ Great place to stay

If you are going to visit this amazing desitination, head there soon and stay at the Heritance Ahungalla - a true oasis of calm and rejuvenation. Right next door is the Hotel Riu - an ugly blot on the shoreline that reminds you more of holidays in the 70s in Benidorm, than resting in the idyliic spot that Sri Lanka is. Word on the street is that next door to the Riu an 800 bed hotel is planned - ruination of the beach thanks to the developers who seem to be focussed more on quantity not quality.
Everything is astonishing, except F/O seems disconnected to the hospitality attitude while the other staff already attached professionally.

Great hotel right on the ocean. Relaxation and opportunity forget about problems. Excellent service and friendly staff. Thanks for Rukmal and all staff for comfortable staying. I hope to come back someday

We stayed beginning of August for 3 nights in the Junior Suite in Heritance Ahungalla. In general, the rooms are clean, the swimming pool is nice, especially for kids and also the beach is great. Unfortunately, like most 5-star hotels in Sri Lanka, also this one lacked essential things like a proper finishing in the room (the bathroom was a desaster, I cut myself several times at the glass door there), a very small TV only etc. The food was good quality, thoug a little expensive, but because we liked it we only ate at the hotel. The breakfast had a wide selection, and there was a big variety at the dinner buffetts, for example "seafood grill night" etc. The service was very poor, anything you wanted to do or to get took ages and did not work properly. On one saturday night there was a wedding with extremely loud music next to the second pool (where all the suites are localed; it was like a disco), and with still going on after 11 o¬¥clock and the kids not being able to sleep I complained several times without success. It went on until 3 in the morning, which literally destroyed our next day and is something no 5-star hotel should accept. Many guests complained, but the management rather preferred to cash in the money for the ceremony instead of satisfiying their guests. Nevertheless we had altogether a good time, the animateurs at the hotel were dedicated and we had a lot of fun with waterpolo and beach volleyball. One last note: as generally in Sri Lankan 5 star hotels, they overprice taxis etc. by 300 to 400%. Just go out of the hotel and rent a taxi or tuc-tuc there, as next to the savings the locals know all the places to go.
Bad maintenance- lack of trained staff-not client friendly - deteriorating standards

Ist eine gro√üe Anlage, aber da muss komplett sehr vieles renoviert werden‚Ä¶sehr sehr vieles. Es gibt viele vier Sterne Hotels, die viel gem√ºtlichen und komfortabler, sauberer sind.

The hotel is extremely beautiful, the pool is right in front of the private beach. You can view pretty sunsets and see a star studded sky at night. Food was great and house keeping and service was exceptional. Please ask for Rukmal, he‚Äôs very helpful!

I had a wonderdul time at heritance ahungalla at the baccus bar with my friends I love this hotel so much may be because of the hospitable staff and the wonderful service that they provide to us when ever we go there. I will recomend this hotel to everyone.

I have just returned from a one week stay at this hotel. The day of my arrival was Independence Day and therefore preparation for celebrations were in full swing, funnily I immediately felt part of the hotel. The staff were lovely, helpful, calm and polite even when I was a bit fraught with things not exactly working out as planned from my travel company. Lazy days on the beach were marred by enthusiastic beach vendors, however with the help of a German guest I managed to negotiate a good price for a silk scarf having told myself "I am most certainly not going to buy anything from them!" Sri Lankans are welcoming people and not all are after your money, although I did find the tipping to the hotel staff obligatory which got embarrassing, if not down right annoying one guy round the pool seemed to want tipping to speak to me! Yet another saved my sunbed all morning for only a smile. On my last morning my pick up time was some unearthly early morning hour, but the kitchen staff managed to lay on my own personal buffet breakfast AND I received a breakfast picnic to take with me to the airport. Food was mediocre but good a selection at breakfast, dinner with my half board was a bit "breakfast warmed up" with some dishes, although as a vegetarian my tastes were well catered for plus an offer of my personal selection from the chef. A Fawlty moment one evening when I asked for a black coffee to complete the meal. I was told "Coffee off, no more coffee, sorry coffee is finished" err is this a hotel? this was rectified when a member of the waiting staff later turned up with my coffee. It needs more polish. Little things like a stain on the table cloth, cloudy glasses, no hair conditioner, a chip on the bathroom mug,a stain on the net curtains in my room and the corridor to the room looked more "seaside guest house". They were improving the walls on the stairs of the hotel with stencilling. A warning, I hit my head on a metal plank balanced precariously between the bannisters where the "artist" stood. Health and Safety in the UK would have closed it down. I did mention it and the reception staff thanked me for drawing it to their attention. The plank remained. The hotel was over all quiet and the music went on till only 10.30pm I did like an early night but the music was pleasant enough despite hearing it in my room and as I say it was only to 10.30pm. The hotel did seem to regulate conferences/weddings to noise minimum and respect to their guests. It might pass for a 4 star only Sri Lankan style but it was not 5 star. Too many rude Russians but this is not a hotel issue just a way of life on holiday now.
Could be better

Room= nice bed, good view nice balcony alot of ants though. Kind of a walk and no lift. Spacious. NO IRON. Bathroom= overall good bathroom clean and we'll equipped. Restaurant= A La carte= expensive for pasta and one pasta looked freshly made other looked like it had been in the microwave and it was disgusting even the waiter said it wasn't good.But didn't care. He was answering our questions and was good at what he was doing always working. Asked for late check out and got it til 2 thank you very much. And also check out was the worst. Shocking!!!!!!!!! Do not come here.

We finally decided to give this hotel a shot as we were traveling through the area mainly due to its architecture (Jeffrey Bower design) and location. Sadly this place failed us. Trivago lists the room that we were given for around $90 US. We paid $175 per night for the two day stay with the full understanding that we'll be getting a decent room. I was expecting much better accommodations given it's the off season and the hotel in near empty. Firt room we got was so bad that I refused it immediately. They then moved us to a different "deluxe" room, as I was told, which was marginally better than the first one. The bathroom is dirty, no bath robes in the room and the view is sub par. The room is located in the far corner of the hotel. It is a smoking room and we were not offered the option to choose whether we needed a smoking room or not. It's puzzling to me that the hotel staff felt this room is consistent with a 5 star hotel. I'd rate this place and our experience at 3 stars at best! I've given them two opportunities to rectify the situation and they utterly failed both times. They've had a golden opportunity to wow us and grantee a repeat customer but for some reason, that I still can't understand, they chose to make sure that we will not come back again. In this copetitive field, where there are many other options availabe, the accommodation we've received is not what I had expected from a Heritance chain (Kandalama in contrast was fantastic). We'll be in this country 3 more days and was hoping to to spend it in this area had they met our expectations. Instead we'll be moving to the Hilton in Colombo for the remainder of our stay. Needless to say that this is the first and the last time for us in this perticular facility. Situation of this type do not warrant a third chance. To the management team... look very closely into the culture that is set forth. I don't think you can afford to have customers like us, who travel all over the world and are often in Sri Lanka, to be this dissatisfied with your facilities. Every one that complains on a site like this, ten goes without taking the time to do so yet they are just as dissatisfied. You're alianating the very customers that is your life blood. This is an absolute self inflicted wound.
Rooms near the reception/pool are noisier in the night.

This is a great hotel in many ways. It is a Bawa design so the actual structure and lay out of the resort is outstanding. The rooms are well appointed with great showers. But for the price and the history of the place I thought the resort could have been better. 1) The resort falls down in comparison to other world class hotels in the details. For example, every room is given a fruit basket designed to resemble a traditional Sri Lankan out rigger. This is a great touch but the problem is that the boat basket was quite broken and falling apart. It should have been replaced long ago. There are examples of this where a good idea is not quite executed correctly. Another example was the intrusion of more conventional resorts into the appearance of this heritage building: in the bar area upstairs there was a Red Bull fridge displayed quite prominently. Does anyone truly think Bawa would have approved of such a thing? Of course not. It disrupts the entire point of a place built by Bawa and damages the aesthetic. The managers should be aware of this. 2) The food was okay but was a mass produced buffet designed to accommodate a large number of people. This led to the food becoming pretty routine after a few days. We also found that it was difficult to get the attention of staff and I found they were not very attentive. Sometimes we had to ask twice for something simple like water. My feeling was that they were very understaffed. 3) A big issue for me was the mattresses. I have some muscular skeletal problems so sleeping on a hard bed is not good for me. But the beds at Ahungalla were very hard. In general I cannot understand why they would not get medium softness beds to accomodate everyone's needs. These may seem like small details, but for the price, for the fact it is a 5 star hotel, and because of its history and heritage, I think the place could do better. Having said that, it is certainly a considerable step up from the majority of large resorts on the SL coast.
ask for rooms facing the ocean, you ll have a great view... we had room 326

They say first impressions are everything!! We knew we were in for a rough time as soon as we arrived. On arrival we were shown to a scruffy bar area with tatty leatherette seats which were all torn and ripped. For the third time in 6 days in Sri Lanka we were taken to a really horrid room (No. 228)!! OMG what a dump - we had paid for a king-size luxury room and what we got was a prison cell twin!! It was filthy, pokey, run down and utterly horrid. Needless to say we made a fuss and were initially told we would have to pay for an upgrade!! We were finally upgraded to a suite gratis. Unfortunately this was not much better!! The hotel is in a terrible state and is in dire need of major renovation. One of the biggest problems in this hotel is the design. This hotel is celebrated for it's design and architecture but in my opinion this is misplaced. All the bathroom walls are simply skimmed concrete which gives them a horrid dingy, dirty prison cell-like appearance. There were no curtains - just these filthy heavy shutters which moved in filthy tracks. The blinds were broken, filthy and flaking!! Pillows were stained. The remote control for the TV was held together with sticky tape, the hotel guide book was covered in sticky dried food, the chair at the desk was filthy and the mini-bar fridge was rusty and leaking water. The final straw was the insect life living in the room!! We were tired, upset and ready to leave. By this time it was very late at night and we contacted our travel agents in UK and told them we wanted to return to UK asap. We were told there was nothing that could be done until the morning. We spent a very uncomfortable night and waited to see what would happen. Well; we had obviously stirred the hornets nest!! Next morning we were contacted by the front of house manager and within minutes we were surrounded by loads of staff members apologising and promising to make things right. After a short while we were upgraded again to a genuinely luxury suite which was lovely. Clean linen, clean floors, curtains and the biggest jacuzzi I have ever seen!! Throughout the whole process all of the staff at the hotel were wonderful and helpful and charming!! We enjoyed the rest of our stay. Once this hotel has been renovated it will be fantastic, if you are looking for a stunning beach resort. The location is idyllic. The buffet restaurant is good with plenty of high quality options - western and local cuisine. Make the most of the area - hire the bikes that the hotel offer and enjoy the amazing countryside. - we spent a couple of hours cycling through the local village. What a treat!! Giant Monitor lizard by the side of the road, buffalo wandering towards us on the road, local farmers working in the paddy fields surrounded by cattle Egrets and monkeys jumping through the trees!! It was very hot but one of the highlights of our trip. A day trip to Galle was very worthwhile as were trips to the local towns. The local Turtle hatcheries are wonderful but beware the 'Spice Gardens' - rip-offs aimed squarely at parting unwary tourists from their cash!! I was genuinely shocked at the number of people putting their towels on the pool-side loungers before breakfast and then obviously spending the whole day baking and drinking beer. Bloody long way to go for skin cancer and to not experience all the amazing sights, people and wildlife this wonderful country has to offer!!

This was our first time visiting heritance ahungalle and we were looking forward to a relaxing weekend. First up when we arrived our room wasn't ready and even though I had specifically requested for a king size bed since we were travelling with our son instead of individual beds this too was not taken into account. After sitting in the lobby for over 30 minutes we were finally taken up to our room . The luggage however was not brought to the room and after waiting a good 30 minutes we had to go looking for it. As for the food we found it to be basic and lacking in flavour. Breakfast was much better as it had a variety with many local dishes and seasoning. I found it bizarre that very little seafood was on the menu being a sea side hotel. The staff were attentive and went to the extent of asking if anything special was required for our son. Location is beautiful and rooms are good. Need to improve in food and urgency of staff In getting things done.

A nice beach hotel to stay in. The staff are very friendly and helpful although when the restaurant is busy you may have to wait a bit. Special thanks to Nelka in the restaurant and Waruna 'The Captain' in the pool bar for their friendly approach and their help, especially in getting my green tea just the way I like it! The service at dinner was extremely slow but the staff and management was apologetic about that

Right on the beach, 2 beautiful pools, and really lovely staff - who are definitely the major asset. But WHY do the bathrooms look so unclean? our shower screen was limescaled (heavily), the floors and walls needed upgrading as they were scuffed and marked and impossible to clean (polished concrete walls au naturel! - but evidently the architect who designed them loves the effect so it doesn't matter!). On the plus side the bed was wonderfully comfortable. Breakfast was in a low ceilinged dark room (often smokey from the cooking of bacon or hoppers) - where you help yourselves but have to wait for tea/coffee (i.e. flag down a waiter if you can catch their eye - although there are always plenty of them around) - and geared to Big Appetites and touring parties. The dinner buffet food in the same room was lukewarm and no one attends it to ensure it is stirred/kept hot. The menus are very restricted. Where are all the delicious tastes of Sri Lanka? Why travel all this distance to eat (mediocre) European food! The middle range restaurant (I think it was called Mustard) with a terrace overlooking the pool was the best, as the food was cooked to order, and the staff more than willing to experiment with something off the menu if they had the ingredients. The beauty salon was staffed by wonderful Balinese girls who gave a very good deep tissue massage - but the standard of the treatment rooms (just converted bedrooms) was poor. Expect more ambience for the price. Not 5* by European/International standards and more expensive for food/drink than the Amangalla or the Galle Face. The hotel facilities need upgrading to earn their stars!
Shame about the food

I have just had the experience of checking in my friend and his wife to the Heritance, it looked ok on the way in but the outlook is very sterile, having read most of the reviews about their coffee shop we eventually made it there after a labourious check in, I suggest to the management that they should send their coffee shop staff into the Capital city colombo to the almost genuine 5 star hotels to find out what a Capucino and a Cafe Latte is and how it is made and presented, we had 2 cups of ordinary coffee with a bit of milk froth on top and were charged the best part of 5 USD for this pathetic version of a Capucino and Latte, I don't mind paying 5 star prices but please please provide us with a 5 star cup of coffee, and how in heavens name do hotels classify themselves as 5 star, a ordinary 3 star hotel in Thailand will knock spots of any so called 5 star hotel in Sri Lanka, very very disappointed.

After coming from Heritance Kandalama we expected the same. This is not the case. I did not want to jump on here and be outright negative, but there is good and bad here. Our room has a broken aircon, bathroom exhaust fan, telephone and main door lock, with no safe. Pretty alarming. Our guy that cleans the room is wonderful and has tried his best to get everything fixed up. So far the kettle has been replaced. They have tried to fix the phone several times with no luck. Reception rings you constantly but you can not talk to them, very annoying. Outside the gates are pushy tuk tuk drivers in a dirty street. Surprising since Sri Lanka is a very clean country with mostly beautiful helpful people. Not here though. We were really looking forward to a few days in the pool looking at the ocean after a pretty hectic schedule. As soon as you get to the pool the yelling people on the beach trying to sell dodgy wares ruins it straight away. Even security and staff were called several times to try and help ripped off tourists. But security does nothing. It is like they work with them. After all the places we have stayed in Sri Lanka this is the worst. We would not come back here again.

As a well travelled guest, Heritance Ahungalla was one of the worst hotels I have been to. My friends and I arrived at the hotel after a long day, expecting the welcome they advertise. But we were greeted with nothing and yet I noticed the foreign tour group next to us at the hotel were getting a great welcome. The foreign guests were given a welcome drink in front of me and even when j was checking in, nothing was really done. This was extremely disappointing to see as their attention was on the foreign guests, even though the hotels are kept afloat by locals even in times of crisis. In a sense, it felt as if I and my friends were purposefully ignored at the welcome to focus on white people. Next, the rooms were OK and clean with the needed amenities. The pool was ok and the environment was relaxing and calm. But the Jacuzzis are broken and one was unusable. This really dampened the experience. Thirdly, the buffet. The food experience was TERRIBLE. I stayed ful board for 2 days and the food was the same everytime. There was not much variety and so, it was really disappointing. At one point during lunch, I found MOLD in my food!!! The same night during dinner, my friends and I ate carved roast pork and the meat was rotten. It smelled bad and when I ate a bite, it was so rotten and I had to throw it away. The breakfast buffet had some diversity and was enjoyable. The staff is nice and accommodates our wish. The bar makes a really good cocktail called the green pool. Other than that, it was a poor experience. Serving bad food to guests and ignoring local guests to focus only on foreign guests was what made me write this review. I never badly review anyplace I travel to unless its horrible, like ahungalla was. It did not serve a purpose to my business trip either. Would never visit again.
The pools were amazing, it had a real colonial style to it which was fun.
The best pastries chef!

The Heritance Style
much better

Not at all a 5 star property by any stretch . Yes all basic amenities like pool, indoor game, bar etc are there but quality/cleanliness not thr. My son and wife also got food poisoning after eating brownie.

We ended off our holiday in Sri Lanka at this hotel, booked in for 3 nights. It was a perfect decision as it was pure bliss and relaxation. The hotel offers various amenities to allow you to unwind, with two swimming pools (one overlooking the ocean and another more secluded) while being situated along the beach from where you can take a dip into the ocean. Other amenities include table tennis, a gym and in-house entertainment such as live music and performances. The staff service is friendly, efficient and professional, while the food is good (not too spicy overall but a decent array to choose from). Our dining experience was made memorable with exceptional service from Malake during breakfasts and dinners. The rooms were clean, comfortable and spacious with a balcony overlooking the ocean. The hotel premises were always kept neat and tidy while offering sufficient space to walk around or relax on a pool chair. Overall I would certainly recommended this hotel to any couple or family looking for a place to relax and unwind while being taken care of at a world-class and luxury hotel. Many thanks.

This hotel was a great disappointment for us. This was our sixth night in Srilanka and when we made the bookings we were so excited about this hotel and the photos we have seen. However, our stay there was a disaster! We waited for more than 30 mins to Check in. When we checked it, the room was in a mess and the telephone lines were not working. We complained to the reception and all they said that this was because of the rain and it will come back within 10 mins but it didn't. We tried again but it was useless. The receptionist and the staff were rude and their service was far below the standards. to make things worse, there was a school trip that night and the kids occupied the swimming pool, the restaurant and everywhere in the hotel. The restaurant was expensive and the food was average but the service was a little bit better than anywhere else in the hotel. The room was small but the balcony was nice. In general I would not recommend this hotel to anyone. If you still want to go there, then please ensure that you are in the middle of the week and not on Saturday/Sunday or Friday to avoid the busy times at the hotel where the service drops down to the lowest level.
