I chose this hotel because it was designed by Geoffery Bawa. The rooms and resort are lovely, but definitely in need of upgradation in many areas. The upper floors look like they've been refurbished, but the lower floors have not. Upon check in, we realised the air conditioning in our room wasn't working, we got twin beds, when we had requested a king size bed and the wi-fi was intermittent. Given the quality and state of the rooms, i was not happy to pay 280USD a night.
All rooms seemed to have a sea view.
It keeps on getting better......
in ground level rooms humidity is to high
Fabulous hotel, views and staff
Nothing special

Our home away from home! Our first visit was in 2007 and we have come almost every year since then. Each stay was more memorable then others. Always receive a warm greeting at arrival, mouth watering food, fantastic rooms, beautiful garden, excellent service delivery. We benchmark other hotels to Heritance. Keep up the good work!

The beginning of the holiday started in a very disappointing way. We arrived at the hotel at 2PM on time for check in. However we were informed that the rooms were not ready. As a result we had to wait for over two and a half hours to get our rooms which was a very disappointing experience to start a vacation. The excuse given by the staff was that the guests have not vacated the rooms on time. This is not a plausible excuse. The hotel should know when to call and inform guests that they need to check out on time. The least they could do then is call us and let us know there is a delay so that we can plan to arrive late to the hotel. My mother who is elderly had to sit for along time in the reception area and found it difficult to walk afterwords as well. We actually decided never to come back to this hotel again but we changed our minds after the experience afterwards. The staff in the hotel mainly the room maintenance and restaurant staff were very polite friendly and courteous. Never before had we experienced such a good service from staff in any other hotels we had been to. Another plus point was the food. The food was excellent. There was a wide variety and it was very tasty. One negative aspect is that we stayed one night on a day where there were less guests. On this day the food variety was not there and that was a bit of a undermining experience for us. Another unsatisfactory experience I faced was with the pool attendant. When I went to the swimming pool I asked the pool attendant for a towel. His reply was that the hotel had instructed him to inform guests to bring their room towels. This seemed very odd to me as I saw other patrons having pool towels. Anyway I proceeded to have a swim and I could not dry myself as I had no towel and I had to go to the room all wet. With the cold wind blowing I could have got pneumonia as well but thankfully that didn't happen. Later on I called the reception to clarify this and they said that the pool attendant should have given me towels and that he had given me false information. In any case I do hope the hotel takes this experience as a learning and inform their pool attendants as to not to refuse to give patrons pool towels. Finally I would like to say that the hotel did allow us to have a late check out in order to compensate for the delayed check in. Overall I would say that I would come back to Heritance Ahungalla due to the friendly and polite staff and the good food. However I hope that I will not face the unpleasent expeirnces I mentioned above, the next time I visit.. Dilshan Thambawita
Request for rooms overlooking the private swimming pool.
They were bit pushy for the check-out. May be they had guests waiting, but they started calling us and reminding us from 1145am onwards
Don't come here if you want to sleep
Rooms further from reception are quieter. Eat early for best selection / later for quieter days experience Top floor rooms have a sea view
Fantastic Food

Heritance Ahungalle was definitely worth a stay in Ahungalle. It's located right on the edge of Galle Road and is easily accessible. The check-in & check-out was fast, efficient and seamless. The staff was very polite and warm. The rooms (although a little dated) have star-class amenities (hot water, kettle, tea/coffee, TV, free WIFI etc). The beach is just near the hotel and the two large swimming pools offer a very good time to relax! My only complaint is with regards to the food. Not to say it was bad, but it could use more variety and flavour too. Other than that, it was a lovely hotel to stay at!
Great Architecture coupled with horrible management equals: We don't come back
Please keep in mind, that rooms located close to the main pool are very loud, as there is music playing every nigh

Wir hatten das Deluxe Zimmer mit 2 Einzelbetten gebucht! Unser Zimmer entsprach in keinster Weise der Beschreibung und den Bildern bei Booking.com. Das Zimmer war klein!! Ich denke, dass kleinste im ganzen Hotel! Der angef√ºhrte Sitzbereich war nicht vorhanden, er h√§tte auch gar keinen Platz gehabt. Um die Klappe zum Wasserkocher √∂ffnen zu k√∂nnen, musste man den Kasten verschieben, der Schreibtisch war im Weg. Safe war auch keiner vorhanden, wurde uns aber auf Nachfrage in den Kasten gestellt. Bei unserem Zimmer stand der Zusatz: Free room Upgrade upon available, Early Check In&Late Checkout upon available...war leider nicht m√∂glich, mit der Begr√ºndung, dass Hotel w√§re voll. Wir waren eine ganze Woche dort und bemerkten, dass dem, allem Anschein nach, nicht so war! Wir hatten das Zimmer nur mit Fr√ºhst√ºck gebucht, h√§tten im Hotel gerne das eine oder andere gegessen oder getrunken. Das kommt aber wirklich teuer, ein Teller French Fries knapp 10 Euro! Es kommt bei allem,was auf der Karte steht noch insgesamt 28% dazu! Schade!
Had great time, could be better.

I don‚Äôt mind staying in 3 star or less and judge them on that criteria , this is the type of hotel I object too , pretending to be a 5 star when it clearly is not . This is a recently updated 3 star at best First Pros Good location , right on the ocean , nice pools that faces the sea , rooms are adequate . Couple of excellent staff , housekeeping and the lady at the buffet Cons Bear in mind this is a 5 star hotel ( allegedly) Two hot tubs , one uncovered and has foot of water the other boarded over with no sigh of life . Broken paving stones by the second pool Old and tired towels at the pool Sun beds all peeling Blinds that come down in poor weather to protect the hotel are shredded and broken Rusty bin in bathroom, Paint peeling in the shower No USB points , Plastic seal on the bedroom shutter coming away Service is sooooo sloooooooooowwwwww Asked about ice cream at the 5 star buffet and told its not included . Sulky waiters 5 star gym is old, 8 year old machines , no matts , What I find suspicious is that all the glowing reviews mention nothing about the tiredness of the place and they are generally written by people with less than 5 reviews to their name , hmmmmm Only here for a couple of days but would be very angry if I had booked a week at a ‚Äú5 star hotel‚Äù to find this

This place was amazing. From our arrival we felt very welcome here. The staff were very friendly and helpful. They were always on hand to help with a smile and were immaculate in presentation. The location of the hotel is idyllic, the pool was fantastic & the room was perfectly clean and practical. The food was 5* quality, great selection to choose from and reasonable at cost. Take the buffet breakfast! You may see an elephant wandering the grounds ;) This hotel had plenty of character, there were activities going on all day & entertainment in the evenings. We even got to try scuba diving in the pool. The spa was fantastic, we had hot oil massages which were just heavenly. We were very happy with our stay here, we only stayed 2 nights - We will be back again for sure! I cannot recommend this hotel enough!

We had 4 nights here at the end of a tour and it was by far the worst of the hotels we had stayed at. No problem with the room (though our friends managed to get their room booked out whilst they were in it!) but the service on two nights in the Coffee Shop and the Upper Dining was VERY slow. Added to this was the meat when it arrived after 90 minutes (!) in our meal at the Upper (Fine) Dining was overcooked in part and a lump of fat for the duck! This was very disappointing as we had been introduced to the company's head chef at a previous hotel. The Jade restaurant (buffet) was good both for dinner and breakfast though.
Check and avoid corner rooms since they are MUCH smaller for the same price
Third floor right side corner room facing the sea is quite nice

We were there on the 23rd October and when we're having bf in between of our bf we were asked to get up because the place was reserved for a foreigner. Then we asked a glass of water and the hostess denied that too. Her name was anuskha. When asked her for apologies she dint even do that . So I warn some indians going there no proper bf dinner also available for indians . No action was taken after I complained the management too.

This hotel is hit or miss. We stayed in a beautiful room but had a view of trash and falling apart tennis courts. There were ants in our room. There are some nice areas (main pool) and some very run down areas (spa area). The beach is nice and long but water is rough with currents and rip tides. The breakfast buffet and lunch buffet were plentiful so it was easy to find food for each preference. The service was good but slow. It took us 20 minutes to check out through some outdated cashier methods (spa had to bring a paper copy of their charges while we waited).

We checked in to the room not knowing they have given us a twin room. What made us upset was the girl who escorted us to the room Dinushi, the excuse she gave was "if you checked in early we would have given you a better room" I was stunned! I immediately told them that we will be checking out the next morning even though we were booked for two nights. It was around 6pm when we checked in and we were too tired after traveling from colombo otherwise I would have definitely checked out the same night. Room was so small and very dirty and old. Bathroom was very small and mind you a huge cockroach was running over our bathroom amenities imagine using rhose tooth brushes and soap and those refill type shampoo bottles which were anyway spilt. I was so upset I cabt tell you how much because we were there to celebrate a birthday. It was all ruined. Later on the duty manager came and ask whether we would do a room change and said the hotel was full but we didnt want to trouble the house keeping staff as we were anyway going to check out next morning. Food at the restaurant was ok but not the best of heritance maybe the reason why was because all the guests were locals. Restaurant staff was good. Friendly. Next morning when we came down to the lobby to check out, i cant believe the same girl Dinushi's attitude towards us. Even though I looked at her she made sure to frown at me. Not bothered to atleast talk to us nor apologize. Wow I am from the same industry and I cant imagine the way she acted. Sadned by the fact that we are from the same industry yet we've been disrespected this way. I am disheartened to write all this because as hotelliers we all have so much expectations from Heritance hotels.
Worthy

One of the best places to be in SL. The food and service was awesome. The place we came for our honeymoon. .and once again visited just before the confinement of my wife...just to recollect the wonderful memories of this romantic hotel. The staff is friendly as expected from the heritance family. Hoping to be here soon again..with the baby onboard!!

We recently stayed here for two weeks and have to say had a great time. The hotel and grounds are lovely. It is right on the beach front which is beautiful. I can only comment on the room we had which was a deluxe room with partial sea view. The only reason it states partial is because there are palm trees and bushes between the room and view but it was lovely all the same. The room was spacious and had everything we needed. Lovely basket of fruit on arrival which was refreshed in the second week. Bottled water Daily and a mini fridge full of soft drinks, alcohol, crisps and chocolate. Rooms were cleaned daily and beds turned down each night, fresh towels twice a day. Lovely towel art left each day. The room cleaners really are a credit to the hotel. Although I have to say all the staff are a credit. All very helpful and pleased to help. Food was amazing. We were on an all inclusive basis which we wouldn‚Äôt normally do but would recommend as not much nearby outside of the hotel. Great selection of meals all day. Have to say we were in curry heaven. Good selection for non curry eaters! Many reviews say Diet Coke isn‚Äôt included in your drinks package which concerned me being diabetic, however they actually have Coke Zero which is included. Wine is only served at meal times in the A.I. Package. Two great pools in the grounds, we spent our time by the quiet pool. Bars were good but we spent most of our time at the pool bar were most of the entertainment was in the evenings. Some of the shows a bit bizarre but that‚Äôs A.I. for you. The days spent on the sun beds were filled with sightings of monitor lizards, chipmunk type creatures and monkeys roaming the grounds. Whilst here make sure you get out and about there is so much to see. We used a local guide who was a fraction of the price of tui who we travelled with. Found him prior to going and booked all our trips via him before going, didn‚Äôt require payment until we arrived and met him personally.There are lots of local guides inc ones on the beach and the money stays local. *** Try Charu of czarek tours *** you can find him on Facebook or at charukadesilva5@gmail.com Also don‚Äôt listen to tui when they say you have to use your rupees up before the airport or exchange what you have left in the departure lounge prior to going through security. You can spend them in the airport!! Finally we would like to thank all the staff at the Heritance for making our holiday so special. I would certainly stay here again if we return.
Ask for a room that backs onto the pool area.
Terrible experience with shameful behaviour from staff

Beautiful location on the beach and 2 pools with plenty of shade. Staff were wonderful and extremely helpful. There was a good choice of options for eating at the hotel which was fortuitous because there wasn‚Äôt really anywhere local to eat. Customer relations were great when we had an issue with our fan and fridge and also assisted us with booking a boat safari.

This is a wonderful hotel the rooms have a lot of facilities and has an excellent view.... The food is very delicious and quality is great ..There was enough variety of food to make my family of 4 satisfy their individual taste buds..The staff is friendly and courteous... And the no words to express their excellent service ... Within couple of months I will come back to this hotel again.....
Not a friendly one place to spend ur money and time in

The hotel is situated in Galle road, Ahungalla and can easily be accessed by a public bus. The hotel was good, clean, and the food was nice. The hotel is built with an antique look/theme however. The old rooms are a bit gloomy and therefore, you might want to spend some extra bucks and ask for a newer/premium room (which I got). There are two large pools and there are 2 small jacuzzis (no extra fee) next to one of those pools!

I woul not recommend this hotel. Specially if you plan to come here on vacation during weekdays. They host weddings and the noise level is really high. We experienced this on a Thursday night where the band that was playing, played until 11 pm at night. It is not a relaxing experience. The noise was overwhelmingly loud. We called the management but they said the loud outdoor music will go on till 11 pm. The service at the restaurants were very slow and unresponsive too. The bars served cocktails that wasn't made properly. It was a disappointing experience at this hotel for us. Will not return here
Hotel too crowded especially during meal times
Not much nightlife or activities around the hotel, though the bright lights of Bentota are only a three-wheeler taxi ride away

We stayed here for a few nights in August 2010 as part of a one month trip. I was very excited about staying here as it was designed by one of my favourite architects, Geoffrey Bawa. However, it was a little bit of a let down on a whole. On arrival the hotel is lovely. You drive through some large gates and up to the open reception area where you immediately notice the infinity pool which looks great. All the staff are very smiley but unfortunately the front desk staff don't really know what they are doing. There was a lot of commotion and we did not get checked in for an hour. Some of our friends did not get checked in for 2 hours. Not what you want after a long journey! First impressions of our room were ok. They are clean but nothing special. We were promised a spectular suite as we were there for a special occassion but we were just given a standard deluxe room which was disappointing. We eventually got our suite on our last night but the only difference was a bit more space and a bath so not really worth the extra money in my opinion. We spent a lot time around the infinity pool which is very clean and the pool boys are great. They provide water aerobics every morning and organise water volleyball straight after so it's a bit lively around that pool up unti lunchtime. There is another pool but we didn't use it. If you like your exercise there is also a small gym which is ok. It's small and basic but has the essentials. You can also go for a run along the beach but as with almost every beach in Sri Lanka be prepared to get hassled by the beach boys/women. One guy came for a run with me whilst trying to sell a tour which I thought was very amusing. Unfortunately I could not give him any business! The food here is great. There is a huge variety on offer and you won't be disappointed. However, if you order snack food be prepared to wait or for the staff to get your order wrong. This seemed to be the norm from our experience and speaking to other guests. The same goes for ordering drinks. They are super slow. You can quite often see your cold drink getting warm on the bar whilst the waiters have a chat. People were constantly chasing up the waiters or walking up to collect their own drinks. The staff, with a few exceptions, seemed to be the main problem at this hotel. They are all very friendly but even the simple things seemed to be an effort. Luckily we have a lot of patience so we found it funny but it was obvious some couples and groups there were getting very frustrated. We stayed at several other hotels in Sri Lanka and the staff were a lot more on the ball. Even when we checked out it became chaos. Lot's of confusion, incorrect bills and in one case it took nearly 1.5 hours! It was a group of 6 but still, not acceptable. We took 30mins and there was only 2 of us. To sum up, this hotel is nice. It has character but it is certainly not 5 star. The rooms and staff could be so much better. My plus points would be the infinty pool and the food. Everthing else could do with improvements. I would recommend this hotel but on the basis don't go there expecting the ultimate paradise. It's good but there is better in Sri Lanka. It's pretty good value for money but needs some attention. 7.5/10 overall.

The worst hotel. I do not recommend his visit to anyone ü§¶üèª‚Äç‚ÄôÔ∏è Cheating and spinning accounts. Without a statement, 20% tax is included. Why???? The manager has no plans to deal with the problems adequately, instead of explaining or at least apologizing for the negative situation , and due to the incompetence of the workers, yelling at the guests The worst hotel ever. Dirty towels, bathrobes. Old interior

The hotel is very beautiful and has 2 pools, and spa facilities. One of the pools had a live entertainer playing some sort of traditional flute. The location of the hotel is convenient as it's directly next to the beach. We tried the massage and the spa facility, and it was very good, although a bit expensive when compared to other 5 star hotels in Sri Lanka. The rooms were tidy and well equipped. The bathroom is a bit small, but up to the standards. As with previous Heritance hotel we visited, the bottles of shampoo and shower gel need to be reviewed from an ergonomic point of view. They are difficult to pour from, either you pour too little or too much. On the down sides, the check-in process took around 30 to 40 minutes. Not sure why. The buffet was a disappointment. After all the great things we encountered in this hotel, we were looking forward to an amazing gastronomic experience. However the buffet was poor in terms of both variety and quality. We happened to be at the hotel on a full moon (Buddha Day), which is a holiday in Sri Lanka. Maybe that was the reason for the bad quality of the buffet, due to lack of staff? I'm not really sure. In general it was a pleasant experience and would recommend staying at the hotel.

Old, noisy, really commercial hotel with huge buffets. Everything could use a fresh painting and cleaning. Staff is not really customer minded. No special efforts are made or extra smile. If you look foor cosiness, it‚Äôs not the placeüòûüòûüòû
Select a room with sea facing

Stayed here with my wife after a week in a hotel in the north of Sri Lanka. The food in the buffet was extremely poor. The al carte was very expensive which would of been ok if the food was good but it was terrible. We had bolognese one day and the spaghetti had been cut up in to tinny pieces or they had served us the crumbs at the bottom of the packet. Second time we ate there the lasagna was also terrible. It had been reheated so much that that the pasta literally could not be cut let alone eaten. When we complained it took nearly half hr and a six man conference In the kitchen to come to the conclusion that it was not edible. We then decided to try the fine dinning restaurant only to find out it was the same chef from the al carte restaurant ! We ate in local restaurants from then on which were really nice and a fraction of the price. Finally upon checking out we were charged for basically the entire mini bar ! After disputing this are bill was quite quickly adjusted to what we had actually taken from the mini bar. In conclusion the hotel is drab over priced and you are extorted at ever opportunity ! My advise would be to keep well away

I had a problem when I was having a shower. Water suddenly stopped. I informed the operator twice and waited for more than 15 minutes. No one came so I could not finish my shower :(. The bell boy was very careless. I personally told him to be careful with my CK bag. Not to put it on floor. When The bag is inside the room I noticed dust marks on the bag :( Food is good. Gym and swimming pool is good too. Other staff members were acceptable and one front office staff member was exceptional (Kanishka).
Fantastic relaxing stay after a 6day sri Lankan tour

We travelled to this hotel with Kuoni travel under the idea that it was a 5* luxury hotel. This hotel had all the potential of a good 4* hotel. The beech was amazing the staff were amazing, however there always seemed to be something missing and not quality about the hotel. We stayed at this hotel for 7 nights having travelled around the island for 4-5 days. The poolside service was very good with staff being extremely friendly and chatty. The animator was also a healthy addition to the hotel encouraging water polo and other activates throughout the day. The pool bar offered a nice little lunchtime snack menu however every meal was with French fries and wasn‚Äôt the best quality. We recommend sprite as it was half the price of coke or diet coke. The sprite was around 70p and coke was ¬£1.50 for a can. There was also a service charge on each bill so there was no need for tipping and carrying cash as it could all be charged to the room The evening food in the main restaurant under a set menu was very average and was trying to be to clever for its own good. Not much variety if you were a fussy eater and didn‚Äôt like fish. The al a carte restaurant (or coffee shop) offered a welcome opportunity to get a square meal. This was available with a 10% discount to half and full board customers. when the hotel got busy at the weekend however the restaurant came alive with a huge Mexican and bbq buffet on the Friday and Saturday nights. The breakfasts were also very good with every possible breakfast such as omelettes and waffles. However, when the weekend did arrive the hotel filled with hundreds of locals. This wasnt a problem until the quiet pool became a holiday at butlans with kids screaming and weeing into the pool. The locals were then extremely rude to the friendly staff making the stay extremely uncomfortable as you had to witness this behaviour. The staff were being shouted at and fingers clicked at with no manners. It was clear that the other guests felt the same through conversations in the lobby. The evening buffet at the weekend although it had good food resembled a school canteen. At 9 oclock families were bringing there young screaming children to dinner. Those children who were not dead on there feet at this time were runing around bumping in to the staff and other guests. This un civilised behaviour caused some couples to leave in disgust. The room was very good although we were continually being pested by staff asking if the room was ok. Also the wiring of the room was questionable with switches for different lights being in the wrong place. The beech was a no go area also as you were trying to have a romantic walk along the beech and were surrounded by peopel trying to sell you trips and clothing. Even when you were trying to sun bathe there was a constant noise coming from the beech of people trying to grab your attention. As a result of this I would not recommend this hotel to anyone I liked. I will also be informing Kuoni of the hotel at the weekend.

The staff are so friendly, comfy rooms, superb pools, lovely beach and overall its a great hotel in a nice environment. The food was not that great and very less dessert varieties. The washroom in the day room has transparent glasses and broken mat curtains so it was quite uncomfortable with friends in the room. So we had to use the washroom with the lights off..

I just stayed one night in this hotel but for that night I enjoyed a lot and experienced one of the best service and hospitality from the staff also the rooms are very beautiful the food is delicious ... the pool faceing the sea is also fantastic and the green relaxing pool was my type. This hotel truly has earned it's 5 stars. I will definitely visit this hotel again.
It was GREAT! You wouldn‚Äôt be disappointed, if you will choose this hotel! u will be lucky,if Maduranga wil give u serv

Well having had a long flight and a long drive I may have been slightly over tired but my first impressions of the hotel and the room was disappointment. It does come down to taste but I found the hotel is characterless. Our room was good but without the two extra beds for the children which was irritating as my husband had emailed the hotel directly confirming them but they were set up quickly and our request for table lamps in the lounge rather than overhead lighting met as quickly. The children loved the pools and I absolutely hated breakfast! It was enough to bring tears to your eyes the oppressive dining room the scrum around the breakfast bar seemingly at all times, the awful service. I had so many variations on getting a cup of earl grey they were green tea, warm milk, teabags and nothing else including water or a cup, they ran out of tea bags I supplied my own and then tea arriving 30 minutes later when you're just about to leave. In the land of bountiful fruit why are 3 out of 5 breakfast juices made from concentrate or nearer to cordial? Can they not default to 4 place servings, then if 2 come to breakfast they are happy and if 4 come down they are instantly satisified a win win rather than waiting 10 minutes for cutlery for 2 of the party. Can they not allocate a server to families staying longer than 3 nights thus establishing a rapport. Saying that the service elsewhere was fine. The food ranged from adequate to good. Amal's in Bentota was excellent for sea food and Refresh in Hikkaduwa(45 mins) had an enormous choice and was very good. The location was ok , Galle was an hour drive Bentota about 30 minutes. We did take some trips to Udawlawe 4 hours each way and Sinharaja 3 hours each way. As mentioned in previous reviews the beach is effectively out of bounds if you do not wish to be pursued by the local tour guides and hawkers. It could be a great hotel with adequate staff training to instill a sense of ownership and pride, a rethink of the decor, a complete overhaul of the main dining room practices, some investment in soft furnishings. Despite its short comings we thought the Heritance was good value for money.

I spent a holiday at Heritance with my friends. Best thing in the Heritance is pool which opens to the beach. Its an amazing view and really refreshing mind. the buffet had a variety of dishes and all are tasty. But I felt that the hotel has gone down in some areas such as maintenance. The major minus point is the unclean bathrooms, ponds and entrance. Overall a very enjoyable stay. Lovely service..
closer to the pool down stair
Fairly Overated

Good - It has beach and a relatively big swimming pool which is clean and nice. Beach has nice veiw but little wavy. Bad - Lower staffs are not friendly... Foods are clean and tasty but not cheap. Tea was very bad....
Struggling to give this 3 stars

We checked in on New Year's eve to see 2012 in. We'd booked a triple room and paid a 50% advance at the head office at Aitken Sence Colombo, which was mandatory due to the New Year's eve rush. But the room was not ready at check- in and we had to wait quite awhile. We were given large half glasses (yeah half!) of a local fresh juice but realised later that other check in guests were given moist towels as well. Finally, we were taken into a 2 roomed suite that had been furnished for only two persons. We had to look for a room boy to tip him to bring in a third bed, third set of towels etc.etc. Our so-called luxury room was far from that - the 'fridge didn't work, the TV was badly tuned, the safety deposit locker malfunctioned, one bedside light didn't work.. Due to the malfunctioning fridge we were not even able to break a bottle of bubbly.. (now who likes warm champagne) - (BTW check the spelling of 'champagne' in the GM's letter of welcome - here my sex was wrong - I was titled as 'Mr' We had tipped the check-in steward - a name like Achila - do avoid this scoundrel at all costs! - generously to get us a table for the gala dinner, but he was nowhere to be seen. We looked into the area four times, to ensure that we had a table, but nothing had been set up for us. Finally, we were told to come down for dinner and that we would then get our table. No table when we arrived for dinner. We were then told to sit at another table. Five minutes later the same steward - named Mudalige - said he was sorry but the table had been booked by somebody else!!- I refused to get up! Our table had no lamp of decor etc like the other tables and after telling just about every waiter passing by, we got some of these things over 1 1/2 hours later!! The next day at breakfast, after standing in line for awhile, I requested a warm item from a serving chef, I was told by him that he had to serve over 50 guests at that time (so what?!). Finally, the time to depart arrived, and we breathed a sign of relief. We were all women but even the final receipt was titled 'Me & Mrs". When I got to my car in the hotel car park I found parts of it strewn about - it had been damaged by a tour operator who had claimed that I had been blocking him! Now this was a clearly designated hotel parking space which should have been so designed not to inconvenienced other vehicles. The hotel couldn't even inform the person to remove my vehicle (they didn't even know the name or company of the vandal) because it keeps no records of guest vehicles - rather a security threat in a country just recovering from civil strife, methinks.... Having said this, the general manager and front office manager were extremely nice and tried to compensate for our traumatic experience by even offering us an extra night on the house, but we had to get back to our families on new years day - so we were given a discount on the room rate, cakes and chocolates to forget our troubles.. The room rate for this unforgettable experience was well over $ 400 and unforgettable experience it certainly was! It will be a loooong time before we recover from the trauma of our stay at Heritance Ahungalla. This is a hotel that needs to get its act together in terms of processes, quality checks and staff training. This is what we pay for when we buy a hotel experience. It is also what we pay for when the hotel is incompetent.
HNB outing....

We had grate fun in our vacation. Food is fantastic and also staff is very friendly. Nice place to stay. This hotel has a wonderful beach and pool for relax rooms are clean and tide. Has private balcony.

2/5 Poor service, poor rooms, and poor food quality. Particularly the food was bad. Unfortunately I included full board with my booking and I wish I didn‚Äôt. I advise you not to come here as you will definitely regret the experience particularly that there are lots more options in the area that are considerably far better. Off course the high end ones can‚Äôt be compared as well

After visiting Sri Lanka 4 times over the last 6 or 7 years visiting several different hotels, I have to say I wasn‚Äôt overly impressed with the Hotel. We stayed for a week in January and to be honest the hotel was ok, the staff were great and the setting beautiful. But I have to buck the trend of good reviews because to be honest the food was average at best. As mentioned above my wife and I have visited Sri Lanka many times without any issues. But unfortunately by the second night my wife and I came down with severe diarrhoea and stomach cramps which lasted the whole week. This could have only been the food or drink because we always drink bottled water. You also dont expect ongoing hotel maintenance in high season with mobile scaffold in the hotel entrance and around the front of the pool for 3 days. Seeing men with breathing equipment sending huge clouds of white smoke into the air in the courtyard outside our room. It was so bad we had to put a towel at the bottom of our door. All together if wasn‚Äôt for the setting and the staff it would have been a poor stay in a 5 star resort.
Lacks Lusture

So we went to the hotel to celebrate my mom's birthday and it's truly an architectural masterpiece it's simple yet sooo elegant and beautiful. With this also comes the fact that the level of activities in the hotel are quite less (personally I'd prefer some music when I'm dining or just chilling in the pool area) The hotel gives a warm welcome and the level of hospitality is absolutely high. The lunch was delicious each and every dish was so tasty yet we were very disappointed with how the evening tea was presented ,yes we came for the day package yet there was no proper place in which it was given and there was no place to sit and I was quite worried about the amount of flies setting on the butter cake. Overall everything was absolutely perfect just that the evening tea was abit clumsy.

We visited this hotel at the end of a group tour and were very disappointed with our accommodation. The other members of the group were given different quality rooms despite having paid the same and were mostly very happy but our room was unacceptable. ( I think from the website images it was a ‚Äòdeluxe‚Äô room with partial sea view) The electrics in this part of the hotel were obviously in need of urgent renovation. Two of the plug sockets were damaged with melted plastic around the pin holes and the air conditioning would only work at all by fiddling with the slider switch on the wall and then went off again after a couple of minutes. We complained and a manager said they would sort out the plug sockets the next day but asserted that the air conditioning WAS working although obviously it was not and the room remained very warm. Apparently the hotel was fully booked and there was nothing he could do about it. I was online looking for alternative accommodation when the situation was resolved by our tour guide who generously swopped rooms with us and this room was lovely. Although the electrics were our main complaint, the room also smelled damp and was generally in need of renovation, not really five star. The rest of the hotel was very good and the restaurant was excellent so our experience was a great shame. (Although a word of caution re check out- all members of the group found that they had paid their bills in pounds with a poor exchange rate although the invoice was in rupees and nobody was asked about paying in sterling)

Great place to end our Holiday. Quality room, immaculate beach,outstanding service. F&B slightly expensive due to the taxes. However the buffet and breakfast spread were fantastic. Great work with chefs cooking hoppers and dosai. Particularly would like to thank the all day dining staff and manager who were fantastic. Special mention - Kumarasiri Salinda who was outstanding with all guests. He remembered names and what our son liked. The front office and porters are equally to be applauded. Great work and will see you next year. Would suggest fellow travelers to stay away from the beach hawkers.
Good but could be better.

The check in was very smooth. Was assigned to a room in the old wing which was very clean. The bathroom was very compact but did have one negative impact since it was party made out of glass and was covered with wooden blinds. This method is not very family friendly when it comes to privacy. The staff was very helpful when changing rooms when we were upgraded to a family suite which was "AWESOME" overlooking the GREEN POOL. As usual the Heritance Chain kept up to the standard when it came to the meals where you could find a massive variety and availability. However appreciate if activities for children and catered for since it was quite hard for us to keep the kids occupied and made it boring for them. All we could find was a GHOSTLY kids room. The beach was very clean, and was the only things which kept the children occupied other than the beach. Since the sea was a bit rough kid's couldn't get the full advantage. Last but not least I would like to bring up some thing, the only negative point is you must discuss at the time of check in about the child policy since I was asked about the ages of my kids at the time of check in (which were 6 & 11), in the end at the time of check out (mind you we had a Triple Full Board booking and prior read up of child policy of the hotel) were charged extra for the child, which I see is not professional. So it's advisable if you confirm prior to booking to avoid any unpleasant surprises.
Some rooms overlook the beach, palm trees seemed so close, balcony to sit, read and eat. Perfect view but some less so. Do double-check
Try Riu instead!!

In some places would need to be renovated in the area of the bathroom. Pool area. Staff are friendly. At checkout at noon, the all-inclusive is cancelled. If you are picked up at night . Bad luck, we were offered a lynx package, which I had declined. Even then alone I would have given inadequately.
Good holiday

The hotel needs a good clean from top to bottom. Except for the pool and bar area it is all pretty grubby eg. the coffee shop chair arms and tabletops are black with dirt. The floor in the hotel room was gritty and some of the linen was gray with dirt or age. Even the most basic accommodation we stayed at in Sri Lanka were better maintained than this. They seem to be cutting costs all round including not enough staff. One good point is the quality of the breakfast buffet which was very good.
Can enjoy beach and swim
Terrible property, they have some audacity to call themselves a 5 Star

Our initial impression was that the hotel was ok but in need of some TLC but to be fair the rooms were kept clean and the general atmosphere made for a very pleasant holiday. General points you may like to note: - the Sri Lankan people are genuinely very friendly which to begin with can confuse westerners. - the beach sales people aren‚Äôt actually that troublesome (nor are the dogs) - both pools are lovely though the green pool has far fewer kids - we never had any difficulty actually getting sun beds, though not always were we wanted them and there was a shortage of umbrellas - Food flavours lovely though we personally found the meats tough on occasion. Truthfully food does get a bit same‚Äôy after 14 nights. Wine in our first week on the all inclusive package was ropey but seemed to be changed halfway though. People said there had been complaints. - There are 2 complimentary bottles of water in room each day and it is in plentiful supply. - there is 1 ‚ÄúBritish‚Äù electric socket in the room but the rest require an adapter. Wall mounted hair drier ok but nothing special. - mosquitoes are a nightmare - take loads of spray. If you are on a TUI all inclusive it maybe helpful to know: - wine is only included with lunch and dinner. Cocktails are ok but not great. Ask for bottled tonic. - you can eat in the other restaurants at additional cost but with a 15% discount. - some tours (e.g Kandy by train and whale watching) start at 4 or 4.30 in the morning! Which wasn‚Äôt pointed out when we booked it. We didn‚Äôt get back from Kandy until 9.45pm so a very long (if great) day. We‚Äôd also recommend the Madu Nature Tour. 1/2 day with a turtle release at the end - joyous! - upgrade flights if you get the chance. It‚Äôs about ¬£250 per flight per person but is worth it in our opinion from the airport lounge to the slightly larger seats it adds to the holiday. To sum up we will return to Sri Lanka but not on an all inclusive basis ...
Best holiday plus relaxation

We had 5 nights here with 3 adults and 2 kids. After a bit of a slow check in and having to swap rooms because of renos, we settled in and had a merry old time. Fab swimming pool and warm, friendly and very helpful staff. The food was terrific, we ate in all the restaurants in this hotel. The amazing team in the kitchen cooked us up some top seafood nosh. Loved the beach dining. There were a few niggling issues with a lack of hot water hot water and dodgy door locks but that aside I would not hesitate to recommend. Ware the beach boys prowling the shore, ready to pounce, and I don't recommend swimming in the surf, massive undertow!!
Superb food superb fun superb environment

Good staff and good food also rooms and good wifi service , we hope to come back again, very beautiful swimming pool and we all enjoy the holiday with heritance and ##########‚ô°‚ô°‚ô° very quite and comfortable place shanika the best girl in the hotel‚ô°‚ô°‚ô°

The room was very clean and the people very friendly and helping. Every day the room Was cleaned and fresh towels. Wenn there was a problem with the room, the came immediatly and were helping. The noun and Buffet where very good

I had the Heritance recommended from someone I know...clearly we have different taste or it was a different Heritance they stayed at. We booked this place for our last night in Sri Lanka as closer to Colombo and also looked lovely from the website. We so wished we had stayed at our gorgeous little boutique hotel in Mirissa instead! I won't make that mistake again...this is definitely a nice enough place for families or people looking for an all-in-one, resort experience, the beach is very pretty and so are the pools and lounge area with lots of grass and trees. Our room was OK but as many people say, 'tired' and not the cleanest ever, although a very good shower. The food, a buffet, was decent, but definitely nowhere near the food we had during our entire stay in Sri Lanka at a fraction of the cost. We had a hefty service charge added to our bill simply for ordering 1 bottle of wine at dinner! We booked a massage at the spa there which was good, and took advantage of the tennis courts. There are certainly plenty of facilities, but the various sales-people around selling tourist goods and palm readings made it that little bit more resorty/touristy for us. Overall, definitely not for the traveller who likes to stay less 'chainy' hotels (I was also enticed by their 'eco' claims but not sure I saw much to support it?) and I would not call it 5 star, but I probably made a mistake in booking it in the first place for what we wanted!

My family stayed at this hotel in one of their suites I must say that even though the hotel needs a bit of renovation and a few variations in there food, they made up with excellent service and awareness regarding there clients needs. They had an exceptional eye for details and requirements of children. Being a local I must say that the hotel staff at this hotel are on of the best if not the best in srilanka ( comparative to my experience)
Comfy stay

Hotel caters for all needs. Food somewhat expensive as per many high end hotels in Sri Lanka. Look at prices and then add 25% for service charge , vat and city tax. The buffet dinner was a highlight for us and one of the best we have ever had. Chef Manjula produced a fabulous range of seafood options plus a wide variety of Sri Lankan and western dishes to suit all tastes. I love Sri Lankan dishes however the other 3 in our party not so much......we all agree it was one of the best buffets that we have experienced in our travels

I was there for two nights with two of my French friends (Tour Operators) The first impression on arrival was extremally good and the welcome was quite impressive even together with the General manager himself of the hotel. Well trained staff in every department and food served was too extraordinary and absolutely there was nothing to grumble... However as a five-star property, this hotel needs an immediate renovation pretty soon. The corridors and most of the other public places look very dull and gloomy. Whilst thanking the management for providing us luxury renovated rooms, we also noticed during the hotel visit that the non-renovated rooms too need an immediate upgrading to compete with the upcoming new properties nearby. (it has been noticed that some renovations especially on the roof are underway)
Ask for a room away from the construction
I think they all have pool or sea views
excellent experience

Fantastic but would have been nearly perfect if there hadn't been a wild dog lose in the corridor howling and looking very threatening at 3am. It's nearly unavoidable to have them trying to get in close due to the wonderful open modernist architecture, but staff should be patrolling the open spaces at night much more regularly. My impression is that staff doesn't patrol these spaces at all at night. Also since it's not easy to get to a town for supplies, a small convenience store should be included, where you could buy personal items, like sunscreen, shaving cream, etc.

Hotels entrance and lobby is very good. Amazing ambience of reception part but unfortunately unexpected rooms. Horrible the first day when we checked inn the room. Room was in a very bad condition. After a fight with front desk got a new room but next day. That was better but not upto the mark. Bad news for vegetarian indian food lovers "No much choice". But yes for any indian veg food requirement in the restaurant there is 1 very helpfull person available i.e. MR. Praveen. He supported us a lot and arranged very good veg indian food for us for all 2 days. Thanks a lot to him again. Overall our stay was very good. Beach , Swimming Pool, Jacuzzi etc etc. This hotel needs a renovation very badly.
Ralxing place
Choose a sea view
The rust was formed in doors but that was not a problem.

Very nice rooms, staff really attentiv and friendly! Choice of food is good and specially the sri lanka menues are excellent!! Complete service is good.the beach is very beautiful and clean. Nice place to relax and we want to come back again.
Mrs Herft

The staff maintained a positive attitude and ensured we felt welcome during our stay. Everyone was well groomed and treated us with respect. Piumi (HR Executive) and Chathuranga (FO Executive) is to be commended. They had a gift for hospitality and showed great respect for all customers. Thank you for a wonderful and memorable experience. Sanjeewa & Nadeesha

We checked in on the first week of Oct. The check in staff was friendly and welcomed us with a refreshing drink. The room was spacious but we received two single beds for me and my husband. Which I found really ridiculous. They should have inquired regarding this when we made the reservation or at check in. When we asked to change they said the hotel was fully booked. We then asked the housekeeping to dress the beds with a single double bed sheet. Which still didn't make a big difference. The room fridge and the phone was not working. Informed them and they replaced it. The rooms need refurbishment and new equipment. The lunch buffet was not that great. The Srilankan option was good but the other dishes were not tasty. The starter section looked really pathetic. And added to that the prawns were not de-veined. Which was unacceptable. The waiting staff was dazed. We had to ask for water. Nobody escorted us to tables. The staff was basically a little lost. During dinner they had barbecue going on which was good. They had a seafood dish again the most prawns were not de - veined again. Brought it to the attention of the management and informed them that there could be consiquences for consuming non de - veined prawns. They apologised and offered to get something else. I informed them I don't need anything else but to keep the kitchen staff informed regarding this. Breakfast was good and tasty. Again during breakfast the waiting staff was lost. Asked for coffee and never got it. I just left it. The other complaint is to get more high chairs for kids to restaurant because our friends needed a high chair and everything was taken. So if the hotel is full there is no option. But I have to tell that hands down the best buffets to go to for is heritance Kandalama and Negombo. So tasty and great variety.
Heritance Experience
Some rooms are far away from reception and restaurant
Third floor rooms facing the ocean

Room was very basic, not even free water which is usual for a 5* HOTEL. There was no toilet paper in the bathroom, we had to ask. Provided after asking. Phone in the room wasn't working only the one in the bathroom did.
Rooms on higher floors offer unobstructed views

We were only here one night and arrived mid afternoon, so we were not able to get a very comprehensive view of the property. Check in procedure was very slow, albeit they do bring you a drink and snacks and invite you to sit‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶.and sit‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶.‚Ä¶..and sit‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶..and just when I was about to get up and enquire what was taking so long, they finally invited us to go to our room. There WERE a few people who arrived at once, but it really did take some considerable time, for reasons not clear to me Check out was also somewhat slow, and then getting summoned to an office behind reception makes you wonder what is going on NOW ? Has my card been declined, my visa an irregularity, am I wanted for something ? Turns out it‚Äôs just the cashiers office ! So why not just accept payment at the front desk like every other hotel in the world ? Room was fairly large, comfortable, and of a good standard, with everything one expects from a resort hotel. I particularly liked the sliding shutters, as opposed to curtains. Cesar Ritz said about an hotel needing 3 things - ‚Äúposition, position and position‚Äù and this property certainly has position ! Located right on the wide sandy clean beach, (not sure if one can swim from it) warm infinity pool reaching towards the sea. Palm trees, lawns, shady trees around the pool area ‚Äì it‚Äôs the epitome of a beach resort hotel ! It‚Äôs a fairly large property too. The standard tourist trap shops selling souvenirs, but I suppose that‚Äôs to be expected ! The dinner buffet was of a good standard, and it was very pleasant to be seated in the warm night outside under the palms, on a lawn adjacent the beach, with lanterns for lighting ‚Äì all very Polynesian Island stuff ! Food was of a good standard, though I found the drinks service a little slow, and slow to follow up. Yes, they were busy with a lot of people, but I often have cause to question whether that is in fact an excuse or not ? In general it‚Äôs often about having sufficient and well trained staff, and quite often just about general organization. On the one hand the hotel has everything you would expect of a luxury beach resort hotel, and there is nothing to complain about as such, but for me there was just something slightly missing - it was all TOO standard luxury beach resort, like many others I have stayed in, and no real ‚Äúwow‚Äù factor as such. I suppose it‚Äôs difficult to be a ‚Äúdifferent‚Äù beach resort, and perhaps I just stay in too many hotels, but these beach resorts all tend to have the same formula and once one has stayed in a few, they all sort of blend together in your mind ‚Äì nothing truly memorable ! I had recurring thoughts of Monty Python‚Äôs ‚ÄúPackage Tour Complaint‚Äù skit ‚Äì go look it up if you aren‚Äôt familiar with it ! We would actually like to go back some time and spend a bit longer, as lazing around the pool with a drink was just what we needed at the end of a busy 3 week trip to India and Sri Lanka. In the end though we had a pleasant stay, and no real issues, and I therefore recommend it as a good place to spend a few days and relax !
ground floor can be a bit noise but the rooms upstairs are quieter.
3 nights
There are no hair dryers. Not recommended for international business. Some tribe rule over payment systems. Prices are all in USD, albeit in their own currency. ‚ÜêAvoid if you have a Stripe wallet .

Traveled with family for my mom's birthday. All of us had a wonderful holiday special mention to the beautiful, clean beach. My 15month old toddler loved everything about this hotel the beach the pool etc was a bit worried about the room condition as the hotel is a bit old but no problem what so ever... Keep up the great work....
Really poor service
Great hotel, great service, value for money

I recently visited Heritance with a group of friends after my wedding in Sri Lanka. We stayed there for 3 nights. The hotel itself was comfortable, with all the necessary amenities. The highlight was definitely the pool, which was great as the monsoon meant swimming in the beach wasn't possible. Another highlight was the quality of food at the dinner buffet which had great variety. The hotel has been there for a number of years and it turns out Aitken Spence (the company which owns the hotel) is opening another large hotel just down the road in the coming months. This may explain the "tired" state of Heritance as it seems like there hasn't been a lot of recent investments. Another disappointment was the lack of evening entertainment. Because Ahungalla itself is secluded with very little night life or day time options (compared to Hikkaduwa or Bentota) it was a shame that the night time activities were so limited. The only options we found were a tired lounge bar, and quiet pool side bar. When I compare it to other hotels in Bentota which had more live music and more bars it was disappointing.
Overpriced and definately not luxury

From the moment we arrived we were greeted with smiles and fantastic service. The level of service throughout the hotel was without exception first class. We stayed in a room overlooking the main swimming pool and also a suite, both of which were lovely. All of our wedding arrangements were taken care of seamlessly, and the whole experience of getting married abroad could not have been smoother. A special thanks has to go to Shanika Jayasekara who co-ordinated our wedding and was there throughout the day making sure everything went to plan. Shanika and Mawatte Mawanna both Executive Officers at the hotel kindly acted as witnesses on the day for which we were both very grateful. On the wedding day we had a tropical storm in the middle of the service, this meant we had to quickly re-locate to a covered area, this was done by many hands in little time, everyone very willing to make the best of the situation. This made a big difference to our day and eventually the sun came back out and we finished the service in the gardens of the hotel. Many thanks for making our wedding unforgettable.

We stayed on route to Australia 20th . 26th Dec . it was the worst Xmas ever. It poured with rain , the hotel was supposed to be a 5 star but really no more than 2 star. The only good point is the staff and they tried their best to please us . but the bottom line is the dismal grotty rooms the gray plaster bathrooms poor quality towels , generally grubby. The main restaurant is dark brown , noisy scraping chairs, dingy, grotty. The food caters for the sri Lankans/ Indians not Europeans . I got a bad tummy that stayed with me for two weeks. I could write a book about all the horrid aspects of this hotel but suffice it to say Don't Go .

A large hotel in good location but after some of the other places we stayed in Sr lanka it was rather soulless and way more expensive. Having said that it has all the usual facilities , the room was fine and the buffets at dinner were excellent. The swimming pool and sun bathing facilities were good and the staff looked after us fine. You should visit the turtle breeding/refuge nearby.
Anne and PK

All our expectations for a 5 star hotel were fullfilled. Everything was really nice. We loved our 5 day stay, and actually we didn't leave the hotels properties, because it was so beautifull, and we loved the silence and the nice staff after more than 2 weeks roundtrip around Sri Lanka. Thanks to all the staff.

This hotel was a bit of a disappointment, not the five star rating we were expecting. In our opinion this hotel needs to be downgraded to four star. Whilst there was some painting/maintenance work taking place while we were there, the hotel didn‚Äôt have that ‚Äòluxurious‚Äô five star feeling about it. Certainly comparing it to a five star rated hotel we stayed in whilst holidaying in Zanzibar 18 month's ago, it was definitely of a different class/standard. The fruit bowl, dressing gowns and slippers were not in our room when we arrived and there was no mention, when we checked in, of them arriving later. The cream rug was filthy (we rolled it up and put it under the bed) and that improved the look of the room immediately! On the plus side, the staff were extremely friendly and helpful and very responsive to our needs. On several occasions we only had one bath towel left instead of two which meant having to call house-keeping. Although immediately we called the second towel would rapidly appear, this isn't the level of service we would expect from a five star resort. The restaurant areas were nice and the food was good. We tended to eat in the coffee shop which also served as a restaurant which did some nice meals, we did eat occasionally in the buffet restaurant. The pool area is nice. The hotel is located on the beach, but most of the time the red flags are flying due to the under currents there. On most days despite the red flag flying people still went into the sea, if you went with caution you were fine, but there were occasions people got into difficulties and the life guard at the hotel had to come to their rescue. We enjoyed watching a wedding take place whilst there. We also had the experience of seeing one of the resident monitor lizards digging up and eating another monitor lizard‚Äôs eggs (13 in all!!!). We were lucky enough to see a turtle come ashore and lay her eggs on the beach before going back out to sea ‚Äì wow what a wonderful experience. We also visited a turtle hatchery up the road, take a tuk tuk (it‚Äôs cheaper than a taxi) and if you want to experience putting baby turtles into the sea you need to go at dusk around 6.00 pm (in Feb). Before booking this hotel we were told we could go out of the hotel and that there were lots of eating places in the area, this is not the case. We were told not to go out of the resort at night, so that was also disappointing. Sadly there is no ‚Äòall inclusive‚Äô option here. In summary, this is a nice hotel, situated on a lovely beach, not five star luxury, but a nice four star. We were here celebrating my 50th birthday and wanted a bit of luxury after touring for 8 nights and in retrospect wish we had stayed at either The Jetwing Lighthouse or The Fortress in Galle.

I couldn't agree more with the comments below. We stayed there from 26th December until after New Year. Had we been able to get a refund we would have moved out on day 1! Firstly, despite what their website says, all rooms do NOT have a sea view. We were given a room overlooking the tennis courts. After a huge discussion, they said that we could move to a lower category room - where a seaview was availabile - BUT they wouldn't refund us the ¬£450 difference. After I pointed out that they were falsely advertising, the local agent out there agreed to pay for us to upgrade us to a luxury suite - however, the hotel really should have picked up this cost as their website was giving incorrect information! The suite was ok - but not worth the money they charge. Again, their website states luxury goods and free sparkling wine, fruit etc. None of those things materialised! The shower gel was provided in glass bottles which took forever to let the gel out. There was no conditioner, no bubble bath and the cotton buds were only supplied on the first day - all basic things for a 5 star hotel! The lighting is also totally illogical as the person states below. It's certainly not a luxury 5 star property. There's water aerobics in the pool every day - with loud techno music blaring out of the speakers. They had Karaoke in one bar and a very naff electronic keyboard player belting out songs like "lady in red" in the other. Not exclusive property that it claims to be! The sun loungers had dirty cushions - which didn't even cover the whole of the lounger - and there weren't enough for the number of guests. You were also shouted at by the hawkers from the beach - which really shouldn't happen at this type of property (I've stayed at lots in Sri Lanka and nowhere else is like that!) Finally, the food. It was very uninspiring for the cost. The upper restaurant was not open the whole time we were there - so the only a la carte menu available was from the coffee shop. I think it's an absolute disgrace to charge the money they do - I was incredibly misled and I too will be lodging a formal complaint. The only saving grace was the location - but frankly - there are lots of hotels in Sri Lanka with just as nice locations - minus the hawkers and at a much cheaper cost!
Good hotel but awful service

This is our secondvvusit to this beautiful place...staf and the service is amazing here.also food is fabulous ..spcially the sunday buffet with lots of selection.. excellent hospitality we ever had....
the luxury rooms on the right side away from the reception and closer to the second pool is better choice
Chillax

Basically ome of my favourite getaway hotels to have a good time with really good food. Service is incredible and staff is amazingly friendly. What can I say except the fact that if you are planning a visit to Sri Lanka this is the place to stay at.
choose a de luxe room with sea view . Ground floor has more generous patio area.
Nice time spent with fanily at Heritance
Terrible treatment and rotten food!!

In this hotel i like the person plays the flute,top of the boat..at night it is just relaxing...food excellent staff excellent,room,atmosphere...some times its bit crowded though its a good getaway from Colombo to spend your long weekend may be with your girl friend..worth it..
Simply Fantastic...Serene Lanka
Sea views are tops.
Staff was very friendly,But my kids didn‚Äôt like the Chinese buffet,Food to be improved.
Not over the bar area overlooking the main swimming pool. You have been warned!
Emaculate stay at Heritance Ahungalla
Wonderfull experience

This is a beautiful well-maintained hotel. Apart from our room key not working three times the food and beautiful surroundings on the spectacular beach are hard to beat! The only problem is that selfish European tourists "capture" their deck chair seats all day starting at 0700 am! this means that when they are in their room or not using them no one else seems to be able to use them! the hotel should definitely stop this and pass a policy to only allow guests who are using the pools to use the chairs and otherwise give them up immediately to be democratic to others. For this reason alone we give the hotel only 3 stars.

We wanted a break from this hustle and bustle,and planned a trip,and again ended up in Heritance Ahungalla,a place where we have visited many times,but has never got fed up of.The moment we entered the hotel,the breathtaking beauty of the entrance kept our mind at peace.The service offered by everyone from the reception to the restaurant is superb.They surely know how to entertain guests.The frontline staff showed their talents by their beautiful dancing and hilarious acting.We like to thank Mr.Thushara food and beverage manager,specially for his warm welcome and always making our stay an amazing one.Thank you so much,From Indika,Eshara,and little Sanayah.
Couldn't be a better place
Great holiday in Heritance Ahungala.

It was a very warm welcome from the staff. And took so long time for checking process even though it was not a busy time. The room we received was not at the expected quality and filled with flyers. We had to request several times to remove flyers and finally we requested for new room since we were with an infant. Initially they rejected our request and I had to talk to FOM to get a new room. So until 6. 30 pm from the time we checked in (3.30pm). It was such a unpleasant experience. Other room services were all good. Restaurant services and foods was very good. Sleeping in the new room was a night Meare because of the noise came from ceiling. It seems that the room was just below a walking path or some steps. Infant was waking up most of the time because of this noise.

Although the hotel is not entirely new, the rooms have good quality furniture and a wide balcony; we got a room on the third floor with a view of the sea and garden The air conditioner works well and silently, there are no Russian channels, but there is a purely music channel, the food is very decent seafood, squid, shrimp, crabs, oysters, beef tenderloin, pineapples, Pattaya, but they rarely served arugula, my favorite greens and Wine is only available in the restaurant, bar, cocktails and beer. But the main thing is that the ocean and a warm pool of 35 degrees are nearby and there are no water-motor modes of transport, a clean endless ocean Live music in the evening but not all musicians are good Requests to notice partially live music on compositions from the Internet were refused, so many evenings it was a bit boring. I don‚Äôt recommend using taxi drivers near the hotel reception, the prices are too high, it‚Äôs better to take a tuk tuk on the street+94 77 950 4156 Alim , you should also not leave things on the sunbeds in the evening, they took my swimming trunks this way, and you should be even more careful in the shops in a tent Opposite Rio, they didn‚Äôt want to give change, we had to threaten that we‚Äôd take away everything that was on the windows, then they returned it, I think I‚Äôll come back here next time

The new year night Was really good - ...awesome ..lovely spread of food ...n amazing music ..simply awesome.....The entertainment n fireworks were fantastic ...The place was beautifully decorated ... Thank You for the wonderful evening. .....
We just didn't get it...

Very warm welcome and good services with tasty foods.staff is very friendly with guests.we enjoyed well and had a very good time.I would like to recommend to this all Srilankans n foreigners come n visit this.friendly hotel.

It is a good beach front property but it needs renovation rooms are quite old furniture is old and there is a particular wet Smell from the rooms that comes all the time,though plus points are that staff is courteous and is always ready to help food is good with a huge spread and very nice swimming pools with a jacuzzi as well.overall a very ok experience for the price paid.
Break at Ahungalle

Higher Floors have a better sea view
Didn‚Äôt get the rooms closer to each other in the group. I was given a room far at the corner even we had booked via booking.com much earlier

My wife and I stayed here for 3 nights at the end of our honeymoon and had a very nice time. We were in a corner room on the 2nd floor and have no big complaints. The staff were very friendly and made a real effort with us as they knew it was our honeymoon. The general decor of the hotel could do with being refreshed and the food was good but not great. I'd be happy to recommend the hotel but I wouldn't class it as luxury.
Sadly disappointing and over rated 5 star

We are a spoilt family when it comes to medium to luxury travels. Therefore this review is based on comparison of this hotel against many others in Sri Lanka. Our stay in this hotel was relaxing and welcoming. The rooms are comfortable and clean and the staff are super friendly. Whilst not the most demanding of customers we were made to feel like nothing was a bother to them. Attention to detail and care was taken by the staff. Special thanks to Dumindha who represented his hotel very well. Recommended. Note However this is not a hotel if you want to swim in the sea. Currents are incredibly strong and dangerous. Now for some points to improve: The hotel is looking tired and needs a modicum of renovation. The walkway floors and hallways can get very slippery when the rain comes in. It‚Äôs all open and is a hazard. The reception staff were eager to workout when we aim to checkout. They could tone that down.
Unfortunately on arrival their was a big group who had just arrived after us , with screaming kids running around and disregarding any other guest of the hotel, but this is not the hotels fault.
Went for a drink only
Ask for sea view rooms on top floor. They are breezy and has less commotion.
i think the spa and dining room decor has some touches that do not respect the great architecture of bawa. that was sad to see.
Wonderfully Surprised

I am disappointed with Heritance,Ahungalla very much, for pick up taxi from the airport to the hotel did not appear in spite of calling and sending e-mail to request. Further worse, the hotel man said that this occasion had happened because I had not sent him confirmation e-mail and ordered me to call the taxi by myself when I telephoned him to help us with nervous at the air port. After all, I ordered him to arrange the taxi and my husband and I could reach the hotel by local uncomfortable taxi. When I arrived at the Hotel, he did not appear, and no one touched this situation. So I requested to meet him, but he did not appear. So I requested to meet the hotel manager, at last He appeared. He did not apology and insisted he had never received confirmation e-mail, but had done his best. So I showed him my mobile to prove sending him confirmation e-mail after 8 minute later his e-mail. He insisted that he had never received e-mail by showing me his mobile(perhaps he cut my confirmation e-mail)and at last unwillingly apologized me. This time, My husband sent e-mail to request the taxi~ no reply, then I sent e-mail~no reply. Then I telephoned to request taxi, and then received the e-mail with taxi fee and requesting confirmation reply, so I sent back shortly. Is Heritance Ahungalla good hotel? I have never meet such a rude and impolite hotel man like him. I sent my opinion to improve hotel by e-mail and left the hotel's questionnaire sheet, but I have not received anything.

Very helpful staff and we had delish food s they have very beautiful full swemig pools, nice place to visit holidays. We would like to come back next holiday too..and would like to recommend for anyone.

The hotel was booked by Russians, the young generation behaved suspiciously, the employees have an internal tipping mafia, in September you can't swim in the sea, it's impossible to walk out of the hotel - you'll be harassed by the locals, excursions are expensive and the tour guide takes the customer to shops that rip you off, I don't understand why some people go on holiday there three times
If you like open space architecture with large pool ,child friendly service and set-up this may be for you.

Since we had already experienced the exceptional hospitality at Heritance Kandalama and The Sands at Kalutara (Aitken Spence properties), we booked our Christmas vacation at Heritance Ahungalla a couple of months back to avoid disappointment. When we arrived at the property we were pleasantly surprised to find out that we had been upgraded to the Luxury Suite with the garden balcony. The Suite (room 324) was HUGE compared to a regular room, in fact if I am not mistaken, the bathroom of the suite probably had the same square footage as a regular room, with a 2 person bathtub, a shower stall, double sinks and a huge walk in closet. The suite was richly appointed with real furniture including a small library. My 13yr old was thrilled to find an age appropriate book by Rick Riordan that she had not previously read. The bedroom had a comfortable king sized Four Poster bed and a recliner. Mini fridge, TV, surround sound system and tea/coffee service rounded off the comforts. Food was excellent as this hotel's chefs had emerged as the Most Outstanding Culinary Team in Sri Lanka after competing against both international and domestic star-class city and resort hotels at the 15th Culinary Art Competition. Sous chef Roshan Pujitha was kind enough to show us some of the culinary masterpieces and their chocolate factory. Most nights were theme nights, and on the night where they served Chinese food, we were prepared to order A la Carte for our daughter who has nut allergies, but the server quickly brought her a plate of Lasagna from another restaurant at no extra charge. the wait staff was attentive and responded to our requests in a timely manner. The rooms were clean and well stocked with fresh towels, bath robes and bottled water. The room steward came every evening to make sure we had fresh towels and to turn down the beds. Fresh fruit was also delivered to the room. The only issue we had was, we wanted the vacation over Christmas, but we were told that the hotel was booked solid. This was not the case as there were plenty of vacant rooms available. This was a bit of a disappointment since we really wanted to be away during Christmas. It was a pleasant surprise to meet Ms Niranjala the hostess, who was also at Heritance Kandalama during our visit to that property in August, and she recognized us and came over to chat. It was an enjoyable experience and a great vacation.
