Select a room on the level one if you love the view of the ocean and catch breathtaking views of the sun set from your private balcony. A slight drawback is towards the 2nd half if the day your room could get a bit warm but if you are coming from a colder climate this too will be a welcome feature.

My first impression as I drove into the driveway and into reception was quite good....then downhill.I picked the hotel as it was ranked a 5 star property,but by European I would give it a low 3.....I was in a luxury room...half the lights did not work,a damp smell lingered despite spraying,the room was old dated the shower over spilled and the water was not warm....I have to say the worst room I have slept in.The public areas and dinning room pool area also very dated.I was informed the hotel was closing in May 2016 for a full re fit....avoid until then....The staff need service training ...I found them lacking direction ....overall totally disappointed.
Great huony moon
Hnb outing.....

Just a beach hotel, huge, comfortable, a lot of services available, but nothing special or memorable being worth for coming here again. Ah yes, one architect detail: an old construction elevator is still on site as a part of the finished building:-)
try to get third floor rooms if you can. if taking deluxe rooms that are in the ground floor or second ask about the sea view. not all have great views.

My wife and I spent the last two weeks of January here. The hotel is very nice, clean and the staff are attentive and helpful. The food in the buffet restaurant was OK.... nothing too special, but they try to cater for all tastes. We booked B&B only as we prefer not to be 'tied' to the same place for meals. However, outside the hotel, there is little choice along the beach. Only the 'sunshine bar' at the far Right as you look at the sea. The food there is simple, but very good and very reasonable. We eat at the 'Mustard' restaurant as well as the 'Fine Dining' restaurant that is within the hotel grounds. The food at both was very good, but because most of the guests were 'All Inclusive' and eat at the buffet, we dined alone in the other restaurants. I did have a bit of an issue with one of the 'room boys' though. The one we had at the start of our holiday was very attentive and made sure he told us each day that 'he was our room boy' (obviously after a tip at the end of the holiday). But he disappeared halfway through our time there. So, when we finally came to pack our bags, we gave our tip to the room boy that took over. However, as we walked with our cases to the lift, we were approached by the original room boy who made it obvious that he wanted a tip also. But we had already given our last Rupees away, so had nothing left. It was a cringingly embarrassing moment, which I didn't feel we should have been put in. I've seen comments here about the 'beach sellers' ... Our experience was nothing but good. I got friendly with a middle aged man called Pathmi, (usually wears a Red baseball cap and carries a Red Sri-Lanka tourism bag) He took me and his Nephew on a fishing trip in the mangroves. It was great. He also invited me back to his house, where his wife had cooked a 1.5kilo fish, potatoes, rice and curry sauce for lunch.... It was a real honour to go into his house as well as humbling..... So please look out for him on the beach. He's a real 'find'! If you are looking for a hotel that can provide good, clean accommodation, as well as good food and are happy to more or less stay around the hotel/beach area... this is a great place! If you are looking for a hotel, but would like to walk along the beach to find different restaurants, then look again. There's none there! (apart from 1)
Monis khan

My wife and I had a two week holiday here in December. Weather was good and we did trips to Yala National Park (4 hours by car) and Kandy (4 hours by car). I list below the positives and the negatives of our holiday. Positives : Good food in restaurant buffet with a different daily menu. Friendly and generally helpful staff throughout the hotel. Excellent sea view from our first floor bedroom balcony. Excellent sea front location offering lovely beach walks. Two very large and spacious swimming pools kept clean. Room very clean and some wonderful animal shaped towels kept us amused. International plug sockets, always a help. Good size balcony. Much needed cold drinks upon arrival. Clean sheets and towels daily. Large 50" TV in bedroom. (A negative for us as we don't watch TV but probably a positive for others). Plenty of colourful bird life in the hotel grounds. And so to the negatives. No Jacuzzi for our entire stay. When we enquired we were told they were waiting for a part but by the time we left the Jacuzzi was looking very grubby with gathered dropped leaves and rainwater. Alcoholic drinks were expensive particularly a small glass of wine with dinner. Costly alcoholic drinks turned up very quickly at dinner but not the free water. On several occasions I had to ask three times for water. Lack of local railway train information at reception. No postcards sold at the hotel. We had air conditioning problems in our room which took a while to resolve. The plug in the wash basin didn't operate properly. No curtain in the bathroom for the first three days of our stay. Wobbly fan on the ceiling (maybe it was meant to be like that !). Wobbly bedside table definitely shouldn't be like that. Nowhere to walk to / have a coffee/beer/snack out the front of the hotel (busy road). That's even if you manage to get past the tour guides who hover by the hotel gates. Lack of lighting at night between the hotel front and the hotel gates. Insufficient staff in the restaurant when busy. This was particularly noticeable at weekends. Noisy building work being carried out on one wing of the hotel during the day. Some of these points might seem petty but added together it wasn't the holiday my wife and I had hoped for. Would definitely recommend Yala National Park. A visit to a Turtle hatchery. The Botanical gardens at Kandy. The fort at Galle .
Relaxing get away to heritance

Truly amazing experience . Excellent location, clean beach , great food and super service. Hotel .... Nice large rooms with all good facilities . . . Buffet was good with many action stations. Overall excellent stay and will be going back for sure !!!
An absolute disappointment

Having spent 8 days braving the roads of Sri Lanka touring their cultural triangle, we arrived at this hotel looking forward to a lovely rest for 7 days and we were not disappointed. This hotel is right on the beach and there is very little around it. It is for this reason that we went half board. A good decision is some respects as there is only one other bar 500 Metres up the beach along with a beach shack. The food at the beach bar was fine and considerably cheaper than the hotel should you be buying on a day to day basis. We often walked to the beach shack at a lunchtime for a beer (300 rupees and considerably larger than that offered by the hotel for 600R). The hotel, in effect has three restaurants. The buffet, the fine dining and the fish restaurant. If you are all inclusive or ¬Ω board you can use the buffet (drinks are extra) but if you choose to use the other two you have to pay. We did not use the fine dining but the food looked good. We did use the fish restaurant on my birthday and it was a pleasant change to the buffet. The surrounding are not particularly appealing, the table and stools not comfortable. Because it was my birthday they had prepared a lovely table for me and provided ‚Äòproper‚Äô chairs making for a much more comfortable experience. The fish was fresh and delicious and went well with the white wine we had ordered. Because Sri Lanka does not produce wine, it is imported and so by locals standards, quite expensive, but no more so that what we pay in the UK. I do feel that the hotel could offer a discount at these two restaurants if you had paid for ¬Ω board or all inclusive but chose not to use the buffet The buffet has a large selection of food on offer and so if you were just using the one hotel for your stay in this country a great way to try the curries that seem to make up the staple diet. (You can even have curry for breakfast). There was considerably more than curry though raging from salads (all cleaned in bottled water), soups to fish and meats. The range of sweets was very good and finished the meal off nicely. My criticism is that perhaps there is too much choice with the main course and as a consequence the food was on the whole not that hot and it was definitely quantity over quality. I cannot say the food was bad, but in my experience it was no more than average. I have certainly eaten a lot better around the world. Breakfast was once again a buffet with a very good selection or hot food and pastries and continental. In my opinion a better experience than the dinner. Turning to the rooms. We were first given a room on the second floor (they use the American system so no ground floor (1)) with a sea view. Number 229. Ok there were some trees in the way so perhaps sea glimpses would be more appropriate, but that did not distract from the fact that we could see and hear it. The room was not that far from the reception but we were told it was a quiet room. It was very ‚Äòtired‚Äô with the decor needing to be updated. At around 9pm we could hear the singer in the bar and also people arriving in reception. The music went onto 11:00 by which time i had been to reception to arrange to move. This was the only major complaint I have as the man on the desk first told me the hotel was full and then looked at his watch as if it was relatively early and made me feel that it was my fault that at 10pm I wanted to get to bed. After not accepting the excuse that it was full they arranged for us to move further along the corridor to the far end of the hotel, well away from the bar and reception the following day. This was in the same design room but one that had been decorated and refurbished. This had been done to a high standard and was very comfortable. We had this for free but they do charge $20 a night for the privilege of having a room that has been refurbished. We were told that the original rooms had not been decorated in 32 years. The room was cleaned daily sheets and towels changed. In the evening housekeeping came round to see if everything is ok and if you needed anything. I think at this point I need to say that all the staff were always friendly, polite and willing to help. Nothing seemed too much effort for them. I cannot praise the staff enough and they certainly make your stay enjoyable. There are two pools, the infinity pool that you see as you arrive at reception, and another in the grounds that whilst not infinity is big enough to swim/cool off and is far less crowded, by far the better choice in my opinion. There are more than enough sun beds, but as at most resorts there are some that insist on putting their towels on the beds that they consider their own for the duration of their stay. If you are prepared to tip the pool attendants, as some did, they will put towels on the beds for you, as they set them up early in the morning If you have a bed by the perimeter you do get hawkers that are in the grounds of the hotel, but stay on the perimeter trying to sell you trousers and sarongs (my wife bought two pairs of trousers at a shop on our travels for 500R whilst the hawkers wanted 2000R for one pair!) I am told that the hotel intend to keep them out of the grounds in the near future. I am aware that this seems a bit negative, not something that I intended as i wanted to give constructive criticism and to make it informative for those considering booking this hotel. I would have no hesitation in booking this hotel. The new rooms are lovely, the ground beautiful (watch out for the little tree squirrels and the small Iguanas) that are lovely to see. Of course in conclusion I reiterate that staff is amongst the best I have encountered and make this hotel what it is.
a country you should visit
Good rooms but lacking great service

We visited Heritance Ahungalla recently and observed some pros and cons that might be useful to point out. Pros. 1. As the room was booked as a part of our anniversary, we were given the most spacious room of the category and really loved every bit of it. It was cozy and relaxing. Our favorite part was how it seemed to be a sort of a separate building to the main hotel and opened up to the jacuzzi and resident green pool. 2. The hotel in general was very relaxing and spacious and never felt like it was crowded. well probably because it wasnt! but either way even if there was a heavy crowd it felt like you had your own space. Cons. 1. TV - Ofcourse you dont come on a holiday to watch TV BUT it would be great to have a few good options. The cable tv had very few channels excluding some of the most entertaining movie and tv show channels which I thought was a bit of a bummer. 2. The food was not great and not bad. Average I must say. We expected a large spread but it seemed that since it was off peak season and less crowd also because it was a weekday, there was very little variety and thereby "threw a dagger" to our expectations. Anyway Thanks Heritance for the nice stay and we hope to see you again sometime!

An awful lot of the people complaining about this hotel are moaning that it 'isn't five star'. As I recall, until fairly recently, a hotel in the UK had to have a Corby Trouser Press in the room to gain that vital fifth star. So maybe people are taking their view of '5 star' from the UK and, if they are then they are probably right - it isn't UK 5 star. But if it was you'd be paying a hell of a lot more than ¬£150/night for it. It is, by any measure a stunning hotel. Cleverly designed by Geoffrey Bawa this low rise hotel (ground floor and two floors above) is laid out to create a series of separate spaces that never seem crowded (they only have just over 100 rooms). The setting, right on the beach, is terrific and the two giant pools are a delight. Those people giving it a poor review also complain that it is 'tired'. It would hardly be surprising given the fight against the elements that must be waged to maintain it but I can't agree. The grounds are imaculate and, yes some of the corridors are showing their age but the spacious rooms are absolutely fine. I've also found the staff to be gracious, charming and attentive. Most Sri Lankans are but here they definitely go the extra kilometre. And you can't fault the food, especially the buffet breakfast which will set you up for the entire day. The buffet supper is also excellent with a cornucopia of choice and a good selection of wines. Don't believe the nay sayers, there's nothing wrong with this hotel.
Ok stay

The hotel is old but well maintained. Garden is wonderful and night lighting also. With regards to the food and beverage, the buffet is ok without any plus. The chefs are very helpful. Buffet conditions are poor, chafing dishes are broken, salad buffet is basic. The Sri Lankan corner is quiet repetitive. Breakfast was up to standard, except the scrambled eggs. Service during breakfast needs to be looked after, as we waited 10 minutes before we were asked for our beverages. Pool bar : Beverage choice ok, but service is not a 5 star and cocktails quality is not up to what expected. Check in was very long but friendly and professional. One major point that the management needs to tackle is the beach boys and all souvenir boys that literally bother you once you go on the beach. Over all good stay, but certainly not at 5 star level. The hotel is extremely overpriced.

We went for our anniversary and absolutely loved it. The hotel has a old-scl charm and vibe with 2 pools and alot of space to explore. The food was very good, though the rooms were smaller in size, it was an overall great experience. The staff was very friendly and food action stations were well rounded! Recommended!
Unexpected Horrible experience
Not as per the expectations
A nice place if you want to de-stress
Final stay in SriLanka

We spent the last 3 night of our honeymoon at Ahungalla and it was the perfect end to our journey. The room was big and the bathroom clean. We spent a lot of time in the pool by the restaurant which was spacious. The staff was very kind and helpful throughout our stay. Every night the chef would come to our table and make us anything we would want because we were a honeymoon couple. Also, the staff helped my wife plan a surprise 5 course meal on the beach for me which they executed perfectly. Thank you Ahungalla

Some of the facilities were pretty good, like the pool, proximity to beach etc however the rooms were very dated for a supposed 5 star resort. The staff were generally ok but check in and check out was ridiculously slow to where we were running half an hour late for our transfer on check out due to the pace in which the staff conducted themselves. The hotel is very expensive given the rooms etc, when I pay 5 star prices I expect 5 star rooms and facilities.
Not 5 start.
Didn't feel the architecture that was heavily promoted. Just like a new hotel.

We came last weekend with my family for 2 nights. The hotel was awesome. Has superb view. Room was good. Meals was excellent. Specially service was superb and Thushara and Praveen has give the excellent services. I enjoyed candle light dinner at Jute Restaurant. There wasn't Ice Cream. But the restaurant staff went off his way and bring the ice cream and give it to my child. Definitely I will be back.

beds were very old and not comfortable, we had a triple room and they have provided a very uncomfortable single bed to make it triple room, you can feel the springs in the mattress and it was very uncomfortable and I couldn't sleep well. the funny part is I'm the one who chose the hotel for everyone and paid.. the other room's A/C didn't work properly and they have switched to another room with the same issue.. We had A/C in our room.

The service was exceptional in this hotel - hence I am starting off by mentioning this - everyone was so friendly and went out of their way to be welcoming. In fact this is the main reason we would return to this hotel. The rooms were fine - we stayed on the 3rd floor and they gave us a nice basket of fruit,biscuits and peanuts to welcome us. I thought dinner was average but nevertheless enjoyable; breakfast was lovely. It is more of a family hotel/ older couple hotel and I think the entertainment is geared to that audience. For the price this hotel is amazing. Another thing worth mentioning is this hotel seems to do a lot for its local community which I think is fantastic - there was an ad for a charity it supports in the lift. I also did wonder if the hotel endorsed the beach sellers - some people probably find the beach sellers a bit annoying but actually if you just tell them you are not interested they leave you alone. These people are just making a living and if I can help them by buying from them I am happy to do so.

I thought the "fine dining" restaurant was disappointing and over-priced. The hotel felt too "Buckland's Holiday Camp" for me. Couldn't wait to leave each day on other activities outside the hotel. It looked to me also that the original building design had been messed with. The model airplane at the end of the 'infinity" pool was ridiculous. Surely Geofrey bawa would not have approved.
Good hotel but could be so much better

Good service and friendly staff üëç Environment friendly and we had a sefly.. Had a good holiday Supportive staff The green pool concept is superb where a gren view is given at a sea side hotel. This pool is rely calming and is the best place in the hotel!
amazing hotel
Triple Rooms are made of double rooms and a very small single bed. So good for double rooms but not great if you are looking for a triple rooms.

Hotel is really good with great food and staff. Good vegetarian food :) Experience is great to be here with lovely location and great master piece of architecture. Created by Geoffrey Bawa .... Perfect destination for holiday... Lovely Srilanka

I previously stayed here when it was the Triton 19 years ago. It was stunning back then ,and it's still just the perfect place to be. All of the staff our smiling ,friendly The view of the beach and sea is 2nd none. I have 3 more days left and i know i will be back.
Ask for a room on the ground floors and near the pools

It's a great holiday but the location not so good. The hotel is right on the beach but no swimming the sea was to rough. The staff were great good not do enough for for your but outside of the hotel were very few shops so you have get a taxi every where but they are cheap enough.
Excellent!!

Excellent Buffet. Friendly staff.Nice rooms with a mini bar with all the requirements. Beautiful surroundings and a great place to relax on the beach.Good variety of food. Excellent service. Can enjoy since they have range of sports activities as well.
Sea view, higher up...

Best hospitality so far from a five start hotel. The staff is exceptional . The food is good can do better. The rooms and other facilities are all good. The architecture of this hotel is a key factor and creates that ambiance for a relaxed getaway for anyone .

We were part of a 4 family group on a holiday to Sri Lanka. We spent 2 nights here. Amazing property, great view, nice pool. Overall a great experience. However, as a vegetarian, I found the food scene a bit disappointing. Apparently it is a sea food lovers paradise. Kid friendly place. They have pool tables, a library, carton board etc. Plan to do nothing but eat , swim, vegetate and chill. Take a stroll on the beautiful beach, play beach volleyball. Don't miss to take a walk to the nearby private property/resort. They have a small rock beach with amazing views.

Well The overall experience is not bad.. The two Pools were clean, big and had a good time swimming.. But the Jacuzzi pools were not clean.. Was very unpleasant to get in.. staff is friendly and supportive, except the staff in the buffet area.. Its like they are annoyed with the guests who are dining there.. One girl poured water to the glass until its over flowed.. She apologised but ddnt have enough time to clean it for us she got occupied with something else.. I dont blame her, But the hotel management becauae it seemed like they were over worked the shifts.. Some of them were exhausted and unable to provide the service as expected by the guests paid for a pleasant dining time.. Poor service from taking away the finished plates to filling up the finished dishes.. Buffet was average in my opinion, food is good, considerable amount of variety was there.. but i hope they can improve a lil bit more when it comes to buffet and dining.. Apart from that the stay was satisfying.. We booked a premium delux room.. Which was spacious and clean.. But the bed was uncomfortable.. I expected for the bathrooms to be cleaner and more pleasant looking for a five start hotel.. Heard complaints from the guests in deluxe rooms.. So make sure to book higher rooms.. I recommend this hotel for a get away with avarage expectations.. Surely not upto five star standards specially compared to herritance kandalama.. The reception staff was very nice.. The check in was easy and quick.. Beach was clean.. Place is quiet and peaceful.. Just some improvements are needed to keep up the five star standards..

Our Honeymoon
there are two pools. to the left of the entrance, the structure is different. to the right is where ul find the other pool and villa options etc.

Me and my family visited Heritance Ahungalla.I have visited two times previously to this hotel. compare to previous visits this time is worst one. Rooms are not clean, and bathroom does not have hygienic seal and bathroom amenities such as toothpaste, toothbrush, slippers, water glass. But I love this hotel very much and food is tasty but does not have more verities except lunch. Restaurant is lonely place especially action station area has lack of persons to serve customers, awaiting lengthy period to taste food. I appreciate service of lifeguard who work at main pool on 16th October 2023. But overall, it was an enjoyable day, and we enjoyed a lot because this time we have room which have both sea and pool view. Beautifully design swimming pool is another attraction has large beach front. I Highly recommended this hotel, but you must improve your customer care and room service. Further I think it would be better if the old boat which is previously locate near the pool is restore because it is iconic attraction of the hotel.

The room and the hotel was clean. The food spread wasn't that good. My parents are vegetarian and they hardly had anything to eat. However they were very accomodating of my child and his needs. He refused to eat at the restaurant twice and both times the restaurant manager (Mr Illanga) was very helpful with arranging his Mel's. He made sure, at every meal to ask us if my child would need anything special done from the kitchens. It is that kind of hospitality that we imagine getting from a Sri Lankan hotel.
Perfect !!!!!

What an experience it‚Äôs been at this hotel. I can‚Äôt rate it highly enough. We stayed here for six days in January and it was absolutely perfect from start to finish and that‚Äôs all down to the staff. If we return to Sri Lanka and this hotel - it won‚Äôt be for the bricks and mortar (although it‚Äôs great) it will be for the very special people who work here. A special shout out to our room guy Rukmal! I‚Äôve stayed in plenty of hotels around the world but I can‚Äôt remember any as being so attentive to detail as Rukmal is. Everyday he makes me smile with the way he has dressed the room with flowers, nice cushions and the towel art is another level‚Ä¶ He‚Äôs such a warm, happy, hard working guy. Also want to give special mention to two guys have made our trip incredible. Lilanga and Nipun - they have catered for our every wish and whim. We set them a challenge of getting us some vintage champagne so we could celebrate something special and the scoured the whole of the island, rang every hotel and managed to find two bottles of vintage Dom Perignon for us before we left. They really have pulled out all the stops to make our stay so memorable. They made sure all our dining has been spectacular by setting up a gorgeous table on the beach, three nights consecutively. I can‚Äôt heap enough praise on them enough. I‚Äôm so glad we got to know these guys, and that should be a little tip for other travellers. The hospitality industry has taken a battered since Covid and the staff work so hard by trying to make every guest feel exceptional. I always like to show my appreciation by learning everyone‚Äôs name, giving them my time, conversation and a few words of encouragement - it really does go along way and it will make your time here go from great to excellent. You can move mountains with guys like Rukmal, Lilanga and Nipun on your team. They are an absolute credit to the hotel and the Heritance brand should know what assets they have working for them. The hotel is beach fronted large and comfortable. Both pools is absolutely huge and so warm and welcoming. The food has been wonderful and the evenings we have spent on the beach, dining by the waves have been exceptional. But everything is down to the staff here. Worth 10 stars just for them!
Swimming pool not very clean, but good location. Food not really good but rooms are ok.
Excellent break at Heritance, Ahungalle

The staff are nice. But the tables in the restaurant are very sticky. We had stayed 2night. The food is quite delicious and changed. My husband and I massage in the spa together, the staff whisper through the whole process. It‚Äôs uncomfortable.
Better view at pool and ocean on 3th floor,_x000D_ But all rooms are quiet and good.

Fantastic stay. Staff couldn't do enough for us. This was our Honeymoon and they made it very special for us. Recommend a massage if you can. Food very good......Everywhere very clean.....room very nice....
The best place you can Visit in bentota
It's been a wonderful vacation due to the hotel staff and the facilities they had offer to us during the stay. Food is great and rooms are clean. And the pool is good for the kids.

My travel agent recommended this hotel to me.. very nice hotel with a lovely beach...very clean and beautiful..... room is amazing.... i came here without my kids.... but now i am very sad now.... next time I will bring them for sure..,,,,

I stayed at Heritance for the weekend with 14 family members. It's a nice beach hotel with two large pools. The Sri Lankan food is really good and the staff is very friendly and always willing to go the extra mile to make guests happy. Praveen did an excellent job making sure we had everything we needed during all our meals at the hotel. We have stayed here many times before and will be back again.

Our last visit to this wonderful hotel was in 2022. We have also been coming since the early 2000‚Äôs too. We had a very nice suite on the 3rd level, overlooking the main pool and near the main restaurant. Despite the rainy weather and rough seas in October, we had a great time. Food (as buffet menu) was fantastic, staff were very helpful. Any little issues we‚Äôre dealt with professionally and quickly. We would like to thank all the staff we had contact with. Special thanks go to Ms Jayaru in Customer Relations, Chaminda in housekeeping, Ms Hasini and Duminda (who remembered us from 2022) in the main restaurant. They were able to reserve a table by the window we liked. A very enjoyable stay and a place we would recommend.

Heritance Ahungalla is not by UK standards a 4,5 star hotel but it was a nice hotel. There is a good selection of restaurants from buffet, caf√© style, fine dining to an outdoor grill and all was off fantastic quality. We went for the B&B option and it worked out we spent about ¬£28pp per day for lunch, dinner and a couple of drinks ( even had lobster one night!) The rooms are a good size however we found the linen and towels to often be dirty. Unfortunately we also had a small amount of money stolen by the cleaning staff. The location is perfect if you want a hotel that is more isolated but for us it was a little quite. During the monsoon session the sea was too rough to swim in so you are limited to sitting by and swimming in the pools.
The main Buffet restaruant is not too good. Lunch is over priced and lacks variety. Breakfast is a repeat of same items every day. The location makes it difficult to dine outside the restaurant.
Very well run hotel with one major weakness for me...
I have been coming here for years, and it's one of the best hotels in southern Sri Lanka
Heritance Ahungalla - To Rejuvenate
Great hotel and amazing location
Not The Best
Quantity & variety seems to be the hotel focus. Quality ~ lacking for a 5 star hotel
Doesn't quite live up to first impressions
IGNITE

We decided to stay at Heritance Ahungalla during our recent trip to Sri Lanka for two reasons... 1. The taj At bentota was under renovation and 2. People generally had good things to say about it. However our experience was OK. Rooms- they are clean, decent size, comfortable beds...but they were somehow a little dull.. Otherwise the rooms were quite clean and the housekeeping generally was good. We had a beautiful view of the sea from the room Food was expensive in the fine dining restaurants.. Buffet and coffee shop were ok though. We didn't quite like the dinner buffet, the breakfast buffet was decent. Overall hotel is ok. When you enter the lobby you don't feel that this is a luxury property. Though it's clean it's really minimalistic. They say it's the geoffery bawa minimalistic design and I personally prefer less to more but This place was actually quite bare. The pool however is very picturesque,,,and very clean. The main disappointment however was the beach. The beach actually was ok .. clean and all but the ocean floor was not a gentle sloping floor like in bentota near taj. It's some thing like it will be 3 feet deep ten feet from the beach and then 1 foot deep when you go further. S it was quite scary for a non swimmer like me as I was not prepared for the sudden drop in the ocean floor. The service overall was good and very courteous. However, the fact that the housekeeping staff barges into your room once u call for a check out was something I Didn't appreciate and thought it was very rude. They knock once and use their key to enter to check the minibar. They don't hv the decency to wait till we open the door or ask them to come in. The other staff was very good. There were a lot of children at the resort and the staff was very patient with all the kids who were almost wrecking their Christmas trees and running around the buffet place like crazy
Mind blowing servise
Tired, below average food and service but lovely setting
The worst hotel!!!!! JUST AWFUL!!!!
Good hotel...
see view, 2nd floor
Just perfect!!
One night stay

We arrived at the Heritance Ahungalla at 9pm yesterday evening after a long journey from the States. We were told that the rooms we had booked and paid for were no longer available. This is a small boutique style hotel. They solution was to send us next door to a large all inclusive party resort We contacted Agoda who booked the room and failed to notify us it was cancelled. They offered a 15% discount. Big deal, we had already lost our first day of a three day visit getting bounced around and treated like a bad disease. Escalation within Agoda was requested but ignored. Instead we got an email congratulating themselves on how well they did resolving our issue. Heritance management were worse and could only blame Agoda for not telling us they would not honour a fully paid reservation. Bottom line, do not trust doing business with these two shysters.
My Least Favourite Hotel of our Tour but Some Good Points
A Must Visit Hotel in SL
Best place with kind of privet beach to stay
Horrible rooms...

The hotel needs improvement right from room allocation to Food and service. We were a groupof 27 people stayed there for 3 nights but rooms were allocated in all different corners, thou requested no one bothered to even take any efforts. Food was very monotonous for both breakfast and dinner On all three days , totally not exciting. . Staffs were polite but were on their own Sweet time and very laid back . Rooms are clean and well maintained .
Try to choose room on the 2 or 3 floor.

Stayed here in January with family. Set amongst beautiful pools and gardens on the beach, this hotel has huge potential. This was our second stay here and felt service and maintenance of the property had slipped considerably. Room are large and well equipped though a little bit dated. The pool and gardens are kept well however buildings were in a need of paint and maintenance. The service and food in the main restaurant were the worst we experienced throughout our stay travelling throughout Sri lanka. Breakfast was a good spread with plenty of variety, getting a cup of coffee took time though, sadly dinner was the worst experience we have had through our travels, the food was just slapped on, we were there for three nights and for two of the three nights we encounted empty dishes when we were serving and this was not replaced for a considerable amount of time, there was more emphasis on western dishes and sadly not much choice. We found service to be very slow, dishes were not picked up when one had finished their meals and staff were not every efficient compared to all the other resorts we have stayed in and we did choose this hotel given the positive feed back that was left on past experience. Sadly we didnt think much of this hotel at all.
Good property but unable to handle crowds with poor processes in place
refreshing and relaxing

The hotel was right on the beach, gated and setback from the main street.with numerous restaurants to choose from. We found the coffee shop lobster more superior to the fine dining restaurant experience. Great buffet breakfast-try the hoppers. The gym was the only disappointment with 2 walking machines and one permanently broken. Pools were great but ocean too wild to swim due to monsoon rains that came and went. The spa was average-reasonable prices but service disappointing. We went to the turtle farm nearby and other day trips are possible. If this is your last night I would suggest going further towards Colombo and staying at Mt Lavinia Hotel which is closer to the airport.
Bit pricy
Exceptional
complete disappointment

everything was spot on. We really enjoyed all the meals, specially the desserts were a killer. Room service never bothered us and our rooms were always clean. we loved the pool the beach and also the staff. they were very friendly and polite. We will surely return :)
Excellent as ever!
Six years later... We went back to Heritance

The location: Pleasant drive from Colombo.Beautiful , tranquil entrance. But the feeling did not last so long as it was a pain to check in. So many forms to fill and signatures, 4 separate ID documents for the 4 rooms. I would suggest the guest relation takes care of the forms instead of requesting the guest to fill it.Different ID docs per room, different signatures!!!! Absolutely ZERO CHILL!!! The rooms :Drab & dated in stark contrast to fond memories i had, visiting this establishment few years ago The food:Good variety , delicious & living up to Heritance standards Service: There were a few attentive staff.But had some bad experiences. My mother had a cramp (after swimming in that gorgeous pool) and requested some warm salt water brought in late night(10pm) .It took more than 30 mins for it to arrive .I wonder how long it would have taken to get a meal to a room. Dogded that bullet!! I feel like the new property next door must have poached best service personnel from here.

First of the good: The people and the rooms are great. Very helpful and kind staff. Rooms have a great view. The bad: Co-ordination of our trip was very poor. We got in very late and realized that they only booked us in 1 room when our reservation said 2 rooms. They ended up finding a room for my wife and I, but it had 2 twin beds rather than a king/queen. Same goes for my parents room. Food: Food was average at best. At a 5 (or 4 star) property, you expect the food to be excellent as you end up spending a lot of time just hanging out at the property rather than running around from place to place. Us being vegetarians was especially hard. We had the same 3-4 dishes to pick from. Most of them even seemed to be served from the meal before. The chef told us that we should have informed them of our dietary restrictions. However, from a 5 star resort, you expect them to follow up with you prior to your visit or during reservation, asking you of these things. Nothing of the sort happened. Of course, if they had followed up prior, the mix up with the room would not have happened either. In addition, if they followed up, they would've known that my father is disabled and would have found a room closer to the elevator.... I can't really recommend this property for the price we paid.

I visited heritance ahungalla with my wife for a Day outing . My friend Shiran recommended the place and i also recommend it to everyone who wants to have a calm and joyful day out with family. Heritance ahungalla is the best place ever. Two pools to enjoy and fabulous food ever with many varieties of foods. Also i have to pay tribute to the GM, Mr. Rasika and pool bar team and cashiers . Also the Ex.chef and chef lakmal and chef heshan for talk us personally and treat us well. Mr. Duminda and restaurant team shows us the hospitality of five star hotel in the restaurant . Thanks you all. Thanks Heritance Ahungalla team made our day fabulous and special. As a newly married couple we enjoy well.

Impressive hotel stay at Ahungalle Heritance hotel in Sri Lanka
Can not fault
Best holiday EVER
Service, Staff, Food

Maybe our expectations were different, but we didn‚Äôt get what we were hoping for with our three-day stgay at the Heritance Ahungalla. We thought that an all-inclusive resort would be a relaxing base of operations but found that we were pretty much sequestered on the property. We wanted to get out and about during the day or night and the operation and setting did not lend themselves to that ‚Äì the Heritance wants to capture all of your money during your visit. Rooms were clean and nicely appointed but small. High premiums for everything, from bottled water to laundry to room service to internet. Food options were limited and consistently underwhelming. Front desk and concierge staff were not particularly helpful when we did ask for suggestions for activities or dining off of the property. Should we find ourselves back on the coast in Sri Lanka we will look for a smaller hotel closer to one of the towns or villages, not an all-inclusive resort.

Overnight on tour. They said it was five stars, but there was no toothbrush or slippers. Shampoo is contained in a ceramic container, making it difficult to use. The rooms are spacious and comfortable, the location is great! The food buffet is not so different from other hotels. The staff are kind. Finally, after I went on a hotel tour, they took my phone away from me because it was a survey. I logged into Google without permission and the hotel staff ticked all the good ratings. The receptionist female staff had asked us to only include comments, but the male staff were surprised when they closed the box and returned without comment after checking all the good boxes. It was an incident that made me think you didn't know what you were doing or you were mocking me.

Red ants everywhere. In the room, in the bathroom. Even got into our luggage. The lobby is gorgeous but the room was full of sand. Not sure if they forgot to mop our room but it was very sandy. Food was not very impressive either. The one positive thing was that the hotel staff were very helpful after our son got sick in the restaurant. I am grateful for that. This hotel used to be wonderful. This trip however was sub par. Not sure we will be back.

It took us 5 hours in a minibus to arrive to the hotel from Colombo (120 km trip) and few attempts to move to a less moldy room (the rooms are nice and people are very friendly). You quickly realize you‚Äôll be facing the same menu for 8 days at the same restaurant (there is nothing around, and don‚Äôt be fooled by hotel ‚Äúchoices‚Äù ‚Äì none was available). The beach is unapproachable ‚Äì even when the waves and the weather cooperate (July is Monsoon season for the west side of the island) beach vendors would not go away. If you plan trips to other parts of Sri Lanka, well, think again. Getting anywhere from Ahungalla takes many hours by train or bus (we were hoping to visit Kandy which turned out to be 7 to 8 hours trip!). In short, there is absolutely no need to travel all the way to Sri Lanka to be locked in a hotel with no options, no usable beach, and nowhere to visit.
An unpleasant experience with a hint of theft from staff
No guest would regret spending D/N at this hotel.

The stunning view beach is the only positive memory that we have from our stay. Otherwise the hotel is dated, poorly managed, and many unmaintained facilities. Air conditioning, ceiling fan in our room did not work. The door locks in our room to the bathroom and balcony were broken. Considering that balconies from other rooms are essentially interconnected, there was little or no security from the balcony side of our room. The main restaurant buffet is expensive and of poor cafeteria style food. Very little flair to the food, designed to please those who did not really want to leave home. Entertainment in the lobby at night is essentially Karaoke musicians mouthing CD music. The hotel was built in the 1960s and it seems nothing was done to improve or redecorate the place since it's initial opening. It is a nice visit back to a mid 1960's contemporary architecture that has a seedy ambiance. The staff is friendly and helpful as long as it does not involve complicated activities such as room maintenance, directions to anywhere, or being served coffee in the restaurants. The hotel has no control over the touts in front of the hotel nor at the beach. These touts are of course part of the scenery but makes the guests not want to wander onto the beach since they will not leave visitors alone and will not take no as an answer. It is a sad commentary of Sri Lanka, but the hotel could do more to discourage these parasites.
We had a roon facing the beach.
Not a great stay
Higher floors have best sea views

The place is very beautiful staff are friendly and mostly helpful good cocktails nice sunset and full programme for holiday. Rooms are spacious and with a wonderful view, very good evening buffet Recommend for family vacation. Very nice decorations, too
Home away from home

This magnificently designed hotel is a few hours north of Galle, on the sea. Like other great Sri Lankan hotels the foyer/reception area is open so there is a wonderful, gentle sea breeze cooling the reception area even on the hotest day. There are 2 separate pools, both clean, and beautifully maintained. There is a huge tree ocer one them providing natural shade. The rooms are spacious and very clean. The buffet is plentiful but you can also order a la carte in a separate area of the dining room. The breakfast is excellent - so many choices. I had the best omelette I had on my trip (and I a few good ones). As in other Heritance hotels in Sri Lanka, the staff are welcoming, polite and honest. You're on the beach - but you can't swim as there's a dangerous rip. But, oh well, the pool's pretty nice anyway. You can always go for a walk on the beach instead. It felt so luxurious and its actually very reasonably priced.

My husband and I have just spent a week at the Heritance Ahungalla. The hotel it's self is very tired and needs a full refurb this is mostly evident in the main dinning resturant and pool side. The hotel needs to deal with the beach traders who make it very difficult to take a walk along the beach. With regard to the staff this was by far the redeeming aspect of our trip as every member of staff we dealt with we're exceptional. The food also cooked by the chefs in the fine dinning was also second to none and you would find it hard to eat a more tender fillet steak or rack of lamb.
Interesting hotel

I travelled alone did a 5 day tour and ended at this hotel on the beach, the staff were amazing so thoughtful and friendly, Rooms were spacious and comfortable.The restaurant was closed for redecoration, so breakfast was in the conference room, as there were not many people staying, it was not that nice and told Mr KK, I asked if breakfast could be served outside by the pool, as this was far more attractive, he said it was not possible, the next day the buffet was outside by the pool, well done to Mr KK and his team keep up the good work

Having travelled to every continent in the world id say - The hotel is a 4star property Mr. Pahan at reception was the friendliest face whose smile calmed me many a times Beware of house cleaning who on three occasions walked in the room unannounced Due to the climate the buffet area have a lot of fruit flies over the food at fruit and salad counter which is disgusting Not many options for alacarte so best is to take a full board package If ur a light eater then half board is good Best part of food is the sri lankan cuisine Pool is amazing and beach is untouched which are the two features i loved most Overall de-stressing and relaxing Will definitely go back hoping for a better experience Used the spa which was average - they could do better with the massage and ambience Oh yes and pls carry shampoo and shower gel as the provisions at the hotel not user friendly - Globe trotter Ms Dsilva R
Very poor
Corner rooms are very large
An enjoyable stay

The hotel is generally good. I was informed that it had been hit by the tsunami in 2004 and all the ground floor rooms were submerged. I travelled in a group and somehow got upgraded to a large deluxe room which was fantastics with all the trimmings. The room was spacious with a great view. However, my friends who were in standards rooms didn't like their stay at all. They complained about the rooms having flying cockroaches. The culinary experience was not as great as I hoped considering the hotel was voted as being the Best in Culinary Experience in Sri Lanka. Maybe because I was comparing with Hilton Colombo where I had just come from and which I would rate as better. The gym was ok but the electic equipment such as treadmills and cross trainers could use an upgrade. The gym is open throughout i.e. it's never locked which is great for flexibility. The swimming pools are very inviting and the meeting room were provided was ok though the selection of coffee/ tea beak snacks could be improved. One thing that was interesting was the sea was rough all the time throughout our stay. No guests could swim in the sea at all. This is a very interesting phenomenon which i had not previously experienced.

From first arriving at the hotel we were greeted with friendly faces and the staff could not have been more helpful. The food was first class and although some of the bedroom furniture probably needed replacing the beds were very comfortable and clean as was the whole of the hotel. Our room overlooked the sea and was very pleasant.Although the hotel is in a small village getting around was no problem with either the hotel taxis or the local tuk-tuks which are outside the hotel gate.We used the same tuk-tuk the whole time and we were taken to some lovely places we would never have found on our own. We would certainly have no reason not to recommend it. The evening entertainment on some of the nights was quite spectacular with the mask dancers and also a show in the pool.
It‚Äôs a bit run down in some common areas.

The room itself was okay, relatively clean and fair in size. My biggest issue with the stay was that, when relaxing or walking on the beach, there were around 15ish street merchants constantly harassing me and other guests to buy their clothes (at extortionate prices compared to going to a local shop or market), as well as being badgered to book tours, again at 2-3 times the price when booking away from the beach. I have to point out that these were not hotel employees, but independent traders whom for some reason had access to the hotel every day we stayed there. The hotel offers a baggage handling service where they will move your bags to and from your room for you free of charge, however, be vigilant as personal items were stolen from our luggage between us leaving the room to checkout, and our bags being moved by one of the staff members. In all honesty, I have stayed at many hotels in different countries and I would say, this is the one time I have gone on holiday and not felt like I was actually on holiday as there was just that much badgering going on that it was almost impossible to relax. Upon walking out of the front gates of the hotel, you would have 4-5 tuk tuk drivers ask and try to take you to places you have repeatedly told them you do not wish to go and although this is not the hotel's fault, when it happens every single day, I feel as though it has to be mentioned. Anyone considering going to Sri Lanka, I recommend it - just consider staying somewhere else because for me, this was a 5-star mistake.
10-Nov

Take plenty of Mosquito repellent we where badly bitten. Beware of the locals who trawl the beach and wont take no for an answer we also found it impossible to go out of the hotel to look around again the locals are a pest, however there is nothing within walking distance and we did not feel brave enough to take the Tuk Tuks

Stayed at the Heritance Hotel for 3 nights in October and was rather disappointed with the quality of the rooms and the rest of the building. It seems to me that many of the bigger hotels in Sri Lanka that trade as 5 star are in much need of refurbishment. Heritance - spend some money on the joint. 3 star at the best. Matthew Melbourne Australia
Fantastic beach hotel
Ayubowan Heritance Ahungalla

Stayed in this hotel with wife and kid. This hotel has great architecture and nice pool. Food was excellent and can go again for food. However room was very small and compact for a class of this hotel and other hotels have larger rooms and better bathrooms. Service could have been better. Empty plates from others rooms were left outside the room and it was not very pleasant. Was planning to stay an extra day, however did not because of the room. Expected more from the Heritance chain, especially compared to Kandalama

I have been to Sri Lanka on many occasions over the last 10 years, often combining work and leisure. My experience of Heritance hotels has been consistently good and Ahungalla was no exception. As with the other Bawa properties I have visited in Sri Lanka (Kandalama and Gallery Cafe for example), Ahungalla is beautifully crafted out of local materials, respects local traditions and also meets the needs of a tropical climate. Ahungalla is also located to provide a stunning view out to the Indian Ocean and several pools from which to enjoy the experience. Perhaps more importantly, the location and architecture are complemented with a warm and extremely professional team of hotel staff. Indeed, in my 30 plus visits to Sri Lanka, only Kandalama has exceeded this hotel in terms of service quality. I co-organised an academic conference at Ahungalla in September 2013, and many of the 142 local and international delegates were equally complimentary of the overall experience, but particularly the architecture and service quality. Unlike many other hotels that host similar events, Ahungalla also benefits from having conference halls somewhat separate from the main hotel. This benefits delegates and hotel guests alike, with the conference proceedings not distracting from the ambience of the hotel. The only slight downside is access. As with much of Sri Lanka, roads are not that good and congestion is common. The Expressway has helped somewhat, but it runs some way from the coast, where most hotels are located. Access from the airport is also difficult, but when the Outer Circular opens, which will bypass Colombo, this will certainly alleviate most of the access difficulties. Despite this and overall, an excellent experience and while I don't visit down South that often, when I do, I shall definitely look to stay at Ahungalla in the future.

Worst hotel I ever stayed at. Beautiful location though, although strong undercurrents so we could not swim in the ocean. Rooms terrible, staff not service minded at all. Everything worn down. Bed sheets dirty, cats running around inside the hotel. Absolutely not a 5 star hotel, would not even give it 1 star. Stay away, do not ever ever under any circumstances go there.

Rooms - We booked 4 deluxe rooms. Our deluxe room was spacious with music in the room. It was overall good. Two other deluxe rooms were smaller than this a lot but we're new. 1 deluxe room looked very old and was not spacious at all were disappointed to have in 5 star hotel. Bathrooms - Urs was spacious with music and a good showerplace. Other 3 bathrooms were very old and aging. the walls were no tiled as well and only concrete was seen. They were very small as well. Very disappointed. Food - This was a beachside restaurant but the buffet was not good at all. there were very few varieties of food and the only seafood for dinner was fish and prawns. Even the restaurant is too packed and not appealing. Others all good. I rated this according to the room we got and not considering others rooms Here's how I gave rating 1-Room 1-Bathroom 1-Pool 1-Beach and other recreational activities 0-food
The resort is really pathetic. One must never visit such Resort it is a very old building structure and feels like we are stayin

We had a very relaxing and enjoyable vacation after spending 4 nights at this 5 star hotel in Ahungalle. We stayed in a luxury room and the rest of our group in 4 other luxury rooms which were all fabulous in their own unique way. All rooms were extremely spacious and we were upgraded to a suite which had a huge living room along with a separate master bedroom equipped with flat screen, DVD player and sound system, a huge bathroom with shower stall, elevated jaccuzzi tub, separate his/hers sinks and a huge wrap around patio with deck chairs. I'll post some pictures to illustrate but please note these were taken just before we left so naturally the room was a bit messy. The hotel has all the amenities for fun with 2 outdoor pools, tennis courts, badminton court and table tennis. The main outdoor pool by the lobby overlooks the ocean and is very picturesque. We particularly enjoyed the other pool which had the shade of a large tree and hence it was never too sunny for a swim. The food was good with seafood at every meal and breakfast was by far the best meal as well as one night with a Sri Lankan fare dinner. Jananjaya a waiter from the main restaurant went out of his way to please and provided the best service I've ever experienced in a buffet setting. Kaushal one of the housekeepers was also very attentive and made lovely animals for our son from towels. Even David P a trainee at the hotel went above and beyond to ensure we had a great stay. Overall from the time we arrived the service was impeccable and probably largely attributed to the very unassuming and nice general manager Upul Peiris who appears to be leading from the front and has clearly set a high bar for the service culture, he mentioned he had previously managed several resorts in the Maldives. The only downside to this hotel is it was designed by a famous Sri Lankan architect who believes in blending in with nature and hence it is not safe for young kids to wonder around alone since the stairways do not have rails, there are ponds all over etc. There is also no separate kids swimming pool. The beach by the hotel is very nice, however, the ocean maybe a little too rough if waves and body surfing are not your thing.
Average experience.. Needs improvements to keep up with other five start hotels

We travel at least twice a year to Heritance Ahungalla as this is one place we feel very much at home. It was a different experience this time celebrating Sinhala & Tamil New Year (Avurudu). The set up created for the guests to experience a traditional auvurudu ceremony was remarkable. Excellent job done by Mr Sisira Senaratne - GM and his Team. One of the best hotels if you like to spend a few days on the beach peacefully.
Delectable & relaxing escape destination.
Part of our 3 day holiday at the Heritance Hotels.
Poor Reception

In Jan 2013 I spent several wonderful days with my wife in the Heritance Ahungalle, work of one of the renowned architects J Bawa.The reception was very friendly. It's a beautiful Hotel for a pleasant stay. The rooms are large, very clean and well furnished. There is also a large pool area. Beach is clean and lovely to swim. [ staff make it happen ]The friendly staff will make sure that every guest at the pool or beach is looked after. It is glorious to eat out with the sunset.
Suites are great if u are with toddlers , as they have plenty of room for ur kid to run about whilst u hav a cup of tea with your wife

Chef Dinesh gave an excuse saying that he had to manage the hotel with two chefs as others have gone for a competition. There is a massive choice for non vegitarians. They dont seem to care us as we are locals. I would not recommend this place as they dont have any regard for locals and especially for locals. We are waiting to get out of the hotel as it ruined our holiday and wasted our money.

Excellent condition. Quick service. Friendly persons, waiters and every one. There are two pools 1.Green pool 2. Main pool. Excellent view with other hotels and the beach. Very beautiful hotel.Good hotel come enjoy get the full services and come again.
Best Hospitality from the staff
Even if you book in advance you may not get a good room!

Do not listen to those writing that the service is ignorant, for it is definitely not, you will be attended for any request, just keep in mind that the hotel is big and popular with the visitors, so let the service take some time. The rates are good, as well as the facilities. The place is not brand new, so you cannot expect fresh furniture, etc., but it feels like a solid 5-star hotel anyways, clean, spacious. The ocean is mostly rough to swim, but you can enjoy the pools or grab a cab to get to Unawatuna for a day. Nice library. The gym is different from the pictures on TA: the barbells have been removed, but the basics are still there for you. The breafasts are good, while I found the dinners to be overpriced if you go for a buffet option. There are many places around that are more affordable and enjoyable.

Though the hotel was nice...but definitely needs maintenance. Our room 240 had broken door handles, lights needed to fix, very small bathroom. Good for 2 but didnt find value for money paid. Staff is super awesome and warm. Very nice people and hospitality

We stayed 3 nights in a deluxe room - extremely comfortable and well appointed. Slept like a log every night. The staff could not have been more friendly and helpful at all times. The hotel itself was designed by renowned Sri Lankan architect Geoffrey Bawa, with great attention to detail - it is in a tropical style with lots of open space and courtyards/gardens within the hotel. Two huge swimming pools, and of course the beach (ocean swimming seasonal though). This is a great location for exploring the surrounding area - lots of other Bawa designed hotels and gardens to visit nearby, and of course the Unesco world heritage old town of Galle (Fort), which is a gem.
Exellent

Located in a lovely place near beach. Very friendly staff. Excellent food. All 3 meals are buffet. Enjoyed every moment of stay. Two big pools with bars. Pool staff is bit rude.not very supportive. Great for a vacation.

Have to say, its not a great hotel in need of some serious updating, lots of new hotels about to open very close by so they either need to up their game or rebuild the place. Beach sellers/beggers were a pest and security didn't seem too bothered with their presence, one lunch time we watched some sneaking in. Buffet restaurant, was not well stocked once the first lots of food was taken, the room didn't seem all that clean, bedrooms were tired, the ala cart restaurant was empty and expensive for the food on offer.
Brilliant team! I will have no hesitation in recommending you to anyone
You'd be better off staying elsewhere
a beautiful hotel

We stayed in the luxury suite which was spacious. The service from the staff was excellent and very obliging. A few issues which need to be resolved - 1) the facts in the information section in each of the rooms indicating that Tamils mostly arrived in the 19th century is fraudulent, 2) internet access needs to be improved such that someone doesn't need to re-register every time they leave the room or the hotel and return, 3) showers sometimes seem to not drain properly leading to flooding.

Exceptional service.. Food was even better.. Best hotel around!!! Love the rooms and the atmosphere was perfect.. Don't hesitate to select this hotel if you are looking for a peaceful get away.. Can't wait to come back again with family next time..
Resort was nice, other things so so

Pointless in requesting any type of room beforehand. It didn't happen for us! As soon as we entered our room, there was a terrible smell of damp. On our balcony there was a white powder. I cleaned this up, and there it was again. It turned out they were decorating the room upstairs, and the "powder" was paint being rubbed down. You couldn't sit on the balcony without it getting on your clothes, and the stench in the room was really bad. In fairness, they said we could change room. I went to check and there was no smell or powder, and the room was prepared apart from bed and bathroom linen, but still they said it would not be ready for 24 hours. We then went for dinner around 9.00 pm. Unfortunately, the food had obviously been there since there since the start, and was either "scrapings" or what no one else wanted. Good nights sleep, then we both became I'll. I just had moderate sickness and diahorrea. My partner had diahorrea , but really, really bad vomiting. It lasted 15 hours, before he finally settled. Towards the end of this we were advised our new room was ready. I said how we sick we were. Probably, a language problem, but they offered us room service!!! The last thing we needed was food - we couldn't keep anything down. We couldn't move room - we were in bed, intermittently, using the bathroom.. By the following day, the powder has stopped appearing (later found out they had stopped rubbing down) and we kind of got used to the stench, and couldn't face packing up again and moving for 3 nights. _x000D_ The beach location is beautiful. The gardens are lovely. Our balcony view was lovely. _x000D_ The rooms are smelly and need updating(maybe why we got the powder). . I didn't enjoy the food, probably because we were ill, but it was varied, and maybe our sickness had nothing to do with it, who knows. But I would suggest you eat early, rather than later, when the food has been kept around for a couple of hours rather than replaced._x000D_ The food in the cafe is lovely, hot and freshly cooked. The staff are really good.
Felt like home

Room size was smaller than expected. After the baby cot was put in the room, it felt a lot more cramped for space. In house liquor was really expensive. The USD to LKR conversion rate applied by the hotel was pathetic.

We had the opportunity to stay for one night. The pool and beach were truly exceptional, providing a delightful experience. The variety offered in all three meals was impressive, with a wide range of flavors that were quite enjoyable. However, I must express my disappointment with the accommodations. The room we were assigned felt quite dated, and the beds were not particularly comfortable. Additionally, the air conditioning unit's controller was malfunctioning, which affected our comfort. The bathroom was notably small, particularly the shower cubicle, making it inconvenient for a comfortable bathing experience. It's worth mentioning that the absence of a hand shower in the bathroom was a drawback. Regrettably, we also found that the staff did not display the same level of friendliness towards locals. Considering our experience, I would suggest this establishment for a day outing rather than an overnight stay.

The hotel was a very big disapointment. we arrived late in evening, the guy at the reseption looked as he didnt feel like showing us arround, tired, bored (?). On the way to the room, he said that we had been upgrated from the room that we had reserved, we got to the room and the first thing I look at is the bathroom, there was a funny smell, when i told the guy he said that is nothing, we just spraid cinamon before you arrived. the towels were old and far from being smooth and nice. At 7 oclock we were woken up by restaurations done at the hotel; we were not told this was going on. All this is not a five star hotel!!! finally we were moved to a suite but still the higine was not perfet and towells not soft.

We appreciate the hospitality the two animators were really good A special bunch of thanks to Ranisha The rooms and the service is excellent and will come back to this hotel again ......wonderful hotel overall. ........

I am absolutely satisfied with everything. The great Hotel, Management, the Beach, Food, Service, Drinks, Tour guides, Entertainment, Rezeption, Pool boys, room chief ect.!!! I always feel great when I am back. Love the place soo much!!

Awesome and awful in one
scenery, luxury and traditional style of architecture, kind and friendly staffs, calm and noiseless environment.

This hotel is one of the nicest hotels I've ever been. The personnel and staff is extremely friendly and helps whenever they can. The food is mainly local, some people hate it, others love it, but if you hate it, no problem, at the pool bar you can get burgers and fries. Room was very nice and clean, fresh towels 2 times a day and they even have a night service to open your bedsheets. Positive Points: - Friendly Staff - Nice local food - All inclusive formula is nearly perfect (will come back later to this) - Nice views of the pool - Nice, clean and big rooms - Wifi EVERYWHERE Negative Points: - All inclusive doesn't include "light" drinks, so as a person with Sugar disease you can not take Cola Light but only regular Cola. This is something where they should look for an alternative for people who can not have that much sugar and don't like water. - The people at the beach who try to sell you stuff, they are nice and friendly, but if you are friendly back and buy some stuff, they just keep coming asking for more, asking for drinks, milkshakes,... This is something to watch. Overall it's a very nice hotel and I will definitely come back to this one.
The upper floors have views of the sea - the ground floor is handy for the pool but the outside area is less private and you would be able to see the sea
all-inclusive is restricted, and no wine in the bar (just in the restaurant at lunch and dinner). Rooms are fine, but not 5-star by any means (maybe a generous 3 star).

We stayed at the Heritance Ahungalla for our honeymoon and were not disappointed. Having done our research we liked the more traditional style, location and hotel size from looking at reviews on TripAdvisor. This is a beautiful hotel, very clean with some fantastic staff. I did unfortunately injure myself while we were there but the staff were very caring and attentive. The food was very good and there was a good variety although it was unusual that not all the restaurants were included as part of the all-inclusive and wine only available at meal times. Our room was beautiful and we had a stunning view of the beach which was right on our doorstep. The only piece of criticism I would have, would be that the walkways and grounds could do with a little more manicuring between the two pools as this looked a bit untidy. All in all we had an amazing stay and I would recommend this hotel. Sri Lanka as a country is beautiful with an abundance of exotic wildlife, culture and some of the friendliest people you will ever meet. This was certainly a memorable destination for our honeymoon, different from anywhere I have ever been and we would love to go back and explore more.
Rooms facing the sea are better.

I live in Dubai, so I know what a USD$400 per night hotel room should get you. Therefore, in Sri Lanka, it should be at least on par - if not a thousand times better. This review comes with a disclaimer ‚Äì the hotel did compensate me with a rather dramatic discount upon departure. I do not believe that this hotel can realistically charge the amount they do for this level of property and service. In the end I believe we paid a fair amount for what we received. They begged me not to write a bad review, so I will not, but I will state the truth. Let‚Äôs start with the ‚Äúpros‚Äù: - Beautifully designed hotel with authentic colonial architecture. - Lovely view from most of the balconies. - Several dining options available. - Good bathrooms. - Good a/c in rooms. - Massages at the spa are heavenly. Probably the best I‚Äôve ever had! - Management responded well to our complaints. Now over to the ‚Äúcons‚Äù: - The ‚Äúconfirmed‚Äù airport transfer was not booked. We waited 2 hours at the airport before they finally arranged. - Our room was filthy. Even after complaining it did not improve. - Room service, bar and snack menus are the same. No Sri Lankan food in sight! - Manicure and hair treatments at the spa were disastrous (rough nails and stripped colour from hair). - Dirty linen at all F&B outlets and room service.

Poor room condition. Very old bathroom and room. Need to get a renovation. But nice location. Nice pool and nice beach. We went there with our friends wedding anniversary. We enjoyed sea bath lot. It's really good experience for us. We enjoyed a Very quality and very tasty buffet. It was really delicious and more varieties. There was a sea food corner also.

When entering the hotel all the guests and bag are being checked by secirity personnels and metal detectors which is a good move to reassure safety. Valet parking is available. We were warmly welcomed and the reception was very busy atthe time we were checking-in. We were offered a welcome drink and a small snack as well as a refreshing face towel. The garden was neat and the lobby area was quite large and spacious. Furniture and the decor was modernised vintage looking. The room was looking so inviting and the lighting did its magic with the look of a lavishly renovated early bunglow. The bed was comfortable and so were the sheets and pillows. The view from our room was partially to the ocean and eventhough it was not directly centered at the ocean, the view of the sea from our room was spectacular. The food was on a buffet set-up and all of what I tried was delicious. Yet, I believe that the variety could have been improved, specially the breakfast service. On the other hand, the dinner was excellent! However, the lunch might not be the best buffets of Heritance Ahungalla I suppose. The buffet quality might be pressed down as a result of low rates being charged in this season to attarct more guests to the hotel. Moreover, the spa was relaxing and the therapists did their part well. Above all, the fragrance in the spa was fantastic. Unfortunately, we had a bad night. After having dinner, a function started at the hotel and we guessed that it was in the lobby area. It was extremely loud and we could not relax in the balcony or sleep inside. I am sure a manager or some authoritative personnel could have made a change in the location of the function. I understand that it was raining in the evening but the hotel might have a certain policy in terms of having functions at the hotel. There is ample space in the property and there might be a better place or a separate place to have functions. So, please make sure that such problems do not occur in the future. The aim of a hotel is to make all the guests delighted in their stay and not making "some" of the guests happy.
Amazing in every aspect!
Try to come off season

We have just spent a wonderful 2 weeks at the Heritance Ahungalla with our 2 teenage daughters. The staff were very helpful and friendly especially Thushara, Dharshana, Anushka and Madhu. The hotel is situated on the edge of the beach and has amazing views over the Indian Ocean. Sri Lanka is a beautiful country with lovely people. .....everyone was so friendly wherever we went. We will definitely stay here again and would recommend this hotel 100%. Mary, Chris, Lucy and Katy Adams, Northampton, UK.

This hotel is positioned on a wonderful beach. While the hotel is starting to show its age the staff try very hard to look after the guests. The breakfast buffet is great to start the day and everyone should try the egg hopper! The beach is the real bonus of this hotel and the waves are great for body surfing. However, there is also one BIG downside. It would be great to be able to be enjoy the beach without the constant attention (unwanted!) of the touts trying to sell cheap and nasty products on the beach. It became so unwanted that we were forced to retreat to the privacy of the hotel, a not bad second option. Having spoken to the manager about touts it is clear that the hotel is trying to address the issue but is not there yet. I wish them success!
Complete and utter disappointment!!
Upper floor to the right of the entrance near the second pool is quieter. Left is above kitchen and restaurant.
Nothing all perfect
Great hospitality & food
Environmental Friendly Hotel
Nice views, friendly staff but dated hotel

We know the hotel as we used to stay there several years in a row some years ago. The architecture is stunning, but some improvements on the rooms are needed to bring it back to 5 star standards. Upon check-in we were early and were told that normal check-in time is 2 pm. We waited for 2 1/2 hours til 2 pm and several inquiries, there we were told, that they are checking. At 2 pm it seems everybody arriving after us was checked-in and we still did not get any information. I went to the reception to complain, but they were busy to set up other guests internet on the phone than to attend to guests who were waiting for 2 1/2 hours. After asking for the manager it suddenly worked and we got a room and apology. Although we asked for the new wing, we were offered a room in the old wing. Despite of kitchen odor this room was definitely the better choice for us as on the other side a 2 day party was going on with lots of noise. Room was ok and had a nice sea view. Cleanliness of the room could have been better. Especially in the shower there were signs of mould and shower door was completely covered with limescale. Service especially upon check-in was definitely not 5 star standard. Also for breakfast it was announced to start at 7 am, but when we came down ones at 7.10 am, nothing was ready, noone was taking note in order to serve coffee or tea. The egg corner was not occupied to order eggs, etc. If 7 am is published for breakfast, it should be ready for service. Food was very good though. Another point to reconsider might be the christmas decoration which did not fit the hotel at all. All in all we had a nice stay in the end. If we would come back, we are not sure as we know better from this hotel from previous stays and it is quite pricy for the service offered.
Wait for the promised refurbishments before booking!!

We had a suite upgrade which was great. Seems many of the visitors are Europeans on a beach holiday. Leaving the hotel was an experience - not really recommended.......... Really have no other comments
