Great location, welcoming staff, great food and comfortable beds
La critique est possible.....

I visited this hotel a couple of times & this is one place you should try for sure irrespective of whether you are a local or tourist. From the lobby itself you can feel the difference. True that there are many hotels with wonderful facilities...some might even have better facilities than here but the real factor that makes a difference here is the "people factor". The employees of this hotel made me & my team feel very special indeed. They have what I would call the personal touch which is the most important thing. I was truly amazed as to how far the General Manager,Residential Manager, Head Chef etc is willing to go to make us happy & make the visits simply perfect! If I were to commment about the faclities....lovely rooms...infinity pool...great restaurants...bar..sat TV....wifi....animators, DJs to facilitate groups....night club..beach view....etc..What more would one want? And also the food is worth every bit that you pay. The range they offer in their buffets is vast & delicious...it'll fit both young & old alike...I would recommend Heritance Ahungalla for a family\business trip without any reservations! Looking forward to my next visit there! Cheers!
NOT HAPPY - DISAPPOINTED
A higher floor gives you a lovely view when you are sitting out on the balcony

Stayed in the Heritance Anhungalla for six nights in September. It is a smart stylish hotel designed by Bawa, Sri Lanka's foremost architect. Some may find it a bit stark and white, we loved it. The rooms were large with a lot of character; comfortable beds and a very diligent roomboys. Food in the main restaurant was buffet style with lots of choice and some interesting Sri Lankan dishes. Prices are a bit on the high side, there is a cheaper restaurant but the menu was limited. There are two pools, one is reserved for reidents, they have weekend visitors who can use the other pool. It is quite a large hotel but still got a bit crowded when they had a convention at the weekend. There are fabulous sunsets out to sea. The beach is heavily occupied by traders, the ladies have some good scarves and sarongs at cheap prices, guys want to sell you a boet ride or visit the restaurant down the beach. Some of our party did and found it very good and cheap. The beach boys are very polite, as are all Sri Lankans that we met and if you say you just want to be quiet and don't want to talk they leave you alone. The beach drops sharply into the sea and waves were popwerful so bathing is banned. This is one of the drawbacks of the hotle. The other problem is that there is nowhere to walk outside the hotel, if you venture out of the gate swarms of helpfull people appear! I think it's a great hotel for three or four nights, we got a bit bored after that.

Sea view is nice, but try getting a room away from the main lobby. We were right above it and the music from the bar at night carries.

This is the most difficult review I have written so far. The hotel has two parts ‚Äì one is brilliant and another is terrible. Therefore I summed everything up and evaluated it as average. Brilliant points: Extensive, very clean beach with clean ocean water. Fantastic pool area (two pools fit for any taste) with very good service. Nice reception, pleasant and airy open lobby. Beautiful grounds with veritable zoo: variety of birds, squirrels, shy langur monkeys, almost friendly molitors, etc. Superb food both at evening and morning buffet. Terrible points: Rooms and bathrooms are outdated, dirty, smelly (sometimes smell of sewage is overwhelming) and ill-kept, some may be cockroachy. After one night I asked to change my room on the ground floor which totally awful to only slightly better on the first floor (at least with more light). Housekeeping is poor: rooms are not cleaned until very late and then, several hours later, in the evening there comes house keeping again for god knows what reason. Also in the dining area at one point the floor was slippery because of spilt fat and remained so for at least two days. Hotel spa prices are more than exorbitant, go for massage to the village. Beware when dealing in cash: bad exchange rate (and different than told at the reception) the cashier cheats (tried to swindle me and one of our group too), so count your money carefully. Even when in the hotel grounds (and especially on beach) you are periodically accosted by touts, seller of various goods, tuk tuk drivers, etc. If you leave the grounds and go to the village you are immediately swarmed with ‚Äúhelpers‚Äù who tussle between themselves and finally you will have one fixed ‚Äúleach‚Äù who will follow all the time offering all kinds of goods and services. So, if you are indifferent to the room you sleep in, the hotel is perfectly all right, even great. But otherwise consider other possibilities.

Excellent hotel with nice staff. But only thing is you should have more vegetarian options for all three meals.. beach is beautiful. Stay is very comfortable. Hospitality is excellent. ...thank you for the wonderful stay....

Once you visit Heritance Ahungalla,you don‚Äôt feel like going anywhere else.Every holiday that we spent with them,was fabulous.Mr.Thushara,the food and beverage manager is actually the main reason why we come to Heritance Ahungalla.His service goes beyond his title.He‚Äôs exceptionally helpful,super friendly and he knows exactly what the guest wants in a five Star hotel.Our family adores him, not only as a professional but also as a great friend.We would like to thank Mr.Thushara,Mr.Nipun,and the rest of the staff at Heritance Ahungalla,for all their efforts to keep everyone satisfied.Once again,Thank you,Mr.Thushara,for being so caring and always willing to give us the best.

have just returned after two weeks at the heritance in AHUNGALLA.We had avery good holiday& the hotel staff were very friendly & helpfull.The only thing that let this hotel down was the rooms which are in dire need of refurbishment.The bathrooms have a half glazed screen with blinds which i found very odd.Some of the walls are finnished in a polished concrete effect , which might have been fashionable thirty years ago but not now.However i do not want to put people off this hotel because the rooms are still comfortable & functional. we found the food also very good with a good selection to suit all nationalitys.The service in the pool bar could be a little slow at times & we did feel that people who were not on all inclusive got a better service than people who were .The other down side to this hotel is the distance to the airport . This can take anything between two & three hours depending on the traffic & the time of day. To conclude i would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to my friends.

This hotel is showing it's age slightly. The rooms are fine and the surroundings are beautiful but just not quite top notch. However we found the standard of service to be superb and are surprised at some of the reviews rating the service poor. We ate dinner in the main restaurant once and the Mustard Cafe three times. One meal in the Mustard Cafe was not up to scratch - the stirred fried beef looked as if it has been made several days ago - all dried up. However all the other meals were excellent. Breakfasts in the main restaurant were very good. There are two swimming pools - one by the main entrance and one outside the north wing. This latter pool was huge and nice to swim in. We also paddled in the sea which is right outside the hotel. The waves were very strong while we were there so it was not safe to go swimming but the sand is beautiful. There are people selling on the beach - it is difficult to see how the hotel could get rid of them as presumably it is a public place. However we didn't feel too pestered as we just ignored them and they went away. All the staff were friendly and courteous. The room boy was especially cheerful and the room kept really clean, in fact they changed the linen more than we needed
Amazing Heritence Ahunga√±

Heritance Ahungalla is not by any standards a 4,5 star hotel. We have chosen it for our honeymoon trip as pictures seen on the website looked amazing and we also read many good reviews. However, our stay there turn out to be a great dissapointment and we won't be going back. To list just few problems you may encounter there : it is impossible to go for a walk on the beach as you are constantly pestered by locals who do not take no for an answer; cockroaches can be found not only on hotel corridors but also inside the rooms; the cutlery served at tables has leftovers of food stuck to it; the bed linen in the rooms as well as the curtains are stained and often with holes; the hotel provides hardly any toiletries and if so, they are stuck on the bottom of a ceramic bottles in a very small quantitiy; there are constant problems with electricity and it can go off for over 30mins at time. As for the service it is probably one of the most tiresom and annoying problems of all, as there is no communication between the team members serving meals in the restaurant, you need to ask several times for a pot of coffee or a bottle of water, provided that you will be understood by the waiter on the first occassion. If so, the requested drink may not be delivered at all, while few other team memers will approach with exactly the same question about your choice of drink but it will take ages for someone to actually deliver it to the table. The tips are expected while the service quality or rather its lack, does not jusitfy it at all. The most imposing are often the housekeeping supervisors (not the regular housekeepers- they work very hard and hardly ever strike a conversation with a guest), who can follow you down the corridor repeating few times that they are entirely responsible for cleaning your room....all obviously to be tipped. In case of any problems with the room calling reception is normally a waste of time, as you have to call back several times before someone turns up to deal with the problem. The hotel is full of damp and looks as if its times of glory have long gone. We have been travelling extensively over last couple of years throughout Africa and Asia and we are very much aware of difficulties some developing countries face, however we cannot find an explanation for advertising a very poor quality hotel as a 4,5 star resort.
All goof

We travelled around Sri Lanka for 2 weeks staying in 6 different hotels, and this was by far the worst service we received out of our entire stay. The hotel itself is nice, rooms spacious and clean, pool area is nice. We dined in the a la carte restaurant which was nice. Don‚Äôt bother with half board / all inclusive - there‚Äôs a handful of restaurants on the beach with better food. The worst part is there seems to be some American expectation of tipping for absolutely everything, and if you don‚Äôt then you simply won‚Äôt get served!! Despite many signs around the pool saying sunbeds can‚Äôt be reserved, it seems the pool boy is more than happy to reserve these for a tip. I was up at 7:30am (jetlag), and there was just 1 set of sunbeds left despite no one actually being by the pool! We stayed there until midday, and some of the reserved beds only became occupied at 11am! So frustrating for everyone else. One woman took the reservation off and the pool boy flat out refused to give her a towel, even arguing with her! She went and got her own, and by midday no one had come to claim the bed! Awful! We went to the bar one night, they saw us walk in. They proceeded to offer every other group table service but us! I had to go to the bar 3 times for menus, drink etc., yet they still charged 10% service! On check-out you get shoved in some tiny room round back to pay your bill which is actually quite intimidating. No one asked if we had a nice stay or where we were going next, or even said bye when we left! While I do appreciate Sri Lanka is a poor country and tipping is needed, this was the only hotel during our whole trip that had this greedy mentality. We saved hard for this trip and don‚Äôt appreciate being treated like lesser people because we don‚Äôt have lots of extra money for tips! They also seem to have no problem in letting touts in to the hotel who come up to you on your sunbed to sell you a sari! I get that this happens on the beach but they shouldn‚Äôt allow them in the hotel grounds.

Visited the hotel for 4 nights. I had booked 7 rooms for friends and family. Great food and very courteous staff. I had booked a suite but the quality of the room was poor, when I discuss this with the front office he promptly moved us to another suite.

Unbelievably beautiful beach hotel

Our first stay here in 2009 was on the very strong recommendation of Sri Lankan friends and we vowed to return sooner rather than later. Neither my wife or I recognised some of the negative comments on this site prior to booking our latest trip in December 2011 but we had some concerns. Those concerns were totally unfounded. From the moment we were met with refreshing cinnamon tea until the redoubtable Dudley packed our cases in the car at the end of our stay, it was total relaxation. The attitude of the staff is a delight and may explain some of the complaints - they have a wonderful ability of being remarkably attentive whilst appearing to be laid back which may be misinterpreted as appearing not to care.Nothing could be further from the truth. Some of the younger staff members are still extremely keen and their enthusiasm, whilst appreciated, intrudes slightly into the relaxed ambiance. They could do well to learn from Jacob. If you have the good fortune to have your table served by this gentleman you will understand the point I'm attempting to make. He is like a swan gliding serenely on the surface whilst away from view he is paddling like hell to ensure that you enjoy every minute in his care. Our room was excellent - the only criticism we could make was the that the Venetian blind in the bathroom was past its best.... this is really struggling to be negative. I can't believe that someone on here had complained about the food - how absurd! Not only was the buffet absolutely first class but the puddings were out of this world. A real trip down memory lane for persons of a certain age! Unsurprisingly, the dessert table won first prize in the hotel industry awards. Please don't take my word for this - our visit coincided with that of an annual trip of French gamblers(???!) to the hotel. They attacked each meal with that Gallic gusto which is unique, (complete with napkins tied around their necks!) - if it hadn't been up to standard I'm sure that it would have been the kitchen staff at risk rather than the food! When these lovely characters found that my wife was multi-lingual they hijacked her on a regular basis to tell the hotel chefs of their appreciation. Another negative comment I had read was regarding the beach folk. Yes, at times they can be boorish but they are trying to make a living. If you inform them that you are definitely not interested in purchasing anything today they will leave you alone. You are, however, missing the opportunity to chat to some fascinating people with experiences completely different to your own who would really appreciate the opportunity of honing their language skills on you - this is especially true of the clothing ladies. If all else fails the magic word to use is 'yanda!' whose interpretation is, I believe as rude as it is effective! We would like to thank the management team of Rifan (General Manager), Tilleth (Food and Beverage Manager) and above all the professional and gregarious Sampath (Assistant Manager) for a superb stay. You have staff and a hotel to be very proud of.

The hotel really needs to be updated, compared to other beach hotels this hotel stands out for being old and dated. Not a good place to be. The rooms are a good size and comfortable but everything needs to be modernised. The food was quite nice and really enjoyed our dinner and breakfast. The hotel is overlooking the sea and the views are great. Both swimming pools are really big and very conveniently placed. The staff make up for the disappointing look of the hotel. Property : Beautiful architecture, bright outdoor spaces and two amazing swimming pools and a useless beach. Rooms: Needs an upgrade to the really bad lighting system. Rooms are very dark and not at all child friendly. Beds are comfy n pillows are great. Room cleanliness is not all satisfied. Cigarette hash underneath the bed looks as if it had not been cleaned for ages. Food: The Salads are not at all up to the standard. Soup was a good start. Main course buffet was a bit messed up. Potatoes burnt while the cuttle fish left raw n the crabs too sweet n also uncooked for dinner. Lunch was way better. The positive point is that the staff after informing made us an ala carte dish of crabs and prawns and it was amazing. Desert was spot on delicious. Variety was also another plus point. Staff: The happy smiling faces and welcoming gestures by the overall staff make you want to come back again to this property. We look forward to coming back to heritance Ahungalla with a better expectation. Imran Hinghora

Could‚Äôve been better

If you are into stuffing your face on buffets and booze, probably a great hotel for you. If you are looking for quality food and culture, or even 5 star service probably not for you. Outwardly the hotel looks great, they rely on the great infinity pool for the wow factor but scratch the surface and there is not much else a pontins holiday park wouldn't provide. Probably why there are limited photo's on the website apart from the pool. We paid extra for a luxury room, which was very nice but cost enough to justify. The room along with the friendly staff were the best parts of the holiday. Breakfast was average, dark, dingy, smokey (cooking smoke) buffet room. Nice cooked options, and hoppers. Waffles were very nice, but coffee served was just terrible. Green pool was OK, but cloudy water. Good green pool service Nice beach, but not worth visiting due to the constant hassle. People have to earn a living but it gets a bit draining to be friendly, only to be hassled to buy something every time you want to walk along the beach. Grotty and hot gym, with old equipment. Miles away from anywhere, so unless you want a 1/2hr tuk tuk ride to Bentota (which is fine and plenty of offers outside the gate) you are stuck with hotel options. The best food we found was in the mustard cafe, lovely curries. Everything else was overpriced euro buffet. Final nail in the coffin was check-out, no service at the nice reception desk, you go round to the back office, smelly little room where you que up to pay your $$$$ bill while the cashier argues and discusses other bills with clients and colleagues. Then the taxi you ordered with the concierge isn't booked after all, they just look at each other and call over the 20 year old smelly wagon. We refused to get in, and they got an equally smelly but slightly newer car for the 9000 rupee ride to Colombo. Smelly is a reoccurring issue here. Overall, 5 star luxury room (for the right $$$) in a 3 star resort......With a really good looking pool.
Location‚Ä¶ beach was very pretty but the sea is dangerous for swimming. Red Flag permanently shown, even on days when the sea looked fairly calm.

Travelled here to part of our office annual trip and certainly lived upto the expectations. The rooms are well maintained and face the sea. Our room located in 4th floor(some staffers say 'sachchin's suite) that faced the sea and the wind blowing towards us. What I liked most was the pool which was amazing in the evenings. It faced the sea and gives a stunning sight towards sunset.

I stayed at the Heritance at the end of October for 3 days. The hotel is beautiful and makes the most of it's stunning surroundings. We opted for half board and were very impressed with the selection of food on offer for breakfast and dinner. The live cooking stations were a great addition. The staff were very friendly and made an effort to remember us and our preferences. The infinity pool is large and lovely, and as we went out of season there were plenty of sun loungers. However there didn't seem enough if the hotel was full. The only downside was the electrics and power points in the room. During our short stay we had three power cuts, the only power sockets in the room that we could use where to power the telly and mini-bar so we would have to simultaneously remove one to be able to charge phones, or straighten hair. The other sockets available didn't fit any sort of travel plug (I'd packed a world compatible one and it still didn't work!) the room comes with a kettle and tea making facilities however even the kettle plug didn't fit in the sockets! Slightly disappointing side to an otherwise lovely hotel.

This place has deteriorated unbelievably. I have visited the hotel on multiple occasions. In the early 2012s the Hotel was decent with friendly staff. Now its all gone down sour. I revisited again in 2016 but was shocked to find out that the standards have turned so bad. Firstly, I was welcomed by the usual friendly smiles and what not but the staff at the pool were extremely rude, and racist... I took some family visiting from the middle east for lunch and soon found that the hotel service made them very upset. They tried to use the pool, however soon knocked back and told that 3 quarter shorts weren't suitable for pool. These idiots have no idea. As a traveller in many western countries, I have never seen such fools running a hotel.. They don't know what guest services means... then the racism part kicks in where the staff are plain rude and are like robots and smiles at white skin guests, but frowns upon anyone with a tinge more of colour... Absolutely ridiculous and I discourage anyone from travelling and staying at this hotel....

STAFF ARE LOVELY BUT NOT A 5 STAR HOTEL , EVERYWHERE IS CLEAN AND BED COMFORTABLE. NO BATH ONLY A SHOWER. ROOM ALSO DARK LIGHTING NOT VERY BRIGHT AND NO WHERE BRIGHT ENOUGH TO DO MAKE UP AND ONLY ONE PLUG OVER ON THE DESK, NONE BY THE BED. THE HOTEL IS LOOKING VERY DATED AND IN NEED OF A FACE LIFT AND THE FOOD IS NOT UP TO 5 STAR DINING, THE MENU WAS QUITE LIMITED, BREAKFAST MUCH BETTER THAN EVEING MEALS. VERY QUIET WHEN WE WERE THERE SO NO ATMOSPHERE OR ANYTHING TO DO WITHIN THE HOTEL, BUT MIGHT BE DIFFERENT WHEN MORE THAN 15 OUT OF 150 ROOMS BOOKED.
Ok but could be so much better

Ahungalla Heritance Hotel is reassuring when you arrive through its private drive after passing the entrance arch gate. It keeps being reassuring when you discover the open reception to the swimming pool that visually extends straight into the Indian Ocean just few meters away until ‚Ä¶ you end up checking in at a bar behind the reception that was very dark as most of its lights were switch off; was it a try of being Eco friendly ?? We had a strange feeling that the hotel was not up to its 5*. This obvious detail was like the top of an iceberg; will we discover the rest of it along our stay? Was Heritance a 5* iceberg? The room was ok, yet had aged and would need a lift. There was no safe deposit (5*?). The room maintenance appeared secondary as we noticed an obvious splash of dirt on the terrace door window and one of the door lock was broken. At ‚ÄúMustard coffee shop‚Äù, we ordered seafood salad, it came with no salad or veggies (misleading salad term). We checked the ‚ÄúUpperRestaurant‚Äù menu and were not impressed by its presentation neither by the incomprehensive culinary composition of its expensive dishes. The restaurant was empty ‚Ä¶ lack of soul, poor lighting, no spark. Instead we went to this little Coconut Hut restaurant down the beach out of the hotel, where we really had a superb and reasonable diner, thank you to Berthy the owner for his welcome. We recommend it. Back to our room, we were not blown by the auto glorifying video of Heritance Ahungalla that was played in random on the hotel TV channel, it sounded too superlative to be true. The Heritance corporate management needs to open its eyes, international real 5* hotel are on their way to Sri Lanka and soon they may be at the origin of the end of Heritance Hotels 5 * era. The F & B department should also be worry and revise its restaurants concepts and put its heart and mind into it.

It is our first time to this hotel. Starting from the welcoming to the checking out everything as perfect. Kids enjoyed a lot.Main pool relaxed our minds and food is awesome.Thank you all! Specially my friend Janaka gave us a good service.Supuni's attention into detail is perfect. Thank you all for making us this much happy!!!

Originally designed by Geoffery Bawa this is a hotel with impact. Beautiful pool areas and superb setting. The staff are always polite and friendly - always ready with a smile and going out of their way to assist. When booking a room be sure to state if you want a double rather than a twin. This hotel codes 'double' as twin beds positioned next to each other. So for a shared bed you need to request a 'king size' upon booking. A small irritating change of descriptor that lead to many a confusion and many a room change request I'm sure. The rooms are of a good size with brilliant en suites - great power showers. We had a large balcony - more of a terrace which was perfect for a g&t as the sun went down. We were on an all-inclusive package eating from the main restaurant each meal whilst in the hotel. Whilst I am never a fan of buffet style dining the quality and range of good was astounding. Always a fab selection of salads and local fruits as well as everything in between. We sampled do many new local dishes - one chef even cooking a new dish to try especially for me! If however it's Mediterranean/English fare you fancy whilst in the tropics, well then too you will not be disappointed. There were always about eight non-local dishes and about the same of Sri Lankan. Plus - if you're still peckish - a dizzying array of desserts. We arrived out of school holiday season and both pools were perfect for working off all that food, or pootling about in. On the last days of our stay however considerably more families arrived which made the pools, whilst beautiful, a little impractical for a full hotel. Whilst Western standard five star this certainly is not, overall it's a fine all inclusive offering.

We have just enjoyed a relaxing time at this hotel celebrating our wedding anniversary. The hotel provides a beautiful setting on the sea front with lovely gardens and two large pools clean and well maintained. The Pool staff are very attentive to guests needs when using these facilities. Whilst the local area is very quiet this is a good location from which to explore the South Western coastline of Sri Lanka and access to a number of popular tourist spots nearby. The staff at this hotel have been superb, eager to please guests and happy to ‚Äògo that extra mile‚Äô to make visitors feel welcomed. We must give special mention to the following staff for their hard work and for making our stay feel extra special - Jacob, Asitha, Jagath, Nimsara and Sinari. A big thank you also to Lokusuviya for his hardworking cleaning and tidying our room each day and the really friendly young man serving in the hotel gift shop! The food served in the main dining room was of a good quality and always offered a good choice of different Asian and Western dishes. We also took advantage of the drinks and snacks regularly available at the Pool side snack bar! During our stay here we were lucky to enjoy all the festivities and additional events organised by the hotel to celebrate their special New Year. We booked several trips during our stay with Rasika, a local guide, who can be found at the edge of the hotel/beach front. He offers good value and local knowledge/experience and we were happy to support local people rather than the large companies. We were fortunate to enjoy the Elephant Safari at Udawalawa, the Madu river cruise, a day trip to the Galle Fort town and spent time at Hikkaduwa swimming with the large Turtles. We also arranged to see the iconic Stilt Fishermen, the rather moving Tsunami Museum and spent time relaxing on the lovely beach at Unawatuna. Thank you again to ALL of the hardworking staff at Heritance Ahungalla hotel. We have really enjoyed our stay here.

Had a good time with my wife in this hotel. The hotel has designed in a beautiful structure and swimming pool and front pond brought a marvelous scenery to my eyes. Very calm and quiet environment. Rooms are comfortable and service was up to the standard. Foods were delicious and the staff were friendly. We were really enjoyed and will definitely come again in next year.

We stayed the night in a luxury room with a huge sitting/dining area and a separate king bedroom area. Lots of space for our little ones. Room was well appointed and amenities as listed on hotel website. Eventhough bathroom was good size, the raised up jacuzzi tub with an overhead shower was impratical. Literally need to climb in and out of the tub. We didn't experience the award winning cuisine from the buffet dinner. (Extremely salty grilled prawns, burnt BBQ meat. Poor food presentation). Breakfast was a tad better. Our benchmark was the dinner buffet at Heritance Kandalama. That's what we called award winning. We enjoyed the two pools and the wonderful beach right at the hotel doorstep. The service from the staff was excellent. Hotel ground was beautiful with a majestic view of the Indian Ocean especially from the lobby. Recommended if you get a good deal otherwise not worth paying the high price as this is 3.5 stars not luxury 5.

We absolutely loved our stay at the Heritance. Food was amazing, all the staff were friendly and welcoming. Special mention to Rukmal who cleaned our room, he made extra effort and it was really special. Would definitely recommend this hotel.

We had a wonderful visit. Food was amazing and menu was fabulous with different meals both morning and evening over the course of seven days. A lot of variety the pool was great. There are two pools one more for family fun and the other more for relaxation and more quiet. Both are very large and well-maintained, the service was incredible and everybody was very friendly and helpful. We were definitely go again.

1st Strange that I am the first to review this in 2015 despite this been a popular destination. Before going I had a look at the web site. I saw a couple of brocken links and informed them but they did not respond back to me... I was a bit skeptical as a 5 star hotel needs to keep its web site 5 star. My skeptism was correct when I went there... I felt the staff was not bothered about good service. They were in general NOT FRIENDLY. The hotel I found not to be well maintained. Things are getting old and discoloured. They did not have a changing room for the pool. Thus you need to change in your room and go. Through the hotel to the pool (I am talking about the main pool). Food was good. Generally it was ok but I was expecting a lot more. I would say this is more of a 4+ star hotel than a 5 Star.

Customer service is excellent. and there is a huge pool. Saturdays and Sundays are great. The food, the service, the staff, the room, everything was perfect. There is no point in describing it all. One must experience it. it's the best place I've ever been and I simply can not wait to go back.

There was some minor renovations of the neighbouring rooms, but since we were mostly at the pool or out during the day, it didn't really bother us. Helpful attentive staff and a great breakfast. Other meals were good too. Loved the in house guests only pool as compared to the main pool as it had more shade. But main pool had a lovely view of the ocean. This hotel has its charm in its design and fittings. Not like the neighbouring Riu which I'm sure is great but is more modern and ... well white. The beach here is clean and really nice. Nothing much near the hotel, except the turtle hatcheries. May not appeal to many but do understand that at least the eggs are being hatched and released rather than consumed. So don't begrudge the entrance fees.

I'm from Kandy. We (myself and my wife) went to Kandalama in dabulla and had a great time So we wanted to take our parents as well. It's pointless of going to the same place (Kandalama) twice therefore we decided to go to ahungama heritance since it's all from the same family. There's about 220km from kandy (up and down both about 450-500Km) it was along trip. by the time we got to the hotel it was 5.00pm on 05/12/2015. We told the reception we have 2 bookings, one double room and one triple room. The welcoming lady was a fat girl and she was very rude to us she did not support at all even when filling the forms during the check in. and she took us to our rooms Double room (215)was ok but the triple room was very small (216) and fully packed most of all there were only 2 beds, so when i inquire about the 3rd bed from that girl we said " Ah.... ok i will send a folding bed for you" As if like we are servants/slaves. I told her politely. I request for a triple room and I have already done the payment by visiting to your headoffice at aitken spence colombo. Her reply was "all our rooms are this size there is nothing we can do" I said if you put another folding bed here, there is no space even to walk in this room. Her reply was "Sorry" she said it in a way either you take the room or go home, and she went away saying she will send someone with the folding bed. My mother said "don't be mad putha we all came here to enjoy not to fight the other room(215) seems to be a bit large so we shifted to the next room. Then again I thought I already paid for a triple room and I don't get the service I wanted. If the hotel has only double rooms, they should have told me when booking. they never told me that. I got mad. I called the reception and requested to connect with the manager. Unfortunately manager was not there and an executive officer was available named "Chathuranga" I told him about my situation. I have child about 10 months old. Myself mywife my child and my mother all are staying at this room, and the room is too small. he quietly listened to my situation and he asked me 5 mins and call back. then he called me and say "sir we have a large room vacant you can shift to that room" I was delighted we all went there to enjoy not to suffer and stay in a room like in a prison cell. Then again I called to chathuranga and appologised him for getting mad and raising my voice what he told me shocking. he told me "sir it's better you told me now rather than checking out, if so we couldn't have done anything for you.

Hard to fault this place as its defiantly got some class and style. Coming from Western Australia we did find the beach a bit disappointing and bizarrely very unused , most likely due to the hassle that the tourists get from the local hawkers. We got a suite upgrade for one of our rooms which was very nice and the other room was great too. Buffet breakfast was pretty good but had a very disappointing ala carte dining experience including a nearly 90 min wait for main course, which was pretty average. Pools were nice . The hotel really needs refurbishment which I believe is happening later in the year . There is also a monster new hotel being built right next door. Staff were lovely. All in all , a really good hotel just needing a facelift
Friendly and helpful staff..

Its my fifth time in Heritance and the standards continue. They have a good selection on dinning, though the dessert range seem to have come down a bit. The Fire dance entertainment is a bit of a joke. We Sri Lankans can never do it like the Africans. We rather do what we are good at like a Low-country mask dance, would have certainly thrilled the visitors than the "Fire Dance". Such dance would have even entertained the Local crowd as well as the foreigners. Parking lot for the residents can improve. Big hump (almost not visible) on the entrance gate brushed up in to my chassis of my new 2013 year car ! Wish that did not happen. Also the parking area is full of grass. They have Baby/Kids care facillity. Had we known before, we would have been prepared to get use of it.

Me and my wife stayed there in 20-21 of June, 2015 weekend (one night stay) to celebrate our second anniversary. We were in a deluxe room and it was clean and spacious. The staff was great and we were very happy about their service. And the food was amazing... all the meals were in buffet with lots of varieties and they were very tasty. And there are two pools. One pool (called Green Pool) is only for the residents and it is very beautiful. We enjoyed a lot and would like to thank all the staff for making our stay wonderful.

We vacationed with friends from 02/12/24 to 02/19/2024. The hotel is super, I don‚Äôt know who writes angry reviews. You need to understand that this is Asia. The hotel is very clean, they cleaned and changed towels every day. There are only 2 bars, one is always empty, unfortunately, the second bar always has delicious cocktails and beer (beer is so-so, like lemonade), but whiskey and cola is super. The waiters are very attentive; in general, Sri Lankans themselves are very kind. When it comes to food, you won‚Äôt be left hungry; be sure to try the oysters, incredibly tasty. There are many Russians, 70-80 percent, the rest are Europeans, but everyone is very cultured, no one bothers anyone. There was a lot of security; once I was going to the beach to visit friends at night, the security escorted me to make sure I was not alone. The ocean is gentle, the waves are just super, I don‚Äôt know who needs a lagoon, the ocean without waves is a lakeüòÅ on excursions: here they are trying to deceive our brother everywhere. Valuables just speak from their heads. We went to Kandy with Kamal, I‚Äôve attached the number. He speaks Russian and charged us for an individual session, less than what we were charged for a group session. +940776085334. Lobster at the hotel was expensive. He even offered to buy it and fry it for free in a cafe from his friends.

The hotel is terrible!!! How can you like the ruined rooms, old dirty towels, sun loungers that are falling apart!!! The service is terrible, they try to cheat at every step!!!! At the bar we ordered Black rum Bacardi, they brought it local for the price of Bacardi and also included service for what????????? Because they tried to sell local alcohol at the price of imported alcohol!!!! They also added 18% tax to the price indicated in the price list. It's not worth the money, it won't spoil your holiday by staying in this hotel!!!!
Lovely hotel... poor food
Good size pool, Pool towels are limited, and would be better if they have better pool toys.

We stayed there for one night. Room was clean and big. The food was nothing great. it was all ordinary stuff and not much variety. There are 2 big pools and the beach was nice. The water aerobic sessions were interesting. Staff were friendly.
relaxing holiday

Everything was o k except for few service setbacks in some areas. But my concern is that the food quality and selection . it didn't stand out despite having the most awarded celebrity chef. The hotel must be careful in selecting the range if foods that compliment each other and food taste was of average quality. When the hotel is championing their chefs individual brilliance they must make sure same is trickled down across the board
Aufdringliche Tuktuk Fahrer direkt vor dem Hotel

Just returned from an 11 night stay at Heritance Ahungalla and already making plans to return. Check in was fast and faultless. The room was well appointed, spotless and, considering the amount of guests, quiet too. Efficiently cleaned daily (even the balcony), tea/coffee replaced, evening turn down service, couldn't fault it. Having spent a month travelling,in Sri Lanka, this was by far the best hotel of my trip. Breakfast buffet was something to look forward too with a superb and varied choice. The evening meals had a different theme with a massive array of western and asian dishes, all cooked and presented at a high standard. After a longish stay at a hotel, buffet meals can sometimes become a bit tedious with a longing to eat elsewhere, but despite several beach cafe choices, we were never tempted away from the quality food served at the hotel. Getting tea and coffee could require a bit of patience in the mornings but this is not logged as a complaint just a niggle when you need your early morning caffiene fix. The pools are amongst the best I saw in Sri Lanka, cleaned daily, the grounds kept neat and tidy and the beach vendors kept at bay by security and a respected boundry line although they do become a complete nusiance shouting and calling out to try and sell their goods but after a couple of days they tend to get the hang of who is worth pursuing and who needs to keep having sales tactics applied to. Beach is a beautiful mile plus of fine sand backed by palm trees and suprisingly free of plastic debris; not totally free but judged against standards of some asian beaches and the collection of bags etc that gets washed up, it's a gem. Only problem is that a walk along this beach is punctuated by the attention of several 'best friends' you never knew you had that want to get you to a cafe/gem shop/ tour but a firm 'no thanks' seems to be respected. There is a handy wine shop to the right of the hotel and several little shops that sell most stuff you could need but don't let any of the men that pounce on you the moment you walk through the gate follow you or continue any sort of converstion as they will be clocking a commission at your expense for taking you to the shop. They get the plan and politely telling them to stop, stay here and don't follow me is respected and didn't cause offence. Would I return to this hotel, too right I will. Would I recommend it, absolutely without hesitation!
Reopened post Tsunami

From the moment we entered the hotel lobby and until we left, the hotel staff took an excellent care of us. They were really helpful, friendly and professional. As we have experienced the hospitality in many hotels in Sri Lanka, like to note that HERITANCE- Ahungalla is one of the best hotels in down south. Amazing hospitality. Great locality. Staff was very good. Clean pool, great resort atmosphere. Located well with all amenities. Had a great experience living there. Live music is played every evening by good well known bands. Drinks were also affordable.

At one stage furing the tour planning, we planned to stay two nights at Heritance, Ahangulla. We thank our forefathers that we decided otherwise. It would have been an expensive disaster had we stayed there any longer than the 12 hours that we spent there. I can not fathom who ever gave this hotel a five star rating. It must be with the help of some under hand dealings. The mistake I did was that the tour was booked through the agency who owned this hotel. There is an obvious conflict of interest here. This is at best a three star hotel.....nothing more. Minuses: unclean floors, dirty pool, dirtier pool towels, fountain with black water in the front of the hotel and by the side of the main dining area, walls, roof all badly needing a stroke of paint, cracked walls, beaches infested with intrusive locals, stray dogs.... Plus: couldn't think of any!

One of the best resort properties in this part of the globe...you might just start liking it so much...you might not miss home...:(. The food is excellent...very genuine hotel staff...cant wait to go back again.

We went to Sri Lanka, and spent 5 days at the end of our trip at this hotel. It is quite tired, but this was offset by magnificent pools, best food, and really good service. Had the service and food been bad, we would not consider the place. But it was great, hence the positive review. Only problem is that there are no villagers around, so other than the polluted beach, not much to see. Or do.

We went to Heritance Ahungalla to celebrate our anniversary and travelled as a family. We selected Heritance as it was by Geoffrey Bawa whose architecture my son loves. And we were not disappointed. The architecture was amazing - simple lines, wide open spaces that blend with nature.... From the moment we stepped in to the hotel, everything was perfect. The view that greets you is amazing! The rooms were excellent and the food delicious.. From the welcome until we checked out the service was fantastic, the staff friendly and accommodating. They all went out of the way to make our special day a truly memorable one. A special thank you from us to all the staff members who went out of their way to make our anniversary a day to remember. Looking forward to another visit!

I‚Äôve spent wonderful days at Heritance Ahungalla thanks above all to the lovely and very kind Ms Sanduni who took care of me during my staying,and also thanks to the master chefs Lakmal and Heshan who delighted me with excellent dishes and cakes.I really hope to go back again.

Nothing to say much. Dont go their for offers. Locals are troublemakers for them. Only good thing is food (but limited spred ). Very compact rooms , bathrooms and even dining area. Unfriendly staff. Never expect this..

We decided to stay at Heritance Ahungalla as it was designed by an architect that we like - Geoffrey Bawa. Later we realized so are many hotels en route Ahungalla from Colombo. Having said that, it sure is a beautiful hotel with two vast pools overlooking the beach. The brand is all about the blend of tradition and modernity. The service staff were all in their white sarongs with white shirts. The rooms were a bit disappointing. We requested for a triple room and realized that it is a double with an extra bed. We really thought there would be more space. The maintenance was not as good and lamp shades were falling off. For a property of that size and price the in-room amenities were dated including a large tube television that juts into the walk path. There were a lot of renovation going on and we had to walk through scaffolding all the time. We also had this noon drills and plumbing noise that would not let us take that much needed siesta. The food was again a strong blend of Lankan and Continental. I was ok with an odd piece of dried fish in my food. My wife and kids were not. So I had to taste the dishes before they ate. But the traditional food was enjoyable and we gorged. There is a fine dining restaurant in the property and I would rate that very high. The pools were fabulous - clean, well maintained and addictive. The gym was old, grubby and rusted (most of the equipment were not usable). When we go to Sri Lanka again we will not go south as it is intended to rip off unsuspecting tourists. And so we will not stay at Heritance Ahungalla either. I think all properties in that stretch of Bentota, Ahungalla are overrated. I would rather stay in a boutique property at Fort Galle.

This is by far my most favorite hotel in Sri Lanka... It's luxury and comfort with the welcoming and relaxing feeling of being right at home.. The staff are extremely friendly and accommodating and went out of there way to tend to our every need.. Exceptional service which I have never experienced anywhere.. The food was fantastic.. The rooms were beautifully decorated, very comfortable and well thought of with all the amenities you would need.. They even helped us make baby food for my little niece.. And the views were simply breathtaking.. I can't wait to go back again to this amazing place with warm smiles, amazing food, beautiful architecture and most importantly the relaxed, peaceful and calm surroundings.. Absolutely loved it!!!

Would love to thank all the members of Heritance Ahungalla who supported to success SLITHM Food and Beverage-025 Hotel Visit. It was a great place and the service was on a great level. And would love to give a special thank to Mr. Praveen Fernando, F&B Executive.

Heritance ahungalla is the best hotel I have ever been. Service is really good. Food is delicious. staff is amazing. We had a lovely time. We want to come again to this beautiful beach.... thank you heritance for relaxing holiday....................................................................................

i had stayed two nights at this Hotel i have nothing to complain about the offerings but would like to mention that i noticed there is some improvement to the service offered compared to my stay thress years ago, i also noticed that overall staff are friendly willing to help since i have a toddler whenever we go to the restaurant the door staff open door help lift the stroller up the few steps, many of the chefs manning the cooking stations were helpful one such gentleman was M.C.De Silva he offered to make us a simple toddler meal that our toddler would like to have in other words a kids meal free of charge, he was humble and extremely polite, his speciality was making great Hoppers that he churned out at the hopper station during breakfast to keep up with the demannd, i have had hoppers in other hotels as well but this guy knew the right consistency and performed fast in delivering the demand for hoppers.you get that feeling that you have stepped in to a hotel but then you feel at home with the service.

Overall, the facilities were nice but we found this property to be poorly managed. 1) Check-in process wasn't organized well. 2 days after check-in, I was contacted and told I had an extra person and I had to pay more money. They didn't even bother understanding their error! We had provided all passports at check-in and we had booked 3 rooms. They had mixed up the adults/kids in the rooms and thought we tried to sneak in an adult at a kid rate. How is that possible if we provided our passports at check-in??? Then at check-out I was still charged and had to get it resolved again. 2) Food was average. And the setup is not optimal. Buffet is split into 2 rooms, with one room having large, open doors which basically let's in bugs/flies. This comes across as unhygienic and dirty. 3) When sitting out by the pool, had to ask 3 times to get towels and ended up getting them ourselves. 4) The room setup isn't good. The bathroom has blinds so it makes it really awkward for someone to use the bathroom. Also, the thermostat directions are on the balcony door (why not next to the thermostat). 5) We arrived on a Wednesday and were excited there would be a show. The show was terrible with what appeared to be some sort of mime type of performance. 6) The gym is a joke! You don't even feel like working out. It's small & cramped with old equipment. 7) There is one elevator that is old and slow.

Had mixed feelings about the hotels. I was not bad but was never 5 star. The check in could have been done in a more pleasing manner. The staff was too harsh, not even with a proper smile on the face to welcome the guests. The much needed cold towels were not provided. We stayed in a standard room and is quite ok though three's nothing outstanding. The furniture was of good quality and the rooms had a prestigious look. We stayed in a tripple and the extra bed was a total disappointment. The mattress was terrible. The verandah of the room was nice and big. Toothbrushes, tooth pastes and a shaving kit was missing in the room. I had to give a few calls to get them to my room. there was central air conditioning with temperature control, but yet the temperature controller seemed not to work right. The bathroom was ok but could have been bit more large. The common areas of the second and the third floor was neither air conditioned nor had proper ventilation. So you can hardly relax on a sofa there. the food was good. had nice sea food. But need to have a few notches up to get it to 5 star level. The service was terrible. the staff is too harsh. No body has a smile on their face and you would have a real unpleasant situation. Those in the dining were ignorant of the guest's needs. During the dinner I had to ask five times to get a bottle of water. They take hours to prepare a new table. A really inefficient staff lacking the professionalism. The two pools were really good. both really large and well maintained. The green pool has a great privacy and is much better than the main one. That of course is 5 star. The towels by the pools were too old and doesnt sute for the five star quality. If you are finding some nice hotel to stay near Galle and if your budget permits the best would be the "The Fortress" Koggala and even the light house hotel may do better.
Unforgettable stay at Heritance...

We were unfortunate to stay at this hotel on a day that they celebrated the Earth Day in 2023. We love, encourage, and actively participate in similar programs. The problem was, how the hotel management went about the celebration and their lack of planning. Hotel management decided to shut all electrical lights in the downstairs lobby area, then lighted kerosene torches. There were so may kerosene torches lit all over the area (including bar, near pool etc.) and the smell was unbearable, air was unbreathable. Add 100C temperature and humidity to the situation and it was absolute hell. What was the point of this stupid show? They probably added more pollutant to the air by burning all the kerosene for few hours than the greenhouse gases emitted to generate electricity. Stupidity at its best was in display at Heritance Ahungalla on 3/23/23.

Overall I would say this is a superb hotel and would definately recommend it to anyone wanting a relaxing place to stay. The hotel is very clean, the rooms are large and spacious and all the staff are very accomodating. The two infinity pools are lovely and the loungers around them can be moved in to the shade very easily or in to the sun when required. As we went off peak it was incredibly quiet and for 3 days there were only 2 couples around the second pool. The beds are very comfortable and the bathrooms well equipped with large showers and always immaculately clean. Breakfast was always very good with a huge range of food, with omlettes freshly cooked to order. Try the Egg Hoppers! Evening meals were available in the main restaurant generally tended to be from a set menu and were always a high standard - although the Sri Lankans tend to put two different dishes on one course. The Coffee Shop was also very good - you have to try Rice an Curry - a real treat. The Negative Points: On two occassions I sent food back only to have the original food returned........ the first was a chicken burger which I specifically requested to have no cheese on, it was returned with cold chips and the cheese scraped off - absolutely disgusting in my book and they were very apologetic about it. However the waiter spilt an orange juice over another plate of food and said he would get a fresh one, but when he returned the food was still soaked with OJ and underneath the salad there were remnants of the juice, so once again the plate had just been wiped down. I understand they were incredibly quiet but keeping costs down at the expense of the guest is not on. At weekends a lot of Sri Lankans tend to come and stay and the hotel becomes incredibly noisy. If you like early nights and peaceful sleeping I would definately recommend you request a room away from the main pool area. We arrived and were put in to a room facing the main pool and just on walking in the room knew it would be too noisy. We could still clearly hear the Fri and Sat night entertainment in our replacement room and Sat night there was really loud music on until midnight. If you value some peace ask for rooms at the far ends of the hotel. A word of warning regarding the beach hawkers...... unfortunately we had a bad experience with Emile De Silva, we arranged a couple of trips and an evening meal at the Sunshine Restaurant. Whilst the trips were 'ok' I felt crowded by having him, a driver and someone else join us (a trick for getting more money out of us by asking for bigger tips), they rushed us around the nice places and didn't really give us any space and didn't deliver on the glass bottomed boat, whilst still wanting the same money. The evening meal also never materialised with 2 different excuses given and then making us walk miles down the beach to another location which was actually on the road. We lost 1000 rupees as we refused to go as they had not told us earlier in the day there was a problem. Otherwise the other people on the beach were great, the ladies selling the 'sari's' were great fun and whilst they did try and call us over all the time they were lovely. Whilst the negative points above need to be considered, please don't let it put you off. The hotel was wonderful and all the staff would fall over themselves to help. It certainly looks by far the most superior hotel on that coastline. We have certainly agreed we will be returning in 2 years time. Tourism in Sri Lanka is desperately needed and when you spend your money you are treated like Kings. Tip: Take a trip to Unawatuna - a stunning little beach outside Galle which was charming and filled with the locals.

We stayed here for 3 nights at the end of our touring holiday. Although we had a room with a beach view it was above the bar area - and each evening we had to endure really loud really awful karaoke type music. Luckily this only went on until just past 11 but it sure wasn't the peaceful, relaxing stay we had anticipated. We asked to change rooms but were told it was not possible. The food was luke warm and the service, particularly for drinks, was slow. We did enjoy time spent around the quieter of the 2 pools and the beach was only a short stroll away. There were touts but we got used to them, it's a third world country after all. It wasn't a disastrous stay by any means but I would describe it as more of a 3 star than it's supposed status of 5 star - so it's expensive for what you get. Be warned - it's about 3-4 hours drive from the airport.

We've been holidaying at Heritance Ahungalle for around 10 years, and have always loved it. Unfortunately it's now in a very sorry state. I can no longer recommend it. The management is shoddy, and the staff barely trained. We faced a catalogue of bad experiences - long waits at check in, meals not being available until 20-30 minutes after advertised start time, wrong orders at bar, shoddy service .... and on and on. The swimming pools and beach are still excellent. But the rest has sadly been allowed to slip. Such a pity.

I have been to this hotel once before and it has managed to exceed my expectations. Great Service and Brilliant Staff, A family friendly atmosphere. Reasonable variation in cuisine to suit all flavor palates. Loved the location, excellent place to get away from your busy life.
There was some maintenance going on, so got woken up in the morning by loud noises a few times. I wish they could inform me in advance.

This is a five star hotel. We got superb food Night club And soooo many activities However, the old area of the hotel has small rooms which a are not acceptable for a star class hotel at all The new side of the hotel has nice rooms.

In general: Architecturally very generously designed hotel complex with beautiful green areas directly on the Indian Ocean. The hotel definitely stands out from other hotels due to the friendliness and exceptional service of the staff. Thanks for letting me be part of the Heritance family for three weeks. I will definitely come back. Rooms: The rooms are larger than average and have a kettle and refrigerator in addition to the general standard. Recommended is the ‚Äúlaundry service‚Äù, fast, clean and inexpensive. The housekeeping was good, thanks for the towel animals or flowers on my bed. In the evening the bed was revealed, the curtains were closed and if necessary the towels were changed again. Restaurant/Bars: In the restaurant, the high level of service is noticeable. You are led to a table set with cloth napkins and bread plates at each meal. Light background music underlines the atmosphere. Thank you Duminda, the good soul of the restaurant, and thank you Jananja for the always professional service. The offer as well as the quality of the food were above average and prepared with a lot of attention to detail. Extra wishes were also gladly fulfilled. Thanks for that, Kavindu. I was lucky enough to be able to take part in the gigantic buffets on Christmas and New Year's Eve. Chapeau Keshan!!! Service: The absolute plus of the hotel is the leadership and exceptional service of the staff. You always feel welcome as a guest. Staff are always friendly. As a solo traveler, I never felt lonely, but rather as part of the hotel family. Danke an Jayaru, Guest Relations Executive. She's helped me with some of my affairs. I'm really looking forward to seeing you again. Location/surroundings. Directly in front of the hotel entrance you can take public transport or tuk tuk to the surrounding towns. Excursions I booked through Sunil. You can find him on the beach. He speaks good German and is very reliable.

If there can be more water sports available will be nice.Staffs are so kindly to solve our requirements. Environmentally-friendly hotel with groups of monkeys and cranes. I would say that this is one of the fantastic resorts that I have been to as you enter the beach overlooking is very relaxing and eye appealing.... This is a very nice hotel to get some rest and recreation, especially for a family with kids. Although the hotel is old, it has some great architectural features. There are courtyards with lush foliage, which gives a cool atmosphere. The grounds are full of trees too, which provides well-needed shade during the daytime. Big pool and the ocean is right next to it. The rooms are also nice and comfortable. The design and interiors are a bit old fashioned, which I personally liked, but not if you are looking for modernism. The staff is very friendly, and the food is quite good, with a lot of variety at all meals. They even had a kids table, which I found very quaint.
Slightly underwelmed

We stayed from 18 to 21 January with a group of 13 family members. This was the second hotel in the Heritance group we stayed at during our 23 day holiday in Sri Lanka. Compared to Heritance Kandalama Ahungalla was a real disappointment. It looks great when you first arrive - the pool looks fantastic but everything else about it was disappointing - the tiles in the foyer area and along the corridors are stained, the bathrooms need a really good scrub, the food in the buffets was boring and many of the staff looked like they just didn't want to be there. Overall there just didn't seem to be the attention to detail we saw at Kandalama - we booked 3 double rooms, 2 twins and one triple room. On arrival the 3 doubles were all made up as twins and the triple had only 2 beds. One of the couples called reception on arrival to have the beds remade as a a double and had no problems, the second called and was told that it was not their practice to do that and in order to have a double bed the couple would have to be moved and that couldn't happen at the time because the hotel was full, the third couple then rang and was upgraded to a better room, despite the previous couple being told that there were no other rooms at all. In the triple room a small fold out bed was provided and most of the first evening was spent trying to explain to the staff that the tiny bed was not large enough for a teenage boy. Eventually after much conversation a better bed was provided. My parents have visited this hotel 4 times, however I would not go there again. In its current condition it is not worth the price charged.

We stayed at this place for 4 days 3 nights - US$1,100, included a lame New Year buffet and "celebration" (US$125 per person) This hotel bore no resemblance with its sister hotel in the same group Heritance Kandalama (where we stayed over Christmas and which was impressive). The architectual and design elememts that make Heritance Kandalama very special are total lacking in the Heritance Alungalla. The level of service could not compared. The attitude of staff generally was insincere and gear towards tips rather than service. We also had 2 experiences of male staff members making inappropriate comments to the females in our group. The food was uninspiring at best and unhygenically prepared at worst (one of our party and a known other guest were both made ill by poor food preparation.) When the issue was raised on our departure with the most senior staff member made available (only a room division manager), no responsiblity was taken nor apology offered and the stock response was that the guest had not until then made a formal complaint (despite the matter being known to reception and housekeeping staff) and the guest was blamed for not having asked for a hotel doctor at the time. The room we had was an attempt maximizing a corner area and was at first glance impressive. However, not all the electrics were wired up and the basic layout of the location of the light switches was poor (you have to get out of bed to turn off the bed side light). And one of the toilet in the suite smelt which affected our enjoyment of the suite. We couldn't use the sitting area of the suite. To cap it all, having paid US$100 for a vehicle to take us to the airport, the hotel provided a desperately underpower, mini people mover which had no safety belts for passengers (an essential requirement for Sri Lankan roads). Compared to the rest of our experience of accommodation in Sri Lanka, Heritance Alungalla was over-priced and poor value. It is definitely not 5 star accommodation as it claims to be. It just seems to be a money making "machine". The main positive point about this hotel is the beach which is beautiful like the rest of the West coast of Sri Lanka (you do have to however put up with beach touts). We will be lodging a formal complaint to the hotel but given their initial response we do not expect any joy.
Amazing venue for an amazing wedding

From the initial approach up the gated drive,the infinity pool in reception,courteous welcome: it only got better.Room was very clean.On ground floor,pool just outside the patio doors.Food was plentiful ,varied and delicious.We always ate outside.Only ever 3 or so couples out there.Attentive service.Cannot compliment the staff more,they were superb.Beach clean and big..Going back to do another tour in 2014.Heritance will be on our return visit list.

Having had our honeymoon at the Heritance Kandalama 6 years ago, during this years' vacation to Sri Lanka we decided to experience another Heritance Hotel with our families and we are more than happy over the stay at Heritance Ahungala. The pictures do not do justice to the beautiful landscape and ofcourse the highly commendable team; the excellence of service by the Aitken hotel staff is something I always admire. Very smooth checking & checkout with special thanks to the Front office Manager Lakshitha who was very informative about the services offered and organized everything for us. Tharindu we will never forget your sincere smile and the service. We were offered a lovely cake congratulating for our 6th wedding anniversary. The surprise birthday cake for my brother in law was also well presented and special thanks goes to the Restaurant & Bar Manager Thushara, Madu, Panditha and of course Chef Thilakaratne you are doing an amazing job to make sure the team is serving the best food and tirelessly looks into making a happy dining experience. We really loved the food and the variations (makes me wanna go back!) The "yare tea" at breakfast was something to remember and loved the variety of hoppers (yum "pani appe" after ages!) Of course we will come again. You will not regret a long stay over here with delectable food, easy access to the beach, 2 beautiful pools (loved the green pool), outdoor sauna, well equipped gym, and within close proximity to attractions like madu river safari, turtle hatchery, & less than an hours' drive to Galle.
Wonderful 5 star hotel

Two of us stayed here for a business trip to this area. The staff are fantastic, friendly, courteous and ever helpful. The hotel itself is on a beach and the views are incredible. The Internet is not strong enough in the rooms, our mobile devices seemed to work but when trying to log in with computers it was a different story. The hotel was quiet, 1/3 of the rooms full yet the hotel still gave us two rooms above the karaoke that started at 8pm thru to midnight. We both moved room but not sure why the hotel would give these two rooms when the noise was so loud the walls were shaking. The restaurant was also a disappointment - cost wise was actually higher than some 5 star hotels in Colombo, and the quality not as good, as well as the restaurant under renovation and moved to a banquet room with no view - overall food was a disappointment.
Awesome service
It is an awsome hotel. Would like to plan next trip to Heritance.

I've only checked in but so far my experience is terrible. Booking and check in process was thoroughly disorganized and apathetic. Location and hotel are beautiful though so I hope the trip proves from here.

Nice hotel, but getting a bit tired. In need of some renovation. Rooms were comfortable, but had to be moved after first night because our so called de-luxe sea view room was situated immediately above the kitchen and dining rooms. Very difficult to see the sea, due to heavy tree line. Replacement room was much better. Restaurant and food were excellent with great choices every morning at breakfast and then again at dinner in the evening. Staff were very helpful and always with a smile. Service was slow in the restaurant. Bar staff were great. This is not a five star hotel, more between three and four.

Holiday at Heritance Ahungalla
Wonderful visit!

On our way from Colombo to Galle we stopped by this establishment without prior reservation. The grand driveway and facade of the Heritance Hotel where impressive at first sight. Having arrived there the good impression faded quickly. The room rate given at the reception was US-Dollar 140 per room without breakfast, which is expensive for the island, but we accepted without a written receipt. First of all we had to wait over 1 hour to get the room. By that time the dinner was about to finish, so we were advised to go to the restaurant where a buffet was presented. The quality of the dishes were far from higher standards. The room was alright, but nothing special. The hotel was crowded with tourist groups from China. The next morning by the tome of check-out a bill was presented of 280 US-Dollar. The chef concierge refused to get the man on duty from yesterday night. The outrageous room rate was ompared by us with rates shown on booking sites. The same night rooms had been available from 58 US-Dollar! After were rude discussions we left the hotel with a "discount" of 60 US-Dollar and paid incredible 220 US-Dollar. A never come back experience!

We have stayed at Heritance Ahungalla several times, and find its a lovely hotel with excellent food and great, courteous, helpful and friendly staff. The kids loved swimming in the pool, table tennis, badminton and the gym. As teenagers, they spent all their time outdoors. The live music at the bar had us on our feet dancing away! The wide range of food in all the buffet meals were delicious and we were even given a tour of the kitchen which was very interesting. We have enjoyed our stay here, I would recommend it to all my friends in Melbourne :)
A popular beach hotel but it‚Äôs no resort.
Not a 5 Star hotel - no entertainment - poor restaurant choices.

We stayed here for two nights. At first we were given a standard room, but our toilet was not working. So thankfully we were upgraded. After this small hitch, all our tour group was upgraded. This lovely hotel, has two beautiful pools and it is quiet and relaxing. The food at this hotel is also good, the staff are friendly and overall a pleasant stay. However on checkout much confusion with bills being mixed up within our tour group. This took about 45 minutes to sort out and when the cashier was asked for proof of purchase, he had to fish the receipts from the bin. This system needs an overhaul to ensure correct bills are billed to the correct person. Would definitely stay here again.
Suits are very larger and having a beautiful view of the beach and a pool.

I am currently in the hotel for 4 nights, may observation: Last city before returning to Colombo tomorrow 1 excellent location 2 2 hours from Colombo 3 enjoyed long beautiful beach ( sunset and sunshine) 4 excellent food varieties of local and European style 5 relaxing under the trees with beautiful sound of the Indian Ocean 6 children are happy with pools 7 nice celebration of New Year 8 good staff with smile 9 comfortable room and room service 10 24 hours coffee restaurant with delicious food Important points: Improve the jacuzzi with warm water near the pool Massage you can make it outside cheaper than the hotel Visit Galle city - very beautiful photos you can take one hour drive To be car full when go to the ocean ( deep and strong waves) they cannot control The area ( long beach). Visit the turtle center 10 minutes by tuk tuk you can see the white one appear only One in 2 millions. Dr Adel Aloffi Bahrain
