Amazing resort!!!

After visiting the sister hotel in dambulla, I had high expectations for customer service. However I was sadly disappointed apart from a very few members of staff. We arrived after touring Sri Lanka for our honeymoon for a rew days relaxation by the beach.. Dispite the local security we were often harrassed by the local "beach boys". A stroll on the beach was anything but relaxing. Although not a private beach the constant calling and shouting at by the locals was very annoying. Even after explaining we were on our honeymoon we were still surrounded by a number of the locals. Obviously this is made worse by the lack of security at the hotel, which allows locals to stroll around even to the resident only pool. After on evening sitting for a pre dinner drink I noticed a number of flis around and which point my husband pointed the food and liquid on the adjacent table. After letting the staff know and expecting a prompt clean up, nothing was done about the mess. In comparison to other hotels within this chain and other hotels we stayed at the hotel was not well maintained. I never saw anyone clean the main lobby and bar areas dispite obvious mess. In fact e only time I say a brush was during a lunchtime of heavy rain to brush the water out and this was only done once. There is a lack of information provided by the hotel. This could easily be rectified by adding a little more information into the room guide. Information about the surrounding area, places to visit and information about food within the restaurant. The hotel food however was of brilliant quality. We enjoyed a meal at the fine dining restaurant and can say this food would not have been out of place at any top london restaurant. The food at the the al a carte restaurant was also of a good standard. The evening buffet was expensive and so we avoided this as we felt it would be poor value and probably poor service what experience we had of breakfast. Now breakfast was a terrible fair, although a wide selection of food not enough waiters or chefs. We came down for breakfast at various times, but noticed if we came after 9.30 no one was around to provide tea or coffee or chefs to cook the food. If we came earlier it was so busy we had to queue for the dishes and the cold foods we're not refilled often enough. Rooms were of a good size and clean. However try to get a room a reasonable distance from the lobby as this can be noisy especially on the weekend. All in all this hotel has the basis for being lovely. The food was good, the views gorgeous, just a little more customer service and focus would improve anyone's experience massively. Maybe the staff here should vist kanadlama or the tea factory for some tips!

The property is located in a great location and really easy to access. The bawa architecture is well preserved and presented. The pocket gardens maintained within the property is really nice. Food was really good and need to appreciate the staff because they are really friendly and helpful. We had in room dining for our baby and they provided the food without any hesitation. Room we had we spacious and comfortable. They stay was calm and very relaxing and recommends anyone to visit the hotel
Bad rooms
Poor accommodations
Excellent Service with friendly staff....

I was attending a wedding held on 20th December 2014 and a friend of mine and I had decided to stay at Heritance. Coming from the UK I was keen to stay close to the wedding venue and enjoy the supposed five star luxury that this hotel boasted to offer. My friend a resident of Sri Lanka arranged the accommodation some five months in advance for us to stay from 19 Dec till 21 Dec, using Booking.com. However upon arrival, they didn't have our booking for 19 only 20. Some 45 minutes, emails and phone calls later I was given a room based on half board. The room itself was large and nice. A bit dark in decor but view of sea front was nice. The hotel is large however there is no clear indication of how the rooms are numbered on each floor. There is according to the member of staff showing me to my room a north and South wing again this is not indicated visibly so it's easy to get lost. The entrance of the hotel is stunning however the rest of the hotels falls in comparison. For four hours I was without WIFI, a number of phone calls later a staff member turns up and fiddles with my phone including switching my phone off airplane mode connecting me to my UK service provider and leaving me with a ¬£40.00 data roaming fee whilst still not realising that the Wifi was an issue with the hotel and not my phone. After trying to relocate me to a new room much smaller with a terrible view I eventually head in hands and eyes filled with tears of frustration and tiredness, was placed in a more pleasant room with a bigger balcony that over looked the sea and the wedding venue. The sliding door which acts as a blackout was unable to fully close because the side table was too big. I had to move this in order for the blackout to fully close. The air conditioner controls were broken in all three rooms so I had to use my nails to switch off the air conditioner. The shower cubicle was placed in such a away that you had to get in close the door before turning shower on. The hotel toiletries were poor - the shower gel and shampoo were all placed in bottles that were not sealed and the soap was well rather useless. There were also no small hand towels or towels big enough to dry hair with. All in all two large bath towels and two hand towels. No bath robes either to sit and relax in. A basic I feel for a hotel claiming to be five star. The mini bar of the last room was broken and had never been checked so we found the drinks warm mouldy and in drinkable. The cost of a glass of wine in comparison to the bottle found in the mini bar also made no sense. It was cheaper in the mini bar. The dining room (only one restaurant in this hotel) was dark and dismal. The hot food area was hard to find until further inspection. The food was ok. A very basic selection. Nothing fancy or elaborate. The bar area outside by entrance was far more prettier yet the service was poor. Morning breakfast in the same dining room was a very dark and gloomy affair. The decor and seating was so basic and dark that you just didn't want to eat in there. The only blessing was the guest relations officer Shanika who was so lovely and ever so eager to ensure we were happy that she went out of her way to do everything to make us feel at ease. We were on exit served with a $200.00 a night bill which I had to question over and over again. I am really sad to say that it was really shocked and disappointed by everything I had witnessed at this "luxury" hotel and having had a thorough read of what is expected to meet the international standards of a five star hotel - this to me is just a glorified bed and breakfast. Having experienced five star luxury and also other ratings of hotels I think I have had better staying in a cheap bed and breakfast in Brighton for far less the price tag. I can't say I would recommend this hotel to anyone and would recommend those that work hard for their money go look elsewhere.
Unforgettable stay!!

This hotel is a 5 star hotel, I say that because of its high standards and of the the high hospitality of the staff no matter how good the hotel structure or the rooms are if the service is not good the hotel is never good but in this hotel the rooms food and the pools are up to the standards but the service is more than our expectations so I recommend this hotel to everyone.

Ceylan (Sri Lanka) is astonishing! Unfortunately this seaside hotel was the worse in our journey around Sri Lanka. Even if it's classified 5 stars, on reality it is not. The hotel needs a huge renovation ( a must for the 80's superb architecture from very well known Sri Lanka architect), the cleanliness could be much better and the staff (almost all of them very friendly) should have better management and be more professional. Even though ( even next time going visit Ceylan is better booking and hotel north of Colombo, because is near the cultural and forest tours), the stay was relaxing and, for a change at the far east beaches, there were 26¬∫ C 3 meter waves to brake....

A unique hotel, great service, but it‚Äôs getting old and needs work Whilst the room (suite) was large and well appointed, the bathroom in particular needs renovation. It‚Äôs just getting old and needs work. In particular the shower over a massive spa bath would be very difficult for someone unsteady on their feet to get into - apart from holding on to the glass shower screen there was nothing to hold on to. There was areas of the hotel obviously no longer used, an upstairs bar above reception was empty, the locked billiards room, and the empty kids club were all looking sad and unloved. With some investment in the rooms and some public areas this hotel could easily beat the new chain hotels springing up

It was only because of the hotels staff that my 2 nights stay here from being a horrible one to a very good experience. We checked in very late one evening and were given rooms above the coffee shop grill which meant that the rooms were full of the grill seafood smoke. A few minutes inside the rooms we started feeling like grilled fish ourselves. Upon request for room change we were told that the hotel was full and our request thus denied. Dinner at the coffee shop was a pretty sad affair too. The chicken that we were served was so hard that I am sure if I'd thrown it at a passerby that person would get hurt. After a stroll on the beach when we came to our rooms past midnight we realized that there was no water supply in the rooms due to some maintenance work and that it'd be restored around 2 am. That too did not happen. Our arms full of woes we met the Resident Manager Sampath De Silva and were surprised that he offered no arguments but only an apology. From that point onwards our stay turned into heaven. Mr Sampath offered to change our rooms and the staff went out of their way to be helpful, courteous and friendly. I'd particularly like to mention manager Praveen from the restaurants who made sure that the fare that was served to us was excellent. I'd recommend that future travellers take advantage of an exclusive special table d' hote that they arrange on the beach. The experience is put of the world.
Right hotel, wrong place
Down south sri lanka
Be carefut to send e-mail and book a hotel taxi.
Good food and nice location
1 star hotel not 5!!!! Do not go

The property is old and there was construction happening in the restaurant area. Only one restaurant was open during our stay and the Ala Carte had nothing much to write home about. The hotel does not have any facilities on the beach (no beach chairs etc.) and the beach seemed completely dry with very few tourists during our stay. Breakfast had a good range though. Rooms look old and the bathroom had strange blinds which did nothing for privacy. Not sure what I missed. Staff told me they get lot of German and Chinese tourists but I couldnt really imagine why anyone will choose to stay here rather than Bentota. Maybe during the season it is more vibrant, we unfortunately did not feel the vibrancy.

I had only food

The first thing that hits you is the chaos that reigns at the reception. It takes 30 mins to check us in . We were desperate for lunch.So at 2.30 the coffee shop seemed like a good option. But instead of quick service we were greeted by rude staff and poor service. The rice n curry we ordered was cold. Took them 25 mins to serve cold food. They did try n make up for it at their main restaurant. We were told "you just name it and we will make it". The buffet spread is vast.Vegetarian dishes they are yet to master.what they cook up as Indian fare falls woefully short.A quick rethink is needed here. Being a resort by the sea side, Heritance could have been exciting but alas the only thing that they provide is the sea! No water sports.No beach based activity. The staff is overworked. Its a mela out there. Bentota could be a better option with many hotels and resorts to choose from.Also it is the hub for water sports.

In terms of service, this is the worst experience we've had so far :D. I travelled through over 40 countries, and nowhere did I see the personnel so chilled - but not in a good way :) Restaurant & bar team easily forgets your order, and even when they don't, you can wait for a simple coffee in a bar with 2 tables occupied for over 0.5 hour. They graciously add someone else's drinks to your bill (8 glasses of wine instead of actual 2? easy!) Moreover, some of them literally beg for tips, and when you tip them, it doesn't mean the service becomes any better. I had a birthday on the first night of our stay, but the reception forgot to inform the restaurant, so we went to ask for a candle. On the same evening we asked for refill of water, coffee and tea in the room (we didn't get a refill on that day, so we called the reception to ask for it as they themselves advised us to do), but instead a boy came with a brewed coffee charged extra... The room keys didn't work on one day, so we had to go all the way back to the reception to then be escorted back to the room by the maintenance guy who spent quite some time fixing the issue. Oh, and as for maintenance, you simply can't be left in peace here - e.g., laundry man barbarically opens your door even with the DND sign on... Last but not least, on arrival, my bank card didn't work, while on the check-out it did. Quite strange. Luckily we had another card. Will I recommend this hotel? Not really. Maybe only for 1-night stay to enjoy the beauty of nature. But if you want nice service and a proper care you would expect for this price, avoid this place. :)

Nothing five star about this hotel. That doesn‚Äôt mean it‚Äôs terrible, it just doesn‚Äôt do what it says on the tin. We should‚Äôve realised when we saw the deal we got. However, blissfully unaware we departed for what was meant to be a 5* hotel in Sri Lanka. From the start things went wrong. I didn‚Äôt understand how a hotel with 5* reviews on Tripadvisor could be so different to reality. But, what they do is they hand out cards asking you to rate them 5*, i presume most oblige as if you don‚Äôt they repeatedly ask you and get a ‚Äúbit‚Äù irritated if you don‚Äôt. Unpleasant and unnecessary and not something you would ever experience in a 5* resort. Room: Our first room smelled like an ash tray, for two non smokers this was just an immediate no. After we said we wanted a new room they looked frustrated, but acknowledge the smell. Seemingly they wanted us to just ‚Äòget on with it‚Äô. I don‚Äôt know if a 5* hotel which permits smoking indoors, especially with private terraces available. Finally we moved rooms (having to unpack / repack). Our second room had a broken AC, which in 32 degree heat was also unacceptable. After two nights of no sleep, 5 complaints about the AC and being told ‚Äúit‚Äôs fine‚Äù, we finally moved to a third room. The AC worked and the room was much larger, an upgrade we thought. However, after the first night it was all clear. We were next to the maintenance and cleaning room, so at about 6.30-7am every morning we were woken up by the sound of trolly wheels on the stone floor. It is so loud that you don‚Äôt stand a chance of sleeping through. Initially they don‚Äôt turn down the bed and don‚Äôt give you the water they promise. The upside of the rooms are the large and comfy beds, and our room housekeeper (Rukhal) was good and left funny towel shapes (monkeys, dogs etc). Poolside: the pools are great, we spent most of our days by the green pool. Lots of space and a nice atmosphere. However, they don‚Äôt clear up so following morning you will find yesterdays banana skins, glasses etc. Quite disgusting. We ended up clearing up ourselves. Staff: some great members of staff, highlight was definitely Waruna. Seemingly the only trained and wanting to please member of staff. The rest don‚Äôt want to be there and expect to be greated with eye rolls and attitude even when ordering food. You feel like you‚Äôve inconvenienced them at great length. Try ordering a cappuccino at breakfast and you‚Äôll know what I mean. Especially when you get a cold one and ask for a hot one. Three people will try to tell you to drink it and then dip a finger in when you say it‚Äôs cold. Going the extra mile certainly doesn‚Äôt come naturally. Another upside was when the guest relations manager walked around asking for feedback. We shared our experience and things improved, that evening our bed was turned down, more water was given and pool was improved. It lasted merely one day though. Also, one member of staff in the restaurant wears an unsightly net vest! I think he is trying to be funny. Seems unhygienic and out of place. The hotel is filled with staff but they are untrained and only do one job e.g open door, fill water (no other beverage) so you end up waiting a long time. They also take your food away from you before you have finished and give you bill before you are ready. Stressful, to say the least. Food: the local food is great, especially the Dahl. Lots of food available and we can‚Äôt complain. Not 5* but still very good. Facilities: they claim to have several bars and restaurant but there aren‚Äôt, or at least not in use. They also have mould in several areas, cracks and paint chipping. The toilets don‚Äôt have soap and are often untidy. Spa: fab! Loved it and worth a visit. Entertainment: avoid! Hotel should stick to the live music. The shows and plays ruin what would be a romantic evening with your other half. Overall: despite all this, we had a great holiday, but that was down to my husband and I laughing about it all and making the most of it. I would even recommend this place to others, but with the caveat - you get what you pay for. It‚Äôs a firm 3*. WiFi is also fab! Tip: visit some of the local restaurants on the beach! Great food. Also, stay away from ocean - strong currents and big waves. Can be very dangerous and if red flag is up your insurance won‚Äôt cover any accidents. Don‚Äôt forget to check your bill, they say 50% off but don‚Äôt give it to you unless you remind them. Expect an eye roll and potentially an argument before it happens.
Weekends for family as it gets noisy and too many people. Pricey.
Cheap OK five-star hotel
Food is ok
Nice but not great

We were there for two days ie 06 and 07 Dec. Let me objectively articulate the good thinga and things which needs improvement: Good ones 1. Well kept resort with private access to the beach 2. Huge open swimming pool which from the reception provides an illusion as if the pool is merging into the sea..a visual delight 3. Nice rooms with a balcony and I was told all rooms were sea facing Areas for improvement: 1. The access to the beach or otherwise ia uncontrolled ie no real security or barricade ..there were outsiders/ touts soliciting business and no one controlled them. 2. Most guests were Europeans and no wonder ..the entire menu was made to cater to their preferences barring a few local items 3. The menu for both dinner and breakfast practically remained unchanged thru our stay 4. Though the staff and chef were helpful, they probably had little clue about Indian dishes / ingredients/ taste. Despite their beat effort to provide one odd dish especially for us, the food experience was far from satisfactory. So if you are Indian and crave for Indian food ...this ia not the place for you. In contrast, all other places we stayed in SriLanka ie Kandy, Nuwara Eliya or Colombo, there were some Indian dishes on offer and some of them tasted good too. 4. Lastly , despite making a special request for cake/ flowers for our anniversary and reminding that very morning again, they messed it all up. Finally with the intervention of our travel agent they did bring a cake but by then the damage was done. It also gave me a feeling that they are probably still under slave mindset of licking the white skun. Thus on balance, 3 to 3.5 stars is what I will give

staff are very polite and very kind. ... i have only one comment Kindly toilet glass need to cover sticker or wall poster because we are staying double sharing room but bath toilet feel uncomfortable..
Unforgettable stay
it‚Äôs ok, but there is better

A hotel that has an impeccable service and warmth about it. From the time you enter to the time you leave the staff will make you feel so at home. Filled with smiles and excellent service 24/7. A wonderful atmosphere with an infinity pool to die for. However i would like to give some constuctive feedback to the hotel management with regard to food. As a five star resort i expected the food on weekdays to be what i would say awesome. But i was disappointed to see the buffet was average. It didnt make me say wow and the dishes were predictable each time i came to the buffet as i stayed 3 nights. I was surprised to hear the hotel has an award winning chef. However it did not reflect so with the cuisine. The silver food containers were very hard to open and close. The buffet should be more colorful and the dessert needs to have variety as i have experienced in other five star hotels in sri lanka. The hotel didnt have a tea/coffee buffet for the evening tea. (As advised by the staff when inquired). Other hotels provide these services for full board guests. The tea in the room is not that pleasant due to the creamer tasting weird with tea. So they need to have a tea corner as well. Next time i return to the hotel i wish see this as a five star hotel to its fullest and not only to the star count. Dinuk Weerasekara (Sri Lanka)
Rocommend at least one night stay at one of their suites
Ask for a sea facing room..

Stayed for two nights found the room to be disappointing, small and a bit dirty, net curtains were stained as well as the rug on the floor very marked. Only one towel in room until more brought at 6pm which was a bit late. Toiletries supplied very poor, bathroom needed a good clean. Found the buffet to be disappointing and dishes not refilled very often also one night the vegetables were very undercooked, also little choice. Breakfast buffet good. Pool and beach lovely. snacks from pool bar good also.
First visit but hopefully not the last!

This is a first class hotel right on the beach. Very spacious well equipped rooms, beautiful grounds and 2 large pool. Nice restaurant with Buffett but was lacking the choices we had experienced elsewhere in Sri Lanka. The family members I travelled with like a cocktail before dinner but less than half the cocktails listed on the menu were unavailable. They had no limes in a country that has heaps of citrus fruit. We stayed a few nights and still no limes at the end. Only a small thing but I‚Äôm sure they could have bought some just outside the resort.

From most of the reviews here and because of the generally good reputation of Heritance hotels we had high expectations for our stay here. This was the last part of our Sri Lankan trip before returning to Colombo and the plan was to relax and enjoy a luxury hotel along a beautiful beach. The beach was beautiful but the hotel was disappointing. Pros: -Beautiful beach-clean, not crowded. -Decently appointed room with large balcony. -Wifi that worked well. -Lovely reception area and infinity pool. Cons: -Room floor was sandy, bathroom mats with dirt smudges. -Bad housekeeping service. After being out all morning our room still wasn't cleaned - I called and asked to have it done right away while we were at lunch. They finally arrived while we were napping three hours later. -Broken minibar never repaired or replaced, after we requested -Breakfast buffet restaurant -Very strong moldy/mildewy smell permeates. Buffet adequate but not great. Chaotic atmosphere and spotty-to-bad service. -Hall noise (many children in hotel during our stay) -Noise from pool area - music at night, exercise activity in pool mid-morning Altogether there were too many things wrong with this stay. Disappointing for what is touted as a five star hotel. We would not return or recommend.

There is a great spa retreat a 5 minute walk away called Bobo‚Äôs house of harmony.

A disappointing stay. Crowded with run down facilities. Food was ordinary and hotel security did not do enough to keep tuk-tuk drivers and sarong vendors from the hotel grounds where they regularly hassled guests.
Disappointing Hotel not 5 star quality

We stayed 3 nights in Hesitance Ahungalla. The facilites are really good. The room was big and clean, the king size bed very comfortable. The breakfast buffet was good. The beach is spotless, as the swimming pool. The hotel is however a bit big and I would not recommend it for couple traveler as it is full of family or big groups. We however enjoyed our stay where we relaxed after 2 weeks traveling around Sri Lanka.

Rooms away from the pool are quieter if that is what you are looking for.

I stayed at Triton Hotel in Dec 2004 I had the most wonderful holiday of my life, the people in and around the hotel are fantastic they open your heart. The service within the hotel is exceptional, the food, out of this world go all inc and enjoy. Don't be afraid to look around, meet the locals and experience real culture. Don't miss out. You can have the holiday of a lifetime and the chance to change peoples lives.

This was our third time at the hotel. We were married on the beach when the hotel was the Triton, visited again on our 10th anniversary and have just returned from our third trip there. The hotel is as lovely as ever and makes for a really relaxing holiday in a beautiful setting. There are plenty of opportunities for excursions to see more of this fantastic country but it's also lovely to relax by the pools or wander along the stunning beach, especially at sunset. The staff throughout the hotel were excellent; from the reception staff at check-in, the restaurant staff, waiters, pool staff ... All were very helpful, friendly and gave a great service throughout our stay. We booked on an all inclusive basis and the food was always very good and plentiful. The staff also arranged a romantic 4-course meal on the beach for us which was superb. Would thoroughly recommend the hotel and we are already planning our next trip back there! Thanks to all the staff who helped make our holiday so enjoyable.

We had bee here in 2002 and 2004 upon arrival having booked a suite it was full of Mosquitos we booked A I went for dinner inedible the wine was just terrible! We went to remember the 10 anniversary of the Tusnami , when we were there. It was a huge dissapointment! It was with regret we had to complain. After a meeting with the general manager every thing changed, we renegotiated the AI do not do it! We re started on B&B it all changed. It is NOT the standard hotel it was, it is with regret I have to say this, the horribly black dinning room! On we go the sun beds are so unbelievably bad they aren't describable , when you see the staff wheeling one wheel with the other on the top ready to stick it back on, residents having to use just the pads on the floor as they don't have enough beds and lying on the grass infested with ants. There are so few umbrellas when yo leave your bed they have to move them for other residents , this is a 2 star or less and I really hate to gave to give this review , but I as an experienced well travelled Sri Lankan tourist I'm so sorry to say I will not be returning. Also to add the beach sellers who I had known since 2002 and have supported. Even to getting a sewing machine funded are the most intense in all our travels they drove us to distraction ! No we won't ever go back and this leaves me with a sad heart on my live of my beloved island

It was an overall disappointing stay at Heritance Ahungalla. The hotel was fully booked during our stay, given the holiday season. The hotel staff was very nice and friendly. It is an old building and definitely needs maintenance, particularly the rooms. For a 5-star property, the room is small, and the toilet hardly has any space in it, which is not what you'd expect given the star category this hotel boasts about and when compared to other similar 5-star hotels and resorts in Sri Lanka. The quality of the extra bed in the triple room would possibly befit a 2 or 3 star hotel. On the other hand, the king bed in the room was very comfortable, and one of the pluses was the sea view from the room, which was amazing. The food lacked variety and if you are a vegetarian, stay away from Heritance Ahungalla. They simply don't cater to those needs, even if you make a special note of it. The lunch buffet was the worst of the three meals we had. This was brought to the attention of the chef and the restaurant manager, and they were most apologetic, but it was an overall bitter experience in the end at Heritance Ahungalla. On the contrary, the desserts were superb and delicious. Overall, our stay did not offer any value for money, so I would never visit or recommend this hotel.
Near the pool side

We only stayed two nights. The hotel was very comfortable, but certain areas could do with updating, particularly the main dining area. Sunbeds were showing signs of age. Our room boy, Ranil was very helpful and kept our room beautifully clean

The rooms are not clean I had upgraded to deluxe ocean view Wood floor has dust paint very dirty you don't want walk on it. Old furniture the floor is old not polished scratched. The lamps are really old. The hotel is very old This my last stop in Sri Lanka out of all the hotel this the worst I would not recommend this to anyone.
Beautiful hotel but very expensive for the extras

If you want a large hotel with conference facilities this would be a good choice. However if you want a 5 star luxury hotel look elsewhere. The hotel is noisy the rooms decidedly past their use by date. The location is a problem with limited local facilities. Taking a walk was a hassle both on the beach and in the village. The main buffet restaurant is extremely tired. The one saving grace are the staff who are really excellent.
Perfect Wedding Day
Nice, but in need of refurbishment.
Blissful holiday at Heritance
Good views and hospitable staff

Disappointing Dining Experience at Ahungalla Heritance I had high expectations when visiting Ahungalla Heritance (part of the Aitken Spence chain), but the food quality was a major disappointment. The lunch buffet was underwhelming, with most dishes lacking salt and flavor. The fried rice, made with samba rice, was a poor choice and didn‚Äôt complement the rest of the dishes at all. Tea-time snacks were no better‚Äîminimal variety and nothing appetizing or memorable. We even raised our concerns with the chefs, but unfortunately, there was no noticeable improvement. For a reputed hotel chain, the dining experience was far below standard. I hope the management takes this feedback seriously and works on upgrading their food quality and variety.

We arrived at the hotel after almost 20 hours by plane and found out that espresso coffee is a special coffee and will have to pay, although it has the same taste and in no case was an espresso. I mention that we had an all-inclusive supplement and the coffee was included First Breakfast: i wanted an omelette I asked the chef to prepare "well done", but he became visibly irritated because I have explained in more detail. He said something in his language, evading after I asked him what he said. I inspected the room where I was staying and found that under the bed were traces of visible dust probably old before those who have been staying here previously, the bathroom is not the bathroom of a 5stars hotel. The towels are to used and have old stains. On the ceiling we discovered traces of mosquito / dead flies on the ceiling of the bathroom The beach behind the hotel filled with annoying vendors that are allowed by the security agents even inside of the hotel property limit. We found the waiters mostly unprepared, lazy and disinterested. At the pool if you order a drink lasts an eternity. In fact, if you order anything in this hotel last an eternity. The food at dinner buffet is an ordinary cantine and you can easily see that they recycle the food from evening to another or is the same food. The concept of all inclusive is a joke, because there are only a few types of local drinks and those bad. Beach towels are to used and have old stains. We chose the restaurant "fine dining", but the disappointment continued. We first drink comes after 15 minutes, and the food was brought after an hour of waiting and although you must have 15 / discount due prepaid package of all inclusive, we were charged 100 / requires that the next day to ask for explanations, explanations that reduced bill. However, the food is typical of a normal restaurant. Not bad, but nothing special. I have to mention that in the fine dining restaurant were only 2 tables with people. It was empty! The new years evening was ok, but we wanted to order champagne and they told us they are out of stock. We wanted Moet, they gave us Mumm. How can you not have stocks of champagne for New Years Eve? The food was very good. If this have been the food for all the holiday i could have forgot all the other things At 14.30 in the nect day the room was not cleaned in the context in which We left at 9 am the room. I ordered a soft drink included in all-inclusive package, it was added to the bill and replaced at the my request. Conclusion: if you're not careful pay twice. Wishing to relax at the beach we waited 30 minutes for the staff to find sun beds towels. Another breakfast: I asked two omelets ( for me and my husband) everything OK, I asked him and the third omelets for my son and the cook was getting nervous. The adventure continues... For sure the hotel management will have a respond to this post, but it will not make any difference , because my new years eve holiday was ruined, so I recommend you avoid this hotel that can be classified as no more than one 4-star hotel!
Whilst we tipped the man cleaning the room on arrival, he was trying for a tip every day so he did not get another tip. Very annoying.

We spent 3 weeks in Sri Lanka and stayed in 12 hotels and this we ranked last at number 12. On arrival our room was not ready despite it had gone 14:00. We were told this was due to a late check out and we were made to wait at reception without any offer of a refreshment. We reserved a table for evening food and upon arriving at the reserved time the table had been given to another group. We received phone calls on both mornings waking us up. One was at 07:30 regarding some washing being ready for us despite not having any done. The laundry department were insistent it was ours and then Hung up when we told them it was not. When we tried to speak to management we had to ask three times and after 10hrs we got to speak to a manager. They heard our complaint and offered half price food for the evening as a good will gesture. The buffet was on par with other hotels and the restaurant food was very good. Unfortunately despite the managers efforts at departure time we were phoned regarding when to collect our bags. We asked for 10 minutes time which they said they could do. After 25 minutes we walked our own luggage to reception and left the hotel in the same style we arrived, little to no service. During our visit some of the facilities were shut despite the hotel supposedly being fully booked. The room was fine and clean but the communal areas looked tired and not what was expected from a 4 Star hotel. The restaurants lacked soul and character. Due to our experience I can not recommend this hotel and I would question the awards and endorsements it has. I hope that others receive better service than we did given the price. Date 16-19th Apr 17, Rm 333

Environment is very good and there are friendly staff. But food is not good as I expected compare to the other heritance hotels. Good place to play beach sports. This is a good place to have a family or business vacation stay.

–í–µautiful and comfortable hotel! Cleaning every day. Friendly and attentive staff! Delicious and fresh food. Clear swimming pools and garden. Beautiful sunsets and dawn. Good live music. Give 5 stars and my heart!

We went in for lunch buffet on Jan 01, 2023 and variety of the food is good. Buffet was priced at 6000 LKR per head. The service is poor though; we had to ask for the staff to clear the finished plates from the table several times, and one of the staff ignored the request for water and had to wait around to find a waiter and get some water. There were no staff when needed at the table.

Good view of private beach from room, two good swimming pools and a jacuzzi But open only till 8 pm! Was served wrong wine, poor exchange rate, a baby girl fell down from above, ac had problems, very slow at check out! Overall a good experience but could be better if improvements are made to food quality, service and overall staff quality.

Stayed in the hotel during my vacation to Sri Lanka on July. I stayed Cinnamon grand, Kandalama before Heritance Ahungalla. I don't know what make this hotel 5 star. I ordered 3 triple rooms but when I got to room they are double rooms. When asked they said they put another bed to make it triple. checked in at 4:30PM but didn't get third bed until 12:30AM. 12:30 AM !!!!. Every time I called they said they have asked housekeeping for the extra bed. Finally got third beds from drivers quarters. Very nasty bed with 2 inch mattress. Food is average not best. I've seen better verity in average buffets. Try a different hotel before considering this.
"A great place to visit "üòâüòâüòâ

I was a part of a team coordinating a wedding to be held at Heritance Ahungalle on Saturday 20th Dec. All plans were in place and all of us in the coordinating team were moving ahead with the game plan when we got to know that the furniture supplier had messed up the order. Needless to say that all hell broke loose while we tried to work out an alternate solution, it was a mere 3 hours before the wedding ceremony. A lot of stress, tension and heart stopping moments later the furniture arrived at 3.00 pm, we had to set up and decorate 30 tables in 1 1/2 hours - guest were due to arrive at 4.30 pm. The team at Heritance Ahungalle, stepped up to the occasion, they deployed additional crew to unload and set up furniture and get it all going to ensure that the wedding set up was ready on time. Their attitude was fantastic - it was a case of everyone working together to give the couple a wedding to remember. The result was fantastic, everything was set up and ready for the wedding with mere moments to spare and it all looked brilliant. It was a result of brilliant cooperation, understanding and adrenaline. No one entering that marquee would have realised the tension we all had to work through - the set up looked stunning and the couple said that it was more than what they expected. What's important is that it was not the responsibility of the hotel to do all this and we in the coordinating crew know that if not for the team at Heritance Ahungalle lead by their F&B Manager Gamini we would not have been to get it all together on time for our clients and give them the wedding of their life. Thank you so much! I have no hesitation in recommending the hotel to anyone.
Not bad but desperately needs improvements

This is my 5th visit to this hotel. Like always "Great friendly staff great food! ". I always love the way they welcomed us to the hotel. It was a very nice experience, with the 2 huge swimming pools near the beach and the nice buffets with a large variety of foods to taste. We played tennis for almost 2 hours with a fee of Rs. 400 per hour. We did enjoy our game but they must resurface both tennis courts(clay). The rooms were very comfortable in few years back, but unfortunately not now. It was terrible dirty and smells like cockroach. The building really need to renovate to keep up with changing times and tastes We used to love our stay in this hotel!!!
Big experiences

We just got back from Ahungalla one of 3 hotels we stayed at in Sri Lanka, we spent the first few days of our holiday travelling around and then 4 nights here. Quite frankly I cannot believe the rubbish some nit pickers write on here. The hotel is amazing, the setting is gorgeous and the staff are the friendliest we met. All the staff are very well trained and could not help us enough very approachable. The room was clean and kept clean daily by housekeeping who did an outstanding job. The A/C worked wonders and our room was a constant cool haven from the outside temperatures. We were on a half board basis and ate every day at the resturant. I found the variety good and my husband enjoyed all the local dishes, even on a day when i couldnt find a meal to my taste the kitchen prepared me something just for me. We were completely content in the hotel and only left once for a small shopping trip. I haved stayed in a variety of hotels in other countried but this was my first time to Sri Lanka, I was unsure what to expect but was completely happy with my hotel choices and the country a fab holiday.
Happy stay

Very poor start to 5 days at this so-called 5* resort!!
Overpriced, terrible service and dirty - AVOID AT ALL COSTS
srilanka trip
Request for a Sea view close to the reception are.
Good pool and beach. Less varieties of food and some rooms not good

we had a suite and never expected that the bath/showe will lick - every time we took a shower we had to call housekeeping to clean the bathroom because it was full of water licking everywhere... there is a big potential for this hotel but it feel like an old and not renovated

As we pulled up outside the entrance to this hotel we were amazed at the view. We were looking forward to some relaxing days. We were shown to our room which was disappointing. It had a poor view and the shower was in need of some good quality cleaning products, with the grouting all black and the glass door was covered in limescale. We were so unhappy and disappointed (this was the third hotel in the group that we've stayed at on this trip) that we asked to be moved to a different room. This was facilitated but we had to wait almost two hours for the replacement room to be ready. This room had a much better outlook and whilst the grouting was cleaner, there was still the same issue with the shower door. Some good limescale remover used regularly would work wonders. That said, the overall cleanliness of the room was very good. The room cleaning service was always good and the guys couldn't have been more helpful. The pool and gardens are nice and the staff at the pool were very good. On one occasion a man was in difficulty in the pool having wandered out of his depth, and the lifeguard on duty leaped to his aid. A happy ending. Don't be too worried if you see chipmunks and land monitors passing by. Perhaps even the occasional monkey. We found the service at the pool bar to be friendly but quite slow, with some staff, on occasion, preferring to stand and chat together. We ate in the outdoor restaurant twice and found the food to be pretty awful. After those poor experiences we ate in the buffet restaurant. I wish I could be more positive but I can only be honest - the evening meals were not up to the level of that at the previous hotel at which we'd stayed. We found many dishes overcooked and almost cold. At the dessert bar, only half the items were labelled, and if you went to eat after the main rush it felt like we were being given the leftovers. The whole presentation was lacklustre. The staff though, were very nice and friendly and the service good, though some worked harder than others. I feel this establishment would benefit greatly from more staff training and motivation.
Second time.was.even better

The food is good, the hotel is old but nice. The pools are beautiful. The beach is clean but the waves are to high for swimming. The only but very anoying problem was they started renovating the rooms and stairs next to us and wrote our travel agency there won't be any renovation when we asked. That's not possible in a 5 star hotel.

We were a group of 10 adults (couples) and this property was part of our itinerary. The minute we entered the property, we were in awe of it but thats it. Our problems began right from the word Go. Our check-in process took almost an hour which ideally should have been a 5 minute job since our passport copies and all details were with the agent and hotel. Post the checkin, our ordeal just began to rear its head. Of the 5 rooms we were provided, 3 of them were with twin beds when it was clear to the hotel that were were couples. Then further, of the 5 rooms, 2 of them were side corner rooms which were nowhere near the deluxe rooms as shown on the website. The plumbing and the lighting too wasn't in order. On asking for a room change, the manager on duty just told that this is all that is available. With absolutely no remorse on settling us for subpar rooms. This is surely not how a 5 star property treats its guests. Thank god I stayed just 1 night. The room service was pathetic and they took almost an hour to get to us since the mini bar was completely empty. What I liked about the property was the various activities, the food and the variety. I liked the proximity to the beach but I just hope the property gets their act together, have proper signboards on each floor and get better processes in place.
Beautiful resort - Woderful staff

Our family stayed for one day occupying 3 rooms!! Food was amazing and the room service was excellent! I have to specially mention Rukmal who served us! 5 Starts specially to him!! We are surely to be back!
if possible ask for a sea facing room (directly) or closer to green pool (for easy access to pool reserved for in-house guests)
Ask for a sea view room

Wanted to thank everyone at the hotel for the fabulous service. We have visited the hotel on several occasions and every time the service and facilities upgrade it's quality level to be the best in the trade. Special thanks to Praveen for your excellent service and not forgetting Thushara, Lalith & gamini for the hospitality. Thank you so much. The stay was worth more than the money we spent.
Needs a little refurbishment
Poor maintenance and building cleanliness.

We stayed during January with my wife to celebrate her BDay. And honestly saying I was really surprised by this Hotel. The service was excellent! From the first minute of our arrival the attitude of the staff was extremely attentive. The room was great, the service in the restaurant was wonderful, the pool service was always at a high level. Special appreciates to Mr. Duminda (Restaurant Manager) and Mr. Panditha (Waiter) who made the birthday celebration especially memorable!
Avoid this hotel in September unless you can sleep through night time maintenance!

We found the stay medioco. The food was not that great and the alcohol is highly overpriced. The staff is great and very helpful. The extra family activities stated on the brochures are not available. The spa was super though. More entertainment facilities too are welcome.
Non-stop pestering from locals
Second to none!

I had my first visit to Hertance with my family, it was our office trip. The rooms are above average, but food and other restaurant services were not great. Most of my family are vegetarian, all vegetarians had the same food experience as we had. Dinner had a BBQ and some dishes, but lack of tasty vegetarian food, they should have at least added some Indian food items. I hope they will seriously look into this. Thanx Anura

Very nice hotel. Rooms are very spacious and amenities are very satisfactory. Food is good and offers a considerable range to choose from. Staff is very helpful and friendly. Access to the hotel is from the main road and parking facilities are available within the hotel premises. Hotel is highly recommended.
The room is nice but the style of the hotel is not modern.
Probably avoid the wing away from the pool at the moment because of the construction work.

Booked this hotel as part of our tour of sri lanka , it was the last one having stayed in 4 other hotels .Recommended to us and overall it was a nice hotel but let it self down in certain areas. Arrival was pleasant and we had a slight delay before going to the room , which was very nice spacious but in need of some improvements . wardrobe doors did not close on the runners , blinds in the bathroom had no function to close them , did report to reception but nothing done . Pool area very nice always able to get a sun lounger two pools available and the attendants were first class in providing towels and arranging the beds for you . Staff in the restaurants and bar areas were also first class being both attentive and professional. Only down side the evening was based around the pool and i feel they need to provide a better more comfortable seating arrangement instead of the same seating for the daytime pool drinking and eating tables and chairs . food and drink was good with a good choice and selection . beach is lovely but quiet due to , beach sellers and men pushing their taxi business which disrupts the relaxing environment , they stay behind a line of flags but it is close to the sun loungers. overall this is a nice hotel and nice beach side location nothing outside the resort if you go B+B then you must eat in the hotel which can work out expensive . The let down for us was the last day , most flights out of sri lanka are late evening , we were due to be collected at 21.30 . The room had to be vacated at 12.00 ( no late room available ). At 12.00 which was embarassing a member of the reception team came and cut off the all inclusive bands when we were with other guests. this is the first hotel which stopped the all inclusive many hours before we left . also if you want that shower prior to departing then they wont provide a room , we had to shower in the pool shower which is also the toilet nowhere to hang clothes or dry your hair . this was a disappointment to me which let the experience of the hotel down and which in my opinion stopped it being classed as a 5 Star , the sri lankan people were great i will return again but not to this hotel , i did read the reviews and thought i could ignore the beach sellers but it did spoil it . couple in our 40's
That was really warm‚ò∫Ô∏è

We had a great time at this beautiful resort. Food was awesome and tbe staff is excellent. We had two beautiful rooms with a lot of space. Thank you for your great hospitality and we will be back for sure.
Heritance the name it is

We visited on 19th December we were a group of 7 adults and 3kids we received a warm welcome and it was a very busy day to fount office. All three meals were very good kids also enjoyed as well as us and rooms are also good and clean... we have booked 2 double rooms and a one triple room, But they don't have triple rooms they only give a extra bed for the third person... Wen they fixed the third bed it was a tragedy! none of us can sleep on that bed because it was a very small folding bed. I have never seen a extra bed like that in my life. we have visited many star class hotels, and we always booking a triple room as we are travelling with our mother. I have never seen such a small extra bed.... When we ask about this from the hotel they told us this is the size of a extra bed they provide. That bed is good for a kid not for a adult... I'm very very disappointed...But I couldn't let any one to sleep on that bed I barely manage that bed so didn't had a good sleep... It was a sleep less night. But except the bed all other things were at the hotel is good... We enjoyed the beach as well as the pools...
A Good looking hotel with terrible service
Hospitality and Smiles that make u want to stay forever.

It would be a sin to not reccomend this hotel during our vacation we visited many hotels around Srilanaka and i have to say that this was by far the best, with an amazing ocean view and extremly nice waves, they had a decent pool, and very good food , staff were extremely nice and helpful as i said before it would be a sin to not reccomend

Stayed here for three nights and loved it. Great staff Always willing to go the extra mile and so very friendly. Even the gardening staff always smiling. Room fabulous overlooking the smaller pool which was an added bonus. Food special. Had buffet for breakfast and dinner.

During our tours of the country, we had dropped in to this hotel as a family several times in passing over the years for lunch etc (excellent experiences) and finally took the opportunity to stay few nights this year. As always, the famous GB architecture in the reception area was fabulous, staff were very helpful courteous. There were some issues with the online booking system where the exact facilities in each type of room was not clear but the staff on the night managed to sort things out satisfactorily for us, even with the hotel being near full occupancy. The room we stayed in was clean and modern (appeared to be a recent refurbishment, the multi-socket wall powerpoints took in my overseas devices without the need for an adapter!), room service was good, Wi-Fi excellent, the gym smallish but adequate, pool & beach areas great and there were some good traditional outdoor displays/ activities during local New Year celebrations. Overall, a good experience & would be even better if the online system and a few minor maintenance needs were to be tidied up by the hotel group.
poor service takes toll on a good property
"Rooms on the south side are quieter"_x000D_ "Corner suites are large and sunny"

We stayed at this hotel for five days from the 13-18 February, in a superior room, on the ground floor overlooking the gardens with a partial sea view. From arrival it was apparent that the room had a stale smell that had been unsuccessfully masked by the cleaning staff using cloves to hide the odour.In general terms the rooms are large,although extremely outdated by the original 1980's d√©cor. Limited attempts have been made to upgrade the bathroom by the replacement of the original sanitary ware. Although bare plaster,binding door,pop-up wastes that do not seal negate part of this exercise. The restaurant prides itself on the training of its Chefs,although has considerable difficulties in balancing the menu to provide a mixture between eastern and western food.There is little provision for some travellers who may not want to eat Sri Lankan food for the whole of their holidays. This was mentioned on more than one occasion to the Assistant Sous Chef,and The Sous Chef,who provided a detailed tour of the Kitchen,although no indication why the menu is so one sided. The restaurant is open between 7-10 pm,when we arrived at 8.30 pm most of the salad trays where empty and had not been replaced. The one European dish,pasta, had two spoonfuls of "penna" left in the tray. When we queried this with the Assistant Sous Chef he asked what we would like to eat?,and this could be prepared for us.I also noted that many of the dessert trays where empty and would be withdrawn and not replaced,normally at 8.45pm. At this time the restaurant is open for a further 1Hours and 15 minutes. I really would expect better from a 4*-5* hotel.

Having read some fantastic reviews of this hotel, we arrived with high expectations. Twice prior to arrival we had reqested a room with a sea view and a double bed. On arrival however we were asked if we wanted to upgrade before even seeing the room, therefore, it came as no suprise that we had neither a sea view nor a double bed as requested. Now I appreciate the hotel was very busy over the Sri Lankan New Year however we had booked well in advance and were assured that within two days we would be moved, which did not materialise despite constant pleas, until day 7 of 10! Agreed the hotel was very clean and in a fantastic location, however, if you are looking for something intimate and romantic this is not the place for you. The beach is beautiful though the hawkers provide little peace and are a constant menace and not to be trusted, given the stories we heard from trusted locals inland.
Best to get a room on the ground floor if you are looking to use the pool and go to the beach

Would expect more varieties in food menu. Pool was good..kids enjoyed it..kids club has less activities..would prefer for more..good for one night stay or for a day outing..quick check in and checkouts..room was ready in a short time..can recommend others..

We spent 10 nice days at the Heritance Ahungalla in april 2015. To summarize, the stay was in general a good one. The setting is wonderful indeed. Spectacular beach. Great weather. The hotel as such is not bad at all. However, given the fact that it is supposed to be on the upper end, and that is has been designated the title Travelers Choice, we expected a lot more. This is more like a mid-range family resort. The good: Wonderful surroundings, sea view from the balcony, tasteful spacious rooms with a well-regulated AC. Great breakfast. Pretty good food quality in general. Friendly service. The headwaiter acted very professionally and listen very carefully and arranged adjustments when we complained about the buff√© dinner. The Bad: Dinner is a Buff√©, served in an environment reminding you of an elementary school. Let us say - not very cozy. They brag about their fine dining restaurant, which serves excellent lobster (hence, you should go there once) at a quite high price, but the rest is nothing special. Expect ‚Ç¨40-50 for a bottle of wine anywhere in the hotel. It is a family resort. Some days the pool area is crowed with screaming kinds, despite that pool rules say: NO GAMES. The staff does nothing to moderate. Between the hotel and the beach there is an area with palms and bushes. In the shade, a dozen or so sales men and women do their best to attract the attention of the guests all day long. Hello, hello! Our plane departed late so our travel agent suggested that we should ask for a late check out. Initially the response sounded as if that most likely could be arranged, but somehow the hotel was fully booked on the Monday morning when we should leave, so we had to leave the room and take the shower in a cramped public shower with no shower gel and no space to leave your belongings. That was the end of a glamorous holiday. Well, maybe not. Suggestions to management: 1. Dinner: Try to do something about the elementary school dining room. Serve the Buff√© twice at 19 and then again at 20:30. Make sure that the food is fresh all the time. 2. Mixing families and couples: You have two pools. Why not enforce strict quiet behaviour at either pool and let the kids play at the other. Everyone will be happy. 3. Public showering facilities: It is warm. People are the for swimming. Make sure they can take a shower in a respectable bathroom before they say goodbye. It will be the last impression they take with them back home as they say Au revoir.
no stars

We stayed at this hotel for the first time back in the late 90s, when it was called Triton. By the way, the statue of this Triton still flaunts at the entrance. It was a marvelous, respectable hotel with several restaurants, a tea room, fine service, and two lovely swimming pools. This is a beautiful colonial-style building, inside there are very beautiful galleries, between which water flows, trees and flowers grow. This is real architecture, not a soulless block with rooms. Unfortunately, the hotel ended up under water in December, 2004. The staff will tell you that only the first floor was flooded, and they will lie. Typical tsunami traces will also be on the third floor, this can be seen, although the walls are being tinted. I don't really understand how they got 5 stars. It is a very sad sight of destruction and extinction. The hotel is a pity as an old horse, from which they are trying to squeeze out the remnants of strength. Unmown grass, peeling sun loungers, frayed beach towels, yellowed bath towels, stained old linen, squeaky air conditioner, mildew, dampness, musty. Tiles are falling off in pools. Fence-mesh around the perimeter. And that is not all. This once beautiful hotel is now used as a staging post for bus groups, arriving to spend one night before departure. From the pros: It is still an outwardly beautiful building The staff works with full dedication Decent cuisine for Europeans, not too spicy, many adapted dishes. In the room, like more than 20 years ago, a bowl of fresh seasonal fruits will be waiting for you. The staff is still on the ball.
Not the nicest resort
A good weekend

Our stay here cost about ¬£180 per night for a double room. Overall the hotel is nice but just not really living up to the standards you'd expect of a 4 star hotel or the price tag. For example the toilets in the reception area were rather dark and needed a clean and tidy, there were lots of staff around but so many of them doing nothing and at one time I had to ask 5 different staff to order drinks over a period of about 20 mins before anything actually happened, a lot of the time the waiting staff seemed to just cluster in groups and were lost if actually asked to do anything. The cushions on the sun loungers were ancient, one of the things we noticed that should be easy to put right if the hotel put some of its profits back into the premises. The hotel makes a lot of its 'award winning' chefs which became a bit irritating after a couple of days as some food was great, some really not so good and I had the only stomach upset of the entire trip after eating at the hotel as did a couple of the family, I think due to food being reheated as some things looked rather familiar. Also they seemed thrown at breakfast if more than one or two people wanted the freshly cooked items such as hoppers so you had to wait absolutely ages or give up and have items that were not needing cooking - a real shame as I love my Dosa and hoppers! The kids club was good but the evening entertainment seemed to be the male ents team dressing in drag every night and miming to something and they seemed to abandon the kids pretty quickly if there was any sign of mingling with the grown ups. The other big downer for the hotel is the mosquitoes which are absolutely rife, not totally avoidable but I feel they could have made more of an effort with the rooms and common areas to minimise the mozzy numbers - as most of the other hotels we stayed in had done. Plus points were the two nice pools and the nice view of the sea. Without a fantastic rate to entice me back I'd be inclined to try somewhere else along the coast when I next go back.

Very nice veiw from the lobby.Rooms are big and clean. Ambience is smoothing. Hospitality is very friendly.staff is excellent.specially at the reception.service is amazing at the main restaurant.we will be back for sure.
Reception not Friendly!!!!
Staff couldn't do enough
Nice..but could be nicer...

Arriving at this hotel, it looked rather impressive with its long entrance and infinity pool overlooking the beach and ocean. On closer consideration, expecting five star quality, I was surprised to see stagnant water in some of the fountains, the quality of the material used in the hallways of the hotel looked rather cheap and our room, while quite big and comfortable seemed kind of empty (as if some furniture had been removed or was mssing something). The hotel food was average (which was how I found most of the food during our stay in Sri Lanka). For the positive, we loved the beautiful beach, which was one of the highlights of our trip, the greenery surrounding the pool areas and the natural beauty of it all, was what finally made our stay quite enjoyable (as well as the geckos wandering around). To reiterate, our room was very comfortable, clean and quite large for the three of us, with a very nice, large bathroom. We had a balcony overlooking the pool area and we could hear the waves of the ocean (unfortunately as of the evening we could not leave the doors opened because of the mosquitos).
5 star property with 2 star services

For the layabout to do nothing, the fitness fanatic to be at peak, the gourmet to garner all the delights or the holiday maker in search of serenity, there is one place in Sri Lanka all rolled into one. That is the five-star Heritance at Ahungalla, where the blue ocean kisses the sand and the swimming pool stands between the airy reception area. This may sound like a leaf from a flyer or an advertisement. It is not. That‚Äôs my experience during a week-long stay at the luxury resort. The absence of what seems an orchestrated hustle and bustle in some of the resorts, being left alone from the taunting touts on the beach and caring of the staff made all the difference. I fell in love with what I saw and what I enjoyed. The buffet meals for breakfast, lunch and dinner had a wide variety to choose from ‚Äì a cross section of the most popular Sri Lankan cuisine and a widespread selection of western and continental food. That is not to mention the fine dining restaurants. If you need to learn a little more, go beyond what the glossy magazines and flashy advertisements on websites say. I did that. The tins, bottles, corrugated boxes and other degradable items do not go waste. There is a team to sort them to be re-cycled. An award winning Chef, Dimuthi Kumarasinghe finds no space on the walls of his room or his tables to place any more awards including trophies. They are full. Ask him to give you what they call an ‚Äúindigenous meal.‚Äù It‚Äôs a three course lunch or dinner with produce including catch of the sea within a radius of five kilometres from the hotel. I told Manager Refhan N. Razeen that I was pampered. ‚ÄúThat is our style,‚Äù he said. So, if you also want to be pampered in southern Sri Lanka, Heritance is the resort. Don‚Äôt believe me. Have a go, try it.
Very mediocre star hotel

Once again I'm back at Heritance Ahungalla and it is just as good as the first time, maybe even better. I came to the hotel with some buddies and had quite the bachelor pad. We tried so many new dishes that were fantastic! The staff were very helpful and very organized. 5 stars! ***** Hope to make this an annual trip with the buddies. Cheers!
Great atmosphere but poor quality of service
Hoped for a 5* haven for a few days after travelling around Sri Lanka

Housekeeping was helpful, he tried very hard to please us and cleaned twice a day. Showers need a good clean up especially the tiles which had black spots. Dining room: Large variety of foods for curry and spicy food lovers, great deserts.

Rooms closer to the private/green pool are more provate (i.e, rooms with numbers around 140 upwards, 240 upwards, 340 upwards)._x000D_ _x000D_ The other rooms are closer to the restaurants for those who prefer less walking.

The worst hotel I‚Äôve been to, even 1 star is a lot , this should be a 5 stars hotel but it‚Äôs the total opposite, rooms are very old and dirty, corridors are horrible, and when I made a complain their explanation was it‚Äôs rustic architecture not dirty and it‚Äôs not an international hotel it‚Äôs a National hotel, which didn‚Äôt make any sense to me What does cleanliness have to do with National or international, the restaurant was like a fish market, stations were unclean and no hygiene at all, in the reception they were putting a welcome drink trolley when I stood by it the servant told me that it‚Äôs only for check In customers, people in the hotel aren‚Äôt allowed to drink which is very funny‚Ä¶ I came with my family to relax for couple of days but unfortunately it was a disaster..

stayed for five nights as a family of five and we enjoyed everything about the hotel. The long well maintained driveway and the large pond in front of the entrance. Everybody smiled and spoke to you and were all very happy. The reception when we arrived made you feel instantly welcome. Our rooms were first class clean tidy and well maintained. We were even visited by a tribe of monkeys playing around the walkways one morning. The dinning area and quality of food was excellent. The waiters were all experienced and very helpful. There are two swimming pools both of which were large and clean. The security staff kept the beach area quiet but you could approach the beach boys and banter with them and they all wanted to be your friend and guide. We had no qualms about using a couple of them as guides and these enhanced our experience of the area and the people. The only complaint I had were often the number of flys in the dinning area which was hard to stop due to the open plan design. The entertainment was low key but very fitting for the hotel and its location

Nice hotel but need to improve on food I suppose. Food at heritance used to be superb but I did not feel that today. Anyway hotel is maintained at same superb standards.rooms are good and the service standards of staff are good.

When you arrive at this hotel you cannot help but be impressed. There is a large water feature outside reception and a lovely pool just inside. The rooms were pleasant but not great. When I got to the balcony the sea view was not quite what I imagined, the hotel is set a bit further back than it may appear in brochure photos. Found the staff very pleasant and the buffet choices quite expansive. The major disappointment were the cocktails on offer on the all inclusive. A couple off the Arrack based ones were OK but the others were pretty naff. Other AI's I have been to have a better range, although sometimes there is a small charge for the more expensive ones. Here it is full payment for non AI menu.

Overall a very good hotel and staff were excellent. Some areas of the hotel were tired but everywhere was very clean. Rooms were comfortable and facilities good, with a reasonably well equipped gym and two large pool areas, where the attendants were helpful in providing towels and arranging beds. The food was very good however, our experience in the dining room was mixed, mainly because at the weekend, the hotel is open to non-residents, so there were suddenly huge numbers of extra diners for dinner on Saturday and breakfast on Sunday, which turned the experience into a bit of a bun fight. The quality of the food was still good, however the presentation was off putting as staff could not keep up with the volume and serving dishes were left messy and tables were not cleared as quickly as on other days. We ended up in the 'outside area' which felt very 'make shift' - perhaps this area should be made available for non residents so that residents at the hotel do not experience reduced standards at the weekend. On the plus side, there is a quieter residents only pool, so it is possible to escape during the day at the weekend. My advice would be to avoid weekends when the hotel is open to non-residents as it becomes far too busy and noisy, specifically in the dining area.

Best Beach property

Had a great time with office buddies. Great food, local and foreign. Pool and sea with indian ocean breeze. Room facilities also good. But triple room is not with enough space to three guys. They also allow bring hard liquor from outside, no corkage charges.
Positively Idyllic

We stayed in Heritance Ahungalla for 16 nights. I want to structure the Review in positive, neutral and negative things and because everyone seems to tell just the positive things i start with the negative ones. Negative: - Dirty beach; the Hotel does not care about the litter on the beach. Of course it is a public beach but there are only Hotel guests. Thats why they should clean it more often. - Beach Boys: they wait in front of the beach and even whistle or shout for someone. You always feel observed when you lie on the pool - Rooms are in poor condition. In the shower is mould, the curtains are dirty and the furniture is old (i enclosed some Pictures). This is definitely not 5-star-hotel-like! - The Hotel customer Service asked if we could give them a good tripadvisor-rating and they want to see if you give 5 points. Thats certainly the fact why there are so many good Reviews. - The Prices in the Hotel (if you dont have AI) are quite high. A 0,3 Liter Diet-Coke is about 3 Dollar, the dinner 26 Dollar. Very much for a Country like Sri Lanka. - When you leave the Hotel there are some Tuk-Tuk-Driver who want to bring you to the next herbal-farm or wants to sell you drugs. After our second try, we did not dare to go out -The Bar staff was quite slow and we had to wait almost 15 minutes till someone cared. That happened many times. Neutral: - Loud Room: We had a room over the bar and the bass was quite loud till 11 p.m. But most other rooms which are further away are certainly quiet. When we told this to the front desk they immediately offered another room Positive: - The architecture of the Hotel and the beautiful pools. - The Housekeeping and almost every Hotel employee was extremely friendly - The animals in the Hotel. There where cute chipmunks, funny apes, lovely ravens taking their bath in the pool, a lizard and even a big snake (i dont know if it was poisonous) - great Food. I dont think that you can find any better Food in Sri Lanka I just rate the Hotel with two out of five because it is made much better on tripadivor than it is for real. In my opinion it is not better than a european 3-Star-Hotel and i know that sri-lanka-standard is far lower than european but unfortunately the Prices are not like Sri Lanka (Massage 1 hour- 100 Dollar!)
A stunning setting slightly let down by poor service and limited food
Hotel top,Hotelshop flop

Th√® architecture of this hotel is very beautiful and the blend of the nature and the beautiful environment and the beach... there was variety of choice in the food and the food is delicious... the rooms are beautiful and we had a sea view beautiful room ...the service and the staff is excellent.....i recomend this hotel to others

The good first - Hotel staff are all wonderful, helpful and the service slow but very friendly. The beachfront location is excellent. The food is good- even the buffet - which I normally dislike with a vengeance was above average, but the fining dining experience (lobster) was excellent and the coffee shop a la carte was also very good. The main pool is fabulous and the other okay - but the Jacuzzi is dreadful - small, old and uninviting. The bad - oh dear!! The rooms are drab, dysfunctional and this was after 3 changes!! We arrived tired after a long drive from Kandy and were given a twin despite requesting a double - when we complained we were moved to a double and told this was an upgrade - despite it being exactly as the other but on a different floor! Complain again - as this was supposed to be a 5 star - and the room was very tired - and we were told that we could move the following day to a luxury suite but not until 5pm. Trying to be accommodating and not spoil a so far wonderful trip to Sri Lanka we agreed not to unpack and move rooms the following evening. But, three rooms later - okay this was larger - a very large separate, very stark work room - with a private balcony and wonderful views but the air conditioning didn't work in the bedroom, there were cigarette buts on the balcony and the shower (which my husband couldn't stand under - built for little people) leaked to wet the entire bathroom floor. However, the wonderful staff, sous chef, and just about everyone we met were so lovely we forgave everything. But this is NOT a luxury hotel!! Just a very standard hotel charging luxury prices and it will be interesting when the 501 roomed giant opens its doors next door to see if it survives. Oh and the ugly - the sunbeds are from the last century and the pool attendants who set them up very pushy for their tips.
Over promised but under delivered
Stay somewhere else

We had a great experience there. The staff and service was superb. The pool is open until 8pm. There was an indoor games area and library. I loved those places to spend the time. The rooms were clean and had a good bathroom. One of the best hotels in Sri lanka which provides great safety. but didn't have a nice view. If you are a sea food lover, you must visit this hotel. Crab, prawn, cuttlefish and many more seafood things in one place. Never experienced such a thing before. They had a good buffet with a lot of varieties and they served tasty foods. But only a few items were delicious. I experienced that drawback from this kind of bigger buffets serving hotels. Live music nights and a lot of services available through the hotel. I believe it was an amazing visit to Heritance Ahungalla.

The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful. Hotel was bit crowed during my visit. washroom was bit small and outdated also not that clean especially the shower etc. Food was ok and garden and beach was well maintained.

We stayed here, and It was an amazing experience. The staff was excellent and the service was remarkable. The issue we had, however was the pool. There were people in the pool wearing ordinary clothes. Which is so off-putting and unhygienic. You are supposed to wear swimming attire and wash yourself before getting into the pool. This made us feel very uncomfortable and surprisingly the hotel management didn't seem to take notice of it either. Then when we went to the second pool, there was another couple the lady was dipping with her clothes on! This is not the type of environment we expect from a classy hotel. I really hope that the management takes required steps and fix the issue. Other than that it was a great stay and an extremely hospitable hotel.
