ÈÖíÂ∫óÊàøÈó¥Ê†ºÂ±ÄÂæàÊÄ™ÔºåÊúâÁöÑÊàøÈó¥ÂæàÂÆΩÊïûÔºåÊúâÁöÑÊàøÈó¥ÈùûÂ∏∏Â∞è„ÄÇ

I returned to Heritance Ahungalla after several years to relive my memories from the last trip which was excellent. This time however the hotel fell way short in meeting my expectations. It all started with a 45 minute waiting time just to get checked in. The lobby was storming with guests and baggage scattered everywhere reminded me of a government hospital than a star class hotel. The room was very clean and neat however, I had booked myself in to a "Deluxe King" room with a "King Size" bed on the ground floor (printed on the confirmation). However I had been given a room on the 1st floor with two single beds put together. We were so eager to get to the beach that the minute we came to the room we unpacked and stormed off to the beach. It was when we returned we figured out that it was not a king size bed. Called and complained to the concierge and I was told that "Sir, you have to make a special request for a king size bed at the time of booking if you needed one". After 15 minutes of arguing and speaking to the duty manager was I offered to be shifted to another room. Again, a very clean and comfortable room but a small shower in a very odd triangular shape. Not for someone who is claustrophobic. We went for dinner in the main restaurant and it was chock-a-block. They had stuffed every available chair and table in to it and we could only move about sideways. The seemed to have a shortage of plates as we had to wait up to 5 minutes sometimes for fresh clean plates. And no service what so ever. There were only five or six waiting staff to serve and we hardly caught a glimpse of them. We were never even offered water. And I am still waiting for the tea I ordered to the table on the second morning of my visit. Dinner was really good. There was a very decent variety of food and the taste was very good. But breakfast was not so exciting. There was no variance and every day it was pretty much the same assortment. In-room dinning was an absolute disaster. It felt as if "In-room dinning" is a whole new concept that the hotel staff is yet to hear about. There was no menu available in the room and two cheaply printed A4 sheets stapled together arrived at the door 30 minutes when we called and asked for one. We ordered two fried rice and let me tell you that I have had better fried rice served on a plane. It was a mixture of rice and boiled chicken with the odd piece of carrot. The hotel is beautiful, comfortable and very clean. As long as you lower your exceptions in terms of service, you might have a decent stay. For me however, I do not see myself returning any time soon.
Nice but could be better

We visited the hotel in April with my husband and small son.As we entered to the hotel we were warmly welcome by the infinity pool with very own heritance traditions and three different types of fresh juices also.Fortunately we could have a room within 10 minutes, even we didn't reserve our rooms earlier.It was fast when considering to the other hotels in Sri Lanka.We were guided by Ms.Supuni to the room and she explained us everything in the hotel with giving the maximum definition to the hospitality. Later my husband wanted to see the green pool even we were not allowed to use it because we were just for the day use. Again we were guided by Ms.Supuni and she explained the history of the hotel that we wanted to know. My son was very happy during the stay because he used to get lollipops when he needed. Food was awesome and I think there is no other place to compete with.Credits to chefs!Our room was cleaned and comfortable although we got a room nearby the spa. We have visited many hotels in Sri Lanka but never felt a hospitality as in Heritance-Ahungalla. Staff is very friendly and always supportive to the best of it. My son was very upset to leave the hotel and we couldn't extend our stay due to overbooked situation. Miss.Supuni is a credit to your hotel and definitely we will be back to feel the hospitality again to this beautiful hotel.Highly recommended for everyone!
Amazing stay and one of the best set of staffs
Had a great stay and super service
room 252 we felt was better than most others though some are very large suites.
rooms 301 till 317, avoid rooms above the grilled buffet restaurant or rooms at the far rigth far away from the entrance, main pool and restaurants

Recently returned from a two week visit to Sri Lanka, staying mostly at the Heritance Ahungalla. The welcome was warm and friendly, with bags taken to the room quickly and efficiently. The room itself was clean, well decorated, cool and well equipped. We had a family suite, which had a bed big enough for an entire family!! Even though we had an additional single bed in the room, myself and my children shared the comfortable large bed and were very happy for the two weeks. The pools and poolside were cleaned daily. Sunbeds were easily acquired. We were in a group of 17 and found beds together every day we stayed around the pool. The quieter pool was slower for drinks, but ever so relaxing. The beach was breathtakingly beautiful. We weren't hassled at all. The current and waves were very strong during our stay, which meant swimming wasn't advised, however, we jumped and played in the waves which was lots of fun. All of the communal areas were kept clean and tidy. The lunch time menu at the bar was lovely. The chips and burgers were extremely yummy! Having booked on an all inclusive package, we used the one restaurant that was included for breakfast, occasional lunch and dinner every day. By the end of the first week, admittedly, this was a little monotonous. The food didn't vary very much from night to night, even though the chef did try to make it themed. However, the food was delicious and to a very high standard. It would have been nice to have a little more variety on offer though - perhaps in the way of a second restaurant/place to eat. Service for drinks in the restaurant was sporadic. Depending on the waiter, we could wait for around 15-20 minutes for drinks alone. We combatted this by building a rapport with one waiter, who after a few days, looked after us and would bring drinks quickly. The evening entertainment wasn't fantastic. And we found the evening's could drag a little. So be sure to take your own entertainment with you! While staying here, we attended a friends wedding. The wedding planner was very friendly, but failed to explain the traditions that the couple were undergoing in their service, which left them and the group confused. The hair and make up provided by the hotel were sufficient - although our bride did end up taking off the make up, as it was a little too much. The photographer was unobtrusive, yet quite dated in his approach. Even though these may sound quite negative, we couldn't fault the wedding itself, which was incredibly special to the couple and us as guests. The staff were so kind and helpful throughout. Overall, we were so pleased with our stay at the Heritance. All of the staff were happy and helpful. Everything was completed to a high standard. And yes, there were some aspects that could have made it even better, but overall, it's been a holiday of a lifetime. Would highly recommend a visit here!
Could get crowded if full...
HERITANCE AHUNGALLA YOU ARE GREAT !!!!!!

Very disappointed with our stay. Rooms definitely need upgrades. Stayed in a triple room where the third bed was just a small folding bed. Blinds in the bathroom were broken and could see through them from the room and the outside. Flies in the room. Communicated all this to front desk but nothing done about it. The second pool was "apparently" under maintenance every time us locals wanted to use it but all the foreigners were constantly swimming!!!!! Again spoke to front desk and we were told the pool was not closed???? Very sad is all I have to say. If this is what we call 5 star then I have no words. Will not be staying here again.

Lovely looking hotel with a beautiful location. A few irritations though - no soap in the rooms, just two empty soap boxes in the bathroom bin! The boutique appeared to have exactly what I was looking for, but despite three trips to the shop and finding the "open" sign in the window, the door was locked and nobody was there. As we had to depart, I didn't have time to try to find someone. On arrival we had to remind the reception staff to give us back our passports. And there was extraordinarily loud drumming below our room for perhaps 45 minutes after dinner! We presumed there must have been some sort of cultural show on that we hadn't been told about. We were just starting to get really tired of it when it stopped. We had dinner in our room, and it was served quite promptly and was delicious. Breakfast was also delicious, with a great variety. Despite this list of irritations, the hotel was quite lovely, and if we had been staying longer, we would have taken the trouble to sort them out.
choose a room at the northern part of the hotel they are more quietness

What's the point of going on a vacation, if you want to feel like home.? Heritance made me and my wonderful wife forget all about home... The meals.. the smiles... the activities.. the room... THE MEMORIES are so much... wr didn't wanna leave :(

We recently stayed at the Heritance and I can say that it was an absolute delight. From the moment you arrive it takes your breath away -- the drive up to the front of the hotel brings you to the view through the lobby, out over the pool and to the see beyond. The hotel's refurbishment has been sumptuous -- beautiful furniture, stylish decor and very well appointed rooms. The food was excellent. Every day we'd see the restaurant manager who would talk to us by the pool and tell us what the specials were going to be that evening, and on the one occasion we went to the fine dining restaurant we had the most exquisite food. We were brought two extra complimentary courses and had wonderfully attentive service (although I have to say that a very minor downside here was that I don't think the staff realised that the CD they had put on was a Christmas CD, which wasn't too appropriate in late January, but never mind...) It was rather heartbreaking that there were so few tourists around in such a beautiful hotel.
Nothing Special

The hotel is a bit old and I would not rate it as 5 star hotel. I stayed there for 3 nights last FEB in a 2 interconnected rooms, the view was nice but the rooms were poor and give you the feeling of the 80s starting from the metal key to the furniture, the AC, the toilets‚Ä¶etc. I had all the meals in-room dining and it was by all means disaster, not clean at all (hair in the food, dirty plats, wrong orders) I made a complaint and the reaction of the restaurant manager was excellent and honestly he was professional gentleman‚Ä¶thank you Mr.KK.

Excellent service. Friendly staff. Quality room service. We'll never forget the experience in Green pool. So much things to enjoy. Especially the spa! We enjoyed very much. Spend peacefull two days with mouthwatering foods and breathtaking views. Thanks Heritance!

After 6 busy and interesting days in Sri Lanka, we couldn't find more beautiful hotel than Heritance Ahungalla. The room have been cleaned twice a day. At the reception desk works very capable staff whome are always available. If you ever stay in this hotel please ask for mr Dinusha Kularathne. He made for us surprise in the room (flowers for wife and fruit basket). He makes a great effort to accomplish any request we had. In general this is the best hotel we ever stayed in, don't skip it if you ever come in Sri Lanka.

Another unforgettable vacation at Heritance Ahungalla
paradising hotel
Anniversary break
Great looks outside but unpleasant inside.

We stayed for Christmas 2007 and agree with other reviewers that the hotel has been beautifully refurbished. We had a fantastic room with a sea view, very comfy bed, huge bathroom, all spotlessly clean. The pool area is stunning and the pool attendants very helpful in brining loungers, towels and refreshing slices of watermelon. A few rupees on day one will get you a great spot and a parasol for the rest of your stay! However we were disappointed with both the food and the service. Yes the fine dinning is superb but overall the food was too "international" with very limited choice for those of us that travel in Asia for the delicious local food. As there is absolutely nothing outside of the hotel ,and only very limited choices if you take long a taxi ride to other towns along the coast, we soon became bored with the choice of one Sri lanka curry, one chinese style stir fry and the local dish of Devilled chicken. Personally we don't travel for 11 hours to eat a rack of lamb no matter how good it is! The hotel was busy at it was Chistmas and it took ages to get served, particularly at the pool bar. Over one hour for a sandwich and a beer for lunch on one occaision. Overal the hotel is excellent provided you like an "all inclusive" type of holiday. Having travelled extensivley in India, Thailand, and Malaysia we were a little disappointed in Sri Lanka overall. It takes forever to get anywhere as the roads are so bad and so congested, the food wasn't that great anywhere, Columbo is polluted and rather grim. Whilst the beaches in the South are fantastic we enjoyed our stay further North more. Tragically there is still a long way to go to recover from the Tsunami. The lack of tourists is having the effect that those that do go are seen as "cash cows" we felt somewhat ripped off on more than one occaision. Beware the moonstone mines - you can buy them cheaper in the UK!
Ground floor suite room had a small garden inside where top floors were just big rooms.

Very creative bedroom decor by Room boy Sumudu. He is very courtiers & obliging. Well done. Keep up the good work. F&B maneger Rasika too was very courtiers & obliging. Pool table had not been maintained well. Full of dust & sand. Disappointing.

Execellent hotel with a excellence service. nice play for the holiday . Tasty foods . Had a nice place for anyone .we want to come back again. Thankz heritance..........................................

Not a fan of everyday live music in the lobby, it gets bit loud and uncomfortable when you wanna have a chat. Staff is very nice, sometimes the conversations felt little bit "robotic", but that should be caused by high customer service standards.

Mixed feelings about the Hotel

fantasti experience. ..we realy enjoyed. ..very friendy...staff...helpfull too...calm and cool environment. ..higly professional...front office staff..with good knowledge. .in customer relationships. .. .

We have just spent over a week at the much vaunted Geoffrey Bawa designed Heritance Hotel. We enjoyed our week on the coast but find it tough to rate the hotel better than average. No doubt in its day the hotel would have been considered ahead of its time however today its minimalist design and decor highlight the fact that hotel is getting tired. The rooms have apparently been renovated recently and they are OK however the public areas are uninspiring. We visited a number of hotels on the coast while in the area. It was noticeable how many are either new - Chaaya at Hikkaduwa or recently upgraded - and Surf and Avani at Bentota, or in the process of being renovated - Vivanta by Taj at Bentota. The latter, based on the upgrade we saw to date, is going to be fantastic. The Heritance will need to watch its competition. The beach is nice once you've been rude to the touts to keep them off. Tourist information is not readily available and most things you'll want to do are away from Ahungalla. We got most information and help in getting around from the on site taxi drivers who can arrange pretty much anything including motor bike hire which despite the local traffic we would recommend. Tuk Tuk drivers outside the hotel are bad news - rude and argumentative which we didn't find anywhere else. Finally the hotel entertainment is amateurish. At +US350 a night it wasn't cheap for what it is.
suites if you can , otherwise 2nd and 3 rd floor - mobility issues stay in reception building

Heritance Ahungalla is a great place to visit if you want to spend your leisure time enjoying the view of blue ocean. Staff is very keen on fulfilling requirements of guests and their service should be appreciated. Comfortable rooms, two large swimming pools and other facilities made our stay full relaxing and enjoyable.

Place is very beautiful with a beach and a huge pool yet the worst customer service ever. I ordered a baby food in advance but that was prepared in the last minute and was served really hot. There is no emergency lines to call in the nights. We asked for in room dining but staff were hesitant and was saying to join the buffet. We were waiting for our breakfast to be brought to our room for more than an hour.When we called the room service they said buffet is still not open due to less staff but the time was 7.10am. Highly disappointed.
Isolated beach resort

It was a pleasant experience from the time we got off the vehicle to the time we got back in to leave. The welcome we received and the casual check-in process they adopt put you at ease immediately. From there onwards the room, restaurants and the common areas are very well designed and decorated. It was obvious that the staff were well trained as the service received from different staff members from different departments were the same and exceptional. The quality of food and the variety available at all meals made dinning a pleasure. They even handled our request for exceptional family rooming requirement and accommodated us. We will certainly be back soon!

Nice, Awesome, Excellent, Except that Food Menu has been Repetitive. Excellent View of Room.. Swimming Pool & Beach. Food had lot of Options. Nice Courteous Staff. Nicely Decorated Property. We had only one Problem. Our room , we were given Twin Bed , not a Queen or King Size Bed, so it was difficult for Daughter to sleep between 2 Beds, Even for a Couple. Extra cot was provided on Request immediately. Stayed there for 2 Days & 2 Nights.
A nice hotel and great location but I think you can do better if you want the same standard for a lower price. OK overall.
Paradise - Did not want to leave.
Quality Establishment
Stay away from this hotel
Unforgettable

Me and my family planned this small vacation to Heritance ahungalla because of a recommendation from a friend and after seeing the amazing photos that they have in their website. We stayed in two rooms and the rooms were pretty much normal. The view of the sea was covered from trees as it was in the 1st floor. And basic amenities were there. Nothing to get excited for. Food and the buffet was terrible. Only few options were there for vegetarians. They have not given their attention to minor things. For an example I had to request a different salt shakers during ALL the THREE meals I had during my stay. (One table didn‚Äôt have any salt/ pepper shakes, other two times - the salt was stuck in the shaker) . Also the arrangement of the buffet was hideous. Food were all over the place. The variety of food was really poor compared to the price we paid. The pool was amazing though!!! The view and the feeling was spot on ! And top notch!
Rooms above the main front pool has better views of the sea
All rooms have at least partial sea view.

This is the worst hotel I‚Äôve ever stayed. Not compared to other 5 star hotels even just some random hotel with no star ratings is better than this. Our check-in was at 2.00 and we arrived at about 1.50 and the person there asked if we are starting from dinner and she said lunch will be closing at 2.30. once we went to get the lunch all the tables were full. they told us to wait outside till a table is available. we booked 2 sea view rooms and only view we got was pool. rooms were not cleaned properly. you cannot even walk barefoot on those floors. bathrooms were dirty and not properly maintained. we went to the pool at about 7.00pm and the person there told us the pool will be closing in 10 minutes. but when we asked before they told they close the pool at 8.00pm. the guy at the pool don‚Äôt know how to speak to people. after 10 minutes he came back and told us to leave. there was a lasagna at dinner buffet that smelled really bad. There‚Äôre so many other things and this hotel shouldn‚Äôt be a 5 star hotel. mainly the staff is very rude and they treat guests like they are staying for free.

i was at the hotel afew days ago with colleagues for a workshop. The location is well located. Staff were also pleasant and of help while needed. My main disapointment was the rooms. As i was taking a shower, water didnt run through the drain as fast as its supposed to. This was a clear indication that the drainage is poor. Also, i noticed a dry roll of tissue placed on top of the septic tank, Yak! I immediately threw the tissue in the bin.The walls of the bathroom are not very clean. I would suggest that they invest in putting tiles on the wall. The sheets were also not sparkling clean. One had a stain of something......i dont know what. The towels are also not new. I had one tired look towel which they tried to hide with the newer towel. The hotel needs to really look into the small things that give guests total satisfaction. Otherwise, i dont think i would want to go back there in the near future.

Travelled here for 2 nights stay with friends which was an utter disappointment, been an Atkins group hotel we expected more valued services. There's is so many things wrong in this hotel firstly The rooms, I have been to so many hotels I have not seen such a dirty room, from the kettle to the floor is filthy if you are looking for basic hygiene this isn't the hotel to stay. Broken plug points, toilet leaking underneath, shower door with full of dried soap marks, and many other issues as on pictures.
Large hotel needs updating
Not great. Not sure what alternative there may be. Just a giant ugly hotel.

It's been a great experience so far.. Am satisfied with all the facilities and also great service have provided by the staffs. Hopefully looking forward to visit again soon with my family on my next visit.. Keep doing the good job as always..

This was the last stage of our April Holidays where we chose Heritance Hotels for our stay. First Kandalama and the last day at Ahungalla. The hotel is spacious and has good food and amenities, and is very family friendly. The staff especially the reception and restaurant staff were helpful when they met our needs. We'll be back! üëç

Heritance Ahungalla offers the best in everything; rooms, beach & pool views, food, and cleanliness. The rooms & washrooms are extremely spacious & tidy. And the staff at the reception are very warm & welcoming! Only suggestion - make sure to segregate the veg options with a proper display. Veg sushi had the display but was mixed with seafood & chicken, and sadly even the chef couldn't figure it out until he tasted it & then confirmed.

I used to be very pleased with service and product. Today after 4 month I come again but the place has changed. Now be careful if your bill. A waiter asked me you know how many beer you have consumed, my answer yes; 3. Waiter no 4.well it is only 3 and this is fraud attempted by the staff. They had to admit that yes only 3 beer was served so why have this stupid discussion trying to make me pay for something not consumed. Very disappointed.

Big buffet but flies on table and crawling crabs under tablecloths in airconditioned dining room. The tiles in the shower area had never been cleaned. Dull resort as very little to do beside swim in their pool. The beach is unsafe, no water sports. Only one table tennis table and one carrom board. Very warm and friendly staff but housekeeping and reception leave much to be desired. Not worth the price.Ground floor rooms are dark and dingy with blinds that need a tug of war to open and close.
Try to take room on the top floor as it will give you the view of the beach. The rooms on the lower level do not offer this view.

The property is nice though but the maintenance seems quite not up to the standard. Nice buffet and dining area. The beach view and pool area are very nice and attractive. the staff is very friendly and supportive all the time. Recommended for day outings.
Lovely place for Family stay
Relaxing atmosphere with a very pleasant stay
Super location for holiday

Nice experience, good location. Good service in the staff. Specially in the restaurant. Nice food and good variety. We all enjoyed in nicely. We would like to recommend this nice hotel to indian people and others.
Another unforgettable holiday

We were a group of 20 people in 10 rooms at Heritance Ahungulla for the new year. The service is absolutely the worst I have encountered across Asia. Staff in general are unhelpful and sometimes rude. The breakfast place is fine but the bar and snack place is absolutely terrible. We had to wait for almost an hour for a club sandwich and when asked three times they kept saying ‚Äú2 minutes‚Äù. Finally when I approached a more senior person at the bar, he was totally unapologetic and asked the same waiter who said ‚Äúyeah, I will get it‚Äù. This is one example amongst many incidents - from no towels in the pool to poorly made up rooms. I certainly do not recommend it - there are many other places in Sri Lanka that are far better.

We stayed here as part of a tour of Sri Lanka, finishing with a 5 night stay by the beach. Positives: the staff are friendly and try very hard. Food was plentiful and usually of good quality. The pools are very pleasant and well set out. The size of the room was good, and the aircon worked well without being too noisy. Drinks were reaonably priced - large beer ¬£1.20, cocktail typically ¬£3.75. Negatives: the building is over thirty years old and doesn't really look as though it has had a proper makeover at any time. It looks a bit tired. Although the staff try hard, they are bit chaotic and prone to mistakes when it is busy. On arrival, the wrong bags were sent to our room, and despite me making this clear, the porter seemed determined to leave them with me - a minor gripe, but typifies things. Drinks and food orders were wrong on occasions. I think that the food was pricey for Sri Lanka at ¬£20 each for food from the buffet. Food at the buffet was not always piping hot, depending on what time we went. There is almost nothing to do outside the hotel. The "entertainment" in the evening is dire.
Request first or second floor rooms.
Don't trust the online reservation

We spent five days in this nice resort.Rooms are spacious and well equipped but need mild renovations.Location is magnificent overlooking the indian ocean, with a beautiful lovely nature all around as well as very relaxing atmosphere.Staff without expetion are so friendly and cute.Food quality and diverisity outstanding.There was more than outdoor swimming pools, a moderate gym and spa all were as expected. Highly recommended for all kinds of trips.
Overpriced, dirty and with no concept of service. Weak link in the Heritance chain.
I do not recommend it if you have actually previously vacationed in 4*-5* hotels.

I don‚Äôt have anything bad to say , But I don‚Äôt understand why they let pest ( Ferrell)dogs wondering around the hotel, and other concern is smokers got all the rights, we couldn‚Äôt find any where not smoking signs maybe hotel management not keep up with world trend about non smokers rights , please fix this we will be back surely Thanks
Facilities and comfort.(Pillows were very hard and bulky beds were not that comfortable.

We visited to celebrate our anniversary. Even though its quite apparent that we are a couple, a twin room was provided. In the reservation page its mentioned about a sea view room ("best perhaps are the private balconies ‚Äì from where it will seem as if the sunsets are ablaze in glory, just for you"). The photo also showing a sea view room. But we were given a garden view room in an isolated corner. When inquired the answer was "sorry sir we are full today". Its not an excuse. I must mention that we were not late for our check in . Actually we came around 12.30pm because we planned to have the lunch as well . Then moving to the condition of the room itself, It's very old looking small one. The doors were rusted, stained & discolored. The Bathroom is small, ancient & basic. Walls faded & definitely need painting & renovation. Even most of the 2-3 star level hotels provided a much superior rooms than this. Neither Toothpaste, toothbrush nor shaving items provided which are expected to be provided in a 5 star hotel. We had to asked for it. When asked they have provided us with two packs of toothbrushes & only one of them had a tiny toothpaste for us two. Anyway we manged it economically for two days although both of us used to brush teeth after each & every meal. We didn't bring those because all the other five star hotels we have visited have provided them without any fuss & we honestly expected this hotel to be the same standard level. I noticed the lack of the shaving kit only in the next day morning. I knew i had to ask for it again. But as we are checking out anyway i didn't bother the housekeeping staff early in the morning and left my self unsaved for the breakfast. I'm wondering whether they are providing older rooms especailly for the discounted booking offers. We reserved Heritance Ahungalla thinking that they would provide with the same exceptional service like their Heritance Kandalama which we visited sometime back. Anyway we have determined to avoid Heritance hotels here after as its not worthy taking any risk ,after our anniversary got totally ruined. I truly hope you could make some improvements in the future.

It was great to be back at my favorite beach resort Heritance Ahungalla with my family members. Very relaxing and comfortable stay. All 3 rooms were upgraded and had a stunning view of the ocean on the 3rd floor. Staff was very friendly and courteous. Had a nice time overall and wish to be back here soon.
Less Buffet. Not match with 5 star grade hotel
NOT FOR ME
Hotel needs some TLC
.Ocean views are best on the top floors. Quiet rooms are are at the end of corridors, but longer walk.

Amazing hotel, very friendly and helpful staff. Our two night stay with a 3 year old was very relaxing as we had plenty to do, two pools and a wonderful beach kept us all busy and happy. My daughter loved the traditional dancers and the evening event and still talks about it. Food is great, you have a lot of choice at the jute buffet, the in room dining is great too as you can sit in you balcony and enjoy a meal in comfort. The hotel was fully booked on our weekend stay, but still got a hot dinner served in room withing 20 minutes which I thought was good!. The hotel is set slightly away from a town, so for longer stays and wondering about you may have to walk about half km to get the the gates to access the main road, and would struggle to get about on own if you are not a local. You can get a tuk tuk, without much difficulty during the day. I would like to thank the staff and management for the wonderful time we had and would love to stay again on our next holiday! I found it is a nice touch that senior members from Management team Mr Razeen, Mr Sampath and celebrity Chef Mr Kumarasinghe spent time meeting and speaking to guests in the evening without sitting in offices. I felt it was nice that they cared about how guests felt and they were easy to access if you had concerns. Thank you!

When we arrived we were taken to a room that clearly wasnt set up for us and our two kids. Not only was no baby beds set up, we could not commit to the room as it was too dangerous for our kids. The balcony had steps to railing, which meant our 1 year old could jump or climb over. There were holes i the railing where our 1 year old could slip through. We then spent almost 2 hours looking for another suitable room. Its been horrible as the only room they could put us in has no floor space to walk as the infants beds and pram take up the entire room. Im so sad that i bought my family here on a holiday as its horrible. They are moving us rooms but this is costing a lot more. This place is not for families.
Average for a 5* Hotel
Its by the beach thats it !
Ahhh-ungalla
One of the best beach resorts in sri lanka
Nothing more than a 3 star!

We were spoilt by the appearance and service of heritance kandalama and tea factory. We arrived and the hotel is a big resort as you'd expect. A bit weather battered but a high quality. The rooms are large and clean. Have everything we need. The service is slow and impersonal. Not what we had come to expect in Sri Lanka. There is little ambiance. The evening entertainment is unnecessary, keeping the bar open later would be better. The pools are great just note that you can only swim in the sea in Nov or Dec. It's really rough and dangerous at other times.

We stayed at this hotel for 10 nights on full board basis. The design of this hotel is magnificent, with great attention to detail. The amenities are amazing. We would especially like to mention the animators who kept us all busy with water polo, table tennis, boules, volleyball, the evening shows etc. The staff were very friendly and helpful, nothing was too much for them. The food at breakfast, lunch and dinner was outstanding and the variety amazing. We will definitely be returning to this hotel next year for two weeks!!
Nowhere near 5*
Needs to Upgraded

The hotel is very old and is very pathetic the bathroom really sucks the building is very old and needs high upgradation it's not a five star property at all that is Baba Adam ke Jamane ki hotel like Dharamshala the bathroom walls are without pain and that are insect and animal creatures in your room including Chameleon and dogs in balcony very cheap hotel never visit again and waste of time and money you will spoil your tour by visiting this hotel
Nice beach hotel

Excellent location and beach. Hotel is a fantastic design. Great food and the majority of the staff are really friendly. Unfortunately however, although the management have repeated on a number of occasions that the renovations have been completed, they are far from complete. We did have a look at some of the rooms that had been renovated and they looked excellent. Unfortunately, we weren't in one of these, our room was extremely dated, the cleaning was not done to a very high standard and we don't think the balcony had ever been cleaned! We used the pool furthest from reception which was excellent, with well-kept lawns. The major problem here is that there are only 8 umbrellas, unless you want to sit under the trees, we we didn't. I always sit under an umbrella and my wife always sits in the the sun but the problem is that the pool boy reserves the beds/umbrella's for those that have tipped him previously which then involved us having to have an argument with him most mornings to get a place with an umbrella - on some days there were 2 or 3 umbrella's/sun chairs that he had reserved but there weren't used all day as the guests must have gone out for the day, but he wouldn't let anyone sit on them! The main pool at reception area is excellent although the surrounding lawn areas are extremely scruffy. Overall had an enjoyable holiday and stay at this hotel but the room we stayed in wasn't up to standard. Stayed first 2 weeks in Feb 2017.
Awesome hotel...

If you want sea view ask for it.
An incomparable service
Nov-12

My husband and I had 2 magical nights away at Ahungalla in between our busy wedding week in Dec 13. We were incredibly well looked after from the moment we arrived. From the welcome drinks in the foyer to the quick and friendly check-in, the staff were always polite, friendly and helpful. We were very pleased to have received an upgrade to our room with a lovely view. The swimming pool, beach access and general atmosphere all contributed to a wonderful stay but the highlight of the trip has to be the amazing food! All three meals were of a very high standard, we were very impressed and thoroughly spoilt for choice. I will gladly go back to Heritance Ahungalla anytime I visit Sri Lanka in the future!
Love to come back again

Triton as we used to know it before re-branding, was a hotel i looked forward going to....unfortunately, not anymore... The rooms on the left wing are large & empty and the bathroom accesories were on the wrong side !! We booked in for half-board and dinner was hopeless, hardly any variety for a buffet & tasteless... but must say that breakfast the next morning made up for it !! The overall service was average, but the service in the dining area @ breakfast time was quite good

We stayed there in new year seson so was bit crowded. Staff is really good and friendly. Food was delicios and had many varieties. Room was not modern design but it was okay for us. Hotel will be a good option if you are looking for a good dinner / lunch buffet.
Ask to send a photo
