The place is beautiful although can get crowded during peak holidays/weekends. the rooms are comfortable big and luxury as well. However, was not a big fan of the widely spread buffet as nothing tasted exceptional. It was average for the price paid. Other than that a great place to spend your holiday

When we bought a tour to this hotel, we didn‚Äôt know that it was undergoing a complete restoration, so we arrived and ended up just at a construction site, all sorts of work is being done everywhere, sanding the walls, you breathe dust, or painting some kind of stinking paint, the rooms are shaky, it‚Äôs extremely uncomfortable, I‚Äôll attach photos to you now If you want to go on vacation at a construction site, I ask you to go to this hotel. Now I am in hotel number 262. The next day after my arrival, having met our respected guide in quotes from Anex, I asked to move us to another hotel, no action was taken on the part of Anex, after 4 days of correspondence, hotel representatives tried to move us to other rooms exactly like this stinky. Informative for those who want to spoil their holiday, the end of the hotel renovation is scheduled for spring!
Ask for a room which is not above the main bar. The entertainment can get noisy in the evening.

This hotel was recommended to us by people who stayed here 4 years ago as 'best hotel in SL'. Unfortunately the hotel did not live up to expectations of 'best hotel' or even a 5 star hotel. The upkeep of the hotel is very poor. I understand the humidity and moisture in the air would make it difficult to maintain but the other hotels are managing to maintain standard. Firstly the rooms are looking tired and old!! -The bathrooms were filthy!! i asked house keeping to re clean!! Shower screens had mould and l was told this is hard to keep clean! - what a load of rubbish!! - Beds had bed bugs in them, we were bitten so badly and i thought this was odd as we have been traveling around SL for 2 weeks and not one mozzie bite throughout the whole trip! -Cockroaches in the bathroom after dark! - Complex too large (may be a positive for some people) - Main dining room dark and mouldy smelly + The positives are the staff!! Always friendly and very eager to help. When i complained about the first room we were moved immediately + house keeping really tried to clean the room upon complaint Needless to say as this was the part of our trip to relax we moved hotels and could not have been happier. If this hotel was rated down then i would not have written a review like this but this is definitely not a 5 star hotel
So it doesn't have a Corby Trouser Press but those who want one are missing the point
avoid long weekends as it gets crowded with locals but the guests are very freindly too

Such a beautiful country and hotel! A peaceful and charming stay with friendly and committed staff, as well as lovely food (both traditional and international cuisine). There is plenty to see and experience, and the staff are very good at helping you organize day trips. The hotel itself is open and serene, and designed by Geoffrey Bawa! Service is always good and done with a smile, and the hotel itself opens up onto a stunning beach surrounded by animals and nature. A lovely place!

What a fabulous hotel enjoyed it from the start to the end the service people are so great and awesome and there was a very high standards in service tooom. The rooms are very clean the food here is very delucious. I loved the green pool very much. Must to visit again.
The live music in the evening is nice but might be bothering at rooms close by. All-In guests
Mind reset
Nice, but needs attention
Very friendly & welcoming.

A quick drive from Colombo,a great choice if you are planning a trip with bunch of long lost friends . Good food, friendly staff and a lot of things to do while you are there.The range of food is better on weekends I guess so try to plan your trip accordingly.

Was there with colleagues we had the best time ever the management gave us a very good treatment we even got our own party place we had drinks by the beach it was simply wonderful we really enjoyed the hotel is Fabulous has a great sea view too

Our stay was from 01st of April to the 02nd of April. As April was a month where a lot of tourists are attracted to Sri Lanka, the hotel did have a lot of guests. But the staff made sure that everyone was treated in a special way. The mastermind behind the architecture of Heritance Ahungalla is Late Geoffrey Bawa and as a result, it‚Äôs one of the most striking resorts in the Sri Lankan coast. From the moment where you set foot in the hotel till you leave, the staff stays by your side making sure that your stay is memorable. We experienced a situation which made our visit unforgettable, on the 02nd of April. It was my daughter‚Äôs birthday on the 02nd and on the previous day, Mr. Nipun Mawatta happened to know about it from a friendly talk with us. However that simple conversation was enough for him to alert the rest of the staff to surprise my daughter at breakfast on the 02nd by appearing suddenly with a trolley laden with balloons and a birthday cake with the restaurant crew coming together to sing happy birthday as she cut the cake. It was totally an unexpected, well-planned surprise and Mr. Mawatte and the staff deserves a shower of thanks. Not to forget, the food at Heritance was always ‚Äúnever-enough‚Äù due to their taste and variety. The rooms were lavish and we highly recommend the rooms with the ocean view as it is truly amazing. The infinity pool is always inviting in the burning heat. During our stay, several gents in the staff decided to display their hidden talents from a hilarious performance after dinner. It kept everyone laughing every time we recalled it. Heritance Ahungalla is one of the greatest places to experience the beauty of the Sri Lankan coast and a place ‚ÄúWHERE TRADITION IS ALIVE‚Äù.

We have just returned from our first trip to Sri Lanka. We had a wonderful time and Sri Lanka is stunning. We stayed at the Heritance Ahungalla expecting a little bit more than we got however the biggiest disappointment was how dirty and aged the rooms were. There was no bath and the shower was filthy as was the rest of the room. My son on the first night was sick (not sure how) however we asked that the room be fully cleaned the next day which is was not. You could still see the smears of sick on the floor from where we had cleaned during the night. The bed sheets were also stained and did make you wonder if the sheets were clean stains or not. The corridors to the rooms were also in a poor condition and looked more like the corridors on a run down housing estate (I can say that as I lived on one for 5 years). The bathroom amenities are also just refills with dirty lids so make sure you bring your own! However!! The staff were amazing and so attentive and the natural beauty of Sri Lanka makes it all worth while. Would we go back to the same hotel? No! Would we go back to Sri Lanka? Yes! Yes Yes! Special mention to Sri Lankian immigration too who are so friendly. Looking forward to returning to Sri Lanka.

I used to be a frequent guest since early 2009. This hotel used to be one of the best in every possible way. I should say that the location is great, with absolutely stunning views of the southern beaches of Sri Lanka. The architecture, flora and fauna gives a very relaxing feeling away from the commercial/business feeling. The staff is still very helpful, most would bed over back to entertain the guests. During the last visit with my wife they even upgraded me to their best suite, the Sachin Tendulkar Suite with no buzz or hazel at all. I must say, the rooms are of good size. But unfortunately that is where it ends! The buffets are not up to the standards ( I am being very polite and generous towards the hotel here). Variety is lacking, taste is lacking, freshness is lacking. The edible items run over in 1 hour, so if you go there it late - you are left to trial the buns and sandwiches like parchment, and some left over stuff. As with many other hotels in SL they seem to cater a specific corporate client base, as a result the food spoils it for the relaxing holiday traveller. This is not just one time experience, but my observations over time. Restaurants and ala carte has little to offer. The "best suite" feels like collapsing on one end, not cleaned for days on another note, and worse of all even the renovation seems to be left at half way. Little activities happening at night, and the management does not seem to be interested in addressing it for years. Last few visits all I felt is that the staff at junior positions, room services, and reception are trying to blow some warmth and energy into it, but the higher levels seem to be not bothered about what they offer to the clients. While I do believe, looking at the number of corporate customers in the restaurant (mainly East Asian and Indian - whom I have randomly come to contact with, have informed me that they are sent to this place via corporate arrangements, not by choice) that the hotel is likely making good returns and is not financially pressured to invest in restructuring and renovation; it makes me sad that this is like an aincient giant which is approaching its last legs. Would I recommend it to anyone? Probably not if you are on your vacation. Given there are quite nice new boutique hotels in the area, for a fraction higher price point. Would I go there again? Probably not, unless the hotel addresses these issues effectively, because it's a waste of time and money the way it is.

Unfriendly staff Fake smiles Attitude Lack of flexibility I feel like a burden on the hotel I didn‚Äôt feel like a guest at all Discriminative I felt that im not welcomed One of the staff interrupted me while i was talking to his colleague and told me 1 minute then he started to talk in Sinhala while me standing waiting for his permission to talk lol My first and last stay in this hotel

I went to spend this weekend to heritance ahungalle with my family, and it was an excellent choice! The food, hospitality, service, was very good. If you're searching for a good hotel to spend your holidays with your family or friends, doubtlessly this is the best choice!

We felt we could not relax whilst in the grounds, the local sellers both men and women, hid in the bushes of the hotel on the beach, waiting to get people's attention. As soon as you stepped onto the beach, you were surrounded by them. Also so much rubbish strewn about the perimeter. Overall the hotel lacked any atmosphere, maybe it is too large for that? The staff were all lovely and friendly. For the money we both felt very let down, it is marked as a 5 star hotel but I would disagree with that.
Be just a little careful

We visit there as out department annual trip. From the start the experience was terrible. General check-in time was 2.00 p.m. Be we waited for ever to get our rooms. We were at tjhe lobby and we had to check every 10 minitues for the room availabity. After great difficultly I manage to get my room around 4.00 p.m. Room condition was not that satisfactory either. to get the hot water after turning the tap it took considerable time. First time I thought there was nop hot water. Bidet shower was made awful loud noise. In the restaurant if the table is not prepared it took some time to prepare it. I still missed certain items like napkins, I asked for severral times and eventually continue witho out it. Food was average in both lunch and dinner, but the brakfast was better. Inside the rooms the cellular service was poor, sometime absolutely no reception. I can't find any reason for this but all my friend experience this issue.

We are a European Asian couple who came to Sri Lanka for our Winter vacations. We admire Geoffrey Bawa as a legendary architect and decided to come to one of the hotels designed by him to live his work for real. So We booked two nights in Heritance Ahungalla. Today is the second night of our stay and we just left the beautiful beach after the music reached the point of a super loud sound test. When we checked in we were made to sit and wait in front of a really loud bad music group. We complained a few times about the loud music right in our ear but they smiled and continued, forcing us to move away with our bags. Otherwise the treatment we got in checkin process was cool. But all the good mood was gone thanks to the awful music. Bawa designed his buildings in a way that the outside is coming to the inside and there are lots of open spaces. So really bad music in full volume means that you will hear it all over the hotel even in your own corridor. We complained more than 10 times and witnessed that other tourists were laughing at the music and walked away as far from the lobby as they could. The hotel management put really ugly ridiculous christmas decoration in the lobby and inside the beautiful infinity pool making, a big mockery of Bawa who designed the lobby so that you see the sea behind the infinity pool. The food was okay, nothing special other than a terrible vegetable chop suey and vegetable fried rice we got for yesterdays lunch. They have great freshly baked bread and spreads which we loved. And nice veggie burgers. Our room was interesting, as it seems to be originally as designed by Bawa years ago. The mini bar was dirty inside and the refrigerator quite rusty. The wifi worked well for my computer every where in the hotel, but my wife had not as much as luck as i did. The staff were trying to give us a friendly face and some times we met nice people. A front desk guy called Khan was really funny and cool to talk to when he helped us secure the late checkout which we were promised via booking.com. The dining area got really wet under my own feet with lots of rain water this morning when it was heavily raining. Our corridor and the bar/ reception area was flooded because the roofs and windows were leaking. They have amazing pools designed by Bawa and we used every opportunity jump in to them. The hotel is an architectural masterpiece and in a very cool location. However, the company that runs it seems to be treating this paradise for architectural lovers as just a another cheaply run 5 star hotel to use as space for mega groups they bus in to maximise profit. The loud music and badly maintained building may kill it for most. For us, we will not come again unless some miracle happens tomorrow. We are extremely disappointed of the fate of Bawa's hotel.
Disappointed, bad experience. 3D2N

It used to be a great place, sadly, not any more. For $172 USD you can find more magic in many other locations in Srilanka's southern coast. Food was nothing fabulous, the restaurant had flies, really far too many. The servers were not on the ball, coffee was horrible. checking in was not smooth, towels (some) threadbear or torn. bathroom water clogged up. However, It was fixed without much fuss. Sorry, I am done with this hotel.
Can't stop coming back
Memories from Heritance Ahungalla
Decent

So it seems that even though we booked a 5‚≠ê hotel, we were unlucky to get the most outdated dirty rooms I've ever seen in such highly rated hotel. I always judge my room by the condition of the bathroom. The bathrooms here in both rooms were so dirty. The shower was the worst. The shower screen was completely covered by soap scum. The tiles were mouldy. Clearly the housekeeping had not heard of bleach or sugar soap or any kind of deep cleaning. Even run down hotels can be presented well with proper maintenance & care. These rooms don't deserve anymore than 3‚≠ê rating. Very disappointed. The food outlets however were fantastic. We dined at 3 outlets during our stay and each area was superb. Food was delicious. Best buffet food I've experienced this time in SL. The service was equally incredible. We travel with a toddler and we can demanding however the team made it so pleasant for us. Thanks you F&B team. Keep up the great work. You guys run a true 5‚≠ê rated Hotel restaurant. Message to the Heritance brand. High time you pay attention to the condition of your rooms rather than leveraging off the great locations your hotels are based at.

Ask for a higher level room with the balcony facing the ocean for a wonderful view. Closer to the staircase or elevator if you're too lazy to walk as I had a to do a bit of walking to get to mine which was fine with me & as it was situated in a corner & i felt it was larger than my parents which was along the corridor.
If you are concerned with noise, ask for a room which is not close to the center of the hotel where you may hear music.

We came here with my family we were really happy with lovely service and food.. Specially chef.thilakarathne, Praveen and thusahara. Sunday buffet is here really big... We will back to this hotel for over night.. Also I will recommend. This place to my other friends As well...
overall it was a nice stay, wish the view from my room was better

We are staying at the Heritance Ahungalla during the monsoon low season, but weather has been great. The hotel is a beautiful Geoffrey Bawa resort, not new but reasonably well maintained. We have a lovely comfortable, well appointed room, spotlessly clean and attended to each day. Beautiful swimming pool (can't swim in the ocean at this time of year as it's too rough). Friendly staff. Great breakfast. So why aren't I giving this resort 5 stars? A few problems. Firstly the service at the outdoor bar area is very slow for simple snacks/ lunch. You wait and wait for a simple sandwich for example. Prices are very high. With tax and service we just paid 2,000 rupee for a bottle of Lion beer, a lime and soda and bowl of devilled cashews. The resort feels a bit isolated and there aren't obvious alternatives for dining etc. (that may explain the high prices.) The resort is large. Next time I will stay in all boutique hotels and guest houses for more personalised service and better value in Sri Lanka. I feel a bit ripped off at this resort (and we have stayed at a range of places around Sri Lanka). Even up market resorts need to understand that there is a limit to what tourists will pay for basics.
Best sea view in the 3rd floor
Not exactly 5 star

Now, we have been coming back to this Hotel since it was called Triton because it stood out among typical beach hotels in Sri Lanka and coming here once in a while was treat for our children. It is a quite different now, and not particularly in a good manner. Our last stay at the hotel was on a weekday and was out of season. The property was about half full and a renovation was going on in the main side. At the dining hall, for some odd reason, there were no cloth table napkins and instead, a cheap replacement of paper serviettes. The food served were all so bland and nothing impressive, that's including desserts. I even overheard a couple saying that it was the same for the past few days! Breakfast had in store for us, an averagely spicy Sri Lankan food corner which was quite good. Pools and activity around the pool was enjoyable and the best part of this stay. An interesting underwater Zumba class also took place! The rooms were the same as before, thank goodness, but one thing made me stop my praise. The bidet shower was out of order. There was a surprise at the check out. I made reservation by calling this hotel and made sure that child meal charge was included with the price. (Child stays free in a double room sharing bed but for the meal, they charge about 30USD). In any case, we were asked to pay extra for the child meal because the price mentioned was the Double room rate. It was a mistake done by booking operator and the Hotel said that if we refuse to pay, the balance will have to be deducted from operator's wage. Since we did not want that to happen, we just paid and left. Overall, I think the hotel could have done a little more to repeating guests. I think that the hotel might have gotten complacent, due to the five star rankings people have given them, but as of now we lost loyalty to this hotel and unlikely to recommend others to stay.
Indian food Breakfast is very poor & tasteless and dry must be bad chef,...Uludu wade like ppadam,..Those taste like eating a News paper,.Sambar is like water,.Other itemsare grate!!!
Excellent Hospitality and Service

Do a quality check on the room you are allocated - while still at reception.... count on your fingers - bed - ok, bed linen - ok - fridge - ok? toilet - does it flush? does the shower/ hot water/ work...... really, is all this effort worth it?? there are much better hotels right along the coast

Hotel is very good! Nice staff, clean and good food. The "tour guides" at the beach are expensive and not reliable. Contact Eranda at +94 77 664 1538 for special and affordable tours. Very friendly Tourguide!

We travelled as a family and stayed in a deluxe suite, so had plenty of room. The furnishings in the room were a little dated, and the hotel as a whole could do with a revamp. There is a new luxury 5 star hotel being built next door, and I wondered whether the Heritance is gradually sliding to the rung below international luxury hotel, so as not to have direct competition. The food and service here were definitely substandard in comparison to the other hotels on our trip (Ulagalla, Anantaya and Jetwing Lighthouse and Yala), and our son ended up with food poisoning on our last evening, nearly delaying our return home. It was hard to get a table in the restaurant, and once seated it was hard to get the staff's attention for any drinks. The hotel was not very responsive to requests (we had problems with ants in the room, a lamp not working and a couple of other things) but the boy looking after our room was very attentive. Having said that, the hotel was very helpful about allowing us to use another room on the day of departure so that we could continue to use the facilities. I think there was a laundry issue: each time we asked for pool towels we were told there weren't any, but they did eventually materialise from a tumble dryer. Service at the pool bar was extremely erratic and inconsistent - we usually had to walk up to the bar to get attention. The stretch of beach by the hotel was lovely, and the currents not as strong as in some places, but still a risk for swimming. There was often entertainment on the beach, but two days after fireworks, the debris was still littering the beach. You have a great stretch of sand, don't ruin it! All in all, the hotel gives the impression of a gradual decline, which is a shame. Our room (at the very end of a corridor) was very quiet, but our friends stayed in a suite nearer to the main part of the hotel (329, I think) where you could hear all the entertainment all evening.
Good but not so great

I liked everything very much. There was great room service. The maid Rukmsn did his job efficiently and responsibly and every day after cleaning he left a beautiful figure made of towels. I always made sure that there was water and a comfortable temperature in the room. Near the beach and ocean. I will definitely come to you again. Thank you very much.

Fabulous pristine beach. Spacious hotel which blends in to the surroundings. Simple relaxed and calm. Rooms are comfortable. Food with all inclusive buffets caters to all types. Courteous and helpful staff.

I am surprised at the number of glowing reviews this hotel has received. Either my wife and I were unlucky, too hard to impress, or other reviewers for this hotel were being too kind. Ill start with the positives. The hotel grounds are very nice, the pool is excellent, the location right on the beach very nice. The rooms are ok, they have everything you might expect or want. Nothing more or less. However this hotel seems to follow the usual business model you find in these types of regions. Hire the cheapest staff you can find, provide only the basic training, charge the guests international rates, make a fortune on high margins. Staff were slow and spoke very little english. They cannot engage in conversation which is frustrating when you need to ask about the local area, request extra food items, or anything you might require. There was no imagination, such beautiful grounds yet no outdoor BBQ for guests during the day or night, outdoor pool bar, or even music. And then there is the idea of apparent supplementation of hotel income by allowing corporate/local guests in with their families in tow on weekends. About 20 screaming kids in the pool and all the deck chairs taken forcing guests like myself to retreat somewhere else. I just dont expect this at a hotel that wants be considered in the luxurious category. Food was overpriced for the quality. It was fine, just not what you would expect for the price. Staff would take away an empty bottle and just fail to ask if you wanted another. Basic stuff. Staff are just in a constant state of apathy. I found myself having to look for the barman, find the guy to bring my wife and I the towels for the pool area. They were just never where you wanted them to be. When you did they were slow and emotionless. And the hawkers waiting outside the hotel limits on the beach. I mean that put me off straight away. We couldnt go anywhere without being accosted by these people. If I want a poorly made garment Ill go the street market myself thanks. Other guests actually hesitated walking on to the beautiful beach just so they didnt have to interact with these people. How is that fair? Upon checkout, my wife and I sat in the lobby area for 35 minutes as we waited for our driver and werent offered a single beverage/refreshment. Guess once you check out you arent worth the time anymore? Given so many of us only have only a few weeks a year allotted for holidays due to work commitments, its heartbreaking not getting what you think you are paying for. I think the Heritance Ahungalla has become complacent due to all the kind reveiws. When compared to the surrounding area it is 5 star quality, but internationally its 3 star at best. Its not a bad hotel at all, just not that great. Therefore I gave it an "average" rating as its simply average. UPDATE: We have just checked in to the Fortress in Galle and it makes the Heritance look even worse. I wish we hadnt bothered with Ahungalla at all now. Im sure Ill get some half-hearted response from the management regarding my critique as they have done to others. I would have given it to them personally had they asked, but they never did.
FILTHY
Luxury and Beachfront

I went here just before Christmas, with friends. It's a lovely hotel - good rooms, nice food, good location (although sea swimming a bit rough). Gym, swimming pool, jacuzzi, free wi-fi, all the trappings. But the service just didn't match up - it was very pleasant. all the staff were extemely nice. But poor English, sloppy service, long waits when ordering anything. So although I'd recommend it, I do hope that Heritance take some time and trouble to train the staff properly - it's a great hotel, but the service lets it down. Biggest black mark was the very vocal hawkers on the beach - they stay just on the hotel boundary, and shout and harass the guests trying to sell things. Not pleasant at all, and really ruins what would otherwise be a restful and relaxing place. I'm surprised the hotel hasn't negotiated with them to tone down their somewhat agressive selling techniques.
Upper floors better if solo; ocean front room - splash out for upper grade suite

Rooms were superb with great facilities and food was great... Had a nice view of the beach and I think it's the best place to enjoy a walk on the beach as well as a swim in the large swimming pool.........
Some areas of the hotel looked neglected and is in need of renovation.
Really helpful and kind staff. Awesome room and service
Not the best

Excellent hotel lovely staff. Had a wonderful time. I would advised management of this hotel to stop tourist visiting and purchasing from Aida gems Bentota.it would not be somthing you would wish your hotel to be associated with. Extremely poor quality work and dishonesty . You will see many very poor reviews mounting to include our own experience. I cannot express myself more to keep away from this dealer. Items will break and gems will fall out. You will not receive any interest in after sales service. Please please share these reviews to others. Thank you for reading.
Not as good as expected!
Traveling to Ambalangoda and getting a tuk/bus from there would be a cheap way of traveling.

I stayed here for 3 nights with my husband, my one year old and my four year old in August. This is a lovely hotel, well maintained with great staff. Everyone was very helpful and considerate especially as I spent most of my time running after my one year old. The only let down for us was that there wasnt a kids pool - my son could only stand up on the steps of the pool which meant we were constantly on guard. The close proximity of the beach was beautiful so the kids enjoyed the playing in the sand. The buffet was good - there was a different choice every night. For lunch we ate at the pool bar which i enjoyed more. There is a very small kids club room so the kids spent a little time colouring. I would recommend this hotel for older families or couple - purely based on the pool depth.
Terrible. Unbelievable. Worst Experience in any Hotel in Sri Lanka, let alone a Five Star one & we have stayed in many

We spent two nights of total rest and relaxation. Staff were friendly and helpful. The high tea was a disappointment as it took nearly an hour to be delivered and when it did arrive the food was disappointing too. Breakfast and dinner buffets had an extensive selection of food. Sous-chef Manjula was very helpful and got us some special dishes from the kitchen. The lady making the hoppers was very kind and helpful too. Beautiful landscaped gardens. Everything was clean and tidy. Great after dinner entertainment. During the day there are plenty of activities to keep the guests entertained. (Water aerobics, beach volleyball etc)
Fabulous hotel

Everything is good good food with great hospitality and good service They think more about us. Every time they try to do best of them. I hope to come again this hotel and I wish you all the best......

Excellent service and fantastic experience at Heritance. Food accomadation anf hospitality is exceptional. Ive been coming here from my childhood. Favourite hotel in the down south. Special thanks out to Thushara Gnanaratne and Praveen Fernando.
The Best resort yet on the beach
Unique ambience and Proffessional Staff
Outstanding
Faded Gem
Block A has a bigger infinity pool.

Buying buffet tickets were as though lunch was freeLaid back service. food prices way too much compared to other hotels in this area. We had lunch buffeut and it was not at all good. It does not justify charges.
Lovely Srilanka
A lovely honeymoon at hertiance ahungalla ‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è
Water dripping off the ceiling | spoiled holiday

A tranquil & amazing stay at this hotel which is set back from the main road with a STUNNING INFINITY POOL and access to the white sandy Indian Ocean beach (where you can see fishermen working hard for their daily catch). Ahungalla is quiet and there are limited offerings around (although never too far away are roti's and spice gardens). The hotel has all of the amenities that you would expect from a top range hotel, so if you are looking for total RELAXATION, The Heritance delivers in spades! EXCELLENT service and incredibly friendly staff who work together to ensure guests enjoy their stay. On arrival you receive a mouth cleanser (different albeit slightly strange) and a welcome drink (multiple options - very refreshing). There were plenty of options for breakfast and dinner (vegetarians and even just fussy eaters have choices to make). The rooms are large, comfortable and well equiped - the best few nights sleep we had in a 3 week trip!

We stayed for 10 in the luxury room during February. The room itself was large and clean, however the accommodation in general needs to up its game to 5 star standards. We were shown two of the newly refitted rooms which were beautiful, however planned works due to start in May have been delayed. What a shame! Other areas of the hotel are showing signs of wear and tear for example the gym with its old equipment. Now to the positives of which there were many. The layout of the hotel is stunning with two massive pools at either end of the hotel. The staff at the hotel are outstanding with particular reference to the pool boys and resaurant staff. Nothing was ever a problem and each request was greeted with a smile . I would advise to eat at the hotel as there aren't that many options outside. Although buffet fare there was always lots of variety, and we were pleased We had a couple of issues , however these were sorted out by the general manager. If you are not happy speak with him and the issue will be resolved. We had a super relaxing break and felt totally looked after with that personal service The hotel will be 5 plus after the refurbishment. We visit again
Insist on the 'third floor' where views and quietness may prevail.

It‚Äôs a beautiful created by the famous architect Geoffrey Bawa. However more than the unique architecture, the hotel is renowned for its delectable cuisine. Some areas of the hotel, like the corridor floors need to be re painted. Had trouble finding pool towels cuz there was one person assigned for that task and he was not present all the time. However their food will never disappoint you. Will return again.
Over-rated, over-priced
Less options for vegetarians. Non vegetarian smell at the eating area was making us uncomfortable.

Great hotel to spend a few days with the family. 2 good sized pools, good sized rooms with balconies facing the ocean/pool in most instances. We were full board and the variety and quality of food was excellent with a number of items prepared by the chefs in front of us so didn‚Äôt experience ‚Äúbuffet fatigue‚Äù. Staff went out of their way to be helpful and always carried a smile. There are some corridor sections of the hotel that could do with a bit of tlc (ie refreshed painting/ decorating touch ups etc) but all in all good value for the money you pay.
Mr thilina

‚Ä¢ I am a frequent guest at Heritance and for the second time in 2022. My holiday joy and that of many other guests was spoiled by the majority of holidaymakers from two other countries. Her reckless and disrespectful manner caused anger among the other guests and hotel staff. Parents didn't take care of their children. The children took over the restaurant as a playground. Eating behavior unacceptable, ‚Ä¶‚Ä¶. .Pool was polluted with sand. The employees tried everything to change this situation, but only met with rejection. Not exactly motivating. It's over now!!!!!!!!!!!! From March 31st no more guests will come from these two countries. The Heritance Ahungalla will shine again in its former glory. Come to Heritance Ahungalla and enjoy unique Sri Lankan hospitality nestled in the hotel's paradisiacal setting. I wish you an unforgettable time.

This hotel is classed as 5* it certainly is not. The refurbished rooms are definitely not. The hotel is tired and scruffy, the rooms are dirty (we were offered 2 rooms) and the pool is filthy. The staff were not bothered that we were unhappy and we were very polite in our complaint. We checked in at 5pm and checked out at 7pm

It was not the greatest hotel we stayed at but it had a good service, nice beach, ok food and all you could expect from a resort like that. We had an upgrade which was appreciated. The property should definitely be refurbished though because it is old and a bit run down. All in all we had a good service but expected a more classy place.
Heritance Hotel Review

We arrived here nearly a week ago to torrential rain. This is the end of the monsoon season in this part of the island. First impressions of the hotel were lovely. The staff are what makes this hotel a pleasure to stay in. We were shown to our room which was a little dated but clean and cool. The rain Showers in the room are great and the shower gel smells of a tropical fruit sensation. Food here is amazing. The head chef Manjua runs a great team of chefs who are more than happy to cook you what you like if what's on offer isn't to your taste. They sure know how to make curries here. You must try every single one as they are divine. Our ever expanding waistlines are proof of this. There is plenty more on offer if curries are not your thing. A myriad of fresh fruit is available and bananas taste amazing, nothing like what we eat at home. The weather was good most days. Towards the early evening rain clouds gather and a heavy downpour follows. Perfect time for a G&T at the pool bar. Sunsets are incredible and worth waiting around to see. The beach is vast and deserted. Just a few hotel guests walking along taking in it beauty. There are however beach guys who nag the pants off you to sell you sightseeing trips. Be aware they usually don't have insurance so best to book with a reputable company. They are harmless just a few no thank you and they get the message. There are a group of ladies who sell sarongs and trinkets on the beach they are lovely and friendly, don't forget to barter here, start low and then usually meet in the middle. Be careful of the sun you burn very quickly and don't forget mozzie repellant and bite cream. We used a guide for our trips LASI TOURS LASI was great and drove safely through the traffic which is another world in itself. He is very knowledgable and will arrange bespoke tours according to your needs. Sri Lanka is beautiful. Made even more special by its people. The temples, turtle sanctuaries, elephant retreats are fab. Unfortunately we didn't have enough time to see everything so a revisit will be on the cards. I hope you find this review of interest

Consistent with the other recent reviews we were scheduled to stay at the Heritance for the final three days of our SL tour. However, we checked out after the first night. On a positive note, the room was clean and recently refurbished. The food in the optional al √† carte restaurant was also good and the restaurant staff very friendly and efficient. On the other hand, the hotel is extremely large with many guests on ‚Äúall you can eat‚Äù inclusive deals. This created a very different feel to other hotels we stayed in. The staff were a mixed bag. Some were polite and others simply ignored you. The grounds were somewhat scruffy and the water in both pools was opaque suggesting a problem with algae (see photos). The adjacent beach was full of litter and hawkers. Having decided to check out were asked for feedback and this was positively received. Unfortunately, this didn‚Äôt result in any gesture of good will and we paid the full bill for drinks etc. In summary, the hotel is adequate if you want to eat, drink and sunbath cheaply but it does not provide the experience consistent with other hotels in this class.

The reception people are very depressing. They are not courteous, rude and I was shocked that this hotel belongs to a group of hotels and a large company. The Reception people really gave my family a soar welcome and ruined our mood. They are very suspicious and look at you like we are thieves. Maybe the Management have to start customer service classes and put the right people there.At least people who can smile. Also responsiveness of services is also slow overall.

Booked over the phone for 3 nights which was ok enough. Nice enough hotel with a decent location though the beach was not as nice as you'd get in the east coast or even some Other parts of west coast of Sri Lanka. Most of our time was spent in the 2 pools as were the others from what it seemed as the sea was too rough during our stay. Food was ok, mainly buffet type of food with a decent variety though the fruit selection seems to be the same everyday (melon, papaya, pineapple & guava) Rooms and the hotel was a little dated to be honest and not worthy of 5 or even 4 star, especially compared to some of the other hotels we've stayed during this trip to SL. I do admit though that I have high expectations usually and wouldn't mind paying for it but this hotel was rather less expensive compared to the others and kind of explains why you get dated room & decor (get what you pay for right??) One things I should mention however was the price of food and drinks. It is an absolute rip off when looking at the cost of drinks. All the menu prices are expensive enough , but they add a mandatory service charge of 10% and government VAT 12.5% on top of the final bill which make you pay about 800 LKR (about ¬£4) for a bottle of Corona. Note that local beverages are not cheaper either. A small bottle of water is about 225 LKR which is little too expensive compared to other Sri Lankan luxury hotels. The location itself is not close to Galle so not much to do outside of the hotel. We did do a boat trip on Madu river (about 10 miles out) which was as well worth it but I'd suggest you don't book through the hotel and go directly to the Balapitiya bride where you can see many tour operators and get a boat for a ride. Takes about 90 mins and cost us 2000 LKR (¬£10) which was well worth it. There also is a turtle hatchery that you can visit which is nice. I probably wouldn't come back to this hotel to be honest as I wasn't overly impressed but could be a decent location for the average, budget conscious traveller looking for a bargain, as long as the price remain cheap.
WORST HOTEL IN SRI LANKA

The hotel at 5* doesn't pull at all. It needs a good repair. Rooms are good, cleaning is good. But there are nuances like a broken kettle, the doors to the balcony don't close. Strange scenery on the walls. The linens are not exactly white. There are two pools. Beautiful ocean view. People are kind, sympathetic. The food isn't very varied. A lot of it's spicy, the beef's really tough. Delicious pineapple and papaya. There was no fish variety. Amateur salads. Ice cream liked it. They gave oysters once. The shrimp is delicious. The restaurant's not big. Wifi is weak. There are no TV channels in Russian. For all the faults, you can rest here well. In food find your own, the population is very positive and simple, nature is beautiful. Just whoever is coming here will tune in to another level of service üòä Special thanks to the hotel, for your help and special attention to us!!! Not the hotel's indifference to tourists and quick response to the issue, for that thank you so much! Thank you very much to the staff! We wish the hotel prosperity and development!

The hotel was built in the early 1980s in the Sri Lankan style. Helpful and nice service, trouble-free contact in English. Rooms clean and spacious. A good base for trips to the most important attractions of the region. The swimming pool is clean and well-kept. No problems with sunbeds in January/February. There is a wide beach next to the hotel with a flat entrance to the ocean. I would highly recommend!

The staff is very attentive and smiling The huge buffet and for every taste pay attention to spicy dishes not always indicated Rooms are sea view Superb swimming pools I recommend the restaurant a little expensive but really perfect 3 servers for 6 people

Best on our "BIG DAY"

I love this place for its beauty and architecture and have been coming here for years (the first time 30 years ago as it was my Sri Lankan father‚Äôs favourite) . However the profile of the hotel seems to have changed -accommodating large groups of badly behaved guests has brought the experience down .
Everything was good, but they did not make up our room (we stayed two nights). Exceptionally beautiful hotel design and location.

Driving up to the hotel it looks wonderful, and it is. Great welcome, and always friendly staff. Two pools, set over a large area, lots of space to seat out. Set over 3 floors, long corridors.Gym, and spa (expensive). 3 restaurants, very good veg curry, best we had all holiday.Balcony to all rooms. Rooms could do with a little more lighting, very dark if you want to read or do work. The Large restaurant that is used for breakfast, is all enclosed, some times gets very noisy and stuffy. Breakfast food very good. Can be hassled by local sellers on the beach but they will move on once you say NO. would stay here again.
Lovely peaceful location
Weather Lol! Rained most of the week, water came in and shut down mode applied. Shame because beach and pool are lovely. Just not so much in the rainMpx
No where near being a 5 star hotel!
Nice property but service lacking

Disrespectful and unfriendly front office manager and staff. From the time I arrived to the lobby. Wasnt provided a welcome drink and towel while other non solo travelers were attended too. Had to carry my own bags to the room. The front office manager was the worst employee I've ever dealt with and was extremely rude. Tried to over charge me for meals and came up with some nonsense explanation which has nothing to do with the guest blaiming the head office. when i made a noise regarding it so other guests could hear he asked me what i want just to shut me up. Extremely unprofessional and sadly this hotel has lost its way especially with staff. Same menu everyday for breakfast which was boring.

Pros - great view of the ocean (sea view avaiable with Premium rooms0 - speacious clean rooms - good size pools (note there are two pools, and one is mostly only offered to foreigners) - good spread for buffet (but its almost the same everyday for bfast) Cons - teriible reception/front desk service; had a don't care attitude and were often rude - had electrical problems in the room when the fan was turned on but even after informing the reception twice (on two seperate days), they did nothing about it..did not even apologise or offer to change the room - requested king/queen bed but were only given twin mattresses - no bath tubs, this is only available in luxury rooms - Not much choice for in-room dining - Don't visit during the weekends; the hotel allows far too many groups to have the spend the day on the weekends (allowing one or two groups is fine but there should be a limit so that the pools are not over crowded); My personal opinion is that the hotel treated foreigners differently to the locals (including locals from overseas); with the locals, they just didn't care. Me and my husband are Sri Lankans and we visit Sri Lanka often and like to escape out of colombo for a few days. We were really disappointed with the way they treated us. I think i've had far better service in other hotels in the area (bentota etc). Great hotel but would not recommend due to the horrible service.

One of the best experience i had out of all the hotels i have visited.... the rooms are quite big and the view is so great.... the food is so delicious and has a very large variety and the people are very kind attentive and very helpful..... the servicr is superb i would say... overall a good hotel will come back again
A Wonderful Experience!
Belated honeymoon
In need of TLC ....Dated...
Excellent and awesome place

I was not a fan of local sellers at the beach trying to sell us stuff even when we said no and they kept following us but it's a public beach and not in the hotel's control. The internet was also a bit spotty inside the rooms.
AMAZING!!!! Best honeymoon ever! Great food & staff!

We spent the new year in this hotel, it as entertaining and fun, we have been to the beach to see the fireworks! There was lots of choices of food this night, more than 10 international cuisine, and it was so delicious. The day after we spent the day at the sandy beach, 4 km of clean beaches with waves , u can t ask for more !!! Good times!!

We had a great stay at Heritance Ahungalla this January! The hotel provides excellent quality for its price, everything is clean and comfortable. The staff was very nice everywhere, from the reception to the restaurant, and always responsive to our needs (special thanks to our housekeeper Rukmal, who made our stay even more comfortable:)). There is great food for every taste at the restaurant, if you‚Äôre curious about traditional food ‚Äî it‚Äôs going to be heaven for you! There are always multiple types of curries, kottus and biriyanis, that vary every day. If you want something more familiar in food you will be satisfied too! We really miss having fresh sweet fruits with every meal. There are two pools at the hotel, one is very big and popular among kids, and the other one is smaller but way quieter and just heavenly. The nature at the hotel territory is very pleasant for the eye. There are some cute little animal visitors on the territory, but no scary big reptiles or insects (you need to be cautious of mosquitoes tho). There is live music in the lobby every night and one of the evenings we were surprised with a beautiful cultural show. On our first day we met a great tour guide whose name is Nimal, we bought an excursion from him to go to the old town of Galle and were very satisfied! We‚Äôve had a great day, Nimal brought us to various great places and recommended a nice restaurant, we‚Äôve taken our time and explored all these places and the old town itself. We definitely recommend Nimal‚Äôs tours! He is a great man that you can trust and always ask for a ride. I hope your stay goes as pleasant as ours! Thank you Heritance Ahungalla!

üßñüèª‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏èüßñüèº‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏èüíÉüèºüë∞üèº‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è We have visited in November 2022 during our honey moon. we had a great unforgettable experience there from the staff at the reception specially sweet ‚ÄúTharindi‚Äù to the daily decoration by Rukmal‚ù§Ô∏è of the room to the luxury of the bath and the amazing food. We especially wish to Recognize and Thank THARINDI , Tharindi treated us all royally each morning, like part of her family, especially on the morning she was called us dally for the breakfast üç≥ Thank You Tharindi üå∏
There was a problem with my booking which meant I was delayed checking in. They sorted it in the end so all was well.

My wife and I stayed here for three weeks and overall found it to be a comfortable and very friendly hotel. This is branded as a five star hotel, but in our experience, these star ratings are pretty meaningless and we have found that nearly everywhere we have been in the world. If you are influenced by star ratings you may be disappointed for reasons I will explain later. The public areas are expansive and the hotel looks out over a lovely beach area. The red warning flag flew every day of our stay and you would do well to take notice of this because there are strong undercurrents. But we swam nearly every day in the hotel pools both of which are large and set in the attractive hotel grounds. Our room was on the 3rd floor and a good size with all the usual fittings including tv with mostly English channels, very effective shower, balcony overlooking hotel gardens, hair dryer and a safe. One day a room attendant arrived to change the safe and after emptying, picked it up and put it on his trolley. Not so safe then! There is a well equipped gymn on the 2nd floor and there is good Wi-Fi throughout the hotel and even in the grounds it isn‚Äôt too bad. Here I have to mention what many visitors will regard as the main criticism of the hotel. The rooms are a bit dated and well used. By that I mean they do look a bit tired and in need of refurbishment. Having said that, I don't think people should be put off by this because there are many really good aspects to this property. For example, we stayed on an all inclusive basis and the food in the main restaurant is outstanding. Every day there are at least seven or eight choices of main course. If that's not enough Chef Manjula who walks the restaurant floor during service, will cook something to your liking. Most of the cuisine is curry orientated but you can get plain fish or meat. He cooked a very tasty sirloin for me. Coupled with the friendly service, and the delightful staff, this really is the main selling point of the hotel. It is worth noting if you are all inclusive that you can only get wine (it's Italian) in the main restaurant and not from the bars. This was a bit irritating for us since we are wine drinkers and didn't want to drink beer, shorts or cocktails they serve in the bar areas. The other point to be aware of is that for religious reasons, if it is a full moon the law forbids the sale of any alcoholic drink for the whole day. There are quite severe penalties if any establishment is found selling or distributing alcohol. We also got caught out on Independence day and regional election day both of which were no alcohol days. The hotel has two fine dining restaurants and a seafood shack called the Wadiyah. We tried this and had fresh grilled fish right by the beach. In our opinion, it is not particularly fine dining. The table mats were dirty, only bar stools were provided until we asked for proper chairs, the music stopped and was never restarted, the salad was very small and the area is poorly lit. It lacked any real atmosphere. You have to pay for any of the alternative dining and we paid 15000 Sri Lankan rupees which is about ¬£75 including wine. We also dined in the Upper Room where mostly European food is served and had New Zealand lamb which was very good. In our opinion this is a good hotel with excellent food in the main restaurant and wonderful friendly staff. They really do go the extra mile to make your stay a happy one. This all goes a long way towards overcoming the increasingly pressing need for refurbishment of the bedrooms.
Good but no 'wow'
Ask for a room away from the entertainment
ones with a sea view obviously!

Rukmal was our crew's favorite staff. He made the towels in the cutest ways. It's fair to mention that it's not only him but all staff are so good mannered and nice.thanks for all services. Also the food was good and they served a big range of foods

The hotel needs refurbishment. Some of the corridors and courtyards were in a very poor state. The meals were OK, although not up to 5 star standard. There was only one ala carte restaurant. The restaurant staff were a credit to the hotel - always willing to help. Unfortunately, cant say the same of the reception staff who would benefit from a communication skills training course. The Gym was very poorly equipped and certainly did not merit a 5 star status.
Holiday ruined

The hotel is totally awesome with a great ambience and courteous staff members! The room is also good. The pool bar has an amazing feel to it. All in all a great experience. THANK YOU FOR THE WODERFUL SERVICE.....
Our dream holiday
Could not ask for more.....

After a 6 hour drive we were welcomed to Heritance Ahungalla with a drink and fast check in and shown to our rooms. We were upgraded to a suite which was a nice surprise and invited to the managers cocktail party. The rooms were very spacious, quiet and clean with wonderful views over the ocean. The pools and grounds were immaculately kept with staff to help you move day beds, supply towels and tend to your every need. The food was great in the restaraunts, but very dissapointing room service and pool bar/ outdoor cafe food - the "hot" food always came out cold and the icecream was served melted and the staff were not that keen to fix it. We wre lucky enough to be invited in to the kitchen for special cooking lessons which were wonderful. I found this hotel to be a wonderful place to relax and unwind at the end of a busy holiday.
The best hotel we have ever been

Staff is very friendly, but the hotel is very outdated. For the price you pay there are better or cheaper options available in the surrounding area. Facilities are ok. Rooms are very old. It looks like the hotel did very small to keep the place presentable. The only good thing is the pool. Big and great for kids. Restaurants are also not bad and food prices are fair. We had a good time but I personally believe that the hotel management can do more to keep the place more vibrant. Also checkin experience is somewhat strange where guests can feel little unwelcome with the process in place. We got electrocuted when using the hair dryer. Unit was definitely faulty. We reported this to the hotel but no management came to investigate or consult our family. We manage to get a replacement and luckily it wasn't a big accident. I'm not sure if the hotel deemed safety of guest as their utmost priority. But in our case, it felt as though they just simply ignored. I don't think we will visit there again. Locationwise, it's a good place.

Just return from a week in Herritance Ahungala. The hotel is amazing with its infinity pool facing towards the ocean. Plenty of sunbeds, beautiful beach. Maybe the rooms needs to be renovated but that is no important, the most important are the people, with their heart on hands just to make your stay perfect. They are not a staff they are a heritance family and try to do everything that you become also a part of their family. Food prepared by Chef Manjula is just delishes. Beginning from European cuisine ending on real taste of Sri Lanka. Grilled lobster, crab curry, dhal, egg hooper are to die for. The food was the best I have been eaten in the all-inclusive hotel. Must say that in many good restaurant you will not eat better. Chef Manjula, who I have had chance to meet personally gave me is even his secret recipe for dhal. I have seen some negative comments about the rooms, food, cleaning- so if you look for a just the hotel (good drinks, animation, standard hotel food) do not go there but if you want to feel the soul of Sri Lanka is the place for you.
Short vaccation with friends
Stylish architect designed hotel
The higher floor rooms have better views

Visited Heritance Ahungalla for a day out with a day room. Superb location close to the beach and also had a nice big pool. The food was great. Room was clean and comfortable enough. Friendly staff. Can be recommended!

Years ago this was probably a very grand hotel, however the grandeur has faded. The location & facilities appear very good, however the devil is in the detail and the lack of cleanliness makes the whole place feel grubby. I have stayed at numerous 5 star hotels around the world and have seen how standards vary in each continent. So using a European standard I would only rate this 3 star, which might meet some guests expectations. The staff are very friendly and energetic as we have experienced in all seven hotels during our two week Secrete Escapes tour. What this hotel lacks is Management direction to fix the cleanliness issues. As an example I enclose pictures of our recently renovated room where staff regularly create ‚Äútowel animals‚Äù when they should be directed to scrub mould of the newly tiled bathroom walls & floors.
Rooms in the wing are better as they have direct access to the pool bar and the pool
Didn't live up to the reviews

we stayed her for 3 nights and honestly i could have stayed longer only we had so much more to see on our holiday. the staff were very efficient, the setting for the hotel was superb. the rooms were fantastic and the pool was great. there was nightly entertainment which was good fun as you were away from all other hotels and towns so it was easier to stay put.
Depends on what you experience

The room was smelly, the electrical switches were falling apart and there was no hair dryer or even a bottle opener in the room. The safety locker wasn't working and after three calls no one came to have a look at it. One of the doors going to the balcony of the room was jammed shut. The rooms were not well maintained at all.

Large (i mean LARGE) hotel, feels like you are among thousands of rooms, room slightly shabby (cvery 1970s India ashoka hotel type), ordinary food... the sort you would expect package tourists to come in droves. the redeeming feature is the pool and the beach right on the property, where you could escape, as you could to a hundred places on the Galle road... would not recommend when there are a thousand other options here...

Good hotel to enjoy good food. Friendly and obliging staff.we had a great time here.Great beach. I would have preferred it if goons were not allowed to encroach the hotel premises. We enjoyed the Christmas Carols and the staff were very good in singing üé∂

(+)Same old same old... and it is what we like about this overprised hotel. We recodnised an amazing flavor of Heritance Ahungalla first go. Our suite room was perfect. Greate stuff and cervice level. (-)The hotel was overbooked. After checking - in (13p.m.) we could not find a free couch with the pool area and put our things on the stairs. We could not to find the stuff as well. The next day was the same situation.
They didn‚Äôt have a kids pool which was inconvenient as I have an infant and toddler.
Not perfect but pretty good
One of the best Hotels

We stayed at the hotel for 2 nights during the 2nd week of August. Took the new Southern Express Tollway to get there and was amazed at how the relaxing the dirve was compared to the Galle Road which we have driven through in the past which used to be a trying experience. The GRO greeted us and offered us a choice for the welcome drink (Watermelon, Orange and coconut water) and also a refreshing cold wet towel which was most welcome as the humidity was pretty high that day. The hotel pool which can be seen from the time you get off the car is absolutley fantastic and overlooks the ocean. We were upgraded to higher level room which gave us a pool view as well as a partial sea view. The lighting in the room was decorative and as I've always noticed in most hotel globally too dim during the night. Why the designers of hotels allover think that mood lighting has to be dim I will never fathom. The food (we were on HB basis) in the retaurant was fabulous and they had a western as well as Sri Lankan choice. We had lunch on 2 days from the speciality restaurant on a la carte and that too was excellent. The choice of wines is limited as expected in a 3-4 star hotel of that standard. The beach was quite nice although the sea was quite choppy on both days due the season we were told. The hotel has limited activities compared to a 5 star hotel in the city but this is to be expected as one goes to these type of resort hotels only to enjoy the beach and pool. The hotel does have a 2nd pool but we did not use it as it was 1.7m depth all round and was too deep for my 2 kids and also had a lot of leaves fallen in du to the close proximity of large trees along the pool. The service was quite good but could also be attributed to the fact that we were staying during the week where the occupancy is lower than compared to the weekends.
did not stay at hotel, but hope to visit soon for a week end
Good if you are looking for a resort/all-inclusive type place - we weren't!

Extremely friendly and great service by Ranil from house keeping. My parents and grand parents have been visiting for the past thirty years and will continue visiting again. The hospitality at the hotel is very good

We had a great time with our 8 month old baby.Pools,beaches are excellent.went to visit Kandy.beautiful trip. But never go with baby as it takes 6 hours to reach there from hotel.don't forget Stroller. Food is expensive.

Not at all a 5 star hotel. Would have chosen a better hotel for this price and facilities. It‚Äôs a mediocre 3 star hotel. Front staff made us wait for 1 hr before handing over keys to our rooms. Bathroom was clogged. No response by housekeeping. Paid for sea view facing rooms instead got pool side rooms. Would not stay or recommend to stay at this place.

when we checked with great expectations about the 5 star facility we were greeted with cob web with spiders running in the room. the ceiling fan was so dirty i think they have not cleaned the room for 3 or 4 months. we have to call the reception and lodge a compliant to clean the room so as to enable us to sleep.

We visited the hotel for 3 nights as part of our Honeymoon tour of Sri Lanka. The lobby with view through to the pool is amazing! Great to see when you arrive! The rooms are clean and well maintained and housekeeping kept them spotless throughout our stay. The variety in the buffet restaurant was good and we always had lots and lots to eat! The staff are amazing! Friendly, helpful, always doing everything they can to make sure you have everything you need or want. We would definitely stay here again if we were ever to return to the area.

Staff was very attentive and proactive, keep that up. Not seen that lately in a hotel down south. Reckon the rooms need some attention. The AC switch was defective, and few others. Hope the hotel does something about it
If ground floor rooms are available then this would be a good choice.
A pleasure place to stay

My partner and I have arrived from the UK this afternoon and we knew instantly, that we had made a big mistake choosing this property as our base in Sri Lanka. The lobby has as much ambience as my mothers funeral in September!!!!!! It is dark, unwelcoming, cold,uncomfortable furnishings and lacks any kind of warmth and inviting environment. We had paid for an upgrade on our room prior to leaving the UK with a double bed deluxe sea view. We got neither. Room was damp with a smell of urine from the bathroom. Interior was again dark with numerous scratches on furniture. No ocean view and two twin beds put together and the safe was not secure to anything!!!!! Tiles missing from the bathroom and no kettle,ironing board and iron!! The list is endless. Complained to the management and the front of house manager did state some of the rooms had not been upgraded in thirty five years. We were moved to another room which was supposed to be an upgrade. Alas not. Toilet that leaks, as well as the air conditioning: no secure safety box and the smell of fresh paint. Have eaten n the restaurant this evening. Best described as bland, average and uninspiring. We have already been in touch with our tour operator to move us or we will be returning early home. The only positive are the very friendly staff. If any of the hotel management read this we are in room 355. If you want luxury, with the added little touches do not come here, save your money and go elsewhere.

Rooms are not clean at all, I was waiting to see all type of animals but not mouses passing near the rooms.it smell really disgusting especially when u are in the breakfast and dinner and u don't have anything to eat even cheese is crispy because of the long time stay outside! This is definately not a 5 star hotel, it's decor is very shabby, bed linen is off colour, stained and has seen better days. There isn't an on complex shop so you have to buy everything in the bar and trying to get out of the hotel main gate to the road is a nightmare as the locals swarm around the en trance ready to pounce on you, they find it very difficult to take "no" for an answer. The same goes for the beach, you cannot get on it in without being harassed as they line the edge of the hotel grounds. Would not recommend booking holidays thru the rep as these are double the price of using the hotel taxi's to take you to the same places. If you are not giving the locals, be it where ever you are, tips for this that and everything then they are very abrupt and can't get rid of you quick enough, especially the rep! They want tips for putting a cushion and towel on your sunlounger and then when it rains they want another one for putting it back again.
The standard rooms are on the 2nd floor and have shower only, no bath, and small box TV. Deluxe rooms on the 3rd floor are much bigger, flat screen TV, better views.

The hotel is very tired. Everything in my room worked, but everything was a little shabby and shabby - both the furniture and the plumbing. And even the ponds with lotuses and carp behind the hotel - if they were at least cleaned, it would be a completely different feeling. The food is beyond praise. There wasn‚Äôt much to eat around anyway, but in the hotel - if you take national cuisine - huge portions and very tasty. The staff tries to solve your problems, but not quickly. The cleaning is lousy, whether you leave a tip or not, it doesn‚Äôt affect the amount of sand on the floor. The hotel always had free sun loungers, which the staff will put where you need them upon request. There are a lot of different animals on the territory - monitor lizards, palm squirrels, funny birds. And also a skinny cat and two very cute dogs (the latter, however, were chased by the staff). Monkeys walk on the roofs, but they are also chased, it is not so easy to see them. The beach is public, but given the location it is mostly deserted. At the exit from the hotel to the beach there are annoying merchants, and you feel like you are alone on the coast. The entrance to the water is perfect fine sand. There were always waves, occasionally strong, so not everyone could swim. There are nuances, but overall it‚Äôs a good hotel, although of course it barely reaches 4.
Beautifully designed pool...Love the food...amazing.. You have alot of peace & tranquilty; especially

We visited three Heritance Hotels during our stay. This was sadly the only one where customers were secondary to hotel maintenance. We were Woking up by hammering of temporary barriers and scaffolding at 2 am as well as loud porters moving beds all through the night. That said, the day staff were all pleasant and helpful but little thought was given to guests when they carry out maintenance work both day and night. The hotel rooms were tired and needed the work, but managed well, they could have sealed sections of the hotel rather than maintain where guests were occupying rooms.

It's gorgeous beach front hotel and nice swimming pools. I spent a total of 15 days after returning to Sri Lanka from Australia. Room was very spacious & clean, and filled with amenities with a balcony overlooking one of the swimming pools. Everyone at the hotel staff were really friendly and attentive, right from the start of booking process to the end. Special thanks goes to all guys at the restaurant including Chef Chandana, Lilanga and the manager for adding a personal touch to the dinning experience. They were always willing to go the extra mile to satisfy my taste buds.
Too many people and th hotel was not clean enough. the pool was unclean

I want to share my experience (no so good) at The Heritance Hotel Anugila. I along with my 2 sisters had made a booking for the 3 of us for 2 nights 17th and 18th August 2017 at The Heritance hotel Anugula. We checked-in the hotel on 17th Evening and were smoothly escorted to our room number 224. 1- On reaching the room we noticed that the floor was a little wet and asked for it to be cleaned with a delay of 5-10 minutes the floor was cleaned. 2- Tired of all the travel throughout the day, we thought of making some tea/coffee in the room, just to find that there were only 2 of all the things in the room. 2 cups, 2 glasses, 2 spoons etc. (for a room booked for 3). Why would the arrangements be for 2 when the booking is for 3??? 3- The electric kettle was placed in a cupboard which had no plug points. we had to shift the kettle to some other table to actually use it. But again to my surprise, the electric kettle plug (Flat pin) and the plug point (Round ones) in the room did not match. 4- My sister sat on the third bed to find out that the bed was actually not stable. If you sit on one side of it, it would lift up from the other. 5- We called up the rooms service for the above 3 points (2,3 and 4), but to my disappointment they could not have been slower. When you have a 5 star facility I would expect the staff to know English. The room service were not able to understand our plain English!! The room service addressed the plug problem, we made tea, and one of us had tea in a glass tumbler as there were only 3 cups in the room! 6- I went for a swim in the evening and came back to my room to take a shower. I land up in the bathroom to find out that there is no Shampoo or conditioner in the room!!! I call up the reception for the same and they tell me they will send it to my room. I wait for almost 15 mins no hear no knock on my door. In the end I had to take a shower without a shampoo or conditioner. 7- At dinner that night, my sisters were a little disappointed as there were not much veg options (they both are vegetarians). The chef was there taking feedback and my sisters told him the same. The next morning we were to go for an early whale watching trip and had to leave at 5.30 AM. We had already asked the reception to pack our breakfast. Previous night, while talking to the chef, my sisters told him that we would be leaving early and to pack good breakfast for 3 (2 veg (for my sisters) and 1 non veg (for me)). We woke up and were leaving for the trip. The reception handed over our breakfast nicely packed. We opened the packets around 10AM on our way back from the trip to find out 3 non-beg meals!!!!! My sisters could not have breakfast that morning, thanks to the chef‚Äôs goof-up! 8- We reached our room, called up the reception for shampoo and conditioner (Which were still not there in the room). The room service comes to the room with an unlabelled bottle and said that was shampoo. I asked for a hair conditioner and I am still in shock that he did not know what that was!! I explained what that was, and he said that they do not have a hair conditioner available!!! Believe me I am in shock as I write it!! 9- The day went on, we did not want to spoil our mood as we were on a 3 sisters vacation! But the next morning when we woke up, we found out that the entire room was dripping of water (see pictures attached). The room had always been wet throughout our stay (as found on check-in) but it started dripping literally next morning. We had our luggage placed on the table above which the ceiling was dripping! All our clothes were wet! We had to quickly move the luggage from there to the beds. And then there was no place to sit. I called up the room service to show them that, to hear a reply that we should not have the window open. We were in a sea facing room and were there to enjoy the sea, not to seal ourselves up in an AC room. That we do anyway at our offices when we are not on vacation. Why would you be in a sea facing room and not have the balcony or windows open?? I have not seen a beach side 5 star property of not having slippers or bathrobes in the room. I do not think these facilities should be provided on request. Isn‚Äôt it obvious that on a beach side resort the guests will go to the beach (or swimming pool) and would need slippers? Why should they have to ask for it?? Again still in shock - No conditioner!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! There are no plug points next to the bed!!!!! only 1 plug point far away fromt he bed. No multi-plugs available in the room. You have to call room service for that as well! We were in Sri-Lanka for a 7 day trip, stayed in all 4 star resorts. We wanted our last 2 days to be special and relaxing and hence we chose a 5 star. Our experience in all 4 star places was far better than these 2 last days! A Dissatisfied customer
All rooms are probably great but some would have better views than others.

All rooms have some sort of an ocean view, the higher in the building the better, but there's only one lift. It's quite a long building so there is likely to be some walking to do - but the further from the main centre the quieter, especially in the evening.
Relaxing at ahungalla
stay away - not worth the trip!

We stayed at this hotel for two nights at the end of 3 weeks touring Sri Lanka. We really enjoyed the beach and lovely swimming pools. Our room was average directly above the main restaurant with a very hard bed we asked staff to it a mattress topper which they did but was not really any better the second night. We We're woken up very early one morning by room service but had not placed an order Breakfast wAs more like a cafeteria this hotel is very popular with the locals and they obviously have very different standards to us they love a Buffett which is exactly what we don't want. This is supposed to be a five star hotel and they certainly charge accordingly but they are not providing five star service or food More expensive for two coffees Than in Melbourne we did not eat any other meals at this hotel we went out to local restaurants recommend jungle Beach 10 min walk turn left at the beach Heritance need to have a look at there food and in particular the price of water prices $100 US for dining on the beach without drinks and the food is just not good enough standard The staff were friendly and pleasant at all times we found this at all Aitken Spence hotels

We spent 2 days in the hotel and it was a lovely experience. Buffets are very good. however, it could have been better. however, we had to wait for more than 2 hours to check in as the room was not ready. finally we checked in around 4pm. That is the only negative comment i'll have to mention. however, we don't mind visiting again in near future simply because of the food, pool and the long island iced tea/mojito served at the pool bar.

The hotel really is tired, needs updating and a good clean in places , some staff rude and unhelpful. All inclusive package is not worth the money as they run out of the decent beer and water down cordial to put into spirits as you can‚Äôt have fresh juice. Food is very good. I find the hotel is not like the pictures. Sun beds are filthy and in need of a clean. Swimming pools are too hot and could do with some cold water as it is not refreshing when your sunbathing and need to cool down.electrical sockets came out of the wall and needed to be repaired, patio doors did not shut properly this also had to be rectified. Needed som information on transport from reception and we were told to Google it, Unbelievable. Shame there is not separate smoking areas as you choke on smoke wherever you go. I am well travelled and shocked that this hotel shows 4 stars. Other than this I would recommend to anyone who wants a 3 star hotel.
Rooms facing the beach on the second level. View from some first level rooms with balconies are partly obscured by large trees.
