It definitely wasn't a 5* hotel. Was a little rough around the edges with construction work ongoing and painters who couldn't be bothered to cover the flora and fauna hence many plants covered in white paint which is a shame. Took longer than usual to check out at 5am..
Needs to improve food quality
So much noise!
Excellent...!

The sign next to reception says the hotel was voted the best 5 star hotel in Sri Lanka in 2010. If it's true then I just wonder what the rest must be like ! The original standard room was appalling and after complaining we were upgraded to a deluxe room which was good. All public areas are in need of refurbishment and there is a lack of any serious evening entertainment. Alcoholic drinks are some of the most expensive I have come across, either in Europe, Asia or the USA. The dinner experience in the Jute restaurant is mediocre, unless you like curry. It's a buffet and nothing is really hot. There appears to be a problem with the extractor fans and as the breakfast is cooked in the restaurant there is always a cloud of smoke circulating in the mornings.The room has a low ceiling and the decor is dark. The are two nice pools but the tiling around the edges is very uneven and loose. The beach is long and pleasant but the irritating, aggressive beach hawkers who stand ten metres away shouting to attract the attention of the guests make life unpleasant, they are a major problem. The beach has a lot of debris strewn about , bottles, polystyrene etc, but the management claim it is the job of the local council to clear it. As a previous poster has said, there is nothing close to the hotel and very little to do. For $150 per night it would be reasonable, but for the $300 per night ( b&b) we paid it is way overpriced. As Sri Lanka seems to have their own star rating system, I would rate this hotel on an international basis as no more than 3.5 stars. The staff go out of their way to be helpful
The staff is very good the hotel is good the food is tasty and you are very careful,careing and well we like your hotel

I've spent two nights on B&B basis at Heritance Ahungalla. Actually my wife and myself had a good time at the hotel with its really nice surroundings. The bedroom was pleasant and relaxing. We really loved the pretty large beach area which is just great! also the pool was spacious. However the responsiveness of the staff and follow up was poor. E.g. My wife is pregnant and she needed bottled water as we have run out of the two, so i phoned house keeping .. hours passed by without any water at all. So i had to go my self to the bar and get two bottles. We even called the reception and they said they will look into it. Water to the room never arrived. Meal variety in ala carte menu was not good either. For people who signed up for B&B doesn't have a variety to choose from. Even at different locations such as Coffee shop and snack bar have the same menu. no choice what so ever and we couldn't make a decision as what to eat.
Rooms with a balcony overlooking the pool are noisier.
If you want a nice sea view opt for a room on an upper floor

On arrival, when Reception was informed we'd been confirmed Room 333, we were told that our room would not be ready for another 20 minutes. After 20 minutes, we were then told that it would not be ready for another few hours as it's a luxury room & will take that long to clean. When we asked if this was because the previous occupants checked out late, we were told they didn't know, and when pressed, they admitted that was the reason. When we said that shouldn't have happened as the room was booked, & previous occupants should not be allowed to check out late, they offered us a "transit room, free of charge" until the room we had booked (which was more expensive than this "transit room" was ready. How could they possibly think we would be happy with a "transit room", which was cheaper & more basic than the one we had booked & put up with the inconvenience involved in changing rooms? When we said we weren't happy with this & insisted on talking to the Manager, he finally turned up some time later & said the previous occupants couldn't be vacated on time as they were elderly & disabled, but they would have four cleaners clean the room & it would be ready in 30 mins. Finally, we had access to the room we booked at 3.45pm (although, we should have had the room at 2pm), but we still had to wait another 15 minutes (i.e. until 4pm) for our luggage, which had been sent to the cheaper "transit room"& had to be brought back. So, they broke their contract. A room we should have had at 2pm, was only given to us at 4pm (2 hours later). We later discovered that the previous occupants were not elderly at all. Therefore the Manager LIED. We complained to the head office and got nowhere. We have not stayed in this hotel again as a result of this disgusting treatment and we NEVER WILL. This happened some time ago, but I'm still so angry about it that I want to report it.
rooms on the top floor have a better view & are more comfortable

My fianc√© and I returned to this hotel following a stay in 2011. We enjoyed our time spent here and combined a visit to Ella and a stay in a guest house in Kosgoda. We would agree with other reviews that the hotel is in need of updating, however we heard that they are closing the hotel next year for improvements. Having said that, the rooms are fine and all areas are very clean (just quite tired). The service and hospitality is very good and friendly, the bar staff, pool/sunbed staff and especially the lovely man we had cleaning the room (Asoka), we saw him every day and he always went over and above, asking if there was anything he can do or anyway he could improve our room. We actually asked to change rooms as we weren't happy with the view from our first balcony (it overlooked the pool and we wanted something a little more private) and within 30 minutes a new room that suited us was ready. The pool area and garden are beautifully maintained and we loved our time spent around the pool overlooking beautiful Ahungalla beach. We stayed on a B&B basis as we enjoy eating outside of the hotel and there are lovely places to do this; the two beach restaurants just a 5 minute walk from the hotel (jungle restaurant and sunshine restaurant), a beautiful restaurant in the next town along (sankarest garden restaurant, a 5 minute tuk tuk ride at 250 rps). There are also other restaurants in Bentota but this is slightly further afield, 20 minute tuk tuk journey at c. 700 rps (depending on how you haggle). We went to tutle hatchery whilst there and a boat trip, both very worthwhile doing. As previously said, the beach is beautiful and very quiet however, I would be interested to see how it changes once the 500 room (vs. heritance 140) hotel next door is completed in two years time. As other reviews have said, you do get a bit of hassle from the beach sellers however this didn't bother us to much and seemed to die down after a couple of days of saying 'no'. We did book a boat trip through a nice guy called Charli who we'd met and had trips with in 2011, you can find him on the beach and ask any of the sellers for him as they all know each other. We would have liked to have taken the opportunity to hire bikes from the hotel but the weather was just to hot during our stay for either of us to have wanted to do this! Overall we really enjoyed our stay at heritance.

I dropped in to this resort with my Wife for lunch while returning home from a meeting. Loved the welcome and the super hospitality by the front office crew and loved the juice cart that goes around serving the exotic juices .. i have been visiting this resort even before it re branded .. its indeed a beautiful resort . Not too happy on the Spread they had for the Buffet Lunch for the price paid .. but indeed the quality of the food that was there was 5 star.. it was a very basic spread .. May be it was due to the low occupancy.. i loved the hospitality and service quality received from the begging to the end .. keep up the good work and improve on the Buffer spread on weekdays ..

Although not near the town centre, this hotel is sited on a beautiful beach, with two pools it has something for everyone. Totally rebuilt after the Tsunami. Breakfast buffet was huge, covering all tastes. Vanilla yoghurt smoothie was delicious. Food in the cafe was very reasonably priced and delicious. Forget the taco in the bar, disappointing. Large comfortable bedrooms, air con bit noisy though. Staff delightful and helpful.

Checked into hotel Mid August into a luxury room and I would highly reccomend paying that little bit extra as the rooms are huge! And you get a bath tub that overlooks the pool.. but no one can see in as there is mesh stopping.. so its very private! On arrival sat down with a welcome drink (Pineapple or Wood Apple juice) as we came early from Colombo around 11am and room was not ready.. but that did not bother me as they advised full occupancy in hotel before we came and cannot get early check in which was ok because My partner and I sat in the bar and had a few drinks.. they came to us and gave the key instead of us going to reception.... Went to our room! and I thought it was very very clean.. the bed was so comfy... In the luxury rooms there is no ceiling fan tho, but you have an aircon which gets cool in the nights ... Room was cleaned every morning and evening.. fresh towels and bathrobes... Both pools were good but i prefered the private pool the best! & it had a spa you can use from certain hours and relaxing!! I used the Coco Spa and got a sweedish massage and it was the most relaxing thing, and was very professional as they drape you properly with the towels and do an amazing job.. they are Balinese ladies and very lovely and do a great job! My husband got one the following day! Food in the resturant was beautiful... you can get your Sri Lankan curries or you can get Bbq night.. prawns.. lots of salad to choose from... & soups.. my favourite was the deserts.. so lovely ... Staff and chefs were nice! overall i would stay here again.. beach is too rough to swim though which is dissappointing.. as im from Australia .. i love the beaches.. I reccomend seing Hikkaduwa and the huge turtles you can swim with.. Great experience you dont even feel like your in the hustle and bustle of Sri Lanka.
Traveling by bus was fun experience, but travel time was way too long.

We had a lovely time in heritance with lovely service and best food... Buffet restaurant staff was excellent service providing..... Special mention uncle praveen. He is really good.. Definitely we will come back and I will recommend to my friends.......

Only thing we did not like was the way the food was laid out in the buffet as it was a bit confusing. Better labelling would have helped. The thing the plates were very hot, when we collected them from the plate holder.

Ignored by the bell boys at arrival and left for half an hour in a dingy bar to await our room. Despite a choice of only 3 welcome drinks, the barman managed to get one of the two wrong !! Eventually given a room which was right on the beach, but seemed to be the only room in the hotel without net curtains, so no privacy at all. We then noticed that the door lock was hanging off so called maintenance. While waiting for them, we discovered a jammed cupboard (so no access to safe), a poky, smelly bathroom and a TV with no reception. Eventually went back to reception (after unconvincing lock fix) and demanded a new room which we were given after another hour's wait. It was better, although lighting was poor. Cleaning was haphazard, towels were often taken but not replaced and there were no insect sprays/mats. Each morning one of the pool boys comes and blasts the pool area with rap music to try to encourage aerobics participants - they should listen to the words one day, which are about 50% expletives and not everyone's taste !! Food was OK but nothing like the Kandalama, another Heritance hotel. Spa was very expensive although treatments were good - watch out for $ prices which mysteriously end up being a lot more in rupees (works out about 140 to the $, not 115). Lots of hassle from beach sellers as well. Overall we were very disappointed as we had such a wonderful time at the Heritance Kandalama in Dambulla and expected the same from this sister hotel. For half the price you can stay at the Kani Lanka in Kalutara which has better food and entertainment.
Too much expectation!
just enjoy the beach, pool and good food. The King beds rooms on ground floor just a step out to the beach

I went to heritance ahungalla in february 2013 to celebrate the birthday of one of my friends. As soon as the staff knew, they prepared a very special dinner for us 6 at the beach , with a personalised cake and a decoration of flowers and balloons. It was a very thoughtful gesture, we appreciated it so much ! thank you for making our stay so special !

Not impressed!

This is a strange one, to be sure. With a few tweeks it could be one of the best beach hotels you'll ever stay in anywhere, but in the comparison with other places we stayed in Sri Lanka (and particularly Mount Lavinia), it just seems to fall short in areas that it would be so easy to correct. The setting, design and physical feel of the hotel are all quite stunning. But right away you get those little irksome contrasts that make this a frustrating place. Complacency abounds and you sense that they are still all patting themselves on the back for being able to re-open after the devastation of the Tsunami (yes those dreadful Youtube videos from Boxing Day 2004 were from balconies at The Triton, which has now become The Heritance). Positive sentiment isn't quite enough at the 5 star level unfortunately. It sits behind a gorgeous stretch of beach with surf that you just are dying to play in just 50 feet away - but to get from hotel gardens to the sea, you have to pass an almost comically persistent group of beach tradespeople each time. The hotel has a line of flags to keep them at bay, but the security staff still let them bother you from a distance when you are on a sun lounger by the pool. Would you get accosted by a panhandler on the steps of the Waldorf Astoria as you left to get in your cab? The sidewalk is public space but things can be done..... The two pools are large and magnificent, with the green pool so huge it even allows you to "length swim". There is also a gym with fairly up to date equipment, but its functionality was comprised every day of my stay by an inability of staff to get the message (despite 3 reminders in 3 days) that the aircon needs to be on and set to below 28 degs C for anyone to be able to use it. The minimalist design of the public areas has an overall calming effect on you, but with the architect apparently having a veto on everything, this extends to a lack of many of the features that you expect in any large resort - an excursions / news board; signs to different areas; names on the bars etc. We had little to complain about the food. In fact it was fairly reasonably priced for a putative 5 star, but it had little real wow factor, and apart from some of the local dishes on the buffet menu, it just scraped by. Last year we stayed on Meeru Island resort in the Maldives and despite the obvious abundance of produce in Sri Lanka compared to a coral attol, Meeru's buffets were both more inspiring and much cheaper. The room was spacious with a big balcony - as it should be for just over $300 a night! But the bathroom was blatantly unfinished with two walls smooth plastered but not painted. Some guests demanded a room change for this - we were told it was a design feature (see photo). With such a huge balcony a sun lounger rather than just 2 chairs and a table would have been an idea. And why oh why was there no rack to dry wet clothes. There was plenty of space, but maybe the architect had his say there as well. All the staff we interacted with were cheerful and accommodating, apart from the reception staff who were a bit feckless and needed to be a little more proactive. We were invited to a cocktail party given by the assistant manager, and found him charming and with an earnest concerned approach to some of the criticisms we gently raised. It really did not sit well however to be told that the beach sellers were tolerated on a "better the devil you know" basis and that other "newer" nationalities amongst the clientele liked having them around. I am not so sure the Heritance is that well advised to try to imitate Sharm El Sheikh at these prices. Lose the traditional customer base and I think they will lose much of their trade to the likes of Mount Lavinia. If you were to stay here and, as we are, you are fairly easy going if the weather is good, (as it was), you will probably be happy enough at the Heritance, give or take the $100 or so a night that should still be in your wallet. But I can imagine it could quite quickly become a nightmare in bad weather. You even had to pay to play on the pool table. Free pool if you spend 1500 rupees on drinks - come on! To end on a positive note of a review which I had intended to be somewhat more complimentary than it has turned out, the laissez-faire approach has allowed wildlife to remain on the grounds undisturbed. To see massive Iguanas digging for crabs next to your sun-lounger while chipmunks frolic around on your umbrella stand is a uniquely warming feeling. We were even able to film troupes of monkeys and even pass them mango pieces to eat on the branches of trees by the pool. Enchanting.
Family stay
higher floors provide a better view. get rooms closer to the recepion area, or you will have to walk a very long walk.
Really needs a renovation

We came here to spend our summer holiday. Great hotel, lovely service, employees are very hospitable and willing to help. All in all a great experience. It was a good choice for us this holiday. Thank you.
Once great not anymore

Stayed here for 2 nights as part of a tour around southern Sri Lanka. The positives: Large pool Very helpful staff Well appointed room - large bathroom The negatives are more numerous and sadly affected the enjoyment of our stay. There were about 8 locals hanging around on the beach outside the hotel for the whole time on both days. They were very aggressive in the way they would wait for you to leave the safety of your hotel sun-lounger, and try and sell you everything under the sun. Just be firm and say nothing else other than 'NO!' If you engage them in conversation, they will pester you ALL DAY. We saw others suffer as a result of this and the hotel must do something about it. Worse still, there are sellers operating within the hotel itself, pestering you for palm readings and the purchase of overpriced wooden ornaments. The hotel management need to realise that the hotel should be a refuge from some of the hard-sell that exists out in the surrounding towns. Also the hotel did not seem particularly clean, and the food was distinctly average at both the Upper Room restaurant, and the 24-hour restaurant. There was some renovation work going on, but I didn't let it effect my overall view as all hotels need to do it at some point. Normally hate to be too critical, but there are some issues that need to be addressed before this one can call itself 5 Star.

The hotel is beautifully located on the shores of Sri Lanka Ahungalla. The entrance view of the hotel is stunning as it is open, airy, has the view of the pool and also the beach. It is stunning. The rooms are spacious and well decorated. The facilities and amenities of the hotel are good. The dinning area is good but has an unpleasant smell. The food was good but not very outstanding taste. There is a lot of room for improvement for the food and the dinning area, taste, presentation and staff servie too. The staff in the dining area need to step up. The uniform of the chief's at the live cooking station was so dirty that it was unpleasant to look at. The hotel overall has a very relaxing and soothing ambiance. It was clean and well organised. The hotel has 2 pools both have a very relaxing feel. Our stay was very short, just one day. Wish we had stayed longer.
Disappointement

Hope to Return Back
The Best Resort....
Property should have some recreational facility on the beach

We have just returned from a 2 week stay at the heritance. We travelled as a family of 2 children 2 and 4 yrs plus granparents. We had an excellent time and would not hesitate to recommend this hotel. The architexture is stunning with a very calm atmosphere and a wonderful infinity pool that blends into the beach. The pictures don't do it justice. We stayed in their 2 interconnecting rooms 301 and 302 which were spacious and had excellent see views. They made them up as a king size and 2 singles which suited us great. You could hear the entertainment but it finished at a reasonable time. The "animators" were really helpful, building sandcastles and flying kites with the children. We all enjoyed the daily aqua aerobics. One of the best things about the hotel and sri lanka is the poeple. The were very friendly and genuine and made our stay one to remember. The service was very occasionally slightly chaotic in a nice sri lankan way, but everyone was very helpful. The food was the best that we tasted anywhere on our trip in the hotel. Breakfast is excellent and the food in the coffee shop was v tasty. The chinese and BBQ buffets were worth it and we weren't charged for the children. Drink prices were reasonable (we were charged twice as much in the hotel on our trip to Kandy). We did some trips around the area with Bertie from the sunshine resturant at the end of the beach. I would definitely recommend the river safari as not to be missed. This is an excellent choice for those looking for relaxation in a stunning setting. There is the option to explore locally and futher afield. We can't thank the hotel enough for an excellent stay, (they are happy to be contacted with room requests before you travel). We would go again!
my 5th visit, and some of the spark has gone...
Ground floor rooms are the best which are face directly to the sea
'In'Heritance
Very average stay
My Honeymoon at Heritance

Spent 7 nights at the hotel at the beginning of February. Enjoyed: the food, the pools (particularly the one with the leaning tree), the sound of the ocean waves crushing on the shore, the spa, the beautiful sunsets from the room balcony and generally the great feeling of being in Sri Lanka in a beautiful hotel. Did not enjoy: the monitor lizards walking around, (did not know they would be there and just got terrified when I saw the first one strolling around the beach!!!), the overwhelming strenght of the ocean waves which prevents you from swimming, the beach ladies constantly calling you in order to sell you something.

My cousin and I had a wonderful stay at this resort . We feel that a special mention must be made about the staff at Heritance Ahungalla . Never have we seen staff at a resort or hotel who were so attentive to your every need . One truly outstanding person , is Kusum , who works at the restaurant The Jute ...... What an amazing person ! He was so attentive to everyone 's needs . You did not have to wait long for anything you needed . When we were eating the most delicious " appoms" with our fingers , Kusum was there with a finger bowl for our messy fingers üòÑ....even before we could ask for one . He remembers little details like the hot tea that we always end our meals with and brings it to us even without us asking , just at the right time ... Kusum always had a beautiful smile for everyone at the restaurant . Chef Roshan was another person who impressed us , he heard that we were eager to eat a certain type of fish and he took the trouble to check with his kitchen staff to see if he had the fish as he wanted to cook it specially for us . I have never seen any place like this , where the chefs all come out during meal times , smiling and greeting their guests . We will be back and one of the main reasons will be because of the fantastic staff that 's at Heritance Anhungalla.

HOTEL: We stayed at the Heritance for 10 Nights. The hotel and staff are lovely. After reading a previous review about being to scared to leave the room, i feel that this is an insult the the hard working staff there. At no point did we feel we threatened by staff, housekeeping staff smiled and never asked for a tip and the same said with the staff in the bar area. I suppose the hotel could do with a lick of paint but as for broken sunbeds i didnt see any, and there was always loads to choose from. The only negative thing about the room is the size of the fridge which is very small. But again it wasnt a real problem. YES.. you tip for most things but we never felt preasured to do so, and even if you do its 100rs at a time! The sellers on the beach are a bit of a pain, but a firm no and they go off to the next person, and after a while getting the same response from us they didnt even bother. Our room was on the 3rd floor and it was lovely, and we even had our own little gekcho which was great for eating insects. Our room was cleaned twice a day with clean towels and more water. The food was lovely, the only downside is there isnt much options for vegitarians. The only major downside with ther Heritance was location. when we travel we like to go out and try local resturants which is why we booked b&b, however other then the little fish resturant (which is cheap with lovely food) along the beach there isnt anything walking distance. We did take a taxi RS3500 (that waited 3hrs and brought us back to the hotel) to Hikkaduwa where you'll find bars/resturants and several rotty cafe. If we'd of known this we would of booked HB as we ended up spending most evenings eating in the hotel. TOURS: We did several trips whilst in Sri Lanka. The first to Uda Walawe park, as much as it was a long drive it was lovely to see the elephants roaming around freely, its def worth a visit. We then did a 2 day trip to Kandy and Sigiriya again a lot of driving, we stopped off at a tea shop on the way which was ok, then the botanical gardens which is a lovely place to sit with an ice cream and watch the world go by. We then went to the temple of tooth which was lovely, and to be honest go without a guide as ours was a bit of an idiot trying to get us to pay for him to study etc etc.. which we felt was very cheeky whilst inside a buddhist temple!!! In Kandy We stayed at Chaaya Citadel which was lovely and great food, to be honest it was a shame we only stayed the night. The next day we had an early start and more driving to Sigiriya, this was via a spice market and to be honest at 830am we probably wasnt the most awake customers!! but we listened and left! Once we arrived at Sigirya we headed up the many steps in the mid morning heat!!! the views at the top are lovely and make for great photos, they even had a family of monkeys that live on the top. Then it was the 7hr drive back to the hotel. Be warned your driver will take you to various tea/gem and spice shops!!!! We asked our driver if we could skip these but its something they have to do, even though we put our foot down and said no to the gem store. Overall we enjoyed our stay at the Heritance and its lovely staff.

On first appearances this hotel wow's you. This is not 5 star by any stretch of imagination. Over priced and quite tacky. Maybe the best in Ahungalla, not in Sri Lanka. There sister concern "The Tea Factory Hotel" beats them by a canter on all counts. The long corridors leading to the rooms were run down. The room was large with a sit out. The housekeeping was slack. The food was quite mediocre. The buffet is a total rip off. It is very highly priced and the food was very average. The beach boys on the beach are a menace and quite intimidating. It put you off from wanting to step out on the beach. Would I return? No.
Request for a beach view room

Super friendly people, super food, sea views, good rooms, overall superb. We spend 10 super super good holidays days. Live music, very nice and helpful managers, bartenders who were also very helpful. Manager change room to deluxe classes, over two floors, at no extra charge.

The waiters needs to be trained about the table etics as they try to clear plates before the client finishes having the meal. Also, we requested a tripe room and a double room was given by just adding a folding bed. They facilities for the room was only for two and we had to request for the third persons facilities on anf off despiting paying for a triple. the reason given by da hotel for not providing a tripe room was it was not ready of occupation. Thats the main reason I have rated the rooms poor. Tks.....
mixed views about the hotel

We checked into the hotel on Sunday a day before a public and bank holiday after the security checking we seated in the lobby for nearly 1/2 hrs and there were no welcome drink no wet towers Following day we saw the cart is serving the guests. Hotel was very crowded and we feel that not enough staff members attend for guests .Huge crowd for lunch dinner and breakfast and we had to come late for all 3 meals . Food was good but less varieties. No entertainment only 2 pics band was playing in the lobby and that also stopped at 11 p.m. due to restrictions , We feel that hotel should give more priority to its in house guests . Rooms are good and clean. The pool was very nice and refreshing. This hotel can be maintained better compared to what we witnessed.

Apologies ! This should have been written a while ago. By no means does the below completely under rate our experience, but hopefully the feedback will be taken as useful, with both the good and bad. The Bad: Having to change rooms the last 2 days, due to water heating and aircon issues. Lack of food options when less guests (totally understandable but still a shame, especially at breakfeast). Wear and tear is visible, a renovation would be a great bonus. But it by no means spoilt our trip, just an observation. Alot of mould in the bathrooms, requires some attention. I know it's a beach resort but the build up can get a little much. Due to choosing "all inclusive" option, the cocktails are very limited. Are nice but limited. I think if I went next time I would not do all inclusive, purely so we could enjoy a bit more diverse range. Snack foods however, (I recomend the fish and chips!) are lovely ! Due to post covid, lack of features and actitives are limited (again understandable, but needs mentioning prior to booking). Examples, Bicycle rentals, Spas, nightclub etc. Also the build up on rubbish on the shores, but again was due to time of the year with the seas as well. The Weird: The constant hello from a lady passing the perimeter of the hotel nearly every day trying to sell something. A Foreign guest who seems to be treated like royalty & known by all staff (Hi Aiya?!), I know there are less guests, but 3 beds, 6 cushions and 6 towels (with change every few hrs) for 2 people is a bit much... Also witnessed the attempt of trying to give chocolates to everyone including children (other guests) seemed a bit weird, maybe their form of a Santa? The repetiveness of the music in the restaurant and the bar, please I would advise working on changing this ! Or atleast having a different playlist alternating every other day ! If I heard John Lenon's Yesterday instrumental one more time... !! And the rest of Good ! (a lot more) : Firstly, the highest points go to the the staff and service, truely everyone that worked there were such amazing human beings, and we were humbled to have stayed at the resort with them ! Their commitment and attentivness was visible throughout our stay, so thank you very much to all of you. Cleaners : Nearly every day not only were the rooms tidied, but we were left with decorative and hilarious towel arrangements ! Kudos to the creativity ! Shout out to Dukmal and his colleagues for this ! I wish you all the best sir. Front of house & general assitance : Welcomed from the first minute by all and every request and detail asked was attented to. Samith whom we were greeted every day by and was checked in on was a great help & very friendly, even arranged a tour to the Safari for us and breakfasts to take was ensured. Sorry we missed saying good bye to you ! Hope to see you again. Restaurant: Lilanga, a gentlemen in charge of the restaurant, with a wealth of knowledge and tries to cater to all your needs . If you ever feel a meal is not right or if you need something, do reach out to him and he will help you, Thanks again ! A big gratitude to Jananjaya, whom we felt looked after us so much every day. Whom we grew to bond with, it was a pleasure meeting you ! Other names to mention, and sorry for not remembering all ! Tony, Panditha, Chamila as well, and also the lovely ladies who always greeted us and sat us down to our tables for every service. Bar: Much thanks to Calinga ! Thank you for all the cocktails. And again others who served us at the bar ! Pool: Both guys we had were amazing and made sure we always had towels, and cushion for the sunbeds. Dinesh, very nice to meet you and always laughing and joking made us so much more at ease. And last but not least, although I dont have names to mention. Many thanks to the security guards who would tend to go unnoticed, but honestly they made us feel safe and secure always seeing them around. The location, on the beach front, shame about the rough seas, cannot wait to see what it is like when the seas are calm ! With the infinity pool in the main area, it felt like you were in the sea anyway ! The food selection, although sometimes smaller, sometimes bigger. Always had a good variety for most days, and was always very tasty, and fresh. As one can expect, spices are prevalent but again requests can be made to amend this. There is alot of western options to accomodate. Again a shout out to Tony whom after talking about the fact that we never saw any Kottu on the buffet, was then on the main Buffet stand the next day being enjoyed not only by our selves but all other guests ! Buffer / BBQs on the outside garden is alway also a great addition when they can accomodate this ! The peacefulness. I think due to the post covid situation, we had the best of both worlds in a sense. Weekdays we pretty much had the pools to ourselves, and the weekends more locals arrived and so the resort was busier. As much as the peacefulness was appreciated, hopefully in the future, more "animations /activies" & I would look to see all bars in full operation, can be achieved to change the days up a bit. The wildlife, Birds, Iguanas, lizards, monkeys. Nothing disturbing but made it so much more tranquil with the plantation as well being among all of this. Not to mention the few dogs and cats. If you like plantation indoors as well, then you will enjoy the rooms and hotel itself as well, at night time they look even better if the lights are working. We stayed at Heritance 15th to the 27th. And really hope to visit another time in the near future !
Not very impressed

This ought to be a great hotel but it ends up only being a good one. It lets itself down on a couple of fronts. First the good - the food is excellent both in the main restaurant and the fine dining restaurant. In particular we were very impressed with the team that look after the pool bar and the fine dining room. Worthy of particular mention are the guys in Lakmal's team including Dilan, Kolitha and Silva who were chatty without being intrusive and went out of their way to help. Dinesh made sure that a birthday celebration in the fine dining restaurant was special and memorable. Also the pools are very large and the main pool is really beautiful. The hotel is justifiably proud of having been designed by Sri Lanka's most celebrated architect Geoffrey Bawa. The view as you arrive at reception is fantastic looking right through the hotel lobby and over the beach to the sea. Unfortunately our experience of the front desk staff is they manage to be both obsequious and a bit too full of how good they think the hotel is at the same time. We were particularly annoyed when they failed to pass on two important messages from our tour operator. The rooms also look the part at first but fall victim to style over substance. There are so many hotel 'ornaments' that you have to clear loads of stuff out of the way to put your own belongings away. The light over the desk is hung so low that you bang your head on it whilst it manages to keep the mirror above the desk in complete shade. You have to ring housekeeping to ask for many of the things we found provided automatically in other hotels such as adaptors and mosquito repellers. You also need to make use of the Do Not Disturb sign pretty much whenever you are in the room or you are likely to find your bed being turned down at 6 in the evening! We also experienced power failures on almost every evening - not the end of the world in themselves but it would have been nice to have had a torch in the room instead of sitting in complete darkness until the power came back on. The bathroom was one of the biggest disappointments as it only contain a shower. We asked twice about moving to a room with a bath and once were told there were no rooms with baths and the second time were asked for $100 per night to move to a room with a bath. On both occassions we were told we could use the jacuzzi near the resident's pool if we wanted a bath although we were never brave enough to stroll down there in the altogether with our soap and shampoo! The jacuzzi is actually a cheap plastic afterthought that would have Mr Bawa turning in his grave. In summary this hotel did not impress as much as other hotels we stayed in during our trip. It charged for things such as internet usage and had not done a great job of anticpating our needs in a way that other hotels did that did not cost anywhere near as much as this one and it would probably not be on our list of places to go back to or to recommend on that basis.
treated as royalty during our stay!
Good hotel but not 5 star

We stayed at 2 other Heritance hotels which were fantastic, so we were bitterly disappointed by the Ahungalla. Service was consistently terrible, filthy mattresses on the sun loungers (they looked like something that belonged in a sri lankan prison), no soap in the toilets, dinning room so dark another guest actually bought a torch to see their food.

We stayed th Sep. 7th Night at Heritance Ahungalla and it was a superb stay. We checked in a bit late around 8 in the night but from thereon to today the service and the staff had been absolutely helpful. The Food and the Cleanliness is also at an excellent level combined with the astonishing architecture. We reserved a Luxury room but it was upgraded to a junior suite by the Hotel itself for the reason of having a bath tub in the wash room was one of the priority for our reservation of a luxury room, and not having one in luxury rooms they upgraded us. The view also pleasant and top pf it all the staff is really friendly and assertive in their very own way.
Clever design means all good views from the rooms.
Bad Experience

Very relaxing hotel with lovely people... both pools are amazing... food and service is excellent... my sister had a lovely room with a nice view.we will be back again to visit this lovely place.thank you...
Serinity
Nothing like the Heritance Kandalama
All inclusive stay is recommended. Beautiful location
Disappointing Stay and low service levels
If only
Ask for one overlooking the main pool. Great views but quiet at night.
Sore Disappointment

The hotel decor is a little stark and requires a makeover - with the corridors resembling a hospital ward - a few pictures would liven the place up a bit. That said we ate at the Bar Restaurant and the food was very good. the hotel pools were enjoyable - but the seclusion was spoiled as the beach was intersected from the hotel grounds by a number of hawkers - who were polite enough but incessant. The beach was lovely - and we even witnessed a giant turtle arriving on shore in teh afternoon to lay its eggs - amazing. All said - I expected more - and beware teh burning sun!
think it needs a bit of an uplift. be it painting or otherwise. The pool needs a good tile cleaning too. restaurant tables were very salty and a bit more effort on cleanliness
Do not eat here if you are staying at this hotel go out for your meals

Our trip was in Dec which is a busy month. However when we called them in the morning to check if an early check in was possible they said 12pm would be fine. On our arrival we were made to sit in the lobby for 2 hours. We could have saved that time by coming later if it was not promised for 12 pm. When they finally gave us the room it was not cleaned well and we were told that the family before us had really messed it up and also stayed on way past check out time. Apart from this our stay was good. The room was big and spacious and the beds very comfortable. If the doors were left open a few mosquitoes would get in so its best to keep them shut when going to the pool or beach. The room service was ok. Best to stick to the rice as the burger we ordered was not very good. The fried rice was quite good. The staff are friendly and helpful. The chefs at the live stations in the morning (specially a lady) were very unenthusiastic about serving and overall the service was very poor. We expected more as it is after all a Heritance Hotel and should have 5 star service. The residents pool is the highlight. Its clean, big and quiet so we really enjoyed spending time at the pool. Hope the service improves.
Service was beyond excellent

We stayed her for 11 nights at the end of September to celebrate our 15th wedding anniversary and this was our third stay here. We were married here (when it was Triton) in 2000. The staff are extremely friendly and really do want to make sure every aspect of your stay is perfect. I‚Äôve read some of the reviews about the food which seem overly critical but there is something for everyone. There are chefs on duty during breakfast, lunch and dinner and if you can‚Äôt find something to suit your palate from the varied selection on offer ‚Äì just ask they would be more than happy to make arrangements for you. We were very well looked after from the moment we arrived. We had made a specific room request which was met and we weren‚Äôt disappointed. We had a suite overlooking the Green (residents) pool which in our opinion is the quieter end of the hotel and this was important to us. The room was extremely comfortable, very clean and maintained twice a day (including turn down service) so fresh towels, water and anything you need is never too far away. I love the creations that the room staff make of towels and fresh flowers. During our stay we received a complimentary dinner in the fine dining restaurant. The chef on duty was TSM deSilva and it was an incredible culinary experience. All aspects of the meal were well flavoured and presented with such care. It was obvious to us that Chef de Silva has a passion for creating amazing flavours and he was keen to receive feedback on the dishes he creates and he chatted with us to make sure we were happy with all aspects of the fine dining experience. We enjoyed it so much we went back again during our stay and we weren‚Äôt disappointed. The second meal was as incredible as the first. They have a lot of talented staff here at Heritance and together they make a great team. We were lucky enough to be given a tour of the kitchens and the Chocolate factory which was absolutely mind boggling. The creations they create have to be seen to be believed. Keep up the good work and please don‚Äôt change too much of what makes this hotel a special place when you close for your next refurbishment (which we understand is due in 2016). The one thing I would say is if you are planning to stay here, all-inclusive does not include please and thank you to the staff. I was astonished at the attitude of some guests towards the staff ‚Äì as I‚Äôve already mentioned the staff want to make your stay the best it can be ‚Äì saying please and thank to the staff does not cost you anything so remember to take your manners with you. Thank you to all the staff who looked after us so well. We can‚Äôt wait to return again.
Not far from Airport in comparison with other guys flying with us who proceed further their transfer to hotel destinations.

If you want to travel with a stay in slow life, this place is a good choice. You can complete everything in the hotel. But if you want to see around, not a good choice. Far from cities, also not many restaurants near. The first infinity pool was not so impressive. Nowadays, you can see the more impressive infinity pool in all over the world.

Our planned highlight, to the end of our Sri Lankan tour, was a frustrating disappointment. We arrived tired and sick, hoping for a clean comfortable room and some simple food. Even though we had booked and paid 6 months earlier, it took a long time to allocate us a room. The room smelled of mould and mould was easily found in the bathroom. My wife complained, but all the staff could do was find the missing outdoor furniture. At dinner, the first night, we had difficulty finding plain food, that would not aggravate our upset stomachs. The chef kindly offered to prepare mashed potatoes, peas and grilled chicken, for us, the next night. However, the next day, this offer was undone by management, who declared we had been selected for "Fine dining". Fearing this was Sringlish for extra spicy, we gave up and went to bed early, without dinned, which we had already paid for. At least at checkout, as some compensation, the hotel did not charge for the sandwich and hamburger, we had at the bar. After my wife presented mouldy toiletries to management, they did offer to change rooms, on the second day; but it was too little too late. The hotel has an impressive entrance and sea view. But what good are those when the hotel fails the basics of room and food.
This is not a 5 star hotel 3.5 at the most. The property needs a lots of attention and staff at breakfast was not helpfu

I enjoyed my stay, especially with the super spacious rooms. The food was pretty average but the service was good. The hotel has a nice beach too. The hotel has 2 swimming pools and they are quite big. Service is pretty decent.
Excellent Service in an oceanfront paradise
If you and Sachin Tendulkar visit this resort at the same time and you get to stay in room# 358, then you can be neighbours with Sachin !! :D AND you'll get a great view of the sea from your balcony
It was really remarkable

During our 4 weeks we had really a very nice time a part from some rain in the evening.Beachfront hotel large and well kept property, Room confortable with everything you need, rooms a little too dark in the evening.Towels and bedsheet in perfect conditions, rooms very clean.Staff kind and helpful also in the 2 pools, the pool attendents were always ready to give you new towels and to help you to change place when necessary.The food in the main restaurant , usually self service, is various and abundant, of course You must like oriental food, not accordingly to european tast, but very spicy, ( not strong or pure fire,) just spicy as a matter of fact the majority of the guest are arabs, indians, and other asian countries.For us italian was OK. Good entertainment afternoon and evening, fire works, shows , music etc.Something special was the man playing flute in the morning at the main pool.What was not good at all, was the great quantity of russian, ukrain and soviet people, noisy,arrogant,impolite, mainly dressed with shorts, shirts withouth sleeves and sandals, and all this at the main restaurant. Also a great deal of small children were roaming shouting and screaming in the main restaurant sometimes . In a 5 star hotel this is not acceptable!!!! In any case this hotel is good and advisable. bruno e marisella torino italia
No more inclusive at checkout at 12pm

Quite disorganised staff. My car was taken to be parked but never given a token as reference. Fail to find the key afterwords which I had to go and select myself. Checkin time was 2pm and the time now is 2:40 ....still waiting for a room to be ready ....Will think twice before booking this hotel again.

Try to get a room by the residents pool. While we were at the hotel they had a conference for an Indian based insurance firm. The outdoor bar b q and disco were held on the grass area in front of the hotel by the main restaurant and the rooms on this wing would have suffered from the noise.
The corner rooms seemed large and great for not much extra..
Buffet prices a lil on the higher side
Returned our lost iPad. Thank you!

My stay at Heritance Ahungalla was disappointing. The management's poor communication left me frustrated, and the staff although willing to help where poorly trained, lacked any authority or understanding of their own systems & processes which lead to a subpar service. The food and bed linens were only of average quality, further diminishing the overall experience.

One thing which makes Heritance Hotels stand out is the food and hospitality. So I had high expectations. I have already been to Kandalama and Negambo, in both cuisine and hospitality is great and flawless. The first thing I noted is that they (Heritance Ahungalla) cannot handle a crowd. No welcome drinks for some of the guests. Very few (sometimes none) food options to vegetarians. The restaurant space was not enough when crowded. Service is really bad at the restaurant. Several times we had to ask for water and wait for it. Both Negambo and Kandalama is excellent in service where they event do not let the water glass finish in any of the tables. So lot of improvement is needed. And it is noted that the service is delayed not because the staff is very busy, but because there are some idle staff as well. More organization is needed. Rooms are okay. The first day there were only one shower cap in the room. The other shower cap box is empty. On top of that, the second day, there were no soap. Even the soap from the previous day has been removed. Location is okay. Nice pools. If the main is crowded or sunny in the day you can use the other pools.

We stayed for 6 nights at the Heritance Ahungulla. It's a nice hotel, we had a luxury double room facing the sea which was spacious and comfy bed. The only thing that lets this place down slightly is the food as you get a bit sick of it after a while, so definitely venture out of resort. Also, watch the hawkers out on the street if you go outside the gates to go to the local shop across the road. They are on you as soon as the gates are closed, asking you if you'd like to see gems, have massages or see spice gardens etc. One even tried to get in a tuk tuk with us, however we politely told him to get out. Good staff, but our room cleaner was hanging around us too much after we had tipped him one day; like he wanted more. Just made me feel a bit uneasy. Apart from that it was somewhere good to stay.
Tired in Ahungalla

My sister and I were really looking forward to ending our 9 day tour of Sri Lanka in an excellent 5 star hotel. To our dismay, we were presented by a hotel which should not be claiming it's 5 star label. A three star at best. It was by no means dirty, but very rough around the edges. It was in dire need of renovation. The room itself had nothing wrong with it, but no determining feature to tout it as a 5 star resort. The food was ok. Unfortunately, it was a big anticlimax for the end of our trip.

(+)Excellent location facing the beach with direct access. Two swimming pools make it less crowded. Staff very polite and helpful. We where lucky to spot the endemic (in Srilanka) purple faced langur in the premises. Good restaurants inside (-) Long walk from the road if you want to buy anything personal. Overall all star ratings

When we i read the inital review for this hotel i read all about eh room that smelt of mold. Well imagine my amusement(not ) after God knows how many hours of travel we arrive....hotel looks lovely...we check in...all good. We get showed to our room - we get showed around and then everyone stands still as the expected tip needs to be handed over. Fine, not great but fine. I then start having an asthma attack, due to the strong smell of mold. Yep I've got the moldy room!!!! We ask to get moved, which was quick and efficient, but i was really annoyed when another tip was expected. At this point i have to say that ws one of my main annoyances about Sri Lanka. of course when you travel to a less fortunate country you expect to tip, but i got out hand. Anyway, hotel was ok...room was nice, good size, bathroom great...Again slight annoyance, they cleaned everyday, but i didn't always think it was that thorough-. The food was fabulous, although we never had the buffet dinner,we ate mainly (when at the hotel) at the 24 h place. the top resturant wasn't open as the hotel wasn't busy enough.Brekafast were wide ranging and very tasty no complaints here. Great gym. which no one uses and it has a fabulous views out to sea- it felt like my own personal gym. The views are great , and the beach is wonderful, never crowded . Once you've told the beach touts that you'll buy something they're pretty good and leave you alone. I'm not sure when they're adding it, but there is no Spa on site, somoen comes in to do massage. I went down the road Eden Hotel & Spa, which i would definitely recommend. Spa is lovely-and they have great food aswell if you want to go for dinner. On the whole the Heritage was lovely, did the job, just a few annoyance, but mainly good.
Average / Below Average
The worst meal in Sri Lanka
Really indulge into this hotel, the staff are very friendly and attentive, except the Front Desk, disconnect to room guests, and pushy, lacking of empathy....quite odd.
What happened to the food

Stayed in August 2013 for Business Meet.The location of the hotel is superb with a lovely view of the sea. The rooms appear to be old need renovation, the rooms don't have card key. the meals were not suiting the tastes for Indian Palate. The staff is not attentive at all, language problem I suppose always had to be called many times even for water. Overall was an average experience.
Maybe food could have been a bit more tastier
Need to be more cuser oriented
Do not select Deluxe rooms, Always choose the rooms by the pool

If you want a cheap five star hotel and you‚Äôre not looking for a luxury experience, this will do. But if are expecting quality this is not the place. The good: Rooms are clean and recently renovated, has three pools, great SL food The bad: Common areas are tired, dining room is cramped, you have to fight to get food, bathrooms smell
Excellent food but poor service.

My wife and I would like to share our wonderful / memorable stay at Heritance Ahungalla during this short trip. We will definitely come back for a longer stay. The team of Sampath ,Gamini and Thusara took care of us so well that we felt we were being spoilt . As I told them in the service industry this is what make the difference. I believe Heritance brand should not expand too fast and special attention should be paid to training and succession planing not forgetting staff retention . A lot of respect should be given to old staff who have been hardworking and loyal which is something I could notice in this hotel organization . Congratulations and all the best wishes. Once again a big thank you for the reception at your hotel .

Absolutely wonderful! The resort was a tranquil haven set away from the busy main road and made you feel like you have just stepped into paradise. The hotel is beautifully laid out, allowing you to go from swimming in the pool to swimming in the ocean with just a few steps along a very private beach. The architecture is stunning. The hotel had a wide array of amenities like 2 pools (one with Jacuzzi), bars, restaurants, a library, tennis court, spa, putting green, gym, loads of games, etc which I felt made it ideal for either couples or families. There were always activities for both children and adults like mask painting, water aerobics, traditional dances, etc but they were unobtrusive, allowing you to either be entertained or just relax in peace around the pool, without being bothered. The rooms were beautiful, comfortable and cleaned spotlessly every day. The service was outstanding with smiling happy faces greeting you wherever you go. Nothing seemed too much trouble to do and they made you feel like you were part of the family, not just an anonymous guest. Special thanks to KK who made us feel like we were royalty every day and went out of his way to help us experience Sri Lankan culture. The food was spectacular with a wonderful mix of Sri Lankan and international dishes. We were mad about the Egg hoppers and wonderful Sri lankan curries with their endless choice of sambals, chutneys, pickles, pitu, etc. This is a wonderful escape that makes you feel absolutely pampered every step of the way.
Not above the restaurant (smell, and all these constant endless parties/weddings, that take place in front of the restaurant).

This is a very quiet resort located away from the town.there is pretty much nothing to do around here other than lazing by the pool and the beach.The sunset here is awesome.The hotel is a bit old and i would not rate it as a 5 star hotel.the view was nice but the room was poor and give you the feeling of the 80s starting from the key to the furniture,the ac,the toilets...The main buffet restaurant is extremely tired.We stayed on a half board basis so ate at the hotel a lot and the quality of the meals was a bit inconsistent.The breakfast buffet was very limited.The first night dinner buffet was also limited but the next night was great because of new guests form arabian countries!!!!it was the best meal we had during our whole stay in this hotel!!!Live music every night was enjoyable.High speed free wifi was excellent.The room boy had mad an elephant with bath towels on bed.Thanks A Lot
WORST HOTEL EXPERIENCE. EVER.
Average
Very nice hotel, Situated perfectly on the beach of the Indian Ocean. Great room, good restaurants and bar. Beautiful design, magnificent swiming pools. What a pity, we have had only one night there.

This is our 8th visit to Heritance Ahungalla. We are returning visitors every year as we are extremely pleased with the highest quality of service we have received and this has been consistent throughout all our stays. We are frequent travellers having stayed at many 5 stars hotels around the world, but this hotel has been outstanding and hence our return here each year. We would also like to thank the GM, the front office manager Indika and all the front office staff and special thanks to Chathuranga who organised kite flying for our 2 children. The food at this hotel is beyond words, it really is amazing. Compliments to the great chefs, Dimuthu Kumarasinghe and junior chef Dayananda. The chefs have recently won awards and we can totally agree that these awards are very well deserved. The hotel restaurant service is excellent and special thanks go to Mr Gamini and Thushara. Special thanks also go to Chamith and Raju the 2 Animation staff who entertained us with a variety of sports and activities for our children. Chamith and Raju are an asset to this hotel, they are both hard working with great personalities. The rooms we have had have always been super clean and spacious. The 2 swimming pools are both really big and always clean with excellent pool staff with great service. Thank you Heritance Ahungalla for a wonderful holiday. See you next year! Regards from Dr Jayasuriya and family
First time time to Heritance
If God give me another opportunity for harbouring me so will I come to again in this hotel with my wife because here too much fun like swimming or playing soccer volleybal
Good view for the room at sea side

As mentioned above the hotels seems to have changed its profile. The first thing that meets you after the majestic entry, that took my breath away the first time I came, is a large Russian banner. The hotel seems to accommodate huge groups of tourists from this country and many of them behave badly, bringing glass bottles into the pool, (drinking a lot in general) ignoring the personnel, treating the personnel like lesser beings (we saw this several times) and not greeting, making eye contact, or even acknowledging fellow hotel guests. I can understand that the world situation makes this awkward for them, but if you choose to travel out, you should make the effort- not expect to take over a beautiful tropical destination and ignore and cancel all others just by outnumbering them. I will not return to Heritance Ahungalla (the Triton to me) until this has changed. It was very expensive too, which is such a shame when the experience is so negative. I can understand the need to make money, but ruining such a beautiful hotel and experience along the way can hardly be worth it in the long run . I‚Äôm sure the architect Geoffrey Bawa would‚Äôve hated this development!

We went quite some time ago. The resort was nice, staff was very friendly. The rooms were okay. The breakfast was good except for the tea and coffee. We tried the dinner buffet one night and that was not nice at all but we complained and got compensated. The pool areas were okay, lots of kids. Massages were decent. Luckily we had a car and driver so went around the area to Hikkaduwa etc to eat otherwise eating options at the resort were very limited

Home away from home !!!

I stayed here in Feb 2011, near to the end of what had been a wonderful trip; but its seems nowt has changed, Staff were not too friendly as we'd experienced in rest of country, the whole hotel had an worn tired feel, the restaurant dark and hot, moved to outside tables for breakfast to sit with dirty table clothes even worse service but plenty of flies for company, asked at least 6 times to turn fans on but never did happen, oh and someone died while there - not sure if that was waiting?
