Ask for a room facing the 2nd residential pool.
Choose the Rooms in 3rd Floor of the resort as the views from balcony are better from 3rd Floor Rooms.

Worst hotel ever Felt like you are in a graveyard. The room is too far especially you need to walk from the lobby to the room is like 1km Not worth the price at all. Staff were polite especially the manager but they need to consider making the hotel better since we pay more and believe the reviews
Not that great
Higher floors offer better ocean views

The location on the beach is great, calm and scenic, close to the water. The hotel pool area is good and quite high level of service around the pool. Some days the pool area was not so quite that we had expected. Layout of the hotel is fine but it need some updating and I understand it will take place in April this year. Communication among staff was non existing, service quite low if you rate yourself as a 5 star hotel, which it is not compared to international standard. The food did not live up to a 5 star hotel standard, medium quality to quite high rates. Breakfast was rather chaotic and serice level among staff low. It seemed as staff wanted to delivery a good service but did not know how. Only on the very last day they checked in and ask how it was and if we were satisfied. Shops in the hotel area were very boring and expensive and far from 5 star hotel standard, recommend to either close or improve a lot. Wil go back to Sri Lanka but will chose antoher place to stay.

It was a wonderful stay. However we would have preferred to have more varieties for the buffets. The main courses mostly consisted of rice. Other activities should be available at least till 8 in the night, including outdoor activities.

We stayed here for 4 nights at the end of our Sri Lanka trip in 2 rooms.impressive driveway and entrance lobby and friendly greeting and check in .Rooms are large and had good views to the garden and towards the sea, well equipped and very clean with great service from our daily room attendant, although on arrival both rooms had cockroaches but he dealt with these swiftly and they did not reappear, comfortable beds and nice linens and towels. No signage to any of facilities such as gym. Great pools and very spacious gardens and lots of sun beds with good service from pool attendants.The major disappointment was the attitude of bar staff and some of restaurant staff to all inclusive guests, unfriendly and unhelpful to the point of rudeness! Why offer an all inclusive option and then treat these guests as second class citizens? We were frequently ignored in the bar area and bills presented in a manner which suggested you shouldn't order anymore! Totally spoilt what otherwise would have been a very pleasant stay.

it was too crowded, cockroaches in our room, also food was not so impressive and the atmosphere was not good for a relaxing holiday the day we stayed there. Didnt like the bathrooms either. sorry but i think it should be a three star hotel Only good thing was the staff, they were so friendly and helpfull. will I go back , nope.

We stayed here between 18-24 June 2007 for part of our 3 centre honeymoon and we were amazed by both the country and the hotel. We were greeted by the Duty Manager and a refreshing cold towel and shown to our rooms following a brief introduction to the hotel as well as a choice of cocktail or wine upon ones arrival. One thing to bear in mind from the momnet you arrive in the hotel, is that tipping is a necessity, 100-200 rupees (50p-¬£1) is adequate and you will find that you tip practically everyone, so make sure you have small denominations of GBP or USD. We stayed in a standard room over looking the pool and the Indian Ocean. The room was exceptionally clean, with a well-stocked mini bar and a tv with various satellite channels. The room boasted a well equipped en-suite, with a huge walk-in shower. The balcony was big with a table and two chairs which were much used when watching the sun set! The room had wooden floors and tiles in the bathroom and there was seating area within the room with a sofa and table. The pool areas were very clean with plenty of sun loungers around. Once you found the sun lounger of your choice a member of staff would bring towels and an umbrella if so required to you. The jacuzzi was not operational all the time, though that is partly due to the lack of clientele, although when it was turned on, there were very few people using it anyway. Periodically, the waiters would bring round refreshing water melon free of charge which was always welcomed. Waiters were also there if you wanted a drink that would then be brought to your sunlounger. Be wary, if you do get a sun lounger facing the sea, you are likely to be bombarded with the locals trying to sell you their goods. A polite shake of the head will move them on as they cause no harm. The hotel have tried to move on the sellers, but they rely on tourism so basically bear with it or move nearer the pool. Although we were half board at this hotel, it was easy to eat in the coffee shop which was excellent value for money and they had a good range of foods. The breakfast were good, with a wide variety which catered for most nationalities, including Sri Lankans themselves who tend to have Pol Sambol (a type of curry) for their breakfast. The evening meal tends to be a buffet, but as the hotel was pretty empty, we had most of our meals from the A La Carte menu which was excellent. On the occasion we did have the buffet, there was a great choice of barbequed meats and freshly cooked meals, all of very high standards. Dress code is smart /casual. The hotel was only 1/3 full as a result of the lack of tourism following the Tsunami and the Civil War, which is such a shame as a lot of staff had to be laid off as a result. The Civil War is taking place to the far North East of Sri Lanka and it was only on the way back to the airport late at night did we ever see army personnel as there are many check points to go through, but don't let this put you off as it doesn't affect you at all. As a result of the low numbers, the evening entertainment was null and void, although as a honeymooning couple, this did not bother us as it was nice to have a walk around or a couple of drinks in the bar before retiring to the room. That being said, the hotel was busy over the weekend and the evening entertainment did pick up. There is nothing about the hotel we would change. The staff are friendly and extremely attentive and they will go out of their way to help you. The hotel in our opinion was worth every penny and would recommend it to anyone. PLEASE don't be put off with the post-Tsunami clear up as we hardly saw any of it taking place, although the hotel is a constant reminder how strong these people are in the face of adversity. The only evidence that you will see in the immediate vicinity of the resort is the boutique on the beach and you can see where the waves ripped the walls apart. Go to the Heritance Ahungalla, it is wonderful and we certainly go back and it is certainly worthy of its 4* reputation.
Choose rooms with sea view_x000D_ Ground floor rooms are easier if you want to come in from the beach and clean up

We have just returned from a 2 week (all inclusive) stay at the Heritance and had a great time. Our room was a bit tired but I believe is due to be refurbished, some rooms already having been renovated. The hotel is in a good position on a lovely beach ‚Äì great for a walk and it would take us just over an hour to walk to the far end and back. The sea is a bit rough for swimming in and the red flag was up for our entire stay, however it was good fun in the waves if you don‚Äôt go out your depth. There are 2 decent sized swimming pools and we never had any problem getting a sunbed. Being all inclusive, all our meals were taken in the buffet restaurant. However there is an a la carte and a fish restaurant if you fancy a change, although you would have to pay for these and there is no discount. We found there was plenty of variety on the buffet and the food was of an excellent quality with authentic local dishes and of course a wide choice of different curries (green pea/cashew and beetroot/potato were some of our favourites). All the staff were very friendly and efficient. The chap that cleaned our room (319) was excellent and the bed was always beautifully decorated with flowers. Jananjaya in the restaurant was always there to top up our drinks. When you first arrive and walk on the beach or go out the front gate you will be approached by people looking to sell you trips/tuk tuk rides. Whilst it can get a bit annoying they are definitely better value than the tour operator excursions. We had a taxi to the fort at Galle for ¬£30 between the two of us and the driver waited for us, whereas the tour company were charging ¬£55 each for a half day trip to Galle. We also took tuk tuks to Brief garden by Bevis Bawa and the Lunuganga Estate of Geoffrey Bawa, and they were some of the highlights of our trip. There is an ATM about a 10 minute walk up the road. One thing to be aware of at the airport when you leave Sri Lanka is that you cannot take bottled water onto the plane, even if you have purchased it in the departure lounge. Oh and by the way there is a public holiday when there is a full moon and no alcohol can be sold anywhere and is not available at the hotel.
Choose a room away from the Spa

I was there in July 2018 with my newly married wife. We used to travel around a world (from Europe, Asia to South America) and what we have to admit - we are very positively surprised by the local people whom we met in Sri Lanka. We are stunned by the kindness and warmness of the hotel's Heritance Ahungalla crew who was always ready to help us, talk and exchange experineces about local specialities - such as food, places worth to see or even costs that we should planned while traveling on our own. We would like to higly recommend them: Vimukthi Ishan, Jagath Vimukthi, Anuruddhi Bandara and Danuka Rakitna - ketachen chef, that gave us recepie for the best Egg Hoper ever! Thanks to this people our trip was even more memorable.

We travelled with family on an outing, that had been planned a couple of months in advance. One of the members of our party is in a wheelchair and from the time of booking, this was mentioned as a special request. However, it was extremely difficult in getting confirmation from the hotel (both head office and hotel were contacted) if they were able to accommodate this guest. Several calls and emails went ignored and we resorted to calling a friend. This was extremely annoying as full paying customers you would like to think that the hotel would want to provide you with this basic service. A complaint made to the FB page provided some call back, but as always the trail went cold. We were unsure as to if this guest was able to make it, so in sheer desperation we had someone physically visit the hotel the week prior to our holiday and ask if they could be shown a few of the room categories, we were happy to upgrade if necessary. However, the person was not shown all categories and so the guest decided to only come for the day. Needless to say, we went there already disappointed with what the hotel had to offer. Once we checked in, we realised that one of our rooms was able to accommodate the guest in the wheelchair, and then proceeded to go to great lengths to ensure this guest joined us for the night. When we questioned the front desk as to why this room had not been shown to us, we were not given a valid response and we let it be, as we felt like we had already exerted way too much effort in what was meant to be a relaxing holiday! Needless to say, I felt like reservations, front desk and the head office staff were negligent and incompetent in this regard. Thereafter our trip went along smoothly, the staff were friendly and courteous and cooperated with requests such as bringing out a birthday cake. The rooms were clean and the common areas pleasant. It is a decent family hotel. The food was average at best, with no real highlights. Nice enough for a holiday with kids, but not good enough to compensate for all the hassle with the levels of initial service rendered.
Incredible architecture and situation with poor service and maintenance

I checked this hotel at tripadvisor before booking it and expected it to be nice and relaxing at the very least, however, the whole stay (we stayed there for 3 weeks) was a complete and utter disappointment! Looks like Heritance has changed a lot lately and it's surely not a 5* hotel anymore. After an almost 20-hour trip to the hotel, my only wish was to have a shower and lie down, however, we had to spent almost half an hour answering stupid questions about our anniversary, etc. The staff was too talkative and tactless even, several times we had spend almost the entire lunch in their company and nothing could possibly make them leave. All the advantages of this place faded away in comparison with its negative sides. Quite nice design of the room couldn't make up for holes in bedsheets, dirty curtains, breaking conditioning, old towels and other things. The food was really fabulous, however, when the evening food was under a set menu, almost all guest opted for the a la carte restaurant as the set menu was really poor and the meal lasted forever. The atmosphere was quite relaxing most of the time, however, there was no chance to even enter the pool as soon as weekend came and the hotel was fully packed with locals. Some things kept on spoiling our stay on every day basis. The beach area was constantly full of locals, who were trying to sell you a trip or whatever you wanted or didn't wanted. Even by the pool your every single movement was followed by their attempts to draw your attention. If you managed to escape and reach the ocean, several guys were waiting for you to come back. I would never recommend this hotel to anyone! For the first time in my life I was looking forward for going home!!

The place was nice with beautiful views. The food was good but overpriced. Also the service was slow in the cafe. I think it was too expensive for the place and to charge almost 3500 lkr for a dinner buffet that had a great salad & dessert bar but the main foods was very limited. I am pretty sure they do not have generators because when the power was out there was backup current. I would recommend that you take a walk down to the beach and take a right to white villa restaurant or take a left to Jungle beach to eat. White Villa has an amazing lookout oint for a sunset....

I had a twin room which was very good but maybe would be a bit on the small size for two people. The bed was very comfortable, there was a desk with a reading lamp in the corner. The bathroom was small but fine for just me. There is a big pool very close to, and overlooking the beach and sea. The sea has too many waves to swim in but good for splashing around and having a bit of fun in. There is not much outside the property but there is a jewellery shop across the road with a very helpful and genuine owner and a wine shop to the right who will rip you off with "tourist prices". To get further afield the hotel does offer taxis but they are expensive. I enquired about Bentota and it was $23 return, another couple got a Tuk Tuk and "negotiated" the price down to 700 SLR abut ¬£3.50. Obviously the car is more comfortable, your choice. The food and the staff are very good. If you want to eat elsewhere there are a couple of places on the beach on right of the property.

Hello . The hotel left a mixed impression, we stayed here from 02/03/24 to 02/12/24 Ocean 5+ (if you are afraid of waves like me, then 35 minutes along the beach and you are in a dream lagoon without waves) Kitchen 5+ Live music every evening 5+ The restaurant also has music for weekend dinners 5+ Cleaning 5+ cleaner Rukmal best every day did really masterpieces! Pool 5+, service 5+, atmosphere 5+ the hotel is really very good, the monkeys running on the balconies are just super. The worst ROOM ü§¶‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è 1+ or 2+ I think you can‚Äôt move into such rooms by any means. I'll attach a photo. Everything is falling apart, electrical wires are sticking out, the socket is barely there, everything is old and terrible, number 230 is terrible ü§¶ ‚ôÄÔ∏è A 3 star hostel is better. We tried not to make the room creepy ü§™ Take the better room category and you will be happy üôåüèº
A nice place to relax

We booked a luxury room during our stay, room was spacious and large, however the furniture was old. From the time we arrived we got excellent service right through to the departure. They also have meal upgrade options which for some reason I missed and only found out night before leaving. It's a option worth considering. We had dinner at the restaurant which was excellent in portion sizes and quality and also very reasonably priced. The location however is something to be considered as it is out of everything, other than the hotel there's not much outside.
Worst Heritance Hotel I have ever been
A good make over is needed !
could be good - but are problems
INCOMPARABLE IN REGION

Glad to see you are renovating the rooms which are far better than the drab rooms with rusty fridges on the other side but what happened with the food which was very average maybe even poor , heritance was known for its food, we only had one night of decent food and that was for a tour group, also I see nothing has changed with the beach boys/men hovering at the hotel and a constant annoyance,
I had to walk to a lot to get to my room. There was no proper room service available. The ambience didn‚Äôt feel relaxing. It was just bare minimum.
some might prefer the security of a 3rd floor room
Ask for a room closer to the sea

We have just returned from a fabulous 2 week honeymoon in Sri Lanka. We had stayed in 3 fab places before our final stop at The Heritance. From looking at the website and booking the holiday through a luxury travel agent, it looked like it was going to be a lovely retreat to relax in for 5 days. Unfortunately this wasn‚Äôt quite the case... I had e-mailed and Facebook messaged the hotel the day before arrival. I asked whether they had any suites or some of their best rooms available to upgrade to, as we were on our honeymoon and wished for something extra special. The responded via Facebook asking for my e-mail address so that they could forward information on. I responded and I didn‚Äôt get anything back. I then e-mailed them directly-nothing back again!! Nothing was said on check in...no special greeting...nothing. We were taken to our room, I told the lady taking us there that I had e-mailed and wanted to make sure we got a sea view. She was quite dismissive. When we got to our room, it was ground floor level taking us straight out to the pool. You could hear the sea, but defiantly couldn‚Äôt see it. The room was pleasant enough-modern with a big bed but definatly not 5 star. There was a congratulations cake on the table to great us (we had one at most places we stayed to be honest). But that was the only thing we got to feel special. No one asked whether we would like to organise a special dinner etc etc. As the cake was so big, it was going to take us several days to eat it. Housekeeping could have taken it away and put it in the fridge, but instead it was left out on the side to attract ants. We were just overall a bit disappointed...it was defiantly more of a family hotel and there were kids everywhere the whole weekend we were there and breakfast was crazy-we thought that the hotel was opening up the restaurant and pool to non residents at the weekend. The restaurant needs a facelift for sure as it again did not feel like 5* dining. At breakfast we always waited patiently to be seated, once seated the waitress or waiter would hurry off without asking whether we would like tea or coffee. I then had to try and grab someone‚Äôs attention again so it basically took 15 minutes to get a hot drink. A little poor for 5*. We had lunch via room service a couple of days and that was pleasant enough-very little choice but if you like chips and sandwiches then it‚Äôs fine. They had no samosas and very few of the wines on the extensive wine list on show. I had to chose 3 different wines before finally getting the 4th one I asked for. Also if you like cocktails, you will be disappointed as the ones I had at the hotel were not very nice. We only ate dinner in the restaurant once during our 5 night stop, as we decided we would get better service and food elsewhere. The fine dining restaurant had no people in on any of the nights we were there and we just couldn‚Äôt think of anything worse than the madness of that buffet restaurant again. Where the staff were in attentive and miserable. Sorry Heritance but we just expected more I‚Äôm sorry. And to top it all off we got a phone call the morning of check-out just to make sure we were checking out on time or if we had booked a late check out. And a bill pushed through the door the night before. Come on...it was low season, hotel was not busy at all and we were on our honeymoon. Every morning we were woken at 5am by noisy people checking out of their rooms or walking in high heels right above our bedroom. With being on the ground floor, we were right on the main drag for people moving around. If we had been higher up with a lovely sea view, then we would have hopefully had some peace and quiet.
Breakfast is good, good Sri Lankan food selections but limited English breakfast options (Hash Brown, Sausages, bacon etc)
Premium rooms on the 3rd floor overlook the sea and give easy access to the pool. Ask for a room away from the lift.

Our stay at this property was 9 nights during our holidays and we wouldn't have expected much from this hotel's overall experience if the grading system of this hotel was honest about being below a 4 star. Despite the general friendliness of staffs at the hotel, there is absolutely nothing to recommend about this hotel if you are expecting it to be a 5 star. From: - trying to put us in a lower category room (which we didnt book through Agoda) - bathroom amenities were never refilled and replaced - what 5 star hotel does 2 in 1 shampoo and conditioner??? - room walls were made paper thin and it didnt help they placed us beside the housekeeping room and we heard every clamour there were starting from 7am every morning - bed sheets looked and felt like it was 30 years old from the stains and the lint built-up which was made to feel like climbing into rough potato sack fabric. - on the swimming/lounging private part of the property they allowed hagglers still on the property to haggle guests to buy products or their services. Overall, it should be reviewed how this property gets to be a 5star or be honest and lower the stars for what this property actually deserve which is no where near being a 5 star.
Ask for a room close to the pool.

This is the one of the best hotels I have visited recently... the food here is very delicious and has variety of food and i loved mainly the sri lanka food ...the taste is truly authentic and of very high standards and I have to thank the chefs of this hotel a lot the service and the staff is also excellent...the rooms are also good ..I recommend this hotelbti everyone...
The view of the room. And the dinner. Breakfast was okay

The buffet was great, like the one at Kandalama, clean rooms, large pools, plenty of space to walk around, great for couples; but beware of the locals near the beach, they will rip you off, offer tours and extort you in the process, Hotel staff ignore what goes around so your on your own
Perfect beach location and great buffet with variety to enjoy.

The hotel is truly beautiful. As soon as you drive in and stop at the portico the view through the lobby to the pool and the sea beyond is ure to leave you spell bound. Its a very charming place with a lovely beach front. The rooms are well appointed with great views. The staff is good but the service is too laid back and could be better. Overall an enjoyable experience with good food at the restaurants.

we booked a room for 2 nights & checked out after staying only for one. Room & toilet were not clean to a 5 star standard. The sofa & furniture in the room were old & worn out. Food was just baisc stuff. The pools are big & excellent. A average hotel.
Book through Indika and he will give the best room in the hotel... Ask for the rooms near Resident pool....

Our stay in this hotel was most enjoyable. All staff worked hard to make our holiday enjoyable. Our room was very comfortable with a sea view. The hotel, grounds and pools are well designed, particularly the main pool. The team of pool attendants are the most helpful I have ever encountered in any hotel in the world. I would certainly recommend this hotel however there is one issue I would suggest the hotel management team consider and that relates to noise from the pool activities and the lounge bar. The hotel has two pools - the one in front of reception is the one seen in all their promotional materials and is beautiful. However, it gets very noisy as a result of very loud music associated with activitites in the pool including aqua aerobics. This mirrors the experience of another reviewer jennymartyn. There is a second pool on the property which is not quite as stunningly beautiful but is still a nice pool. However, the noise from the main pool travels and that spoiled our enjoyment on a couple of occaisions. We prefer to listen to the sound of the waves on the beach and the noise of the birds in the trees not head-banging noise from aqua-aerobics and beach based activities. A big thank you to staff including reception staff (can't remember all their names), Vishme (guest relations), housekeeping and pool staff for trying so hard to meet our needs.

Stay was great but 1. Considering there is nothing nearby to eat the food choices for A la cart and Room service are very very limited. 2. Phone receiver was smelly. None of the buttons worked 3. Door stopper broken and the the door kept banging if left open for a few seconds 4. Space beneath bed had not been swept or cleaned in a long time 5. TV was not working . Hotel staff were warm and Service was lovely. The location and rooms were fabulous, so we overlooked all faults except Point number 1 on Food.

We booked our 2 day stay after reading the good reviews but were a bit unsure if we would get the same watered down treatment we received in a hotel in Sri Lanka which had good reviews from foreign tourists and where we stayed last year. Although living in Australia for 22 years we do not exactly have a "foreign" accent, having been born in Sri Lanka we speak the local language which gives us away to the local staff who generally love to pamper the foreign tourists only. What impressed us in this hotel was that the staff made no distinction between the local tourists and the visitors from overseas, and we were well looked after from the time we arrived. Checking in was very friendly, no standing at the reception, but a staff member escorted us to a sitting area and we were offered a choice of freshly squeezed fruit juice. While we enjoyed our complimentary wood apple juice, we were checked in by the staff member. After we finished our drink, we were actually escorted to our room by this staff member who conversed with us in perfect English and told us about the hotel amenities. We had booked a luxury room with balcony and ocean view, and the room was very comfortable. We enjoyed the view from our balcony usually after waking up in the morning, sipping a cup of tea before heading down to the restaurant for breakfast. The food was really good, the restaurant staff smiled as they approached us. We were even asked to let them know if there was anything we would like to have that was not in the menu, and they did actually oblige with my wife's request for grilled seer fish on Kebab night. We were hoping for a quiet relaxed stay during the middle of the week away from busy Colombo where we had spent most of our Sri Lankan holiday, and we had exactly that. The only thing that wasn't to our liking was the persistence of the hawkers on the beach. My wife bought a sarong that looked quite nice from one of them, however this appeared to be a mistake because that enticed the rest of them to keep following us although we very firmly told them we were not interested in buying something from each one of them. Probably there was nothing much the hotel could do about them. Just one other thing and this is about the bathroom. This was very spacious and we liked it very much, however, the louvered blind on the glass wall adjacent to the bath tub wouldn't shut properly. Not quite sure if this is a deliberate gesture by the management to promote intimacy between couples using this room!
Mixed feelings

Hotel located in good Hotel and some of the staff were very friendly. Had to always wait over 1 hour to have meals served after they were ordered. _x000D_ _x000D_ The website indicated that drivers got free accommodation and 3 meals but the staff did not honor this and made our driver pay. It was very get hold of the Manager to complain so something could be done. Our Driver did not end up getting the money back either> Very Disappointing. _x000D_ _x000D_ Sport Staff (Raja) was very good and was very helpful.. One out of many!!
Bad experience they didn‚Äôt smile till we tipped them I didn‚Äôt feel welcomed at all
Great customer service

Assez cher pour ce s√©jour qui √©tait tr√®s bien mais pas exceptionnel. L‚Äôh√¥tel est rempli de monde partout. Les 2 piscines sont grandes heureusement mais pas d‚Äôimpression d‚Äôexclusivit√© et d‚Äôintimit√©. Les repas ne sont pas terribles mais nous avons pass√© 3jours de repos, et la chambre √©tait tr√®s agr√©able.
MAGNIFICIENT WATERFRONT LUXURY PROPERTY

We Have been coming to Heritance Ahungalla for over 15 years. We experienced the same warmth and hospitality right throughout. The food was of a very high standard, accommodation was very comfortable and the staff always made a special effort to make our stay memorable.
Amazing hotel with amazing staff
floors nearer the residential pool

I have such mixed feelings about this hotel but I‚Äôm confident in saying that this is not up to the standards of a 5 star. We stopped here for the last week of our 2 week trip to Sri Lanka for our honeymoon and on arrival to the hotel from the lobby/main gates it looked exceptional! On arrival to our ‚Äúdeluxe‚Äù room we were instantly disappointed. The room apparently had just been refurbished which I found really hard to believe. The shower was covered in limescale and the room was tiny. After a bit of a battle we were finally allocated another room. This room was slightly bigger but the bathroom was once again the bathroom was again covered in limescale, half decorated, very basic and we couldn‚Äôt see anything deluxe or 5 star about it. Earlier in the week we stayed in a deluxe room at a sister hotel ‚ÄòHeritance Kandalama‚Äô and the room there had an amazing view, whirlpool bath & amazing decor‚Ä¶ so as you can imagine we were really disappointed with this room. I‚Äôve attached a couple of photos for reference too. The food was really really good at the buffet and snack bar and we thought the verity of alcohol provided on the all inclusive was good. The staff were friendly but there wasn‚Äôt enough staff and they couldn‚Äôt keep up with how many people were there. I personally wouldn‚Äôt recommend to anyone looking for luxury to stay here and agree with the below comments that this is an equivalent of a European 3 star hotel. Finally, it seems that the management and staff prioritise the returning customers which is such a shame as if they put the effort in to new customers (especially ones who have spent a considerable amount of money on honeymoons) too along with a few touch ups, they‚Äôd receive better reviews.

At the entrance to the hotel there was a big advertising board claiming to have the best culinary team in the island, since another tourist recommended the food here we booked in for lunch as a special treat. It was a buffet priced at over ¬£27 per couple which is quite expensive compared to normal Sri Lankan standards, considering all the hype we were expecting a grand lunch to remember. We were tempted by the grilled seafood skewers as a starter and this was the beginning of the worst meal in Sri Lanka ever. We could not eat them they were stale and tough as old boots. I decided to go for the main course and on the way noticed to my horror the cause of the awful starters the chef was taking out old cooked seafood skewers from a container and putting them back on the hot grill. The main course did not impress one bit the meat curry was stale and very dry, the vegetables were overcooked. The desserts were awful and the only good thing served here was what they did not prepare themselves" the curd & honey". During our meal we requested to see the chef to make a complaint regarding this terrible food. Finally a gentleman appeared at our table who was unable to give us any satisfactory explanation. We ordered coffee and guess what it was stale and lukewarm. By then we were fuming and demanded to see the manager who was very apologetic and requested us to come back that evening for a meal on him, how kind. He even charged us in full for the worst meal we had in Sri Lanka. Do you think we went back that evening for another repeat performance on the house, "Hell no". Do not be fooled by false advertising claims when you can get a much better meal from any roadside cafe for less than ¬£8 for two.

The hotel looks lovely and the rooms are very nice - large, airy and tastefully furnished in a modern take on traditional. Wonderful big comfortable bed, excellent rain shower, big flat screen TV, minbar, generous safe and covered private balcony. Public areas are open plan and also look very nice - until you spot the package operator signs & programs, hear the scream of children in the pool (right beside the only bar & lounge) and realise the predominant language is Russian. Service is hit and miss - there are some excellent staff who cannot do enough to please, but there is also a lot of inexperience and a shortage of staff for the number of guests - leading to some extremely poor service experiences (eg. Wine ordered at dinner not arriving until after dessert; dirty plates left on tables for long periods; tables not properly cleaned between use; buffet dishes not replenished; etc.) The food quality in the buffet is poor - tough cuts of meat, over cooked curries and left out/not refreshed very often. Even at the fresh food stations the ingredients were not top quality and over cooked - and at best all the dishes are luke warm. Breakfast was no better - some good curries, but otherwise heavy doughy croissants, ‚Äòbutter‚Äô that was in fact margarine, a couple of cheap jams, limited selection of fruit and one person cooking eggs and another cooking hoppers for the 100s of guests. To round it off - the majority of the wine list was unavailable (excuse being difficulty with supply chain due to pandemic - but the other hotels on our tour hadn‚Äôt suffered the same problems), as were a number of items on the pool bar snack menu. The sl a carte restaurant and the other bars / coffee shop weren‚Äôt open either. Definitely not a five star experience.

Excellent service.We enjoyed lot. Visited there to celebrated our 2nd wedding anniversary w our 10 month old kid. They specially prepared kids meal for her. Balcony open for thr Fabulous sea beach open. We booked deluxe room. But they upgrated it to suit room. Large spacious nicely arranged room. Two swimming pools are fabulous very closed to the beach. Wow......! They treat every guests as same. Either local or foreigner . Special thanks Should goes to miss Shanika (Guest Relations Executive )and Mr Thushara Restaurant & Bar Managing Executive. Thanks Heritance and the friendly staff for Making our 2nd wedding anniversary so marvellous ......!
The food is not that good. Cleanliness can be improved

Never have I felt the urge to write a review while I'm still staying at a place... But just so that no one else is cheated , I'll do it now... "Steer clear" ... We viz. 2 couples with young children were given twin beds in a "deluxe category" room... God only knows why... They expect the kid to sleep , hanging in the crevice... The house keeping is extra sloppy... 1 hr to get room slippers (read-only I had to personally go to the store room)... Air con s/w broken... Staff got me phenyl when I asked for an antiseptic (dettol) solution... No idea where the first aid kit is... This is my first 2 hrs at the hotel... What's amazing... All this at a ridiculous price
Great location and excellent service

This is our third trip to heritance ahungalla and had a really poor customer service. First we had to wait for more than 15 minutes for our welcome drink since lot of foreigners arrived just AFTER us and had to remind 3 staff members. we went only for lunch buffet and while entering the dining hall our tickets were checked, but while we were dining one lady approached us and wanted to know our room number, so we told we are here only for lunch. Then she again wanted to see our tickets one by one while we were having lunch giving the impression we havent paid. we were amazed by this 5 star treatment. This not what we are expecting after paying Rs 3500 per adult. we will never come back to this place.
Unfortunate Glich

The hotel need an urgent renovation ... Location good but far from center .... 15 mn with a tuktuk ... Pool is clean ... Breakfast and dinner buffet are good .... Entertainment not bad ... All in all is a good place to be for relaxing after a long trip in Srilanka
excellent in every way
Lovely stay with family.

This is a lovely hotel in many ways but it isn't quite good enough to get a "very good". It seemed very expensive for what one got but that may be because we booked a suite directly with the hotel. I suspect many of the hotel guests had booked via tour operators and got a considerably better deal than we got. We were shocked by the average age of the guests which must have been 60+. Don't come here expecting a wild or exciting time! The setting is lovely and the beach is good. The waves are wonderful to play in but they are very strong and only for confident swimmers. The food was of a high quality and reasonably priced although breakfast was a little disappointing. Staff were well meaning but often inept. I once asked for bread 5 times before we got any. We could see the bread baskets in the restaurant ready to be given to diners but the waiters just didn't seem able to serve us (there was only one other table dining in the restaurant so the waiters were not rushed off their feet). We also asked for the bill only to be ignored for 15 minutes (despite being the only people in the restaurant by then). When we asked again, we were met with a blank look and a lack of comprehension. In the end, we said we were going to our room and asked if they could send the bill to us there? The bill never arrived although we were charged for the meal so someone managed to sort things out. At breakfast, we wanted to sit outside as the restaurant was very gloomy. There was only one umbrella between about 20 tables so we would sit in the shade which sometimes necessitated moving the table a little or turning it so we weren't in the sun. Quite often, the staff would then move the table back whilst we were serving ourselves at the buffet. We would then move it again. Also, I asked the chef making omelettes if I could have poached eggs and he had no idea what they were. Fortunately, another chef did and went and organised them for me in the kitchen (they were cooked perfectly). Having said all of that, the staff were lovely and wanted to please. The Valentine's dinner was great. It had the perfect level of cheesy entertainment (the dancers were hamming it up brilliantly), the food was very good and the staff couldn't do enough to please. The beds are very uncomfortable so do consider that if bed comfort is important to you. It was like sleeping on wooden boards. We had a good holiday here but it really wasn't worth what we paid.

I was in Sri Lanka for the second time. Prior to this trip would never have believed that Sri Lanka has such a luxurious hotel with a very kind and responsive staff. The ocean is not deep at the hotel, my 9 year old daughter a lot of swimming in the ocean. The beach boys are friendly, trying to help. If you have forgotten something - be sure to bring in, do not steal. Very good food, I recommend HB

Room was good however the television had to be changed 3 times. Food was avarage but a lot more room for improvement. Staff is the main reason for the guest to feel well come and happy during there stay. One of them in perticuler Ranisha very plesent and helpful. Night club was also avarage however the collection of music could have been and it was empty.
Very dissapointing stay here, wouldn‚Äôt stay here again.
Front office staff are very rude
Getting all inclusive is more economical if they offer you deals at the hotel.
Not as good as it seem
excellent Service
if the hotel is close to fully booked dont go there
sagara

A country full of lovely friendly people with happy smiling faces. Their delightfully naive view of life being that if they give something a 5* rating then it must be so. The problem is that prices have gone up to international 5* levels giving rise to the expectation that it will compare to other high graded hotels around the world. This maybe one of a group of Sri Lankan higher quality hotels but no way is it as 5* by INTERNATIONAL STANDARDS. At best it is a low 4*/high 3*. The entrance is spectacular and beautiful but the rest of the property is simply awful. Poor maintenance, unsafe tiles around the pools, under equipped rooms with intermittent electrical supplies and poor drainage. Hawkers on the beach screaming for your attention every time you go anywhere near them. Nobody walking around with any frequency to see if would like a drink whilst sunbathing etc. It could be so good if only they understood what makes a 5* hotel. Still delightful and enjoyable providing you don't go expecting the best, but it is poor value for money.

Room was decent, nothing fancy. Beachfront was nothing to die for. There are so many better beaches in southern coastline of Sri Lanka. The let down was how the hotel staff discriminate between dark skin people and white skin people. Initially I thought it was a mistake, then a coincidence when differential treatment continued and then understood it is a systemic issue in this facility. All 3 of us had experiences that we can relate to. Also, they make you wear a wrist band during your stay: reminds me of a hospital admission. Perhaps, they cannot remember that you are a hotel guest without having the band.

First time in Sri Lanka but have done Goa so knew what to expect The heritance hotel in AHungala is former five star colonial styled hotel set in beautiful grounds with a magnificent beach golden sands which stretches for miles The rooms are comfortable and clean the staff are extremely friendly and the service is great The buffet style restaurant offers good selection but it gets bit boring if your there for two weeks as we‚Äôre We went for the all inclusive package which is a bit of a joke as apparently all inclusive does not include a whole list of things inc wine at the bar use of the merge sports facilities anything from the mini bar etc. The main problem with the hotel is it‚Äôs loaction once you walk out of the heavily guarded front gates you are straight onto the main columbo to Galle Road The reality of Sri Lanka hits you with a vengeance the local village is a ram shackle mess of half finished buildings with rubbish piled up everywhere The road itself is a constant stream of horn blowing buses lorries car taxis and the famous TUk TUk Not the picturesque photos seen in the holiday brochures It‚Äôs also a long way from the main tourist triangle where the main temples and sigara rock are located We did the two day trip the return journey was six and half hours mainly stuck in traffic not pleasant I was ever to return to Sri Lanka I would certainly choose the location of the hotel so as to be closer to the sights maybe week in Kandy the week at the beach
Preis-Leistung ist nicht stimmig...
I was looking for hotel with great food, definitely better than I imagined.
Nice hotel but could be so much better
Fabulous Holiday at Heritance Ahungalla

1. The hotel did not reply my inquiries I sent via booking.com. Unlike other hotels I booked via booking.com, they always replied within 24 hours. 2. In contrast, they charged the room fee one day before I arrived based on the credit card info left here. My experience is the credit card is used for guarantee while other (5 stars) hotels will check with me my payment preferences when I check in. They can charge me via credit card if I didn‚Äôt show up in the end. 3. I asked if I can have late check-out at 12:30 one night before checkout date. Hotel staff just told me she can‚Äôt confirm it right now and asked me to check again the next day morning. My feeling is they don‚Äôt care customer satisfaction but care more abt their occupancy rate as this is 5 star hotel, which they probably think they can always get sufficient tourists to stay. 4. Lastly, some staff i.e breakfast time is less patient.
It‚Äôs a bit old and tired. Actually it‚Äôs not that old, but needs a good amount of maintenance to bring it back to its former glory
Nice Beach, Average Food
We expect more from an Heritance Hotel
Ground floor are horrid but they give what they wish regardless of preference indicated.
Beeautiful Hotle

last night we were at Heritance . That was a lovely hotel. At the entrance they gave us a admirable welcome . After that we entered to the dinning area . The food was delicious . They had variety of food . Yesterday [ Friday ] was Sri Lankan night . We enjoyed our meals very well . We could taste different traditional Sri Lankan sweet meats . We enjoyed the king coconut drink with lemon grass the most . Finally we saw a troop of kandyan dancers . The restaurant manager Mr. Praveen and G.M Mr . Senarathne and the entire restaurant team were very friendly and helpful . Yesterday was an unforgettable day for our lives!!!

We had our staff trip here. Kind and friendly staff. During our stay we experience kind hospitality from most of the staff, be it reception, Restaurant(The best I must mention) pool staff and the security.The good thing about this hotel I noticed was the prompt service. It was a pleasure meeting Mr. Thushara Gnanarathnam(A senior staff member),who was apparently a reality TV star in Sri Lanka not so long ago, and his kind hospitality. - Family friendly, specially if you are travelling with kids. - Two swimming pools and a Jacuzzi close to one pool.

The food at this hotel was great but overall experience of hotel was average The shower in the room was great very powerfull The food is very good - great choice at breakfast and very fresh, high quality food

hotel and the view is very beautiful,bathrooms need to be refurbish,restaurant staff is very friendly with good service skills,most disgusting thing is a girl come to every table @ the restaurant and begging for good reviews on trip advisor so don't judge on those reviews ,please stop doing that.food is old fashioned ,cant expect these quality of food from a five star hotel.the good lesson i learned from this hotel is not to book any hotel by looking at the reviews.you guys put a bad image on the heritance name.
Sea facing rooms
Avoid the ground floor rooms.

The Problem with Hotels on the East coast, is that they are close to the main road. Less than 20 meters. This means you cannot get away from the noise of the buses and hooting that is so prevelant in the country. Heritance is more than 200 m away from the road and therefore away from the hussel and bussel of the surrounding area. You acutally feel like you are in a quiet tropical location. You hear the birds and natural noises. The Hotel itself is stunning, Geoff Bawa, the architect definately got the right balance between building and embracing nature. The nutaral colours the blending of building with nauture is appreciated. The beaches are clean and there is a lot of beach to cover so you do not feel onto of other tourists there. The waves were fun and water temp pefrect. The only blemish is the constant harrassment of locals trying to sell you clothing or go to their resturants. The staff are excellent and well trained. They did a lot for us in terms of assisting with our wedding and went further than requested in seeing that our wedding was as beautiful and romantic as dreamed. Thank you. It also helped that the level of English was good, so communication was not a problem. Heritance can handle all element s of arranging a wedding so there was no need for a wedding planner. They even have celebrety cheif, so meals were of high standard. . Prior to coming to Heritance we were originally in Hikaduwa, which was not that great. We are not surfer, lonely planet travellers, which I felt Hikaduwa was catering for. We are in our mid thirties with our priorities at (quiet, cleanliness, beauty and a level of comfort a lady expects at this age). The prices in Hikaduwa for Hotels was not in proportion to what you were getting. Heritance was more expensive but you got what you paid for and the website is not misleading in terms of quality of rooms and the look of the hotel. We found a number of hotels in Hikaduwa misleading on their websites. Therefore Heritance was our saviour! We also recommend Heritance for a family holiday. As a kid I would of had blast swimming in the sea and swimming in both pools, one of which has a beautiful tree covering it. Lots of activities in the hotel and surrounding area. We have been to Sri Lanka three times and if I was to go back, I would only go back to Heritance to the calm and beauty of the place. Use Heritence web site to book. You get the best prices there. Dont be afraid to negociate an upgrade once you get there. You might be surprised.
Home away from home....

We stayed at Heritance Ahungalla for the second time and again enjoyed the splendid architecture, the beautiful location, the excellent food and - about of all - the friendliness of the staff. Our particular thanks go to Rukmal for the room service and to Dinesh, the pool attendant and to the restaurant manager Duminda and his very friendly and helpful staff. A small recommendation to other guests: try to avoid taking a room near to the pool bar which can get quite noisy in the evening. As a wheelchair user I particularly appreciate that all areas are barrier free.

My recent stay at Heritance Ahungalle was an absolute memorable one. On October 21st 2019, I was proposed to by my now finance, Tim Thatcher Tim worked with my parents and the amazing staff at the resort to organize a memorable evening for me and my whole family. We had beautiful rooms, food and entertainment for the evening. Especially, the staff helped organize and execute the proposal by providing us with an intimate space, a spectacular four course candle lit dinner (with a specialized menu featuring our event), full table service, photographers, flower arrangements and overall wonderful hospitality. I want to express my sincere gratitude to the team at Heritance Ahungalle, Mr. Rasika (F&B manager) Mr. Thushara (Restaurant Manager), Mr. Sisira (GM) and their teams for allowing us to execute Tim's vision. It was a very special day surrounded by my friends and family and it wouldn't have been a possibility without the support of this team. Heritance Ahungalle lives and embodies the true Sri Lankan hospitality and service. Thank you to all!!!

When we hear the name Heritance of Aitken Spence, we usually consider it to be one of the most exciting stays. But unfortunately it is a shame to the so called brand Heritance and as well as for the Aitken Spence. We went there for our annual gathering of my workplace and we have reserved about 19 rooms for the last weekend. please find the following: Welcome: They have warmly welcomed us and given the rooms on time. It is appreciated since we got the rooms just within half an hour. Rooms: The room given to me and my wife was on the third floor. Right at the moment we stepped in to the room we felt that it was not cleaned properly. Basically it was not swept at all for weeks as we felt. We were not even provided with the bathrobes to the rooms. Further, only two towels were available at the room and not even the face towels were placed. Bathroom amenities were so old and an immediate renovation should be taken place. One of the Tea/Coffee mugs in the room was not washed (Pictures attached). Buffet: Only one restaurant in operation or only one restaurant is available. It was totally crowded. Dinner on 26th Sept 2020: Restaurant was fully crowded. They do not provide at least the enough seating capacity for the guests. If I'm not mistaken, there were two other groups checked-in to the hotel during that day. However they have arranged some tables outside the restaurant where they were not attended by a single restaurant staff member just to refill their water goblets. Food was totally bad and had a very bad experience with the so called Sri Lankan Chicken Kottu Roti. It was totally frozen andwas not tasty at all. I have complained but the only answer I got from the so called F&B Manager or the Guest Services Representative was 'Will inform and will check with the chef'. Is that an answer from a so called hotel chain like Heritance by Aitken Spence??? Restaurant staff were not capable of attending to the guests and could not even clean the buffet frequently. Please find the attached pictures of the Ice Cream corner. Breakfast on 27th Sept 2020: Compared to the dinner on previous night, this was slightly okay. But they failed arrange the seating for the whole set of occupents. Lunch on 27th Sept 2020: Again it was horrible and had nothing to eat at all. We went for lunch around 1.30pm and even on that time they are out of some food. They had a bowl with a name tag 'Chicken Sausages' and only a half of a sausage is left. When I asked for 4 sausages to me & my wife, the guy came and noted our table and promised to bring them to our table. But unfortunately I couldn't see him afterwards. When it comes to desserts corner, there were nithing to eat at all and please refer the pictures attached. No more refilling or serving and the time was 2.35pm. Premises: There was a very bad smell in the whole hotel from the evening to the noon of the next day. When inquired, they said it is from the sea. But please note that this is not the only hotel we visted in the sea side and we have no any kind of an experience from the rest of the hotels we visited. I have never being to a Heritance Hotel before and I hope that the rest of the Heritance hotels would not be like this. Personally, I'm so disappointed with the hotel and I didn't expect this kind of a service and an experience from you guys. Lack of staff, does not mean that you are free from providing the five star hospitality. If you don't have the sufficient staff, please do not accept so much of bookings for a day. In my opinion, you should pay more attention to the above in order to provide a better experience to the people who visit Heritance Ahungalla. Further, especially in this period, you all are surviving just because of the locals. I'm truly disappointed and also feel very sad. By the way, Good Luck!
avoid the ground level rooms

We had booked this hotel some time ago, as part of a package with the parent company, Aiken Spence. The trip was paid for and confirmed. We arrived at around 1pm on the scheduled day, to be told the hotel was overbooked, and that we were to go to a smaller hotel 2km away. They apologised but offered no compensation. We had to demand to see the new hotel (we were told the room would be a suite, it wasn't). We had no call previously. The front desk people were very keen to move us along rather than ensure we were satisfied with the arrangements. Only after a displeased call to aitken spence were we offered recompense- half board at the hotel and a room upgrade, when we arrived there the next day. This practice of overbooking at hotels in Sri Lanka is not unheard of, but ought to be discouraged. Our advice would be to call the hotel to confirm yourself, and, if it happens, don't leave until you have spoken with the manager. This is a very shoddy way to treat paying guests. Apologies don't cut it, especially when over bookings are either deliberate or easily avoided,
Try to get a room which facing the beach front
Rude stuff
We had rooms in the right building away from the noice, the pool was just below and all the rooms on the third floor have sea view

The entrance is very cozy...check in was smooth...welcome drinks were uniquely served...room was spacious with all required amenities...the swimming pool and the beach view was just amazing...Staffs always smiling was very good....in-house buffet dinner and breakfast were amazing with multiple options to choose from...highly recommended.

Luxury rooms (in ground floor) are not wow...but the private pool and Jacuzzi near the pool makes it worthwhile. Ground floor rooms provides easy access to pools and beach. The rooms in upper floors probably have better view.
the property is in need of a refresh and a good deep clean.
Pools facing the ocean have a little balcony where you can watch the ocean and relax.

we were stayed at the Heritance Ahungalla for reason our family louting. The location was perfect & Nice hotel. Positives: - The bed was great, much more comfortable than my lousy bed back home! - Restaurant food was good but service was not great - Clean Towels Negatives: - Reception people did not do so great a job. When I arrived, there was many people around but no proper welcome.Dark GRE was not helpful at all.She was negative when we ask for bigger room. - Service in restaurant was not very good. - Bed room Carpet need to change. Overall, experince was not soo great.!!!
Frindly staff , Best care

We stayed here for 2 nights with high expectation, but were a bit disappointed about the in room facility. The room is a bit old, the electric water pot was quite dirty. The tooth mug was dirty with crack, the shower gel container also had crack and without a cap. I don't expect all these for a 5 star hotel! Speaking of service particularly the restaurant serving the buffet. It takes me several attempt to refill the coffee and got the plates collected. The waitress saw us and not responding. However, they are responding proactively to non Chinese. This gave me a sense of discrimination! Despite the negatives, the swimming pool is fantastic. It faces the Indian Ocean which is awesome!

Hotel ambiance itself was very relaxing. The check in process was taking bit of a time, but that was not much of a problem as we had time to lool around the property. I would say that the staff were not too open to help. They mostly replied with a negative sense. The buffet spread was amazing. They have a separate vegetarian corner that is easy to figure out. Nothing to be blamed of the taste.It was amazing. The main pool is a bit too opened to the lobby. The second pool is lovely. The highlight is the warm water jacuzzi that is there near the pool. The rooms were too clustered and badly need refurbishment. In one of the rooms we had the lock was broken. The water pressure in the shower was too much. Lastly I would say that the guests must have their freedom to review the hotel after their stay. I feel it is very wrong to force a review. May be they can suggest to leave a review on tripadvisor, but it is not required for the staff to download it on the guest's phone and wait till the review is posted. If this happens please get a moment off and tell them you will go back and post a review.
Buffet experience was poor..

Claims to be a five star resort. It's not. Five star resorts, in fact any decent hotel should care about their guests. They do not have a bloke with the loudest industrial strimmer working right outside a guest's bedroom ceaselessly from 5.30 am. Oh and the wifi is crap.

We were in rooms 209 and 210. Pros: - well laid out and planned hotel - swimming pool area is beautiful - proximity to beach lovely Cons: - hardly any lights in room-very dim - run down - wifi not too great - very sparse room-not even a coffee table! - kettle had a calcified or corroded heating element so we did not want to take a chance with boiling water for our morning coffee. While it was well camouflaged, there was no plug point attached to the kettle so it would had to be physically moved near a plug point to operate-bad design. - bathroom has windows with only dusty, uneven Venetian blinds for so-called privacy - floor was dirty with dirt stuck on it - room was smelling musty when we came in. Couldn't leave balcony door open for too long to air, due to mosquitoes. - no room numbers written on key card envelopes-had to go out the door to check! - no in-hotel numbers written near the phone - cobwebs on balcony panels-rubber coming off - hotel information papers in the binder were not in order-pages missing. - no in-room menu in room. - checking in took time and we were shown a seating area that was impractical to sit in as sofas were not placed opposite of each other but next to each other. We stood around for about 10-15 mins and no one even asked us to take a seat at another more practical area which was close by. - the man showed us everything in the room but to omitted to show us the balcony! We could not see it as it had opaque sliding type panels that covered the sliding windows - the towels and sheets did not smell fresh - hardly any vegetarian options in the menu to warrant the money so the only options were a la carte in the coffee shop and that were going to take 45 mins to order. That hardly seems fair for vegetarians, does it? Since there was no other option, we ordered 3 western choices from this menu. Unfortunately, we were disappointed with the quality and taste of all the options. The veg lasagne had pasta that was chewy, the pasta primavera had peas that were raw and the potato and bean 'pie' was in fact not a pie at all-just potatoes, onions and beans topped with cheese! - The place needs a lot of maintenance.which it wasn't getting - staff need to improve their English, esp since there are so many non srilankans visiting-language was definitely a barrier esp when it came to ordering food. - staff need to be better trained to know what the hotel offers-boy who showed us to rooms said we could get a la carte in the dining hall. Instead there was only a buffet and no a la carte. - in our room, 210, we had no locking system in the door inside the room-no latch or knob, so ostensibly, the master key could be used to open the door at any time from the outside, even while we are inside the room - no tissues in tissue box in room 209-poor housekeeping - took 20 mins and reminding a few times to get our coffee at breakfast - took a long time for the dirty plates piled up from the buffet breakfast to be cleared. Had to point it out. Sadly, the cons far outweighed the pros. I would not stay here again unless it undergoes a major restructuring.

I think this one of the worst places I have ever seen. Very bad experince with the reception team. No smiles, they want to charge me for the air I am breathing. They intentionally selected a very far away room although we are a family. They know it is one night so we will have no time to complain and request room change.
